company_name: British Columbia College of Nursing Professionals
job_description: Does the idea of data, where it comes from, how and why we use it, and under what authority, light a fire for you? Do you get excited helping people analyze their data? If yes, read on if you want to be a part of our team!The BC College of Nursing Professionals (BCCNP) has an opening for a Data Analyst (DA) in the Operations Department. In this role, you will work closely with the Information Systems Team to identify and facilitate the collection and analysis of accurate and reliable data for BCCNP to make various informed business decisions.DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?Data is like a puzzle for you. You enjoy understanding data, linking it to policies, recognizing the relationships of information, how it is classified, who owns it, what legislation enables the College to gather and use it. You have managed databases and data warehouses, and you know how to deliver excellent customer service.WHO WE ARE:BCCNP is the college empowered under the Health Professions Act to regulate the practice of all licensed practical nurses, registered nurses, registered psychiatric nurses and nurse practitioners in British Columbia. Regulation helps to protect the public by ensuring that professional care or service received by the public is competent, ethical and meets the standards that society views as acceptable.At BCCNP each of us strives to meet our commitment to the following values to maintain a workplace that is respectful and supports the well-being of every BCCNP employee:Trust is essentialBetter togetherSpeak the truthProtect the publicStay curiousAs a member of the team, you can expect to be treated in a respectful and professional manner. While your workload will be busy, the College supports staff in achieving a healthy work-life balance.WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?Reporting to the Chief Officer, Operations, and working closely with the Information Management and Corporate Risk Team Lead the Data Analyst (DA) requires an understanding of BCCNP’s mandate and statutory obligations to collect and disclose information under our legislative framework and information sharing agreements signed with external organizations.The work of the DA is to identify and facilitate the collection of accurate and reliable data for BCCNP to make informed business decisions on our registrants, support the authorized disclosure of information and to support strategic decision making, including developing reports for the management team, BCCNP Board, external stakeholders, and for predictive analytics.The DA is responsible for working with data owners to ensure the quality and integrity of data collected and created by BCCNP is reliable.RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Planning, coordinating, controlling, developing and implementing controls on the lifecycle management of data including data analysis, data preparation, data modelling, and data evaluation.Leading the evaluation of data needs of stakeholders and researching, implementing, and supporting business intelligence tools to meet these needs. Reviewing and making recommendations to improve the delivery of data requests, reports and to support e-discovery and/or FOI requests.Assessing the data, including understanding the interrelationships among data elements, investigating data quality issues, and working with the relevant data owners and stakeholders to correct and/or improve data quality issues.Implementing and maintaining a data migration project and/or a national registry.Developing and implementing various data modelling techniques to address the business needs of stakeholders, to detect patterns, interrelationships, and abnormalities among various data elements and making predictions, forecasts and monitoring trends.Responding to requests from internal and external stakeholders for data, developing reports and data extracts in meeting reporting requirements, assessing the key attributes of data and information (i.e.) integrity, accuracy, timeliness, appropriateness and their limitations within the context of the intended use.Developing, implementing and maintaining a data glossary and data dictionary which includes defining, classifying information fields and mapping BCCNP data with external organizations’ data structure as stipulated in our information sharing agreements.Reviewing and recommending policies and processes to control where data is stored and how it is shared.Assessing and evaluating data models periodically to determine the reliability and usefulness of the models in supporting business and data objectives.Monitoring and verifying that the data extracted from organizational systems is correct.Responding to and addressing privacy and confidentiality considerations relating to requests for information and reports.YOUR EDUCATION & SKILLS:A baccalaureate degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics. An advanced graduate certificate in data analytics is an asset.3 to 5 years of experience as a data/information and/or reporting analyst managing and controlling data.Demonstrated experience working with databases (MS SQL), advanced MS Excel, extract, transform, and load (ETL) frameworks, knowledge of and experience with reporting packages and business intelligence tools.Excellent quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.Demonstrated knowledge and application of relevant legislation; ethical and legal obligations, guidelines relating to privacy, confidentiality and security of information.Ability to plan, prioritize and manage workload within a time sensitive environment.Demonstrated ability to keep track of industry trends in data analytics including artificial intelligence, machine learning and the Internet of Things.Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to use audience appropriate communication and language to present information, analyze results and convey concepts.Ability to work outside of regular work hours, on occasion, to ensure the smooth functioning of BCCNP related systems.Data warehouse implementation and experience with data dictionaries is an asset.Experience with Dynamics CRM and SharePoint is an asset.Ability to develop and apply statistics and statistical methods in managing large amounts of information, and experience with a range of statistical analysis tools is an asset.COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:As the successful candidate, you will enjoy a generous compensation and benefits package.HOW TO APPLY:To apply, please visit https://www.bccnp.ca/bccnp/Careers/Pages/data-analyst.aspxThe closing date for applications is April 1, 2019.To learn more about our organization, please visit www.bccnp.ca. Thank you for your interest in the BC College of Nursing Professionals.While we appreciate all responses, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.Job Type: Full-time

TemporarySource:  BC HydroJob Title:  Financial Analyst 3 - VancouverJob Number: BCH-T-4933-190327E1Job Location:  Vancouver, British Columbia, CanadaJob Status: Full-time, Temporary_______________________________________________________________We’re BC Hydro and we have a big job to do.Keeping the lights on for over 4 million people across the province takes a lot of talented people doing many different jobs. From working deep in a generating station, atop a power pole, or behind a desk, whatever it is that makes you tick we offer challenging careers to help you reach your potentialWe’re investing more than $2 billion per year in major capital infrastructure projects to help meet the growing demand for safe, reliable power. Ottawa, ONWho We AreThe Canadian Research Knowledge Network (CRKN) is a partnership of Canadian universities dedicated to expanding digital content for the academic research and teaching enterprise in Canada. Through the coordinated leadership of librarians, researchers, administrators and other stakeholders in the research community, CRKN undertakes large-scale content acquisition and licensing initiatives in order to build knowledge infrastructure and research and teaching capacity in Canada’s universities. On April 1st, 2018 CRKN merged with Canadiana.org which has allowed our teams to cohesively pursue a united and coordinated strategy to leverage Canadian heritage and scholarly content. As a merged organization, CRKN will continue its core licensing activities for scholarly journal content, while expanding support for the digitization, access and preservation of Canadian heritage content through the services of Canadiana.The RoleThe Metadata Analyst serves as a subject matter expert for CRKN’s metadata needs. Through engagement with the galleries, libraries, archives and museums (GLAM) community, the Metadata Analyst ensures a high quality of metadata for the Canadiana collections and coordinates metadata enhancement projects. With the goal of enhancing discoverability of the Canadiana collections, the Metadata Analyst works with the CRKN digitization, platform, and communications team to update metadata standards and implement evolving best practices and standards. Through active involvement in national and international communities of practice, the Metadata Analyst ensures that CRKN participates in the ongoing development of metadata standards and practices.Reporting to the Manager, Member and Metadata Services, the Metadata Analyst identifies current and future functional metadata requirements; selects and adopts appropriate technical standards and practices; and in close coordination with the platform team develops mappings, crosswalks, scripts and other tools to validate, normalize, convert and migrate metadata into required formats.Duties and Responsibilities1. Research and planning (45%)Maintain in-depth knowledge of evolving metadata standards and practices in the GLAM and other relevant communities and identify their relevance to CRKN and its activitiesEvaluate CRKN’s metadata standards and practices to ensure they remain consistent with evolving community standards and practices and take advantage of emerging technologiesMonitor and participate in the development of emerging linked open data (LOD) standards and practices and develop LOD strategies and capabilities for the organizationDevelop and maintain metadata profiles, templates, guides, and best practices documentation, and train and support staff in their adoption and application2. Partnership building and collaboration (35%)Engage in national and international collaborative initiatives to ensure that CRKN is involved in the development of national metadata strategies and policies, and ensure that CRKN comes to be recognized as a centre of excellence in this areaIdentify and develop partnerships with institutions, organizations, researchers and other parties for the creation, linking and enrichment of metadataIn close collaboration with the Director, Marketing and Stakeholder Engagement, and in partnership with other national organizations who work with Indigenous people, develop metadata standards that reflect Indigenous cultural understandings3. Development (15%)Analyze business requirements for creating, capturing, transforming and normalizing metadata for the Canadiana collections and third-party clients and determine technical solutionsDevelop mappings and crosswalks to convert and migrate between different standards and formatsProvide subject expert guidance to the platform team and assist in the development of scripts, tools and workflows for parsing, extending, normalizing and transforming metadata records, and other related operations4. Other (5%)Provide governance and administrative support as needed, particularly in preparation of committee documentation.In a small team environment each individual is expected to work towards overall CRKN goals and at times a team effort is required that may involve taking on tasks outside the normal or expected scope of their role. Other duties may be assigned as required.QualificationsThe ideal candidate will have a master’s degree in information science, library and information studies or archival studies, and at least five years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. The ideal candidate will be eligible for Reliability Status from PWGSC. Other relevant and desirable education, skills and experience include:Knowledge of open source frameworks, standards, models and applications for digital preservationTechnical knowledge of metadata standards used in the GLAM (galleries, libraries, archives museums) sectorKnowledge of digital preservation standards and practices within libraries and archivesKnowledge of and involvement with the digital preservation and linked open data communities in Canada and internationallyStrong written and oral communications abilitiesExperience presenting to a variety of audiencesExcellent interpersonal skillsKnowledge of linked open data (LOD) principles and LOD modeling experienceExperience in transforming data sets into LOD triples and implementing LOD platforms and discovery layersExperience with different digital preservation repository systems and toolsKnowledge of XML standards and toolsProgramming experience with scripting languages, especially for normalizing and transforming data sets will be considered an asset.Database development and data modeling experience will be considered an assetAn understanding of Indigenous cultures and traditional knowledge will be considered an assetStrong research abilitiesTermFull-time, PermanentLocationOttawa, OntarioBenefitsCRKN offers a generous benefits package including vacation, health and dental benefits and pension match.We thank all applicants for their interest in CRKN, however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. CRKN is an equal opportunity employer, with policies and practices intended to build an inclusive and accessible work environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please include in your cover letter when applying for the position and all efforts to provide the appropriate accommodation will be put into place.Qui nous sommes Le Réseau canadien de documentation pour la recherche (RCDR) est un partenariat d’universités qui se consacre à élargir l’accès au contenu numérique pour la recherche universitaire et l’enseignement au Canada. Avec l’aide de bibliothécaires, chercheurs, administrateurs et représentants de la communauté de recherche, le RCDR entreprend des initiatives de licence et d’acquisition à grande échelle pour bâtir une infrastructure de savoir, de recherche et d’enseignement pour les universités canadiennes. Le 1er avril 2018, le RCDR a fusionné avec Canadiana.org, ce qui a permis à nos équipes respectives de poursuivre une stratégie unie et coordonnée pour mettre à profit le patrimoine documentaire canadien et le contenu savant. À titre d’organisation combinée, le RCDR poursuivra ses activités principales de licences de publications savantes, tout en élargissant ses activités relatives à la numérisation, l’accès et la préservation du patrimoine documentaire canadien par le biais des services de Canadiana.PosteL’analyste des métadonnées agira à titre d’expert pour répondre aux besoins du RCDR dans ce domaine. En mobilisant les galeries, bibliothèques, archives et musées (GLAM), la personne retenue pour ce poste pourra produire des métadonnées de très haute qualité pour les collections de Canadiana et coordonner les projets de mise en valeur des métadonnées. Pour accroître la découvrabilité des collections de Canadiana, le candidat choisi devra travailler avec l’équipe de numérisation, plateforme et communication du RCDR afin de mettre à jour les normes de métadonnées, en plus de s’adapter à l’évolution des pratiques optimales et des normes. En participant activement aux communautés de pratique nationales et internationales, l’analyste de métadonnées permettra au RCDR de contribuer à l’élaboration de normes et pratiques en métadonnées.Relevant du directeur des services aux membres et des services de métadonnées, cet analyste doit répondre aux besoins futurs et actuels de l’organisation en métadonnées; choisir et adopter les normes et pratiques techniques appropriées; élaborer, en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe de plateforme, des configurations, correspondances, scripts et autres outils pour valider, normaliser, convertir et assurer la migration de métadonnées vers les formats requis.Rôles et responsabilités1. Recherche et planification (45%)Connaissance approfondie des normes et pratiques changeantes concernant les métadonnées utilisées par les GLAM et autres communautés; déterminer si ces normes et pratiques sont pertinentes pour le RCDR et ses activitésÉvaluer les normes et pratiques en métadonnées du RCDR pour s’assurer qu’elles soient adaptées à l’évolution des normes et pratiques dans la communauté; tirer profit des technologies émergentesSuivre l’évolution et contribuer à la création de normes et pratiques concernant les données liées ouvertes (DLO) émergentes; élaborer des stratégies pour les DLO et approfondir les capacités organisationnellesCréer et maintenir des profiles, modèles et guides de métadonnées, ainsi que des pratiques optimales en documentation, en plus de former et soutenir le personnel dans l’adoption et la mise en oeuvre de ces pratiques2. Collaboration et création de partenariat (35%)Participer aux initiatives de collaboration nationales et internationales pour que le RCDR s’inscrive activement dans le développement de politiques et stratégies nationales de métadonnées, en plus d’être reconnu comme centre d’excellenceRepérer et approfondir les occasions de partenariat avec des établissements, organisations, chercheurs et autres parties qui contribuent à la création, mise en corrélation et enrichissement de métadonnéesTravailler en étroite collaboration avec la directrice du marketing et de la mobilisation des intervenants; établir des partenariats avec d’autres organisations nationales qui travaillent auprès de populations autochtones et développent des normes de métadonnées qui reflètent la culture autochtone3. Développement (15%)Analyser les besoins de l’organisation en créant, capturant, transformant et normalisant des métadonnées pour les collections de Canadiana et clients externes, en plus de trouver des solutions techniquesDévelopper des configurations et correspondances pour la conversion et la migration entre divers formatset normesServir d’expert auprès de l’équipe de plateforme et participer au développement de scripts, d’outils et de flux de travail pour l’analyse, l’extension, la normalisation et la transformation de métadonnées, ainsi que pour d’autres opérations connexes4. Autre (5%)Assurer la gouvernance et fournir le soutien administratif nécessaire, surtout dans la préparation de documents de comités.En travaillant dans une petite équipe, chaque membre doit tendre vers les objectifs du RCDR, contribuer aux efforts collectifs et donc parfois entreprendre des tâches qui vont au-delà de ses fonctions habituelles. D’autres tâches pourraient être assignées à la personne retenue de temps à autre.CompétencesLe ou la candidate idéale doit avoir une maîtrise en science de l’information, bibliothéconomie ou archivistique et au moins cinq ans d’expérience, ou l’équivalent en éducation et expérience. La personne doit aussi être admissible à la cote de fiabilité de TPSGC. La section suivante décrit toute autre éducation, compétence et aptitude souhaitable et pertinente que la personne pourrait avoir :Connaissance de cadres, normes, modèles et applications du libre accès pour la préservation numériqueConnaissance technique des normes de métadonnées dans le secteur des GLAM (galeries, bibliothèques,archives et musées)Connaissance de normes et pratiques de préservation numérique en bibliothéconomie et archivistiqueParticipation active dans les communautés qui oeuvrent dans la préservation numérique et le secteur desdonnées liées ouvertes au Canada et à l’internationalTrès bonnes aptitudes de communication écrite et verbaleExpérience et capacité de faire des présentations auprès de divers publicsExcellentes aptitudes interpersonnellesConnaissance des principes de données liées ouvertes (DOL) et expérience dans la modélisation de DOLExpérience dans la transformation d’ensembles de données en DOL (triples) et mise en oeuvre de plateformes de DOL et couches de découverteExpérience avec divers systèmes et outils relatifs aux dépôts de préservation numériqueConnaissance des outils et normes XMLExpérience de programmation avec des langages de script, surtout pour la normalisation et transformationd’ensembles de données (sera considéré comme étant un atout)Expérience dans le développement de bases de données et la modélisation de données (sera considéré commeétant un atout)Comprendre la culture et le savoir traditionnel autochtone (sera considéré comme étant un atout)Excellentes aptitudes de rechercheAvantages sociauxLe RCDR offre de généreux avantages sociaux incluant des vacances, de l’assurance maladie et dentaire, ainsi qu’une cotisation à parts égales au régime de retraite.Échelle salarialeLe poste s’inscrit dans la catégorie professionnelle 2 (P2) et le salaire sera déterminé en fonction de l’expérience du candidat.MandatTemps complet, permanentLieuOttawa, OntarioLe RCDR souscrit au principe d’équité en matière d’emploi, notamment par le biais de politiques et de pratiques ayant pour but de créer un environnement de travail inclusif et accessible. Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation pendant le processus de recrutement, veuillez l’indiquer dans votre lettre de motivation et nous prendrons toutes les mesures nécessaires pour les mettre en oeuvre.Job Type: Full-time

Do you enjoy working on challenging, yet meaningful problems? Do you want complete free rein to try new ideas and unleash your creativity? Do you want to be part of a team that is completely redefining the way that resource investing works?GoldSpot Discoveries Inc. (https://GoldSpot.ca/) is a technology and analytics company that is developing and refining machine-learning technology capable of significantly improving mineral exploration targeting. The approach mitigates investment risk and increases the efficiency of exploration in data-rich environments. Past accolades include placing 2nd in the Integra Gold Rush Challenge, and a top five finalist in the Disrupt Mining Challenge. In addition, we are working with several multi-billion dollar companies well known in the mining sector.The success of our company can be attributed to our constant development of data science tools and techniques for earth sciences. We believe that a continuous investment in R&D is key to maintaining a competitive edge in the market place, and there is no shortage of interesting data and use-cases in the mining industry.As part of our R&D team, you will bring your real-world experience, natural curiosity, and positive attitude to a team of interdisciplinary PhDs and machine learning specialists. You’re not afraid to get your hands dirty with the data – whether it be scraping data from unusual sources, trying out unusual data transformations, brainstorming new approaches, or building data pipelines to auto-refit your models. In return, you get to work for a quickly growing, dynamic company without all the strings that come with working for a large organization. You will:Build and interpret multidisciplinary databases, including remote sensing, geochemical, geophysical, structural and geological dataBecome familiar with the exploration vectors and footprints of various styles of ore depositsContribute to continuously improving our data integration workflowsResearch, brainstorm and test feature engineering techniques for exploration dataBring new ideas to the table and unleash your creativity to solve current and future challengesProvide deep understanding of machine learning techniques, and know how to tune them for optimal performanceDevelop and create research proposals, draft reports, and give presentations on research and resultsSubmit abstracts and represent GoldSpot at various geoscience conferencesCollaborate with a high performing, diverse team of individualsBe a champion for GoldSpot’s culture and valuesBe comfortable working with a partly remote team (Toronto/Montreal)Successful candidates will:Have a PhD in an earth sciences discipline, such as Mineral Engineering, Quantitative Geoscience (including Remote Sensing, Geophysics, Geochemistry), or PhysicsHave demonstrated excellence and knowledge in machine learning techniquesHave experience in computer programming (preferred Python)We offer:A dynamic, diverse, and highly collaborative work environment in both Toronto and MontrealCasual business environment with significant flexibilityAn opportunity to gain broad exposure to all sides of the business, as well as multiple industriesChance to join a successful start-up in its early stages, and grow with the companyA focus and emphasis on personal developmentOptions packageJob Type: Full-timeExperience:Machine Learning: 2 years (Required)Education:Post-Doctorate (Preferred)

job_description: Waterloo, ON$100,000 a yearIMS (Part of Trak Global Group) is a leading connected car solutions provider delivering services and analytics to insurers, governmentsand enterprises. IMS is the developer of the cloud-based DriveSync® connected car platform which has received industry acclaim for its ability to offer customers a data source-agnostic, multi-device strategy for service provision versus a single focused technology approach. IMS’ platform-oriented approach drives more revenue and average revenue per user (ARPU) by future proofing investments so customers can target specific segments or their entire customer base with different services at the same time. job_description: Toronto, ONLanguages: Hindi or Nordic Languages (Danish, Dutch, Finnish, Norwegian, Swedish)Location: Two full-time positions in Manila, Philippines or Toronto, CanadaStart Date: May 1, 2019 or by agreementAbout RepRiskRepRisk is a global leader and pioneer in data science, specializing in premium ESG and business conduct risk research and quantitative solutions. With daily-updated data synthesized in 20 languages using a rules-based methodology, RepRisk systematically flags and monitors material ESG risks and violations of international standards that can have reputational, compliance, and financial impacts on a company.Our flagship product, the RepRisk Platform, is the world's largest database of its kind, consisting of 100k+ public and private companies and 25k+ projects of all sizes, in every sector and market. Leading organizations around the world rely on RepRisk as their key due diligence solution to prevent and mitigate ESG and business conduct risks related to their operations, business relationships, and investments.Job DescriptionAs a RepRisk® Analyst you will analyze and enter news from NGOs, the internet, print and other media into the RepRisk® tool (www.reprisk.com ). RepRisk® facilitates the identification and assessment of environmental, social and corporate governance issues which may present financial, reputational and ethical risks. It is used by investment professionals, financial institutions, supply chain managers, multinational corporations and compliance managers. The tool plays an integral role in increasing transparency and ensuring compliance with internal and international standards, thereby helping reduce risk exposure.ResponsibilitiesIdentifying news related to environmental, social and corporate governance issuesAssessing the corresponding RepRisk issues (https://www.reprisk.com/our-approach#scope) within the newsEntering newly criticized companies, projects, etc. into the RepRisk® databaseSummarizing and scoring the incident according to our proprietary methodologyCandidate ProfileYou are fluent in Hindi or Danish, Dutch, Finnish, Norwegian or SwedishYou have the equivalent to a native-level of EnglishReading proficiency in one additional RepRisk language would be an advantage: Chinese, Arabic, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish. job_title: Data scientist in Computer Vision and Deep Learning
job_description: Toronto, ONPart-time$42,000 - $60,000 a yearRMA Laboratory at Ryerson University, Toronto, Canada*About the employerThe Robotics, Mechatronics and Automation Laboratory (RMAL) was founded in 1997 and since then has been an active entity of Ryerson University. It is an interdisciplinary laboratory bringing people and projects related to Mechanical, Aerospace, Industrial, Biomedical, Electrical-Computer Engineering, Mechatronics, and Computer Science. Its objective is to design and build in synergistic manner systems for advancing robotics and automation. The laboratory takes a broad approach of what constitutes good research and education, all measured by their industrial and social impact. The ongoing research spans from the applied to basic research. The output from the lab research ranges from ground-breaking papers to ground-breaking prototypes. The usual team of industrial partners, faculty members, postdoctoral fellows, graduate and undergraduate students creates unique opportunities for furtherance of the education, research and technology transfer goals. The contributions in the lab can span from developing core engineering techniques and theoretical analyses of robotic algorithms, to working closely with existing companies and health organization, to engaging in entrepreneurial activities. RMAL also welcomes inquiries from companies interested in participating in our research and development works as industrial members. The lab has pioneered the development and commercialization of Robot PbD (Programming by Demonstration).Learn more at: www.ryerson.ca/~rmalOpportunities: The opportunities provided to the programmer will include improving his/her real-time programming skills in Deep Learning and Computer vision; hardware and software design experience, potentially publications record, experimentation skills, teamwork capabilities, communication skills including documentation and presentation skills Additionally, the lab promotes entrepreneurship opportunities through Ryerson Digital Media Zone (DMZ) and Ryerson Entrepreneur Institute. The lab has catalyzed employment of former programmers and alumni in prestigious academic and industrial organizations.Job Description: An open position for a data scientist in Computer Vision and Machine Learning is available through NSERC funding. The project goal is development and commercialization of a Visual Learning System for Robot Programming by Demonstration. The leaning system employs a vision system for using machine learning (and in particular, deep learning) methods to estimate a 3D object pose capturing tasks demonstrated by a human expert. The project involves close collaborations with industrial partners.Responsibilities and Duties:Candidate will aid in the design, implementation, testing, and documentation of machine learning algorithms relevant to the project. The candidate is expected to contribute to the project for visual robotic learning from human demonstrations by improving the existing system developed in RMAL through coding and documentation of the algorithms. The candidate is expected to possess knowledge of machine learning and, in particular, Deep Learning algorithms in Linux using GPU. The ideal candidate should be highly motivated and dedicated to the project. He/she will be expected to work collaboratively with a postdoctoral fellow, and as a team, they will put efforts into commercialization of the developed software package for robotic visual learning.Ability to work independently, and in a teamKnowledge in Robotic Operating System (ROS) and C++ will be considered as advantageExperience in using OpenCV is an assetAbility to work in a team, serious, reliable and responsibleBenefits: The position will be for 12 months with the potential for extension, subject to satisfactory performance and availability of funding.Anticipated starting date is as soon as possible.Salary is competitive ($3,500-$5,000 a month) and depends on the previous experience of the candidate.Preference will be given to Canadian residents.RMAL is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, or genetic information.For more information you may contact us at, https://www.ryerson.ca/~rmal/contact.htmJob Types: Full-time, Part-timeSalary: $42,000.00 to $60,000.00 /yearExperience:Programming in Python: 1 year (Required)Programming Deep Learning algorithms: 1 year (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's Degree (Required)Location:Toronto, ON (Preferred)Licence:Work permit (Required)Language:English (Required)

CompanyThe award-winning Vancouver Public Library has been dedicated to meeting the lifelong learning, reading and information needs of Vancouver residents for more than 100 years. Our vision is an informed, engaged and connected city. Our mission is a free place for everyone to discover, create and share ideas and information.Our public library is the last freely available indoor public space in Vancouver – open to everyone. We help people of all ages to pursue their passions and to fulfill their creative potential. Across 21 locations and online, VPL is the most visited major urban library per capita in Canada. VPL values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve. Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.MAIN PURPOSE & FUNCTIONReporting to the Manager, Policy & Planning, the incumbent is responsible for data compilation and analysis, report writing and research in support of organization-wide planning, marketing activities, library performance measurement, and policy management. This role gathers, researches, and interprets quantitative and qualitative information from a wide variety of sources; presents information in suitable formats; drafts reports; and provides project management support for initiatives led by the Department. The incumbent works collaboratively within the team and system-wide to deliver on the Library’s goals and objectives.The incumbent demonstrates and models conduct that adheres to the Library’s policies and procedures in accordance with the Library’s vision, mission and values.Duties and ResponsibilitiesCollects, compiles, analyzes and interprets data from a variety of sources to support strategic initiatives, planning and departmental projects. Duties include: converting data from internal and external sources into local databases and spreadsheets; interpreting data; and preparing narrative and graphic material for inclusion in reports and presentations.Drafts and edits reports for manager review, including strategic plan progress reports for management and Board, annual operating report, and annual provincial grant report.Performs special research tasks and analysis on a variety of topics as required. Contributes to the planning and execution of primary research projects.Liaises with internal and external contacts, such as VPL and City of Vancouver staff, to gather and/or provide quantitative and qualitative information for organizational planning, reporting and forecasting.Maintains the Board and Administrative policies of the Library under the direction of the Manager, Policy & Planning.Conducts research to inform the development and maintenance of VPL’s policy management framework.Provides research and analytical support to staff throughout the organization; shares best practices and enables the adoption of evaluation / assessment tools and processes.Applies project management principles and practices to planning, research and analytical projects and other types of strategic and operational initiatives.Creates and delivers presentations related to the work of the unit for peers and colleagues; undertakes research, provides input and graphic support for manager’s presentations to library senior management and the Board.Maintains awareness of emerging demographic, technological, and social trends and changes, and supports interpretation of the ways these and other trends will impact library services.Participates in professional development activities to ensure currency with trends and best practices relevant to library planning, research, analysis and policy-related work.Job RequirementsEducation/Qualifications:Successful completion of a university degree, preferably at the Master’s level, in Business Administration, Social Sciences or other relevant discipline. Successful completion of university-level coursework in statistical and research methodologies is also required.Experience: One to three years of related work experience in a business or public sector setting.Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Proven ability to collect, compile, analyze and interpret quantitative and qualitative data, and to prepare related reports and presentations.Knowledge of analytical and research techniques, particularly as they are applied to strategic planning, business planning and performance measurement.Sound analytical skills, including the manipulation of data and the interpretation of patterns and trends.Sound written communication skills, including solid report writing and editing skills. Strong presentation and oral communication skills.Considerable skills in using Microsoft Office, with considerable knowledge and experience using Excel, Word and Powerpoint. Experience with statistical analysis software is an asset.Ability to learn and quickly adapt to software used for reporting writing, presentation materials, mapping, data compilation and analysis.Knowledge of trends and issues affecting public libraries and library services and policies.Knowledge of project management principles and practices.Strong organizational and time management skills; ability to deal with multiple tasks and meet competing deadlines.Ability to work collaboratively and supportively in a team environment, and to build effective and trusting relationships with colleagues and internal and external contacts at all levels.Job Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's Degree (Required)

Barrie, ONPermanentTitle: Business Intelligence Data AnalystReports to: Manager BI & Data IntegrityBased at: 9 Napoleon Rd., Barrie, OntarioSalary Grade: 11Job Purpose: The Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst (BI Data Analyst) manages in-house data models, prediction models and systems to ensure high levels of accuracy and integrity. This includes planning, designing, developing, implementing, supporting, and optimizing all BI data models, meta-data and prediction models. The successful candidate must have management skills to drive projects to completion on schedule with team members and mid-level business professionals.Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities: · Technical implementation and ongoing management and continuous improvement of data models, meta-data models, mining models, and machine learning models which include regression, classification and unsupervised learning.· Collaborate with BI group and department leads in delivering a working prediction models to meet business objectives for forecast accuracy.· Oversees the machine learning architecture resulting in the delivery of production prediction model results to business stakeholders.· Driven from business requirements, architects, implements and builds solutions to assist in the generation of prediction models that add value to the business and partner with stakeholders from the business for successful deployment.· Leads the BI group in the creation and maintenance of machine learning tools, meta-data, prediction models, validation/testing of models, model change management and model design methodology. Rationalizes new model requires to avoid excessive complexity and assist other business analysts in use and application of model.· Provide input into the development of model testing strategies and plans to ensure models are always up to date and relevant. Validate that developed solutions align with defined business objectives.· Provide technical documentation and technical support for existing models, meta-data catalogs, or other tools. Maintain a library of model documents, templates, or other reusable knowledge· Develop statistical methods for evaluating information accuracy and ensure data published in BI solutions meets business expectations for data quality.· Analyze and resolve end user problems related to databases and data warehouses, reports in a timely and accurate fashion, and provides end user training where required.· Contribute to the strategic direction of the BI platform, the creation of the BI roadmap, the selection of new tools, and the overall integrity of model delivery. Expand knowledge of broader range of Business Intelligence products and toolsEducation and Experience: · University degree in computer science, mathematics, finance, statistics or equivalent experience.· A master’s degree in any of these and/or a core data science curriculum is highly desired.· Strong understanding data analysis, SQL queries, advanced statistics, machine learning and business intelligence report applications required.· Proficient with the design of data models, prediction models, and implementation user machine learning solutions based upon business requirements and content knowledge.· Advanced statistics including probability, descriptive statistics, distributions, correlation, inference, T-tests, linear/multiple regression, ANOVA, etc.· Advanced skills in one or more Statistical computing languages such as R/Studio and/or Python/Anaconda.· Experience using predictive machine learning model building packages such as R/Studio CARET and/or Python/Anaconda Sci-kit learn/statsmodels/sciblox.· Solid understanding of model building activities including preprocessing, imputation, unskewing, normalizing, standardizing, removing outliers, and splitting data (training, testing and hold-out).· Ability to diagnose and improve models using statistical model diagnostics such as RMSE, MAPE, AIC, goodness of fit, sensitivity, specificity, receiver operating characteristics, etc.· Previous business experience architecting, implementing, and developing machine learning models considered an asset.· Knowledge of one or more Data Warehouse design methodologies and implementation (Inmon CIF, Kimball Dimensional, Data Vault 2.0) with preference to Kimball or Data Vault 2.0.· Microsoft SQL server knowledge and experience.· SQL language skills (SQL, MDX, DDL, DML, DQL, DCL, ADX, XML)· Knowledge of data governance including meta-data and data modelling.· Prior experience with report writing tools (Business Objects, Crystal Reports, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, Looker, DundasBI, SiSense, Reporting Services) considered an asset.· Intermediate Excel/Access skills, including VBA scripting considered an asset.· Intermediate PowerPoint, Word, Visio skills considered an asset.· Active collaborator and listener with excellent oral, written, presentation, one-on-one and group communication skills.· Demonstrated ability to learn quickly and produce results.· Organized, thoughtful and likes to make a difference by sharing knowledge with others and seeing improvements.· Energetic, positive, driven and independent.· Objective driven yet tactful and respectful of others' contributions.· Thinks broadly, resolves problems, and has ability to see multiple perspectives on issues.· Manages competing priories in an effective and positive manner.· Experience interacting directly with customers to elicit, document, and implement solutions· Demonstrates Intermediate project management skillsJob Types: Full-time, Permanent

Peterborough, ONContractThe Workforce Development Board/Local Employment Planning Council (WDB/LEPC) is a not-for-profit organization funded by the Ministry of Training, Colleges and Universities. We are seeking an individual to provide leadership in the collection, analysis and dissemination of labour market information in the full-time position of Labour Market Information Analyst. This is a contract role ending March 31, 2020 with the possibility of extension. Reporting to the CEO, the incumbent will be responsible for interpreting information to determine local labour market supply and demand and communicating this information to key stakeholders and community partners.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Conduct labour market research, including the collection, analysis and dissemination of local labour market information that is relevant to the needs of employers, job seekers and the community partners serving them.Participate in research, analysis, consultation, development, writing and updating of the Labour Market Plan and other reports as required.Develop customized labour market reports for community stakeholders based on their specific requests/needs.Maintain a valid and up-to-date database of Labour Market Information and other statistical information relevant to regional socioeconomics.Support the production of accurate, relevant and current communication tools, such as publications, press releases and articles and quarterly updates of the Labour Market Gateway and Eye on the Labour Market newsletter.Contribute to the development, implementation and delivery of LEPC projects including: consultation, assessment, marketing, application/proposal writing, partnership development, monitoring, reporting and communication.Support LEPC project activities, including acting as project lead on some projects, to ensure the objectives, milestones, deliverables, outcomes, timelines and reporting requirements are met.Develop and maintain relationships with community partners to access labour market trends data.Be proactive in regard to emerging issues that may affect the WDB by advising and developing related risk assessment and mitigation strategies.SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS: Post-secondary degree or diploma in a field related to the defined position responsibilities (Business Administration, Computing and Information Systems/Data Analytics, etc.), or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Evidence of research, analytical and report writing skills, preferably related to labour market information and/or quantitative research methods.Knowledge and experience performing analysis of multiple data sets.Knowledge of local, provincial, and federal labour market sources (i.e. Statistics Canada, Labour Force Survey) is an asset.Evidence of strong project management skills and experience in a not-for-profit or public service environment.Evidence of exceptional interpersonal, stakeholder engagement, oral and written communication skills, including public speaking.Advanced knowledge of office support software including MS Office.Ability to consistently represent the WDB professionally and in a manner that reflects WDB values and public image.Availability and willingness to travel within, and occasionally outside, the WDB catchment area.Must possess a valid “G” Ontario Drivers’ license.For further consideration, qualified candidates are invited to submit their cover letter and resume by Tuesday, April 9, 2019 at 4:30 p.m.While we appreciate all applications, we can only contact those individuals selected for an interview.We are committed to providing accommodation for persons with disabilities. Accommodation will be provided as part of our hiring process (if accommodation is required, we appreciate Applicants making this request in advance, so we can support your needs).Job Type: Contract

Employment Type: Permanent - full time (in-house)jSonar, a successful Vancouver startup, is expanding it’s team and looking for an experienced verification (QA) analyst who is passionate about application usability and possesses strong troubleshooting skills. Job no: 502284
Brand: Finance
Work type: Full time
Location: British Columbia
Categories: Business Support

Data Reporting Analyst - Vancouver

About the opportunity

As part of our Americas Business Intelligence Team, the Data Reporting Analyst is responsible for assessing business analysis needs including gathering requirements, analyzing source system data, and developing proof-of-concept data models and visualizations. In addition, the candidate will dig deep into company data to uncover insights and information to help drive profit, process improvements and best practices.


Duties and Responsibilities

Designing and developing enterprise-wide data analysis and reporting solutions (as opposed to reporting silos)
Converting functional requirements into technical solutions
Analyzing data from multiple internal and external sources
Helping visualize technical data in a way that is meaningful to business decision makers
Understanding, interpreting and applying business rules to ensure a high level of data integrity and consistency
Engaging and consulting with team members on new data, business needs and opportunities to improve system effectiveness
Scrutinize and assemble raw data from multiple sources, generate reports, automate best practices and build dashboards that facilitate efficiency, profit gains and productivity
Work with operational stakeholders and the project management team to assess needs and document requirements
Testing, reconciliation and validation of data and coordination of UAT for production-ready products
Recommendations on process changes and best practices
Skills / Experience

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience with SQL and dimensional modelling
Experience with data transformation/ETL and proof of concept development
Experience with tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI or other visualization and analysis tools
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to develop relationships at all levels
High level of commercial acumen and professionalism
“Agile” in both personality and development philosophy – a high degree of flexibility and the ability to deal with change and a high-pressure work environment
A team-focused individual that enjoys collaboration and can “leave the ego at the door “Highly creative and outside-the-box thinker who believes “it’s always possible”


If this sounds like you, come on board with a global organization, and one of Canada’s 50 Most Admired Corporate Cultures!


We thank all candidates for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Our promise is to provide an environment with equality of respect, dignity and opportunity for all our employees. We value an inclusive and supportive workplace which truly reflects the diversification of our society. Flight Centre Travel Group is committed to providing a barrier-free pathway throughout our recruitment selection process. If you require accommodation because of a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please let us know in advance by contacting our Recruitment Team at fccareers@flightcentre.ca

Toronto, ONAt XTL, we know that positive financial results will help us grow. As the Pricing Analyst, you will review and analyze the pricing strategy at XTL. Your focus will be creating profitable rates for new and existing customers based on our current network, growth areas, changing customer shipping patterns, and the competitive market environment.As a Pricing Analyst, you’ll continually improve the freight network by identifying pricing opportunities that maximize revenue and minimize operational cost. London, ONThe Data Analyst, Internal Audit Advisory is a newly created role that supports the execution of Data Analytics within the Canadian Internal Audit function reporting to the Manager, Data Analytics, Internal Audit Advisory. This individual will be accountable to support the Canadian Internal Audit teams with data extraction and transformation activities across different business systems, improving the department's access and understanding of business data, and implementing the Data Analytics strategy.
He/she will bring a strong technical skillset to support the execution of data analytics and support Internal Audit in improving the depth and breadth of audit coverage, leading to improved risk assessment, richer business insights, enhanced monitoring, and efficiencies.
Accountabilities:
Supporting the Internal Audit team's data needs for performing audit analytics
Extracting data from key business systems using SQL and other technical tools
Preparing and transforming data for auditors for audit engagements
Consulting audit teams on data validation, consolidation, and cleansing
Developing and execute data access plans for key business systems working collaboratively with IS and business stakeholders
Developing in-depth business system insights and documenting data knowledge to meet the needs of the Canadian team
Supporting internal training initiatives, assisting in the development and delivery of training to staff
Development business case scenarios and material to be used in training programs
Supporting the execution and refinement of the Data Analytics training program
Supporting the Internal Audit Advisory team on delivering engagements and initiatives affecting the broader practice

Qualifications and Competencies:
Bachelor's degree with a technical discipline (computer science, information systems, statistics, actuarial science) [Minimum]
Bachelor's degree with a combination of business and technical disciplines (business degree with management information systems, computer science with a business administration minor, etc.) [Preferred]
2+ years experience with data extraction, data management, and programming [Minimum]
2+ years experience in an insurance or financial institution analytics role, and/or experience with Insurance business systems [Preferred]
2+ years consulting experience in a Big Four environment or large consulting firm [Preferred]
Strong competence in programming languages, databases, and data concepts, such as SQL, Python, VBA, Excel Macros [Minimum]
Competency in descriptive data analytics techniques, such as outlier identification and pattern analysis [Minimum]
Familiarity with enterprise systems and IT environments, such as SAP, Mainframes, Microsoft SQL Server, Sybase, and IBM DB2 [Preferred]
Familiarity with audit analytical tools such as ACL, IDEA, Teammate Analytics [Preferred]
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Qliksense [Preferred]
Familiarity with advanced analytics tools such as SAS, R, IBM SPSS [Preferred]
Strong critical thinking, problem solving, relationship building, teamwork, and collaboration skills [Minimum]
Excellent communication skills, ability to deal with difficult situations and opinions diplomatically. [Preferred]
You will consent to a criminal background check as well as the Government of Canada enhanced security screening, the cost will be covered by Great-West Life.

Discover your opportunity….Apply today!

Great-West Life offers competitive compensation, great benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance, wellness account and personal days not to mention onsite cafeteria and fitness facilities. If you’d like to join our team submit your information online and introduce yourself.

Together Great-West Life, London Life and Canada Life serve the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.

Great-West Lifeco would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

The Measurement and Research team is responsible for development and execution of an enterprise-wide brand and customer experience measurement programs as well as decision-support research within GWL Lifeco. The insights generated from this team are used to guide strategic and tactical improvements to Lifeco products, processes and customer service experiences.
Supporting the Manager, Data and Research Operations, this role is responsible for managing and monitoring the research pipeline for the entire team; and for creating and updating process documents for the Measurement and Research Team.
The Data and Research Operations function within this team works closely with business stakeholders to:
1. Ensure that relevant data requirements are mapped and extracted for each new survey;
2. Support ongoing survey data enhancements (add, modify, delete) as data and systems capabilities change or evolve.
Accountabilities:
Execute thorough QA Tests as part of the survey deployment process
Manage the customer feedback mailbox
Work with business teams to ensure new survey data requirements are mapped and extracted
Work with business tech teams to update survey metadata for existing programs as systems and data capabilities evolve
Develop and update (as needed) the comprehensive CX Measurement Process Document
Manage the MR Team Kanban board, Research Pipeline, SharePoint Site and JIRA requests
Participate actively in team meetings and huddles
Actively invest in developing data, research and analysis skills
Qualifications and Competencies:
Post-secondary degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, business or data analysis, operations management
3 years’ experience working with data in a list management role, with emphasis on mapping, extracting and analyzing data for research campaigns
Prior experience in data and business analysis as well as process documentation
Knowledge of SQL and Tableau would be an asset
Superior written and oral communication skills
Process management skills
Ability to multi-task and deliver quality work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
Experience with transforming and manipulating data in Excel
Understanding of the CX and MR practices within the business context
Basic knowledge of the Canadian and global insurance industry
Basic knowledge of corporate IT infrastructure
Discover your opportunity….Apply today!

The Data and Research Operations function within this team works closely with business stakeholders to:
1. Ensure that relevant data requirements are mapped and extracted for each new survey;
2. Support ongoing survey data enhancements (add, modify, delete) as data and systems capabilities change or evolve.
Accountabilities:
Execute thorough QA Tests as part of the survey deployment process
Manage the customer feedback mailbox
Work with business teams to ensure new survey data requirements are mapped and extracted
Work with business tech teams to update survey metadata for existing programs as systems and data capabilities evolve
Develop and update (as needed) the comprehensive CX Measurement Process Document
Manage the MR Team Kanban board, Research Pipeline, SharePoint Site and JIRA requests
Participate actively in team meetings and huddles
Actively invest in developing data, research and analysis skills
Qualifications and Competencies:
Post-secondary degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, business or data analysis, operations management
3 years’ experience working with data in a list management role, with emphasis on mapping, extracting and analyzing data for research campaigns
Prior experience in data and business analysis as well as process documentation
Knowledge of SQL and Tableau would be an asset
Superior written and oral communication skills
Process management skills
Ability to multi-task and deliver quality work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
Experience with transforming and manipulating data in Excel
Understanding of the CX and MR practices within the business context
Basic knowledge of the Canadian and global insurance industry
Basic knowledge of corporate IT infrastructure
Discover your opportunity….Apply today!

Great-West Life offers competitive compensation, great benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance, wellness account and personal days not to mention onsite cafeteria and fitness facilities. If you’d like to join our team submit your information online and introduce yourself.

Together Great-West Life, London Life and Canada Life serve the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.

Great-West Lifeco would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

$80,880 - $101,100 a yearPermanentPLEASE APPLY THROUGH UBC CAREER WEBSITE https://hr.ok.ubc.ca/careers/staff/JOB CODE: Job ID33190 - further details of job description can be found there.Salary Range: Annual - Minimum $80880 to Midpoint: 101100 to Maximum $126376This position leads the assessment of domain specific research tools, methodologies, and resources for computationally- and data-intensive research.This position will serve as a liaison and will advise researchers and research groups on the facilitation, assessment, design, and implementation of complex digital research infrastructure (DRI) research data management solutions specific to the methodological needs and imperatives of the UBC research community.This position will also focus on training, liaising with experts, and research project consultations and assistance for the UBC research community system-wide.EDUCATION/WORK EXPERIENCE:Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. A minimum of 5 years of experience, in-depth knowledge of applications and the business requirements supporting them or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience supporting the research community and working in environments involving multiple stakeholders. Previous knowledge and experience providing ethical and analytical subject matter expertise on the assessment of domain specific research tools, methodologies, and resources for computationally- and data-intensive research.FURTHER DETAILS AT UBC CAREER WEBSITEWORK PERFORMED:- Provides research data management expert liaison and training to UBC researchers system-wide on best practices for such topics as data management plans, data collection, analytics, tracking, transfers, and data quality procedures- Liaise and coordinate with the Library in supporting researchers with the evaluation and implementation of data management plans- Advises researchers in resolving data problems and ensures data is managed consistently by advising on standard operating procedures for the acquisition, processing, analyzing, and transferring of research data.- Participates in the assessment, coordination, training, and knowledge mobilization for researchers in the use of digital research infrastructure (DRI) systems, research tools and best-practices.- Provides strategies to build awareness of local and national training and support initiatives.- Advises researchers on various aspects of computational analysis including access to appropriate DRI and software, workflow optimization, and data management.- Advises researchers on determining and documenting computational and storage requirements on grant proposals and national platform resource allocation competitions.- Serves as ARC research data management subject matter expert on national, regional, provincial, and institutional committees and advisory panels where appropriate.- Works with DRI service providers nationally, regionally, provincially, and institutionally in the development of and access to secure state-of-the-art DRI resources- Coordinates with ARC team with respect to the support of domain specific research data management platforms, tools, and software on the ARC system.- Work with the Library coordinating research data deposits and metadata descriptions- Advises researchers on use of research data management software tools, platforms, and workflows.- Works with partners across government, industry, and local communities to build partnerships and relationships beneficial to UBC researchers- Engages with local communities at UBC to benefit researchers through communication, collaboration, and coordination between relevant groups and departments on campus.- Provides input for establishing policies and procedures pertaining to data management, maintenance, and utilization.- Leads the assessment of researcher needs utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to identify priorities, information flow, content needs; and recommends options.- Identifies, elicits, and documents research requirements and communicates requirements for the implementation of digital research infrastructure solutions.- Researches and evaluates vendor supplied applications, provides customized recommendations and solutions for systems and applications.- Analyzes and reviews existing or proposed system features and integration, security, scalability and performance requirements with researchers, analysts, and team members.- Communicates with stakeholders of varying technical ability and subject matter expertise.- Builds and maintains good working relationships and collaborates with others to achieve objectives.- Provides consultative services for the development of policies and procedures- Manages small to medium sized projects and related budgets.- Provides technical expertise, training, and consultation to other staff.- Works with teams to develop large grant applications with significant computing needs- Compiles and analyzes metrics.- Maintains appropriate professional designations and up-to-date knowledge of current information technology techniques and tools and provides input to strategies for ongoing support and upgrade of these systems.- Performs other related duties as required.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $80,880.00 to $101,100.00 /yearExperience:applications & business management: 5 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's Degree (Required)

Customer Satisfaction
Search

Experience with working with Google Cloud Environment

Analyste d’inventaireAer Rianta International est l'un des principaux exploitants de boutiques hors taxes dans les aéroports internationaux. Nous avons toujours des postes à pourvoir dans différents domaines : cosmétiques, vente, achats, finances, entrepôt, etc. Quel que soit le service, nous recrutons.Communiquez sans tarder avec notre recruteur pour en savoir plus sur nos postes à pourvoir et vos perspectives d'avenir chez Aer Rianta!The Loop: Hors Taxes cherche à combler le poste d'analyste d’inventaire. Le candidat sélectionné sera responsable des tâches de contrôle et de production de rapports relatives à tous les aspects du processus de gestion d’inventaire, et devra également rechercher des moyens d'améliorer l'efficacité d'un point de vue opérationnel et financier. Il offrira par ailleurs un soutien direct en ce qui concerne la gestion des stocks, en concentrant ses efforts sur les stocks obsolètes et à faible rotation et leur destruction, en plus de préparer des analyses financières et le rapprochement des inventaires tournants et complets des stocks.Voici à quoi ressemblera votre journée : Surveiller tous les aspects de la gestion des stocks, notamment l'exactitude des transferts, des ajustements et des inventaires physiques des stocks;Contribuer à la gestion des stocks en analysant les données pertinentes afin d'identifier les risques et les opportunités; rédiger des commentaires détaillés sur les ICP relatifs aux stocks;Produire des analyses des causes profondes relatives aux statistiques d'inventaire et passer les résultats en revue avec les équipes responsables des finances, de la logistique et de la vente au détail;Développer des processus pour améliorer les contrôles, l'exactitude et la reddition de comptes des stocks;Produire les rapports de fin de mois sur la rotation des stocks en incluant des commentaires sur les domaines clés auxquels appliquer des mesures de gestion;Examiner les dispositions relatives à l'obsolescence, à la freinte, au gaspillage et aux tâches;Veiller au respect du calendrier approuvé des inventaires;Concilier les écarts d'inventaire et s'assurer que tous les ajustements après l'inventaire soient traités correctement et en temps opportun dans le système;Veiller à ce que la dévalorisation et la destruction des stocks soient effectués en temps opportun, avec preuves de vérification et approbation;Examiner régulièrement les items pour assurer un traitement rapide des stocks immobiles, obsolètes et endommagés;Préparer des analyses et des enquêtes sur les résultats des inventaires afin de soutenir les responsables de la vente au détail et de la logistique quant à la mise en place de contrôles efficaces;Effectuer des analyses financières qui comprennent le rapprochement avec le grand livre et des commentaires sur les résultats des inventaires tournants et complets;Aborder les problèmes pouvant avoir une incidence sur les opérations, la logistique et les finances, et les transmettre à l'échelon approprié;Effectuer des tâches de fin de mois relatives à la gestion des stocks;Compiler et analyser les informations concernant les coûts de transport;Participer aux processus budgétaires et prévisionnels;Apporter son soutien lors d'audits internes et externes;Participer à des projets ponctuels.Avez-vous ce qu'il faut?Baccalauréat;Au moins deux années d'expérience pertinente (une expérience dans le domaine de la vente au détail est un atout);Expérience avec les systèmes et processus ERP et de gestion d'entrepôt;Excellente connaissance d'Excel et de MS Office;Fortes compétences organisationnelles et de gestion du temps;Excellentes capacités de communication verbale et écrite; capacité à communiquer de façon claire et concise avec tous les échelons de l'organisation;Capacité à travailler dans l'urgence, souci du détail et capacité à assurer l'exactitude des résultats attendus;Solides compétences en résolution de problèmes et aptitude à contribuer à l'analyse et au rapprochement des données financières;Motivation, esprit d'initiative, capacité à penser stratégiquement et à travailler avec un encadrement minimal;Capacité à gérer plusieurs tâches simultanément, à établir des priorités et à respecter des délais rigoureux;Capacité à identifier les problèmes et à élaborer des solutions créatives tout en mobilisant les intervenants clés;Capacité à communiquer efficacement en anglais et en français;Disponibilité à travailler selon un horaire variable de temps à autre.Ce que nous ferons pour vous!Sourire : Couverture soins dentairesSanté : Couverture médicale complètePlanification de l'avenir : Régime de retraite avantageuxProduits de luxe : Réduction sur les achats aux boutiques hors taxesTransport : Facilement accessible en transport en commun; stationnement gratuitBesoin de vous confier? Accès à un thérapeute par le biais de notre programme d'aide aux employés______________________________________________________________________________Inventory AnalystAer Rianta International Inc. is one of the major international airport Duty Free Boutiques Operator. We continuously have positions open in different areas: cosmetics, sales, purchasing, finance, warehouse etc. you name it, we’re hiring!The Loop Duty Free is currently seeking an Inventory Analyst. This position will be responsible for monitoring and reporting all aspects of the inventory process while identifying opportunities to improve efficiency from an operational and financial perspective. Hamilton, ONFULL TIME

Title

Quantitative Researcher

Location

Hamilton, ON or Ottawa, ON

Reports To

Research Manager

Who We are Looking For

The ideal candidate has a strong background in quantitative analysis, is curious and innovative, and adept at the creative use of data science tools and techniques to produce strategic value for an interdisciplinary research team and for senior management. The candidate will take a leading role in imagining and generating new angles and applications for our work and data collections. Valuable assets include: an interest and expertise in social policy and a strong understanding of the importance and limits of data in public policy research.

Who We Are

Cardus is a non-partisan, public policy think tank and registered charity dedicated to promoting a flourishing society through independent research, robust public dialogue, and thought-provoking commentary. Drawing on 2,000 years of Christian social thought, we seek to renew North American social architecture through credible public research into big questions that require strategic collaboration to address human need. We have research programs and initiatives in the following areas: Education, Family, Health, Law and Religious Freedom, Social Cities, Social Isolation, and Work and Economics. Cardus also publishes Comment Magazine (https://www.cardus.ca/comment/) and Convivium (https://www.convivium.ca/) . To learn more about us, visit our website (https://www.cardus.ca/who-we-are/work-with-us/) , follow us on Twitter (https://twitter.com/cardusca) , and check us out on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/cardus.ca/) .

How to Apply

Cover letter REQUIRED.

We will review applications as they are received and look forward to hearing from you. Job posted until filled.

Core Competencies


Strong data analysis and research methods skills with proficiency using SPSS, Mathematica, R, or similar statistical software packages.
Entrepreneurial spirit and thirst to unlock new story and policy angles from data sets.
Understanding of advanced statistical analysis such as regression and factor analysis
A demonstrated understanding of the contributions and limits of quantitative research, and the ways in which it can work with and assist other kinds of research, including qualitative, philosophical, and theological.
A minimum of three to five years work experience, with data analysis support for public policy projects considered valuable.
Strong attention to detail and the ability to perform work with a high level of accuracy.
Excellent project management and planning skills; ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Ability to complete and prioritize assigned duties within critical deadlines.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Upholds the professional integrity necessary to handle confidential information.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Bachelor's degree
Master's degree an asset.
Understanding the significance of Christian social and political thinking for public policy challenges considered valuable.
Strong work ethic and aptitude for continual learning and professional development.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), E-mail, and Adobe Products.

Position Emphases

Research and Analysis.


Clean, evaluate, and analyze quantitative and qualitative data using statistical software.
Provide data analysis and research for the production of policy papers and briefs for multiple audiences, including program stakeholders, parliamentary committees, media, and civil society leaders.
Perform data quality and data integrity checks.
Identify and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Contribute methodological insights and planning in the early stages of project research.
Perform literature and data set reviews using government, academic, and other sources of information.
Effectively execute and communicate complex analysis and insights to research and management team colleagues and various stakeholders in a visually appealing and concise manner.
Produce content to support the development of internal research and public-facing deliverables.
Deliver data-driven insights, produce timely and actionable information and help drive results for internal and client-facing projects.
Bring data to life through effective visualizations and explanation for non-technical audiences.
Develop recommendations for process improvements to benefit research department.
Assist with other research assignments and special projects for Program Directors and Management as needed.

Writing.


Write, publish, and provide analysis of research findings for reports, articles and other deliverables.
Develop and curate research and data content for public and by-invitation only symposia, panels, and events.
Draft, edit, and redact content for research and management colleagues and publication.

Collaboration.


Collaborate with research and management team members to anticipate data needs and formulate solutions to research problems.
Liaise with various networks/organizations as determined from time to time for specific projects.
Assist in developing research and undertaking analysis across a range of policy areas with multiple Cardus staff members.
Contribute to Cardus staff meetings, research team meetings, and semi-annual staff convention gatherings in Ottawa and Hamilton.

Comox Valley, BCTemporary$25.43 - $27.01 an hourReporting directly to the Manager of Financial Services, the Finance Support Analyst is responsible for the full range of accounting functions, including bank reconciliations, accounts receivable, balance sheet reconciliations, financial aid transactions, etc.
