Job Description
IBM is seeking a Risk Analyst to strengthen the IBM Algo Risk Service and Data Management Teams.

IBM Algo Risk Service on Cloud offers hedge funds, asset managers, pension funds and other buy-side organizations access to an award-winning web-based portfolio construction, financial risk management and reporting service without the costs or challenges of an in-house deployment. Offering bundled data, it provides a wide variety of simulation-based risk analytics that enable portfolio managers, traders, risk managers and senior executives to take a proactive approach to financial risk oversight and investment decision making.

The Role

Risk Analysts work in a multi-disciplinary group (business leads, technical consultants and core Development teams) to support the IBM Algo Risk Service on Cloud framework or to assist in Data Quality and Validation. This framework involves data, analytics and reporting services that employ Risk Analytics Algo One applications. Working from an existing legacy platform, consultants assist in the transformation to a dynamic and flexible Cloud based risk service integrated with a proprietary Data Service.

Our team works collaboratively and members are encouraged to explore and develop unique ways to solve challenges employing advanced quantitative finance techniques. Projects require individuals who are able to research and experiment to develop new ideas and solutions. Working with an open and constructive mindset, guidance and feedback is available from the broader group.


Responsibilities :
Provide subject matter expert advice to internal and external audience for risk management topics including financial markets operations, product valuation methods, scenario based risk analysis and risk reporting standards.
Own functional projects related to feature extensions including interaction with development team (team & core), research and client service teams. Involves independent scope setting, task determination, priority setting and development support
Consulting with sales and pre-sales to present Service capabilities to prospects. Identify and fill gaps where necessary.
Investigation of data sourcing, transformation and storage for use in the risk management process. May involve extensive communication and negotiation with external vendors.
Investigation and remediation of client support issues (3rdlevel support).
Work with Development team to improve the core software offering.
Competencies and Skills :
Theoretical understanding of financial economics, mathematics and statistics.
Practical knowledge of financial markets and risk management standards.
Practical knowledge and experience around financial instrument valuation methods and (stochastic) scenario generation techniques.
Strong research and problem solving skills.
Familiarity with data science languages such as R or Python.
Written and oral presentation skills. Must be able to convey complex ideas to a functional and technical audience.
Technical aptitude including use of computer networks, Linux operating system and client/server applications.
Education :
University degree in the field of Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or other quantitative discipline.
Advanced degree in Financial Engineering or Mathematical Finance is beneficial.
CFA, PRM or FRM designation(s) beneficial.
**NOTE: the successful candidate will need to work from our 185 Spadina Ave office on a regular basis**

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

At least 5 years of relevant experience in the financial industry working with front or middle office portfolio risk management systems.
Experience in an advanced technical environment – collaborating on or writing scripts or code, integration, testing and deployment.
Experience with financial market data such as Reuters, Bloomberg or Interactive Data applications.

Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

N/A

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. CanadaData Scientist, Acquisition Strategy

25 York Street, Toronto, Ontario, M5J 2V5
President’s Choice Bank is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Loblaw Companies Limited (LCL) and was established to promote President’s Choice Financial services offered by strategic partners in all regions of Canada. PCF has grown to over 3 million customers earning millions in better interest rates, free groceries and other rewards. It operates in the following segments:
Mastercard : The President’s Choice Financial Mastercard is offered and operated by President’s Choice Bank.
Insurance : Home and auto insurance, travel and pet insurance are offered through affiliates and relationships with several insurance companies.
PC Services , which includes PC Financial Insurance, The Mobile Shop, Prepaid Cell Phones Express and gift card businesses, is a new business in growth mode.
PC Optimum : All PCF customers have the opportunity to earn PC Optimum Points that can be earned and redeemed in all LCL stores.
Loblaws Inc. is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Loblaw Companies Limited (LCL). LCL is Canada’s food and pharmacy leader, with a network of corporate and independently- operated stores in communities across the country, employing close to 200,000 Canadians. PCF is an important business unit within LCL that manages and develops products and service programs to improve the customer experience, maximize value, and provide a platform to enhance customer insights and relationships. PCF’s vision is to provide superior value financial products to consumers.
What You'll Do:
Develop and monitor acquisition strategies for prospects from face to face and digital channels. Use advanced analytics and modeling/machine learning to understand how the behaviour of customers and prospects, their interactions and touchpoints contribute to their overall customer experience to inform the overall acquisition strategy.
Collaborate with product and sales teams to develop a thorough understanding of business objectives to deliver customer-focused insights, analytics solutions and customer acquisition strategies.
Through statistical analysis (e.g. Linear and Logistic regression, Gradient Boosting, Random Forest, etc.), understand and measure the changing needs of the target customer to influence the customer experience.
Conduct multi-variate testing and A/B testing to measure effectiveness of strategies and refine them as needed.
Translate customer data into cross-channel customer insights, and competitive intelligence reports, which will form a strategy to meet customer needs and improve customer acquisition, growth and retention.
Using structured and unstructured rich data sources, (including but not limited to internal customer data, competitive intelligence, industry benchmarks, voice of the customer, and web analytics), produce customer/prospect experience metrics and insights, including awareness, engagement and customer loyalty, across all channels.
Measure the effectiveness of the customer journey, by using path analysis, channel attribution and media mix modeling, providing specific recommendations to increase revenue or reduce costs.
Present business analysis results and recommendations to key stakeholders.
What you will need:
Post-Secondary education or equivalent experience in a quantitative field preferred (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Engineering/Science, or Operations Research)
Minimum of 3 years progressive experience analyzing structured and unstructured data, developing and executing on strategies and making strategic recommendations to management.
Experience in working with statistical software applications (e.g. SAS, R, or Python)
Experience with SQL, Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics is an asset.
Strong MS Office (Excel, Access, PowerPoint) skills.
Excellent analytical, storytelling, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to distill and communicate complex analytic recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, both orally and in written presentations.
Results oriented. Demonstrated ability to be part of multiple projects/initiatives of varying size and complexity, while prioritizing and balancing multiple tasks within a fast-paced work environment.

Windsor, ONJob Summary:
As a member of the Decision Support team at Windsor Regional Hospital, this person will primarily work in collaboration with provincial and regional cancer/renal partners to support the Erie St Clair (ESC) Regional Cancer Program (RCP) and Regional Renal Program. This position will provide data analysis expertise in the areas of cancer and renal surveillance, research, information/data dissemination, evaluation, quality improvement, and Quality Based Procedures (QBP) reporting to contribute to the building of better developed and managed cancer/renal services across Erie St. Clair.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for ensuring compilation of data/reporting pertaining to QBPs driving funding and performance agreements
Assists with designing/implementing performance/quality improvement measures within the Regional Cancer Program and the Regional Renal Program
Manages data associated with required and requested Ministry and Corporate indicators
Collects and links cancer/renal data from various sources including but not limited to: CCO (IPORT), Ontario Renal Reporting System, Nephrocare, Statistics Canada data and surveys, CIHI and other relevant databases.
Develop or modify databases for the collection of relevant information and extraction of informative data.
Collaborates with various local and regional stakeholders regarding their information needs
Coordinates and conducts analysis of regional cancer/renal system based on provincial data, community input and other sources for the purpose of identifying gaps and establishing planning priorities
Provides consultative and analytical support involving integrated clinical, statistical, and financial information to support evidence-based decision-making and the monitoring of performance.
Required analyses may include trending, impact analysis and benchmarking as requested to support monthly utilization reporting and presentation to internal and external committees and agencies.
Determines and influences the collection of new cancer/renal data through new and existing data collection tools and questionnaires
Reviews and validates data samples to ensure high quality timely cancer data accurate assumptions are used in regional service planning and evaluation.
Qualifications:
A Baccalaureate Degree in health administration, health policy, statistics, business or equivalent, Masters preferred
Experience with biostatistics, evaluation or related field required
Minimum of 2 years in a health care (hospital) environment. (preferred)
Experience in conducting methodologically sound, multidisciplinary, evidence-based research
Proven ability to undertake advanced statistical analysis and interpretation of all types of health data
Solid understanding of report writing for both ad hoc and regular reporting including data structure and standardization. Select candidates will be tested prior to proceeding to interview stage.
Excellent facilitation and leadership skills, which foster a collaborative team, approach to data and research initiatives.
High level of proficiency with a variety of computer software – i.e. Word, Excel, Access, statistical software (e.g. SPSS, SAS) Medline, PowerPoint, Internet.
Demonstrated excellence in communication, customer service. team building with the ability to model positive change.
Good understanding of/sensitivity to Health Policy environment, the ability to assess impact on hospital operations.
Demonstrated commitment to lifelong learning.
French Language proficiency an asset.

Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.
This position is with IQVIA’s Privacy Analytics team in the heart of downtown Ottawa, Canada.

Our Professional Services team is growing. We’re hiring Clinical Trials Data Anonymization Analysts to support an expanding line of business. In this role you’ll be end-to-end responsible for client anonymization projects. Using our tools you will analyze and mitigate the risk of re-identification for trial participants whose data appears in clinical trials documentation. As an ideal candidate you learn quickly and can produce extremely accurate, precise work within tight timelines. You’re familiar with medical or scientific language, and your excellent communication skills are complemented by strong technical acumen and the ability to meet tight deadlines.

Responsibilities:
Develop familiarity with our de-identification methodology.
Own assigned projects or project tasks and deliver such on time and with the required quality, providing timely and transparent status updates and managing client expectations.
Configure our in-house software tools, to process clients’ clinical trials documents and data.
Core responsibilities include: Pre-processing documents, analyzing lengthy, technical / medical documents (Clinical Study Reports) against established standards, including noting sections which may or may not be clearly identified, checking the quality of automated document processing steps and manually securing patient and commercial information where required
and / or:
Identify and classify direct and indirect identifiers, measure and mitigate re-identification risk, determine and apply required transformations.
Facilitate the creation of anonymization reports and other client deliverables.
Collaborate closely with other team members, ensuring that all work meets established quality standards and is completed on time. Participate in peer-reviews of work products.
Identify and communicate tool enhancements/refinements and relate defect documentation to developers and researchers.
Skill for pre-processing datasets (importing from client formats, converting data as required), analyzing complex and complicated statistical clinical trial data structures, transforming data using SAS scripts and SQL would be an asset but are not essential.
Qualifications:
Ability to understand policy documents and apply this understanding in a variety of contexts; an educational background in health sciences may be beneficial.
Ability to learn our methodology and develop a thorough understanding of how directly and indirectly identifying information contributes to the risk of re-identification. This is generally demonstrated through experience and comfort with scientific and quantitative disciplines for example, clinical research, STEM fields, etc.
Exceptional detail-orientation.
Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills.
The drive to meet exacting deadlines and the flexibility to adapt to shifting priorities.
Ability to manage sensitive information with the utmost confidentiality.
Medical writing and/or clinical trials experience is an asset.
Familiarity with ICH guidelines for clinical trial documents and EMA Policy 0070 are valuable assets.
Experience with Adobe PDF and MS Office products (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) required.
1-2 years working experience with SQL (MS SQL server), SAS, R, and statistical analysis of clinical or healthcare data would be a great asset, but are not a requirement for all positions.
Experience configuring and working with Natural Language Processing (NLP) tools would be a great asset, but are not a requirement for all positions.

Job Summary
Positions within this family ensure data is properly managed and leveraged from Source to Storage to Delivery in the most efficient and effective way to benefit the organization. This position is an Entry level role into Data Management field. This position performs accountabilities under general supervision and supervisor provides guidance and examples on how to perform a task but expects the employee to use the new knowledge to independently perform the task. General supervision: the employee is told what to do but not how to do it. The how to is left up to the employee. These jobs have some discretion on work accountabilities.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Applies data derivations, rules; and data requirements that align with standards and regulatory compliance. Participates in the data governance and metadata processes by preparing artifacts for review and submission (i.e. researching, preparing simple submissions, and data quality metrics). Actively implements Data Management standards and best practices. Acts as data management representative on projects to review data requirements against data standards. Monitors, identifies, investigates, prioritizes, remediates and communicates data quality issues. Performs data profiling, analyzes and communicates results in support of data quality processes. Implements processes to certify data quality for business intelligence purposes. Applies data and data quality definitions and standards, and transformation rules, in daily work. Demonstrates understanding of overall data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules and participates in the creation of data models (e.g. entity design and population). Builds on existing knowledge to learn line of business specific end to end data flow and lineage from capture at source, to storage, to delivery and its business intent at each stage (i.e. capture, transformation, fragmentation and editing). Performs assigned functions to meet goals and objectives of the unit. Data Analysis: For assigned tasks, develop and maintains business data requirements to support data standards, ensuring that solutions (structure, values, relationships, quality standards) meet operational and business needs. Analyzes customer requests (internal or external regulatory, e.g. data calls) for changes/new business data requirements to production system, determines impact on existing systems processes and develops appropriate specifications, enhancements, system table updates and/or procedures to comply. Meet with customer to elicit requirements and conduct fact gathering sessions. Independently conduct root cause analysis; identify data trends, propose and implement approved specification changes to address issue, working with impacted areas. Perform testing and validation of business data requirements, including creation of test strategy and test plans. Perform other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelors degree or equivalent education required.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
Bachelors degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or Business preferred. 1+ yrs. general business experience, Data Management experienced preferred. Insurance knowledge preferred. Understands concepts and applications of business information models. Demonstrates understanding of relationship between data and business rules and functions (i.e. data analysis concepts). Proficient with tools and software to extract and analyze data in the data management function.

Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Solid knowledge of data practices and principles for data analysis. Demonstrated solid analytic and diagnostic skills. Demonstrated solid interpersonal skills. Demonstrated solid communication skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Demonstrated ability to multi-task. Demonstrated problem solving and diagnostic skills. Seeks opportunities to learn. Solid decision making skills. Intermediate skill/competency level: demonstrates solid knowledge and ability; can apply the competency with minimal or no guidance, in the full range of typical situations. Requires guidance handling novel or more complex situations.

Medical cannabis markets are rapidly expanding in Canada and around the world. Recreational cannabis is on the horizon. Now is your chance to join the largest, most recognized cannabis producer in the country as we set off to build something amazing, relying on established but ever-evolving brands.

The Company

Hi.

Canopy Growth Corporation ("Canopy Growth") is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC) and part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries, including its flagship Tweed and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand, are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis. With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production, and operations spanning five continents, Canopy is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of our success and take pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration and diversity. Our employees stem from a wide range of professional backgrounds; each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Does inefficiency make you shudder? Do you find yourself dreaming about process improvement? If you answered yes to both questions then this job is for you! This position is responsible for gathering data, building process tools and conducting analysis with the goal of improving Canopy's supply chain across multiple facilities and departments. The successful candidate is a highly motivated, self-directed individual capable of multi-tasking with a high level of professionalism and the ability to work with various departments.

Responsibilities

Inventory, planning and scheduling

Aggregate product need from marketing team and use/develop statistical tools to forecast demand
Compile detailed view of inventory available / future. Highlight issues, lead corrective actions and escalate roadblocks for prompt resolution
Forecast needs for consumables to help ensure adequate safety stocks are always maintained
Develop analysis on product mix across various facilities
Track and analyze key metrics such as throughput, OEE, inventory turns, load leveling and labor usage to identify potentials areas of improvement

Procurement

Assist with translating the production schedule into a supply plan to procure all cultivation materials, consumables and equipment on time across the company
Analyze spending and identify opportunities for procurement related cost savings

Logistics

Identify under-performing areas in the global supply chain
Keep track of operational KPIs and balance scorecards
Must be able to work a variable of different shifts
Other duties as assigned

Experience and Background

Degree in Engineering or Supply Chain management preferred
MBA considered an asset
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel is a must
Solution oriented with excellent analytical and creative problem solving skills
Strong initiative, enthusiasm and project management skills are essential
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast paced environment

Other Details

This is a full-time position based out of Smiths Falls. Depending on your seniority and what you bring to the table, we’ll figure everything else out.

Note: The chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

We appreciate the interest by all candidates however we will be contacting those that best fit the requirements. All resumes will be maintained in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Vancouver, BCJob Description Summary
The Data Analyst is responsible for data analysis, reporting and warehousing, in addition to being engaged in all aspects of the different business areas within STEMCELL. You will also be responsible for providing actionable data to operating departments and will be an integral part of helping establish and grow a new business intelligence platform.
Job Description
Duties and Responsibilities
Works with internal business areas to define business data modes and reporting requirements.
Perform complex data analysis that requires critical thinking and report development activities, such as the creation of SQL queries in order to extract data for reports.
Contributes to the development of the IT strategy via critical assessment of emerging data management technologies and gaining a deep understanding of STEMCELL’s business processes and tools.
Design and implement report templates using MS Excel and/or Google Sheets, including the ability to develop scripts for those tools.
Assist in the training, support, maintenance, and ongoing administration of reporting applications.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of delivery and operations within reporting and data warehousing.
Collaborate with cross-functional team members on features, design and implementation.
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
Experience with business intelligence reporting tools - SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or BusinessObjects (BOBJ) preferred.
Experience with data visualization and reporting software. Familiarity with Microsoft Access a plus.
Experience writing SQL statements for Oracle and MS-SQL.
Familiarity with the R scripting language.
Familiar with ERP and manufacturing systems - SAP preferred.
Familiar with issue tracking systems - JIRA preferred.
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written) both in one-on-one and in a group setting including presentation skills in front of development and business areas.
Excellent problem-solving with a keen attention to detail.
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. ADP is hiring a Workforce Forecast Analyst I . In this role you will be responsible for developing accurate forecasts (long, mid & short) for multiple client channels including but not limited to Inbound, Outbound, Email and Chat, as well as, back office workload. In addition, you will be responsible for developing accurate long-range forecasts to determine overall staffing capacity requirements. In addition, you will develop staffing capacity requirements to support GlobalView and all migration efforts. This person will also develop accurate mid-range forecasts to allow for accurate planning of associate development, coaching and training needs. He/She works closely with Service Management Project Teams to assess the impact of the project on the forecast and the ability to deliver on associate initiatives. The Workforce Forecast Analyst works with Sr. Leadership and Finance during the fiscal planning process to ensure that planned FTE headcount supports the Associate and Client Experience goals of GlobalView.


At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP.

We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Oversees and maintains the Workforce Management platform (configurations for skills, call & multi-channel routing, associates, historical trends, anomalies, etc.) Multi-channel includes calls (Inbound & Outbound), Email and Chat.
Conducts weekly/monthly meetings focused on reviewing forecasts, capacity planning, shrinkage review, KPI results, etc. throughout all levels of leadership in SBS.
Establishes a statistical baseline for call volume forecasts for SBS enterprise. Provides clear communication of the forecasted workload, changes, assumptions, inputs, etc to leadership team.
Establishes a statistical baseline for multi-channel (calls, email & chat) and back office forecasts for SBS enterprise. Provides clear communication of the forecasted workload, changes, assumptions, inputs, etc to leadership team.
Analyze multi-routing result of call volumes, call patterns, call trends and staff productivity for assigned call centers; use this information to build, coordinate, and accurately maintain employee long-term schedules
Maintains events calendar on behalf of Region (meetings, trainings, 1:1 sessions, etc) and ensure that impacts to business are captured, analyzed and recommendations on staffing supporting the associate experience are delivered in a timely manner
Identifies and researches Region -wide service level risks for problem resolution and management notification
Creates business process/workflow for agents across SBS to use self-serve functionality in workforce management scheduling
Responsible for updating statistical info into WFM modeling software
Responsible for assisting WFM Director/Manager in training and supporting new WFM team members. This includes training of the WFM platform, policy and procedures and all additional related systems
QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

Bachelor's Degree-is an asset with Major Area of Concentration in Math, Business, Statistics, Technology or related field.
3 -5 years experience.
Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:

Proven workforce management experience and strong knowledge of call center operations
Proven experience forecasting with WFM applications Genesys (preferred), Aspect, Verint, Pipkins, IEX
Solid understanding of call routing strategies (CentreVu, Meridian, etc..)
Skills & Abilities:
Ability to prioritize, organize and summarize data
Strong Excel skills, and solid working knowledge of Word, PowerPoint
Attention to detail and process
Ability to influence and drive results
Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills
Open to learning new approaches and willingness to take direction
Ability to learn and work in a fast pace environment

job_description:
$23.76 - $31.70 an hourThe Neurobiology of Depression and Aging Lab at the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is seeking a full-time, contract Research Analyst to join our team. You will require excellent organizational and communication skills as well as a strong scientific background to work effectively and strategically with a variety of programs as well as staff. This position is located at 250 College Street.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Assist in the submission of manuscripts to scientific journals and abstracts/posters for various conferences
Assisting in preparation and updating of CVs for grant submission and U of T affiliation
Participate in drafting project budget modules for proposals and including contributing to grant editing and submission
Liaising with other internal CAMH departments (Research Services, REB and Biosafety) for projects as needed
Help in booking appointments and scheduling meetings such as research lab meeting.
Conference travel organization for scientists including submission of travel authorizations and submission
Planning and organizing weekly seminar series as well as special meetings/events
Basic experimental procedures (sample collection, macromolecule extraction, and quantification) as well as data analysis and report-writing and editing
General laboratory and equipment maintenance.
Successful candidates will support a healthy workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork, and complies with all applicable policies, regulatory and legislative requirements.

Qualifications:
The successful candidate will have an Honours’ Baccalaureate in biology, health science, psychology, or related discipline combined with one year of relevant experience. Previous experience with working in a research setting / hospital or university is an asset. Previous experience in grant submissions is an asset. Strong PC software skills, including Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel) are required. This position requires superior attention to detail. The candidate needs to be well organized, with the ability to meet deadlines and to work independently with minimal supervision. You will possess superior interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively both within our team as well as with other CAMH departments and external organizations. The ability to work effectively in a wide range of settings with individuals from diverse backgrounds is mandatory. Bilingualism (French/English) and/or proficiency in a second language would be an asset.
Please note: This full-time, contract position lasting one (1) year is part of the OPSEU Bargaining Unit.
Salary Range: $23.76 per hour to $31.70 per hour

CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.
CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.
As an employment equity employer CAMH actively seeks Aboriginal peoples, visible minorities, women, people with disabilities, (including people with who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges), and additional diverse identities for our workforce.

Canopy Growth Corporation ("Canopy Growth") is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC) and part of the S&P Composite Index. Vancouver, BCWho we are
lululemon is a yoga-inspired technical apparel company up to big things. The practice and philosophy of yoga informs our overall purpose to elevate the world through the power of practice. We are proud to be a growing global company with locations all around the world, from Vancouver to Shanghai, and places in between. We owe our success to our innovative product, our emphasis on our stores, our commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we get to make in every community we are in.

About this team
Within retail operations, the future retail operations team leads initiatives that transform our retail experience across channels. we create new programs and tools to change guest and educator behavior that elevate guest experience in the physical and digital environment, allowing us to recognize outcomes & opportunities that wouldn’t otherwise exist. We love strategic, resourceful and innovative people that excel at operations recognizing business needs, collaborating and initiating action (read: cool nerds that make the magic happen).

About Omni Channel & Store Technology
RFID is the heart beat that supports our omni-channel and in-store technology programs. Through industry leading inventory accuracy, we’re able to know where our inventory is at all times. Store Technology programs such as digital fixtures and instore transacting allow us leverage accurate inventory look up. Our omni fulfillment programs such as “ship from store” & “buy online, pickup in store” unlock this power of RFID, ensuring we can always find whatever product a guest wants and get it to them to wherever they want, as fast as they want it.

A day in the life:
Drive analysis and insights for our Store Technology programs in North American storesWork in collaboration with our Product Owners to support the prioritization of workSupport our UX designers to help uncover data to drive designPerform ad hoc quantitative and qualitative analyses to support the development of store technology use cases and experiences to engage, inspire, and connect lululemon guestsAudit and evaluate initiatives post-implementationWork with a cross-functional team including E-Commerce, IT, Store Operations, FP&A and ProductAgile in identifying and helping resolve project issues as they arise

Three to Five years of professional work experienceMinimum BA / BS degree from a four-year accredited universityAbility to collect, analyze, and present complex large data in a simple, digestible wayHungry to learn, problem-solve and make an impact on the organizationDesire and ability to learn quickly and work in an agile environmentResourceful and able to work on time-sensitive deliverables autonomouslyComfortable coordinating with multiple cross-functional stakeholdersHighly proficient in Excel and experience with visualization tools (e.g. Qlik, Power B.I, Tableau)Experience with ecomm analytics tools such as Adobe, Google Analytics, Quantum Metrics a plusUnderstanding of retail and online landscape a plusRFID & store experience a plus

Must haves:
Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life.Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results.Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same.Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously

Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to act on solutions; good negotiations skills.

The WHY

As the Junior Analyst for Total Rewards & Organization Design, you provide supporting analysis, reporting, and technical expertise in compensation, benefits, job design, job evaluation, and organization design best practices. This contributes to MEC effectively attracting, retaining, and engaging the right people to accomplish its mission and goals, and improving employee experience daily.

Why MEC?
MEC is more than a store, and we’re more than a place to buy hats and backpacks. We’re physical and digital hubs for the outdoor community. People connect here, through our stores, online channels, over the phone, or through one of our leading events, clinics or services.

MEC is an equal opportunity employer. We’re proud to work with our people to create a diverse workplace, which accommodates individuals of all abilities, backgrounds and identities. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Tell us what you need during the hiring process, and we’ll do our best to accommodate you.

Why YOU?

If you like working with an inclusive, hands-on, collaborative team that connects people with quality products to encourage active outdoor lives, then this is the team for you. MEC is an awesome place if you’re always learning and trying new things, like bouldering, yoga or trail running!

You are pragmatic, innovative, a skilled problem solver, and have the capacity to deliver under pressure. With the help of your team, you can translate strategic imperatives into tangible and relevant local outcomes. You have outstanding people and stakeholder/partner relationship skills, with a track record of delivering on prior organization design and/or total rewards initiatives.

The HOW

Assist in bringing unit’s projects to life through analysis, coordination, and research.
Support end-to-end organization design workflow including the design, development and implementation of the organizational structure.
Own reporting, invoice processing, upkeep and internal communications of total rewards products.
Support employee benefits processes including reconciliation and preparation of invoices, posting updates to the appropriate communication channels, providing data in support of our partners’ requests.
Support with market survey and external benchmarking processes, including planning, research, matching and data collection.
Own the standardized compensation activities that support effective biweekly payroll processing.
Support the annual vacation payout process, including communications, fielding general employee questions, and co-ordination with payroll.
Assist in the delivery of all annual compensation activities, like salary increases, bonus.
The WHAT

1 to 3 years of functional and related experience in relevant fields, especially in compensation & benefits, reporting & analysis, and organization design
University degree in business, economics, sociology, or a related field
Intermediate-to-advanced data analysis skills. Always finding ways to improve
Experience in delivering standardized reporting to the business or vendors with demonstrated attention to automation and scalability


What Great looks like

Working with our partner departments and your team, you develop tools and assist with implementation of Total Rewards and Organization Design projects, policies, systems and processes. You advise cross-functional teams, assessing current processes and structures. You work to ensure that organizational needs, development, and structures are harmonized and aligned with MEC’s short, medium and long-term strategic objectives. You make proposals on new ways to work, after conducting analysis. You assist in the creation of KPIs and how we assess performance of our current rewards products. You assist in the delivery of the total rewards product calendar. You monitor the market regularly for trends to ensure ongoing competitiveness in MEC’s total rewards offering.

DRW is a technology-driven, diversified principal trading firm. We trade our own capital at our own risk, across a broad range of asset classes, instruments and strategies, in financial markets around the world. As the markets have evolved over the past 25 years, so has DRW – maximizing opportunities to include real estate, cryptoassets and venture capital. With over 900 employees at our Chicago headquarters and offices around the world, we work together to solve complex problems, challenge consensus and deliver meaningful results. It's a place of high expectations, deep curiosity and thoughtful collaboration.

We are looking for a driven individual with a strong quantitative background to join our Event-Driven trading team, and support our existing trading strategies through data analytics. In this role, you will be working closely with traders, researchers, and developers and your work will be relied upon for every trade. You will have an immediate impact in driving the bottom line. And you'll be working on the cutting edge of finance and technology for one of the world's leading trading firms.

You'll feel right at home if you:

Have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or a related quantitative field

Have an understanding of financial markets
Have experience working with one or more programming languages: Python, R, VBA, C++, Matlab
Proficient with Microsoft Excel
Have strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as the ability present complete and cohesive findings and explain complex ideas clearly
Are fluent in English
Have strong interpersonal skills and have an ability to work in a collaborative environment with cross-functional teams
Possess self-motivation, intellectual curiosity and a passion for technology

Bonus Points for:

Experience working with databases and SQL
Knowledge of options and/or equities

Applying quantitative techniques to large market datasets to obtain actionable insights
Researching intraday trading data to develop profitable trading strategies
Assisting with the development of analytical tools
Investigating the potential application of existing strategies to new products
Developing a post-trade framework and conducting post-trade analysis
Identifying innovative solutions to complex problems
Working as part of a trading desk to maintain and expand current front-end trading methods and data infrastructure
Collaborating with traders, researchers and software engineers in a close-knit team environment

Toronto, ONAbout JLL –
We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. As a Fortune 500 company, we help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. We have nearly 300 corporate offices across 80 countries, with a team of more than 86,000 individuals.
If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. With us, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections and be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions—join us at JLL!
POSITION OVERVIEW
Do you have experience conducting research to compile market information and statistics to support pitch materials, publications and reports on the local commercial real estate market? Are you able to adapt and prioritize to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment?
JLL is currently seeking a dynamic individual for the role of Research Analyst to provide reliable, timely, efficient support to the Retail brokerage team in Toronto. The position entails working with a diverse group of internal and external Stakeholders at all levels of the organization, and the individual will require the independent judgment to plan, prioritize, and organize a diverse workload. This role provides a wide variety of support services to the brokerage teams and the successful candidate will be detail oriented with strong organizational skills and a team player attitude.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with research and other team members to compile market information and statistics on the local commercial real estate market; conduct research and collect information materials on market fundamentals, ownership, tenants, and economic analysis
Conduct research at a designated level to support pitch materials, publications, reports and deliverables to the Local Practice Leader and/or applicable brokerage team; assist brokerage professionals through the completion of market surveys, data analysis, cash flow analysis, financial modelling and other deliverables
Contribute to the collection of and ensure the integrity of comparable data, new development information, and applicable information on city planning changes/issues; apply technical and analytical skills to disseminate market data and ensure data integrity
Contribute to designated local market research requests: market snapshots, market overviews, quarterly market decks, topic specific research to support pitches and brokerage opportunities
Liaise regularly with other real estate professionals including developers, appraisers, landlords and brokers
Coordinate and manage daily, weekly and quarterly research tasks
Contribute to special initiatives, such as: annual/semi-annual publications, whitepapers, and quarterly reports (Skyline, Look Forward Skyline, Office Insight) as required
Any other reasonable duties and responsibilities assigned
QUALIFICATIONS
Post-secondary education in Commerce, Economics, Business Administration, Urban Economics, Urban Planning, or Urban Geography
1+ years of relevant experience or combination of education and experience
Experience in the commercial real estate sector is an asset
Demonstrated proficiency with all applicable software packages including but not limited to MS Windows; MS Office, including MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint; Adobe Professional, X, or Standard; CRM; MLS; and RECBC
REQUIRED SKILLS
Good verbal and written communication skills in French and English
Able to adapt and prioritize, meeting deadlines, in a fast-paced environment
May require on-call activity after regular office hours
Operates with a sense of urgency, quickly responding to Stakeholders

Position:

Supervisor, Data Governance


Reports To:

Sr. Manager – Data Governance & Analysis


Tier:

Supervisor/Team Lead


Department:

Data Governance & Service Optimization


Company:

GS1 Canada


Location:
Toronto


Status:

Permanent, Full Time


Job Number:

1434



Keys To The Role

Our mission is to generate the greatest possible return on internal data assets by protecting the integrity of enterprise information through data management policies and guidelines. This requires a deep understanding of governance principles and a genuine desire to create, document and audit the conditions which will enforce its robustness.

Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Data Governance & Analysis, the Team Lead, Data Governance will spearhead a team of Analysts to manage organization-wide data governance activities and will have responsibility for improving the quality and maintaining the integrity of subscriber data and information assets. In addition, they will assist in defining indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements that aid in increasing cost recovery.

The Team Lead, Data Governance will manage day-to-day activities and workflows by monitoring timelines, allocating resources and ensuring all deliverables are met. This may involve addressing escalations and negotiating deadlines. Data is our asset and thus ensuring Analysts are conducting thorough review of policies and procedures is critical for this role. While being adaptable and responsive to changing priorities, the Lead will also contribute operationally where and when required.

The Team Lead, Data Governance will possess solid understanding of GS1 Canada’s data content across various platforms and will develop and maintain strong relationships with SMEs across the organization to develop this knowledge. The incumbent will be a champion in establishing best practices while maintaining standards and be a pillar of consistency which the team can emulate, and the business can rely on. They will work closely with the Team Lead, Data Analysis to ensure standard operating procedures are clearly documented and reviewed regularly, processes are mapped, and protocols are followed.


Core Responsibilities
Lead day-to-day data governance operations of 2 or more analysts within the GS1 Data Governance & Service Optimization umbrella
Analyze and oversee strategies designed to enhance data reliability and minimize redundancies and complications
Propose and/or establish the policies, standards, rules, processes and technologies to effectively manage GS1 Canada’s data assets.
Create and maintain common data dictionaries and the tools or methods that support data standards for an organization
Work closely with senior business and technology leaders to create programs, disciplines and practices to significantly improve the ownership and quality of critical data assets.
Have a key role in guiding and influencing various stakeholders across the organization to achieve the goals defined in the enterprise data governance and enterprise data management strategies.
Coach Analysts in validating and modeling data with the purpose of defining clear governance protocols.
Triages requests from the business using workflow management tools, prioritize and delegate tasks. Follow-up daily/weekly on request status and ensuring progress is being made and deadlines are met.
Evaluate business requirements gathered from multiple sources and identify underlying business needs vs wants and work with Analysts to prioritize development efforts.
Create process maps which succinctly represents the flow of data and key decision-making steps.
Closely monitor project resources, tasks, risks and milestones. Bring forward blockers and make recommendations on course corrections when necessary. Act as a point of contact to resolve policy, procedure, or technical issues within the scope of Data Governance Team’s responsibilities and ensuring prompt escalation to Sr. Manager or Sr. Director for critical or time sensitive issues.
Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development
Develop data remediation plans: Monitor and track quality issues, identify gaps, and build action plans to remediate gaps
Lead and develop team members in technical proficiencies required for them to succeed in their roles
Assist with screening, interviewing new staff and conducting onboarding/training as required
Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
University degree or college diploma in business, science, mathematics or a related area of study; or combination of skills and experience in working in high performing teams
A minimum of 2-3 years’ work experience, preferably in data management, governance, reporting and/or analysis
Preferred minimum of 1-year team management experience in supervisory or team lead capacity, or senior analyst with proven ability to lead.
Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business requirements, technical design and operational implementation of systems and processes
Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps
Proficiency with Excel and advanced capability with other MS Office applications highly desirable
Background in business intelligence (BI) and familiarity with master data management highly preferred.
Knowledge of Data Warehouses, design and/or architecture highly desired
Demonstrated ability to coach and guide others through both technical and situational problem solving
Works with passion and promotes optimism; fosters respect and builds trust; exhibits confidence in self and develops in others
Takes pride in the team’s work and celebrates their success
Validates with vigour to ensure accuracy and correctness; follows-up promptly
Meticulous with high attention to detail particularly when reviewing work of others
Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment, requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs
Demonstrated ability to interact in a professional and courteous manner
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to positively influence others; communicate with a negotiating standard
Able to speak and present to stakeholders at all levels
Strong organizational focus, with demonstrated analytical, problem solving and planning skills
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM would be an asset

Must be able to explain technical concepts and analyses implications clearly to a wide audience, and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses.Experience with SQL (any variations thereof), Python/PySpark and/or preferred; though experience with other analytics software (SAS, STATA, MATLAB, Mathematica, R/Sparkly R) is acceptable.Familiarity with AWS solutions such as Glue, S3, and Redshift.Proven analytical and quantitative skills to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses.Capable of taking responsibility for an initiative and working with minimal direction; self-starter even when assignments are vague or undefined.Creative in finding new solutions/designing innovative methods, systems, and processes.Excellent written / oral communication and interpersonal skills.

Amazon’s Demand Forecasting team – part of the Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) organization – develops and deploys sophisticated algorithms that involve learning from large amounts of data in order to forecast the demand of millions of products worldwide. These forecasts are used to automatically order more than $200 million worth of inventory weekly, establish labor plans for tens of thousands of employees, and predict the company’s financial performance. The work is complex and important to Amazon. With better forecasts we drive down supply chain costs, enabling the offer of lower prices and better in-stock selection for our customers.

We are seeking a Data Scientist with strong machine learning, analytical, communication, and project management skills to join our team. As part of a multi-skilled team, you will help identify and solve complex prediction problems to improve forecast accuracy based on new data that were not previously used in forecasting. Also, you will develop metrics and reports to measure our impact on Amazon’s business. In a typical day, you will work closely with retail leads, product managers, engineers, and various business groups.

You are an individual with outstanding analytical and machine learning modeling abilities, excellent communication skills, good business understanding, and technically savvy. The successful candidate will be an analytical problem solver who enjoys diving into data, is excited about investigations and algorithms, can multi-task, and can credibly interface between technical teams and business stakeholders.

Responsibilities Include:
Build statistical, predictive and machine learning models to drive forecasting accuracy.Ensure data quality throughout all stages of acquisition and processing, including data sourcing/collection, ground truth generation, normalization, and transformation.Influence leaders to make thoughtful data decisions to provide the most consistent and usable data for all teams across the company.Combine expert knowledge of statistical methodology and analysis with advanced programming skills to support complex analyzes.Share/develop best practices with other Amazon teams on a global scale.Build metrics, reports and dashboard to analyze key inputs to SCOT Forecasting systems.

Masters or PhD in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics or Economics.Knowledge and experience with Agile development practices.Experience in Demand Planning & Forecasting, Supply Chain or Inventory Management is a plus.Demonstrated ability to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously and drive projects to completion.6+ years professional experience in Analytics or other quantitative disciplines.

In our company you need grit, it is what we were founded on over 150 years ago and is what keeps us growing. S/he will highlight areas of opportunity/risk by combining consumer insights, POS & shipment analytics.
The secondary purpose is to support to Scotts National Field Manager and the Retail Field Sales Teams. S/he will ensure all tools, reporting and program details are available to the field to ensure smooth execution of all national programs at field level.

Act as an integral partner of the sales team by identifying and clearly defining the key category and customer opportunities/risks, that help shape retailer strategies and sales tactics
Use POS data to add intelligence to new products product introductions, customer insights, account comparison, and competitive analysis
Maintains this database and provides competitive information and research data for internal sales.

RPIA is a Toronto based asset management firm with over $5 billion AUM that provides fixed income solutions for family offices, foundations, and pensions in Canada. We specialize in publicly traded global corporate bonds. Through an actively managed and trading orientated investment process, we have developed alternative fixed income solutions for our clients utilizing our expertise in this segment of the market.

Portfolio Analyst:
Reporting to the Director, Risk Management & Analytics. The candidate will ideally bring a combination of expertise in technology and portfolio/risk management, be professional in demeanor, and comfortable working in an intense, fast-paced capital markets environment.

What You'll Do:
Participate in infrastructure build-out to support RPIA’s risk management platform, working in Risk Management & Analytics team but closely with Portfolio Management.
Work closely with the portfolio management, client portfolio management, compliance, and operations teams to develop and implement investment performance, risk analytics and reporting solutions; translate user requirements into reports and solutions.
Assist in the development of fixed income analytics – including but not limited to: multiple currency support, custom swap/basis curves, rich/cheap analysis, etc.
Develop risk management tools and models – such stress testing, jump-to-default, etc.
Build, implement and test security pricing and curve fitting models.

Who You Are:
Someone with knowledge of financial markets in particular fixed income, a strong background in software development, and a desire for a career in the middle office.
A highly motivated and entrepreneurial individual that is comfortable taking responsibility and ownership for a number of business-critical tasks.
Someone with exceptional attention to detail, accuracy, and completeness
A focused and efficient multi-tasker who is able to calmly and professionally manage their time and possible conflicting priorities.
A creative thinker who is always looking for ways to streamline processes in order to improve and increase efficiencies.
A thoughtful communicator with exceptional written and oral skills.
Someone who thrives in a demanding, fast-paced environment that requires resourcefulness.
A team player who exemplifies and understands the importance of the accuracy of your work.
Someone who will embrace the importance of upholding RPIA’s controls and service standards.
Someone who will exemplify inclusiveness, respect and accountability in the workplace.

Requirements:
University degree preferably in one of the following disciplines: Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Commerce or Economics.
Strong programming skills are essential, in particular but not limited to: C#, SQL, MATLAB, SQL, Java, Web Frameworks (JS, Angular, React, etc.), and VBA.
Knowledge of software development methodologies, and working experience developing software is preferred
Data visualization and modeling skills including summarizing in a cohesive fashion is an asset
CFA designation is an asset
Knowledge of Calypso (RPIA’s Portfolio Management System) a plus

What RPIA Can Offer:
Comprehensive health benefits package
Competitive salary commensurate with experience
Opportunity for growth, development and continuous learning
Collaborative teamwork environment

Victoria, BCRoyalty Analyst
Financial Officer R14

This posting may be used to establish an eligibility list for future permanent and/or temporary opportunities. Currently, there is a temporary assignment/opportunity available to November 1, 2019, and may be extended.

A unique opportunity to apply your financial expertise in this exciting role
The Mineral, Oil and Gas Revenue Branch is responsible for the effective financial management and administration of the Mineral Tax Act, the Mineral Land Tax Act, the Petroleum and Natural Gas Royalty and Freehold Production Tax Regulation, the Oil and Gas Commission Levy, and the Mine Health and Safety Inspection Fee Directive. These revenues are specific to mining and petroleum industries. They are intended to capture a return to the Province from commercial production and depletion of subsurface resources on Crown and freehold land and to recover costs related to regulation of these industries.
The Branch's mandate is to calculate and assess amounts payable, record payments, verify information on which calculations are based and ensure revenue recorded in the government accounts is timely and accurate. The branch provides current and historical information on these revenues and responds to general enquiries related to them.

Royalty Analysts are responsible for a wide variety of duties related to collection of oil and gas royalties and freehold production taxes from 150+ royalty/tax payers. Major responsibilities include control of data received on various reports from the petroleum industry, control and reconciliation of payments received, requesting amendments and missing reports from operators and royalty payers, explaining and resolving reporting errors and discrepancies with royalty payers, computer system maintenance, and preparation of reference manuals. Major responsibilities include; control of data received from Industry reporting submission and analyzes discrepancies. Royalty Analysts provide the initial point of contact for Industry clients and provide guidance to those clients in the reporting and payment of royalties and taxes. Royalty Analysts are responsible for ensuring that royalty invoices are prepared on an accurate and timely basis and that royalty accounts are kept clean.

About Hopper

At Hopper, we're on a mission to make booking travel faster, easier, and more transparent. We are leveraging the power that comes from combining massive amounts of data and machine learning to build the world's fastest-growing travel app -- one that enables our customers to save money and travel more. With over $235M CAD in funding from leading investors in both Canada and the US, Hopper is primed to continue its path toward becoming the go-to way to book travel as the world continues its shift to mobile.

Recognized as the fastest-growing travel app by Forbes and one of the world's most innovative companies by Fast Company two years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 35 million times and has helped travelers plan over 100 million trips and counting. The app has received high praise in the form of mobile accolades such as the Google Play Award for Standout Startup of 2016 and Apple's App Store Best of 2015.

Take off with us!

The Role

A stellar opportunity to have massive impact: join the rapidly growing company continually redefining how people travel. As a Fraud Analyst, you will be helping fight against fraudsters from all over the world. In order to fight the good fight, you'll be using a variety of fraud-prevention and air-travel related systems, such as GDSs and payment processing gateways. You'll be working closely with our Traveler Experience team as a resource for fraud-related customer interactions, potentially taking over interactions by email, chat, or phone. You are quick-thinking, analytical, creative, and very fond of efficient research. You are constantly on the lookout for suspicious behaviour, but are able to behave diplomatically when interacting with suspected fraudsters.

In this role you will:

Minimize losses resulting from fraudulent transactions by analyzing potentially-fraudulent Air and Hotel bookings and deciding the fraud risk associated with bookings
Analyze chargeback data and user activity to assess risk level and provide recommendations to improve fraud detection and prevention
Take over fraud-related Traveler Experience interactions and resolve them efficiently and diplomatically
Independently resolve problems that require in-depth investigation

A perfect candidate has:

The ability to be friendly and courteous to users while being on the lookout for suspicious behaviour
An extremely keen eye and remarkable attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills as well as the ability to be a team player
A Self-starter attitude: energetic with a strong sense of initiative and creativity
A willingness to work a flexible and demanding schedule. We are currently looking for analysts to work our evening shift, 2:30pm - 10:30pm EST and applicants must be available to work both weekdays and weekends.

Benefits


Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options.
Dynamic and entrepreneurial team where pushing limits is everyday business.
100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans.
Access to a 401k (Boston) or Retirement Savings Plan (Montreal).
Easy commute with a paid-for public transportation or parking pass.
IATA Travel Agent Card for discounts in the travel industry.
Fully stocked kitchen with: coffee/tea, beer, bagels and snacks (both healthy and not-healthy).
Team lunches, off-site activities and much more!
In Cambridge, work in a historic factory building near Kendall Square; in Montreal, work in an artist's loft in the Mile End.

At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.
Job Description:
As a member of the Individual and SLGI Services (ISS) PMO team, the Project Information Analyst provides portfolio planning, reporting and analysis for the ISS Team and supports key tools that are vital to creation of our reports and metrics. The successful candidate will work closely with the ISS Portfolio Manager to compile and analyze data supporting the ISS Portfolio delivery, including tracking the IT Delivery pipeline, reporting status, and budget and forecast information.
The Project Information Analyst coordinates efforts to collect data, manages spreadsheets, and identifies anomalies and trends. Sources of data could be project delivery actuals in days or cost, delivery planning, project status, chargeback to business partner actuals, IT resourcing requests, etc.
This role provides the successful candidate with the opportunity to exercise and develop technical, analytical, and relationship management skills. The Project Information Analyst will support an environment that promotes knowledge sharing, client service, quality, innovation and teamwork.
This position is part of a dynamic, fast-paced team that offers ample challenges and opportunities to support on-the-job learning and skills development.
What will you do?
Populate, maintain and distribute bi-weekly Portfolio delivery reporting to ISS Delivery management.
Support and govern the ongoing delivery pipeline process, to support Resource Allocations.
Participate in Budget and Forecast setting/reporting for pipeline planning and staffing.
Support consistent and effective use of the time tracking tool (Changepoint) set-up and reporting.
Identify reporting requirements, design the solution, and deliver the expected results.
Support vendor contract process by updating P/O’s and eSig routing, and tracking Invoices.
Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and drive to solutions.
Takes ownership of small initiatives and engages the appropriate resources to reach solution.
What you need to succeed:
University or other Post-Secondary education in a relevant field (Business, Mathematics, Accounting, Finance or related).
2 years of experience in a similar or equivalent role
Expertise with MS Excel is required, including use of complex data formulas, data validation, data sources and linking, Pivot Tables, charting, etc.
Working knowledge of financial concepts such as expense, chargeback, purchasing cycle, total cost of ownership (TCO), capitalization, amortization, etc.
Experience with Sharepoint, OneNote, MS PowerPoint.
Experience with ChangePoint project / time tracking.
Preferred Skills:

ContractThe Opportunity:

We’re looking for an experienced Reporting and Analytics Specialist to be responsible for the collection, analysis, and communication of system and user data. Reporting to the VP Product, the ideal candidate will deliver concise, accurate, and timely insights that help us build the platform where healthcare professionals around the world learn from one another.
The scope of this role includes key performance indicator (KPI) reporting for senior leadership and business stakeholders; content consumption insights for Medical and Content teams; funnel conversion and lifetime value reporting for Marketing; user engagement and in-app behavior for Product Management and UX teams; as well as ad hoc analysis. This individual will work with both stakeholders and engineers to ensure that data is available when needed.

Responsibilities include:

Develop reporting strategies and frameworks to monitor and analyze KPIs related to: application use, content consumption, function testing, funnel conversion, and lifetime value of a customer

Develop executive dashboards for each department lead to help them understand high-level daily, weekly, and monthly trends related to their area of specialty

Provide insights through analysis to help inform decisions in all parts of the business, including Product Management, Technology, Medical, Content, and Marketing

Work closely with the reporting analyst in Business Development on data requirements, reporting formats, and consistency of metrics across teams

Proactively create path analysis reports to identify potential areas of improvement in the user experience and information architecture

Merge this data with other external data for a complete customer view in order to profile, segment, and optimize the user experience

Establish predictive analytics capabilities to explore data for strategic business advantage

Work with the Marketing department to help track conversion and ROI on digital marketing activities

Regularly conduct tagging audits and analysis to ensure the accuracy of reports
Work on multiple, unrelated reporting and analytics requests simultaneously
Experience and skills:

Undergraduate degree in Business, Marketing, Mathematics, or equivalent work experience
3-5 years of reporting and analytics experience in digital environments – experience in healthcare environments preferred

Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and strategy skills
Highly proficient with leading web analytics tools such as Google Analytics as well as other analytics solutions such as Tableau and Looker

Strong SQL skills

Advanced Excel skills
Experience with SEO, SEM, PPC, social media, and mobile analytics
Keen understanding and experience developing multi-channel attribution models and analytics

Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to interact with company leadership, business stakeholders, and technical team
Intellectual curiosity and a strong willingness to learn
Ability to synthesize information into succinct, concise, and logical summaries and reports
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and deliver on multiple tasks to tight deadlines
Ability to take ownership and accountability

Who we are:

Figure 1 is the future of healthcare. Millions of healthcare professionals—as well as prominent institutions including Doctors Without Borders, BMJ, and Mount Sinai Health System—use our digital platform to share cases and help save lives with the largest active network of medical professionals in the world. And that’s just the beginning.

We’ve raised more than $20 million in financing from world-class venture capital firms including Union Square Ventures and Samsung Next. With this support, our team is tackling the trickiest problems in one of the world’s most complicated industries. In the words of Wired, “as Figure 1 grows, it has the potential to become global health’s central nervous system—improving diagnostics, care, and treatment for non-users everywhere.” We’re looking for the people who will make this vision a reality.

While we’re helping the world’s caregivers, we take care of our team with amenities like in-office yoga, lunch and learns, professional development including bi-weekly mentoring, and unlimited vacation.

Figure 1 is a diverse, inclusive, and open-minded workplace. Candidates who identify as a minority are encouraged to apply. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities, and accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or national origin.

Working at Figure 1 comes with:

Competitive salary

Extended healthcare benefits

Unlimited vacation

Paid parental leave

Stock options

In-house yoga, weekly cocktails/mocktails, field trips, and other activities

Opportunities for travel for conferences and professional development

Bi-weekly one-on-ones focused on mentorship

Lunch-and-Learns

The chance to help save lives and make the world a better place. Also, free snacks

Job location:

Downtown Toronto, near the subway

To Apply:

To be considered, please submit a resume and cover letter.
