Job description

Role: Strategic Sourcing Analyst

Reports to: Procurement Manager

Company: Freshii

We are looking for an enthusiastic, self-motivated, Strategic Sourcing Analyst to join the Freshii team. The Strategic Sourcing Analyst works as a negotiation and data-analytics expert in supporting the Procurement Manager in negotiating best-in-class contracts in diverse food and non-food categories, including produce, protein, packaging, ingredients, bases, dressings and ingredients. Join our growing supply chain team and support our 100’s of Freshii locations in getting their most important product – fresh(ii) and health(ii) food! If you’re interested in joining our mission of helping individuals live healthier and more fun lives by making healthy food convenient and affordable then keep reading!

What this role entails

Identify and assess savings opportunities
Research supply markets, supply chain dynamics and industry trends and benchmarks as they relate to sourcing activities
Develop and conduct supplier evaluation
Perform comparative analysis of pricing proposals, quotations and bids
Build and maintain excellent relationship with trust worthy suppliers, ensure that vendors are knowledgeable and abide by policies set forth by Freshii.
Design and implement strategic sourcing best practices, processes and guidelines as well as act as a champion for the team’s branding efforts and outreach within the organization
Maintain a dynamic database of vendor contracts and work with various business units, including Legal, to monitor expiring contracts and proactively assess renewal or strategic sourcing opportunities
Source products and services across business line
Assist in various due diligence activities during the sourcing process
Assist in the development of RFP’s, service level agreements and contract negotiation
Ability to drive aggressive implementation plans and schedules
Escalation point for supply issues, price increase requests, quality and shipment issues.
Co-ordinate and communicate project activities within departments and status on an ongoing basis, escalating issues when necessary
Assess and improve sourcing activities by analyzing spend, researching commodity prices, building costing models, adopting procurement best practices, challenging suppliers, and creating redundancies (fall-back options) for critical SKUs
Create consistency in sourcing processes


Core competencies & requirements

Strong problem-solving skills, as well as ability to advocate (explain, synthesize, gain acceptance, plot next steps) both internally and externally
Strong analytical skills (collection, analysis and interpretation of data)
Strong presentation skills and understanding of needs of executive reporting (concise, logical, action-driven, supported by data, great reading flow)
Assertive, well organized self-starter. Driven for distinctive achievements. Passionate for increase-mitigation and cost-containment. Not one to shy away from confrontation, negotiation and supplier accountability.
Ability to establish cross-functional, collaborative relationships as required
Detail oriented individual with a strong ability to multi-task on the go
Excellent written and verbal communication Skills
Minimum 2 years of experience in the food or indirects industry with sourcing experience (GPO or Distributor-side experience highly preferred)
Minimum completion of Bachelor’s degree preferred in Business, Finance, Engineering or Supply Chain.

Job Description

We are presently recruiting for an Analyst/Senior Analyst within the Data Content team in Enterprise Data Services (EDS). EDS is the team that enables CPPIB to implement a business-led and IT-enabled data program. You will report to the Manager, Enterprise Content Operations and you will work with talented investment data professionals to understand (and develop) data knowledge across multiple different data domains. You will have the opportunity to learn and do the following:
Update and maintain investment data content across different systems
Perform security setup and data reconciliation activities (as appropriate) to ensure seamless recording of transactions through the trade lifecycle
Develop subject matter expertise across different asset classes that CPPIB invests in(from a data perspective)
Monitor data and content integrity issues on a timely basis, take discretion to resolve issues, and communicates outcomes openly to internal data consumers
Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to support data through the trade lifecycle
Actively work with colleagues to share knowledge and cross train others
Escalate recurring issues and participates in problem root cause analysis
Proactively identify process automation opportunities, facilitates implementation (as appropriate)

Qualifications

Demonstrated experience supporting financial data in a data management platform (securities reference, pricing, index data, counterparty data, etc)
Understanding of industry identifiers (CUSIP, SEDOL, etc) and unique characteristics of descriptive data by asset type
Experience using a data management platform (Markit EDM, GoldenSource, Asset Control, etc) an asset
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel, experience using SQL/Python an asset
Highly organized and takes personal responsibility and accountability for quality of deliverables
Strong service orientation; a track record of responsiveness to business partner needs and enjoys adapting to shifting priorities
Concise and clear written and verbal communication & presentation skills
Willing to work flexible hours
Undergraduate or advanced degree
Investment industry qualifications including the CSC and/or CFA are an asset
Exemplify our Guiding Principles of integrity, partnership and high performance

Job Title: Production Support Analyst
Reports To: Director of Technology Services
Department: Technology Services

_____________________________________________________________________

Job Summary:
The Production Support Analyst is responsible for the first level triaging and investigation of D2D Production incidents utilizing the ticketing system Maximo and applying resolution. If the incident cannot be resolved by the first level then coordinates the efforts with the second level teams. This individual should have experience in Ticket resolution system, ability to analyze issues and resolve within the specified SLA’s and providing root cause analysis with recommendations for improvements.

Responsibilties:

Providing production processing support level 2
Troubleshoot failed jobs and output data, remediating issues
Monitoring for production errors, working with operations and customer service
Working with Development team and Level 3 support to resolve D2D issues
Identifying repeated challenges and finding permanent solutions
To manage production incident tickets effectively and efficiently
Act as a subject matter expert investigate and resolve complex incidents/issues
If assistance from other teams is needed, coordinate efforts for reassessment and quick resolution, Monitor, Support and troubleshoot problems in the production application environment.
Conduct root cause analysis of application incidents and implement recommendations to improve the situation (focusing on permanent solutions).
Manage the resolutions of day to day issues escalated to Production Support, Respond to stakeholder with the agreed SLA’s
Ensuring the production issues are resolved on time
Ensures this procedure is followed as required within Production Support
Coordinates any training requirements for personnel within their department and ensures Training Record is documented
Maintaining technical documentation and tracking challenges
Troubleshooting Data Communication and Printing Issues
Attend daily Production Support meetings
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

College diploma in an IT field is required (Computer Science is an asset)
Experience (min 2 years) object-oriented programming languages is required (C++), (C#), .NET
Intermediate knowledge of MS SQL is required (stored procs, functions, queries)
Excellent understanding of various file formats is required (XML, CSV, TXT, MIME)
Experience in Operating systems such as Windows and Linux
Excellent verbal and written communication skills is required
Ability to work well across many teams and environment is required
Ability to manage competing priorities across multiple projects is required
Highly detailed and organized, Ability to work in a fast pace dynamic environment.
Ability to work in Production Support Environment, with problem solving and investigative skills

Working Conditions:

At times, may be required to wear a smock and safety shoes when visiting the production floor
Sitting for extended periods of time
Providing 8 hour coverage between 7AM to 7PM
At times, may be required to work evening or weekends
Ability to stay behind to ensure production issues are resolved to meet SLA

Additional Information


This job description is not intended to be all inclusive. The candidate hired will also perform other reasonable related business duties as assigned by the supervisor. The company reserves the right to revise or change job duties as needed. This job description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment.

The Passenger Transportation Branch is responsible for all aspects of strategic passenger transportation policy, regulation and licensing in an ever-changing industry. The Branch plays a pivotal role in leading passenger transportation policy initiatives and legislative reform in alignment with government’s strategic corporate agenda. In all program areas, managing stakeholder expectations and priorities while maintaining positive working relationships with internal and external partners is critical for effective policy development and program delivery.
The Passenger Transportation System Analyst reports to the Director, Policy and Projects to provide expertise and technical knowledge of the Passenger Transportation System (PTS) to the Passenger Transportation Branch and associated business partners and stakeholders including technology specialists from the Ministry’s IM/IT Branch.
The position is responsible to represent the program area in the design, development, and ongoing implementation, enhancement and maintenance of a business application that meets current and future business needs. For 35 years, Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) has helped innovative companies and their investors move ambitious ideas forward, fast. SVB provides targeted financial services and expertise through its offices and innovation centers around the world. SVB is currently growing into Canada to better service the booming Canadian tech and life sciences industries.

As the market leader in providing financial services to the world’s most creative tech and life science companies and investors, SVB has exposure to vast amounts of data covering the breadth of the startup and VC landscape. While data has been integral to SVB’s growth over the past 30+ years, we’re placing an even greater emphasis on being a data-driven organization by establishing the Analytics & Sales Operations team to support all sales focused aspects of our banking practice.

As part of a growing team in the Canadian market, this position offers you the opportunity to apply analytical skills to the private, venture-backed innovation ecosystem and gain a comprehensive understanding of the industry through the firm’s positive relationship management network. It is an opportunity to collaborate with Senior Management, drive the execution and recommendations of sales and market analysis, and work cross-functionally within the organization.

Research and profile targeted prospects, reporting and analyzing portfolios, identifying and aggregating current SVBFG relationships, and identifying cross-selling opportunities for the sales teams to execute.
Develop and drive the performance reporting and tracking of sales team performance and key metrics related to client acquisition, pipeline, product penetration, referral channels, etc.
Seek out areas of operational improvement and recommend development of more efficient and automated portfolio management and prospecting.
Report and synthesizing market trends.
Lead ad hoc business analytics requests as part of strategic initiatives.
Identify opportunities to use proprietary datasets and external company data to extract valuable insights and present these findings to key stakeholders, along with useable data to execute.
Where applicable, take responsibility for the maintenance and accuracy of company data within SVB’s data warehouse, CRM systems and other repositories.
Lead long term projects to improve the underlying data architecture and sales operations.
Establish relationships and information flow across groups within SVB.
Responsibilities:
Prospecting: Prospecting the market opportunity including tracking, reporting and catalyzing sales team’s action on leads, identifying trends to understand client share of early stage fundings and tracking activity of top Accelerator & Incubators to provide recommendations to the channel strategy.
Reporting and Analysis. Own monthly goal reporting and analysis; provide key insights to the sales team to be actioned. Develop dashboards for process flows such as referrals, market share and pitchbook prospecting.
Thought Leadership. Provide thought leadership such as content for events and speaking engagements. Craft internal sector and subsector insights reports.
Lead ad-hoc activities including analytics to support strategies and initiatives, partnering with Marketing, IT, Credit, and piloting process changes.
#LI-86777003_VL1

You will ideally have a combination of consulting experience, strong data analytics background and good interpersonal skills. Experience in forecasting, planning and reporting are an asset. Additionally, you will have the following:

Bachelor’s Degree
Aptitude for framing business questions in analytical terms and translating business requirements into useful datasets and analyses with actionable insights
Experience using and developing reports, metrics and dashboards with data analytics and presentation tools (e.g. Excel, PowerPoint, SQL, Tableau)

Interest in technology, entrepreneurship, and venture capital
Analytical mindset

Detail oriented

company_name: South East Local Health Integration Network
job_description:
Belleville, ONTemporarybased on experience, in accordance
with our policy

Service Contracts Accountability and Reporting Specialist

As the Service Contracts Accountability and Reporting Specialist, you will work within the Service Contracts
team and be primarily responsible for negotiating, managing, and monitoring the Service Accountability
Agreement (SAA) process for Health Service providers. This position acts as the internal lead and
provincial representative for activities related to the Service Accountability Agreement contracts.
More specifically, in this role you will:
 Develop, monitor and prepare the Health Service Provider service accountability agreements
according to guidelines and processes developed through the Provincial working groups. This
includes:
> Developing the annual work plan for the accountability agreements and follow-up for
completion.
> Annual financial and service plan submission and verification of submissions from the
Health Service Providers
> Setting draft targets for provincial indicators and managing process with internal LHIN
leads.
> Coordination of the local indicators and obligations with internal LHIN leads.
 Support the Senior Manager with Health Service Providers on issues related to interpretation
and implementation of performance specifications noted within the SAA and contribute to the
resolution of issues as they arise.
 Review and determine performance against provincial indicator targets and identify emerging
issues or requirements for remedial action in consultation with the Service Contracts team as
required.
 Act as a liaison with the LHIN’s Health Service Providers to communicate and clarify issues.
 
Contribute advice and input on performance standards and service provider
performance/accountability to the development of health system and integration plans, and
interpretation of system performance issues to the broader LHIN team.
 Participate in one or more of the Provincial SAA Workgroups
 Act as the South East provincial representative for all of the health service provider
accountability agreements.
 Support the financial and non-financial analysis of health service provider’s quarterly and annual
submissions and highlight issues to team Responsible for the maintenance of the Community
and Hospital Analysis tools (CAT & COMPAS) under guidance from a Senior Financial Analyst
 Work with South East LHIN Communication team to maintain and update accountability
agreement materials posted on the LHIN’s external website
 Develop and deliver training material related to the accountability agreements during the
annual refresh and quarterly reporting periods

We seek a profile that includes:

 Post-secondary degree in business administration, finance, accounting, health administration or
relevant field. Masters degree preferred.
 Strong financial management experience with an understanding of one or more health care sectors.
 Demonstrated experience in facilitation of agreements and familiarity with negotiation, conflict
resolution approaches.
 Experience in risk management and demonstrated capacity to identify and respond quickly to
emerging issues and priorities.
 Proven ability to effectively manage complex and sensitive issues associated with service
accountability agreements.
 Experience in analyzing and interpreting performance data, including financial data and quality
indicators.
 Utilization of MS Office applications (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Access etc.).
Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
 Sound financial management experience with understanding of one or more health care sectors
an asset.
 Communication and interpersonal skills, to work effectively with managers and staff, and to liaise
with colleagues across LHINs and with contacts in the ministry.

HOW TO APPLY:
Applicants should submit a resume and cover letter, indicating Posting #32-2019 in the subject line, no
later than April 10, 2019 at 12:00PM to: careers.se@lhins.on.ca
We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please notify Human
Resources. Accommodation will be provided in accordance with Ontario’s Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians
with Disabilities Act. The South East LHIN is an equal opportunity employer.

Within the Student Success Office, the Data Analyst and Evaluation Specialist is responsible for the investigation, identification, implementation, management and monitoring of the data and information that forms the evidence base for the initiatives related to the support of student success on campus. The Data Analyst and Evaluation Specialist, plays a critical role in obtaining the information and data that underlie and inform the evidence-based planning of strategies directed at student success, as well as overseeing all program and service evaluation strategies within the office. The information gathered from research and evaluation will help the Specialist inform decision making, strategic planning, messaging and budget related planning that improves services and programs for student success.
Responsibilities
Develops and implements research and evaluation plans that support undergraduate and graduate student success strategies
Assists the SSO staff and management team in the development of an appropriate and timely process and outcome evaluation plans, data gathering methods, analysis and use of the results to support continuous program improvements
Maintains awareness of, analyzes, and understands all types of recorded university data, including but not limited to key performance indicators, student satisfaction surveys, NSSE, and government reporting data related to graduate outcomes, determines any applications and implications pertinent to SSO strategies; and educates the appropriate staff accordingly
Collaborates with IAP, MUR, and other departments to further analyze data from large student population surveys (e.g., NSSE, Incoming Student Survey, iBarometer, etc.) and develop complementary inquiries that focus on specific needs and services
Determines and recommends any specific, measurable, actionable and realistic metrics that can be employed as indicators of success of SSO’s strategic plans
Manages, and conducts ongoing, timely evaluation to determine the effectiveness of SSO strategies
Works with large datasets to clean, merge, and format lists, examine relationships, inconsistencies, and find the story in the data
Prepares and delivers any required in-person presentations of research results
Manages all aspects of SSO participation in any large scale surveys or research projects
Facilitates SSO survey design and programming
Trains and supports staff with respect to the use of any data analysis tools
Analyzes current SSO data collection systems and evaluation processes to identify trends and opportunities for streamlining
Investigates new data analysis tools, systems and practices and makes recommendations for enhancing SSO processes
Consult with IAP/IST and other departments on the design, implementation, testing and operation of any computer systems required for the collection, storage, reporting and analysis of data and trends related to student success in conjunction with the Manager, Integrated Communications
Understands and applies current, relevant research methods and trends, audience and institutional knowledge
Maintains a clear understanding of the characteristics of current students including their preferences with respect to completing surveys, questionnaires, and other research instruments, so that s/he can translate this information into effective tactics for enhancing research strategies
Keeps current with respect to best practices in research and evaluation methodologies, as well as trends in communicating with students and influencers
Collaborates, advises and consults
Works closely with the entire SSO team to ensure the cohesiveness, consistency and integration of research goals and plans with current strategies and messaging
Supports and advises the SSO leadership team with respect to any new or evolving research strategies, opportunities, and results as well as any analyses that may assist with decisions about priorities and long-range planning
Works closely with SSO team to determine data analysis needs with respect to the broader university database and then liaises with IAP to obtain appropriate data
Collaborates closely with the Evaluation and Accountability team and the Data Analytics and Reporting team in IAP to provide input and expertise and to obtain advice with respect to SSO research requirements and initiatives, including but not limited to survey management and interpretation, forecasting, retention definition and analyses and participation in large-scale surveys such as NSSE. Contribute SSO progress and outcome indicators to the support of various institutional accountability measures, including those related to the university strategic plan
Advises and keeps SSO teams informed about any plans, features and results of IAP and/or other department or faculty-related studies and data that may affect student success
Shares research analysis, detailed reports and clear explanations with all interested and affected on-campus stakeholders
Consults with and advises SSO team members with respect to design, administration and analysis of program evaluations, the results of which inform the development evaluation and each area’s strategic plans
Other
Participates in SSO events and in the administration of SSO-wide responsibilities, and other such general and specific duties as may from time to time be determined
Qualifications
Research-based or other relevant masters or post-graduate degree with solid knowledge of social science research methods, both quantitative and qualitative; ability to use descriptive and inferential statistics to analyse data; and knowledge of various methodologies to gather data (surveys, interviews, focus groups, community forum, literature reviews, environmental scans; situational analysis, needs assessment, etc.) or equivalent education and experience
At least 3 years of experience in a data analysis and/or research role, preferably in an educational setting
Strong educational and professional background in data management, statistical analysis, associated computer applications, program evaluation and related applied social research methods
Strong ability to understand, maintain and address data quality

Superior oral and written communication skills as demonstrated by success in engaging, understanding and supporting data users, including proven presentation and public speaking abilities

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

The Decision Support Analyst develops and supports Logistics applications and processes to enable day to day decision making, with efficiency and effectiveness. You will provide technical expertise, automation solutions, analysis and reporting on essential Logistics processes and KPIs. The Decision Support Analyst also works with resources from across the organization including Logistics, Merchandising, Distribution, Transportation, Finance, and IT.

What you’ll do

Work closely with a team of decision support/business analysts to support, design, develop and document applications, while aligning to IT and industry standards

Collaborate with users to understand, define and document business and technical needs and translate into user requirements to create tools and automation solutions

Challenge the status quo to find alternative/creative ways to improve business processes

Provide ad-hoc information, reports and databases to support the business in decision making

Actively work to remain knowledgeable in latest coding languages, software and standards

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

Database development experience using SQL Server 2012 or higher

Proven knowledge of ETL processes and SSIS package creation and deployment

Experience with .Net framework 3.5 or higher using VB.NET, C#, and Visual Studio 2010 or higher

Web development experience using ASP.Net Web Forms

Experience with Microsoft Office Access

Familiarity with Robotics Automation software such as RPA Express

Familiarity and willingness to learn newer data analysis tools such as Hadoop, Python, Knime and R in working with Data Lake architecture

Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills

Excellent communications skills along with the ability to prepare/present data and analysis to various audiences

Ability to work as a team member or individually to achieve business solutions, with a strong customer focus

Ability to adapt and embrace change in processes, operations and technology

Passionate about leveraging emerging technologies to simplify processes

Supply Chain and Retail experience is an asset

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request special accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Information on accommodation for persons with disabilities
When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
Do you love leading-edge data?
Are you very curious?
Do you want to enrich your knowledge by learning about research in multiple disciplines?
Do you enjoy sharing knowledge about research and data methods with others?

If you answered yes to all these questions, we believe that a Research Data Centre Analyst position would be an exciting choice for you! You will have the opportunity to explore the research questions of researchers in many different faculties. You will also be able to contribute to the research process by providing guidance on data, methodological techniques and software.

You will have the chance to grow in this position, as you learn more about new data,
software, techniques and disciplines. You will be part of a strong research community!
Duties
Below you will find the main duties and responsibilities you would have the chance to assume!

Administers the operation of the Research Data Centre (RDC) for its clients and ensures
that the activity is consistent with Statistics Act. This includes activities such as assisting
researchers with project preparation, administering RDC access (security checks and contracts), orientating new researchers into the RDC secure computing environment and liaising with the program management.
Responsible for maintaining the integrity of the secure computing environment by ensuring that physical, technical and legal requirements for the operation of an RDC are within standards used by Statistics Canada. This would include assigning tasks to local IT staff as required.Coordinates and participates in consultations, meetings, committees or working groups.Provides consultation on research methods and data concepts to the RDC researchers in a client service oriented environment while fostering a culture of confidentiality.Analyzes all interim and final research outputs that leave the RDC to ensure that they respect Statistics Canada’s confidentiality protection requirements.Maintains a liaison between the RDC network and Subject Matter Areas responsible for the Statistics Canada household surveys or administrative data.Participates in various program wide projects which include a range of activities, such as
recommending, documenting, developing and providing advice based on areas of specialization such as confidentiality vetting, use of administrative data, and survey data concepts and methodology.
May have to supervise local and/or other RDC staff.
Work environment
Statistics Canada is a world-renowned leader in its domain, and its employees are proud to fulfill its mission: to serve Canada with high-quality statistical information that matters. We want to help Canadians better understand their country, so they can make more thoughtful decisions. Be part of this mission by applying for this position!

In January 2018, Statistics Canada received the National Capital Region's Top Employers Award for 2018. A week later, we were also awarded a spot in Canada's Top Employers for Young People competition.

That's not it!

The advantages of a strong workplace cannot be understated. Diverse. Accommodating.
Nurturing. Rewarding. For employees to reach their full potential, a workplace MUST be meet all of these criteria. Well ours is! Statistics Canada provides you with the tools you need to succeed. Our job opportunities provide you with a unique chance to:
expand your existing knowledge and knowhow;strengthen your team spirit and extend your network;strengthen your project management skills;propose innovative ideas and participate in modernization;and so much more!
We support talent. Let your talents and interests shine and come discover new ones. If you’re looking for a place to build a career, you’ve found it!
Intent of the process
The intent of this selection process is to staff part-time determinate positions with the
possibility of extension, indeterminate positions and/or full-time positions. A pool of qualified candidates will also be established and may be used to staff identical or similar positions with different tenures, various linguistic profiles, and various security profiles at various Research Data Centres across Canada.
Positions to be filled: 1
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
EDUCATION

Graduation with a Master degree* or a PhD** from a recognized university with an acceptable specialization in Economics, Sociology or Statistics.

OR

An acceptable combination of education, training and/or relevant experience in a health-related field of study such as epidemiology, health sciences or health services research, or in a social-related field such as psychology, geography or demography.

Alternative to the Master degree, we accept:candidates that are currently enrolled in a PhD Direct-Entry Program and has completed Master degree level requirements or PhD course work and comprehensive exams; ORcandidates that have completed all of the program requires sufficient for graduation (confirmation from the university will be required).
**Alternative to the PhD, we accept candidates that have completed all of the program requires sufficient for graduation (confirmation from the university will be required).
Degree equivalency
EXPERIENCE

EX1. Experience using census data, administrative data or complex surveys, such as but not limited to the Statistics Canada Household Survey data.
EX2. Experience conducting advanced quantitative analyses at the level taught in graduate-level statistics courses.
EX3. Experience in the use of Statistical Analysis System (SAS), Statistical Package for Social Sciences (SPSS) or STATA, in the conduct of a social science research project.
EX4. Experience in making presentations to client groups, peer groups or scientific meetings, such as presenting research findings at a conference or teaching a class.
If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications)
ASSET - EDUCATION

AEd1. Graduation with a Master level degree from a recognized university.
AEd2. Graduation with a Ph.D. from a recognized university.

Other education assets may be used as needs arise.
Degree equivalency
ASSET - EXPERIENCE

AEX1. Experience with Statistics Canada's Research Data Centres Program.
AEX2. Significant* experience using individual or household census data, administrative data, or complex surveys, such as but not limited to the Statistics Canada Household Survey data.
AEX3. Significant* experience using business, organizational survey or administrative data, such as but not limited to Statistics Canada Business Microdata.
AEX4. Significant* experience in the use of SAS, SPSS or STATA, in the conduct of a social science research project.
AEX5. Experience using Statistics Canada microdata.
AEX6. Experience working with confidential or sensitive statistical information.
AEX7. Experience supervising employees, including the responsibility of their work objectives.
AEX8. Experience screening or vetting statistical output for confidentiality and data protection.
AEX9. Experience with administrative procedures and handling legal documents (for example, that are related to access to secure work space), with an emphasis on details and organizational skills.
AEX10. Experience in writing procedural documents for a variety of audiences.
AEX11. Experience with providing Information Technology (IT) support (for example, in a virtual computing environment, such as but not limited to VMware).

Significant experience is defined as the depth and breadth of experience normally associated with the equivalent of full-time performance of duties for approximately two (2) years working or studying in one of the domains.
Other experience assets may be used as needs arise.
The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)
Various language requirements
Bilingual Imperative BBB/BBB
English Essential
French Essential
Information on language requirements
KNOWLEDGE

K1. Knowledge of statistical methods associated with the analysis of social survey data with complex sample design.
K2. Knowledge of the major social surveys or administrative data sources maintained by Statistics Canada, or comparable surveys or administrative data.
K3. Knowledge of current and emerging challenges relevant to social science research in Canada.
ABILITIES AND SKILLS

A1. Ability to advise clients on advanced analytical methods, construction of custom data files and creation of variables, using statistical software.
A2. Ability to prepare material and deliver presentations to a variety of audiences.
A3. Ability to work effectively in a client service environment.
A4. Ability to communicate effectively orally.
A5. Ability to communicate effectively in writing.
PERSONAL SUITABILITY

PS1. Effective Interpersonal Skills
PS2. Initiative
PS3. Reliability
PS4. Judgment
The following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)
OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS

Below you will find the current or future requirements of the organization for the proper
functioning of the work unit or the organization.

1) For these positions, scheduling flexibility is limited as operational requirements
necessitate the Research Data Centre (RDC) adhere to agreed upon hours of
operation.
2) Employees who hold employment elsewhere or who are otherwise engaged in outside
activities are required to give priority to the requirements of their Statistics Canada job.
3) The candidate may be required to travel occasionally.
4) Employees working part-time must be able to increase their hours and/or change their
schedule with reasonable notice due to training or workflow demands.
Conditions of employment
Reliability Status security clearance

Hamilton, ONThe BI & Analytics Analyst is responsible for provide assistance in supporting one or more functional areas of the business by providing analytics and insights that drive optimized decision‑making to deliver operational efficiencies and/or improved franchisees and corporate profitability.

This position reports to the Director of Strategy and Analytics and offers a high level of visibility with the Brand President and other Senior/Executive Management Team members. There is also a high level of interaction with the Operations and Sales teams.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Analyzes business performance and supports test and learn efforts for key functional areas
Design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions
Strategizing with business partners and implementing new analytical approaches (e.g., designing new segments to analyze franchisees profitability)
Develop and promote creative data visualization to derive actionable intelligence
Helps with identifying innovative ways for measuring and optimizing center-level operations
Supports the development of tactical plans aligned with business strategy in order to bring the vision into realization
Assists functional areas in reaching their goals via timely and insightful analyses
Keeps pace with change and maintains a competitive advantage within the marketplace by seeking out and keeping abreast of changes in the field
Development and maintenance of Qlik Sense, existing company-wide BI platform
Prepare analyses and presentations for the Senior Management Team
Assists with ad-hoc analytical requests, seeing them to completion
Perform data analyses as requested; develop and present ad hoc reports in support of various business process initiatives both internally and externally.

Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in related business or quantitative analytic field (Operations Mgmt., Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, etc.)
1-2 years of relevant work experience
Knowledge and/or experience using enterprise grade analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Tableau, Qlik)
Knowledge and experienced managing data analysis and big data
Knowledge and/or experience with SQL (Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, BigQuery)
Experience working directly with business leaders to understand the decisions and impacts driven by data
Experience analyzing data to determine root cause of issues
Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills preferred
Articulate with excellent verbal and written communication skills
Highest standards of accuracy and precision; highly organized
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Detail-oriented
Ability to handle multiple priorities against multiple deadlines
Able to work well with people across multiple functions
Ability to communicate/present to senior level managers

Regina, SKJob Description
Aon is looking for an Analyst for a 14-month Maternity Leave position in Regina, Saskatchewan
As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions supporting the Western Canada Investment Consulting Practice.
Do you have a passion for investing? Imagine working with many of the largest investors in Western Canada; some of the best and the brightest people in the business; having the support and encouragement you need to succeed; and making an immediate contribution as a member of the Aon Team.

Job Responsibilities:
You will be part of our dynamic, results‐driven, team that specializes in institutional investment consulting. Our focus is on adding value to our clients’ investment programs through development and application of innovative world‐class solutions, backed by our experience and the resources of Aon nationally and globally. Your work will positively impact significant investment pools and broad stakeholder groups. In addition to working with our extensive and diverse clientele, you will meet and liaise with top investment managers from Canada and around the globe.
As an Analyst, you will have the opportunity to demonstrate your research and analytical skills and apply your institutional investment knowledge to our client’s long-range investment strategies. Your main responsibilities will include preparation of performance monitoring reports, investment policy reviews, manager searches and investment research reports and presentations on a broad range of investment issues and topics. Under the guidance and mentorship of our Investment Consultants, this position provides you the opportunity to develop and build upon your knowledge and expertise in the institutional investment arena while contributing as a trusted member of the team.
Required Experience:
Undergraduate degree in business or commerce with a specialization in finance, or a degree in economics, actuarial sciences or math
Experience with financial/investment analysis will be considered an asset, however candidates with the right passion and aptitude who have less experience will be considered.
Proficiency in Microsoft Suite preferred (i.e. Word, Excel, PPT)
Commitment to ongoing professional development and can manage and adapt to change
Candidates who are pursuing or willing to pursue their CFA designation are preferred
We offer you

A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon:
Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.

Aon is committed to a diverse workforce as an Employment Equity employer (Women, People with Disabilities, Aboriginal Peoples, and Visible Minorities).

DISCLAIMER:
Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Calgary, ABPermanentHelping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you?
Business Analyst
Are you interested in being a part of banking history...do you want to be a part of a financial institution that thinks differently and is committed to Albertans greater good?
ATB is just that! We promise to do the right thing for our customers no matter what. We are more than a bank we think beyond the lines of tradition and process to find solutions that impact our community. How do we do this?... By putting our team members first!
We know that for our customers to be happy it starts with the happiness of our people and we are committed to helping our team members learn and grow, and empower them to create their own paths for success. We believe that work should be fun; we inspire our team members to think beyond today and what we can achieve 30 years from now. Let’s create something new together!
The Opportunity:
Reporting to the Director for Business and Risk Management in Treasury and Payments Solutions (TaPS), the Business Analyst will assist the TaPS leadership team through data, processes and communications to best accomplish improvements for the business. This will be done by coordinating various activities and tasks that will facilitate the successful development of business solutions and support TaPS strategic initiatives.
This position is accountable for the regular production and analysis of a growing suite of reports for various audiences in TaPS. The role translates simple information and data requests from team members into meaningful reporting that creates insight in a timely way for these team members. The Business Analyst role will also conduct analysis on current TaPS processes and products and make recommendations on improvements to the TaPS leadership.
Key Accountabilities:
Focus on winning in the market by supporting the Director of Business and Risk Management in TaPS to deliver the strategic business priorities of enhancing client loyalty, increasing product penetration, and maximizing revenue growth & profitability for ATB.
Support Development & Integration of Business Process Management
Maintain and build industry expertise, leveraging superior networks and insights to deliver world class customer experiences and elevate the TaPS business.
Together with the Director of Business and Risk Management in TaPS, create and manager overall TaPS risk profiles to address all operational, transactional, regulatory and compliance, financial and liquidity, AML and sanction, and cybercrime risks
Job Requirements
What We’re Looking For:
University degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Math, or other quantitative or technical discipline is required
Minimum of 3-5 years of analytical experience
Experience with the development of complex analytical or statistical models
In-depth to expert knowledge of Cash Management, Treasury Management, Payments, Investments, and Financial Systems.
In-depth understanding of the payments product/ service offerings and how they provide customer solutions alone or combined
Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
Highly developed analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills (ability to devise creative, workable solutions within established policies, or provide analysis and recommendations for policy changes)
Ability to network & cultivate productive working relationships at various levels within ATB
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to interact effectively with Business Unit Management, Lines of Business, as well as external vendors
Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office tools and Google Suite including extensive experience with Excel and Sheets
Strong research and project management skills (including planning, prioritization and execution)
Self-directed, self-motivated & committed to continuous learning
Strong time management, prioritization and organizational skills
So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of?
Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it.

Montréal, QCInnovation is a core value of CN. We transport annually approximately C$250 billion worth of goods across our network. To transport these goods with increasingly better reliability, efficiency and safety, we are continuously investigating and applying innovative Operational Technologies (OT); including deploying an advanced Internet of Things (IoT) connected railroad program. Therefore, if you are interested by challenges involving complex connected systems, state-of-the-art sensors and control electronics, sophisticated planning and decision support systems, big data infrastructures, advanced analytics, deep learning, and other leading-edge technologies you will be at the right place at the right time. So, if you have what it takes to be a key player in shaping the future of an industry, read on….

Job Summary
***6 Month Term***

Provide functional and technical support in areas of Business Intelligence software and technologies, application delivery, life-cycle strategy and roadmap solutions. Job Description
NAV CANADA is a private company that owns and operates Canada’s civil air navigation service (ANS) and guides the world’s aircraft safely and expeditiously through Canadian-controlled airspace. With approximately 4,600 employees located from coast to coast, we offer some of the most exciting careers in the field of aviation.


Our Business Intelligence and Data Management is growing, and we are looking for candidates who are motivated and want to work with this high performing team as an experienced Analyst/Developer in Business Intelligence. This is a temporary role to start and is a great foot in the door. As part of this challenging role, you will provide support in the area of Power BI.
The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in Microsoft Power BI designing, developing and implementing reporting and dashboard solutions. This role will involve a significant amount of autonomy so the candidate should be comfortable working in a fast paced environment with little direction and can communicate upwards with self-confidence.
As a 2017 NCR Top Employer and 2018 Canada`s Top Employer, we offer a total compensation package that includes:
Competitive Base Salary and Leave Structure
Health Care and Dental Care Plan (with additional Health Spending Account)
Defined Benefit Pension Plan
Opportunities for professional and personal development and growth
***6 Month Term***
What you will be doing
Plan, analyze, design, develop and implement Power BI dashboards and
reports, and will advise and assist clients in support of their self-service Power BI development.
Partner and collaborate with the Business and IM teams to further advance capabilities and adoption of Microsoft Power BI.
Under the overall direction of the NAV CANADA Project Authority (the Manager, Enterprise Performance Management), will work as a member of the project team and shall be responsible for the following activities:
Develop Power BI reports and dashboard solutions.
Develop Power BI data models that aggregate data from multiple data sources to meet requirements.
Configure and setup application gateway refreshes.
Analyze of business and user needs, documentation of requirements, and translation into proper system technical specifications.
Provide feedback and inputs on gaps in requirements and technical feasibility of requirements.
Create mock-up reports for proof of concept reviews.
Write functional/ non-functional and integrate test cases and test scripts from Power BI reporting business requirements and technical design documents.
Perform Power BI report test execution and document test results.
Assist clients during the User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
Develop and update technical documentation.
Collaborate with our Data Architecture, Data Integration and IM teams to integrate data for Power BI applications.
Share best practices to ensure we leverage the best design available.
Provide training, mentoring, support and advice to clients on their self-service Power BI development and on how to query or analyze data and create robust visualizations.
Participate in team meetings to provide a status report of work in progress, accomplished and problems / issues encountered.
What we’re looking for
Graduated from a recognized university or college with a degree/certification in Computer Sciences/Information Technology, Business Administration, MBA and/or Aviation OR an acceptable combination of education, related experience and training.
Minimum 2 years hands-on work experience with Microsoft Power BI designing, developing and implementing dashboard and reporting solutions
Significant experience in the areas of:
Data warehousing design methodologies including Dimensional Data modelling; Star-Schema Modelling, Snowflake Schema Modelling, Fact and Dimension tables.
Business systems computer languages in particular for Oracle and MS SQL database technology (SQL, PL/SQL).
Developing reporting business requirements and translating those requirements into functional and technical specifications.
Developing test cases and scripts and performing all levels of testing and defect management.
Experience developing and optimizing Microsoft Power BI dashboards and reports with a focus on usability and performance
Experience creating compelling and meaningful visualizations, hierarchies and drill-down in Power BI
Experience using DAX Data Analysis expressions and functions, Power Pivot, Enhancing Power BI visuals, Data extraction and Power query for data transformation.
Experience with Power BI data modelling: defining a data model with calculated columns, measures and calculated tables using DAX.
Experience with Power BI security methodologies; aligning business use cases with security solutions.
Experience configuring Gateway services.
Experience with Power BI development best practices, industry standard, methodologies.
Experience with SAS and/or R language (‘nice to have’).
Experience with integrated team delivery, coordinating deliverables and contributing to planning with management.

Language Requirements:
Bilingual* (English, French)
* Language requirements are bilingual. However, in the event a qualified bilingual candidate is not found, a qualified unilingual candidate will be considered. Both bilingual and unilingual candidates are encouraged to apply
The successful candidate must meet the security requirement of the position and be legally able to work in Canada.

Reference number: 48123-CSE(OC)2019 Closing Date: 2020-03-31

Job Summary
**The big picture**
CSE plays a critical role in the implementation of Canada’s cyber security strategy. To carry out our mission we track cyberthreats around the world, monitor Government of Canada networks to detect and mitigate cyberthreats, and protect information of value to the government. CSE’s data analysts/scientists play a crucial role in generating insight from data-rich environments.

 *What’s in it for you?*
Are you interested in a unique working experience applying data analyst/science skills to a diverse variety of cyber defence problems? At CSE, data analysts and data scientists are motivated by an environment with:
interesting and distinct problems to solve
talented colleagues
encouragement to approach problems from different perspectives
continuous learning and development to maintain a technical edge
opportunities to see the impact of their efforts
If the above description sounds attractive, you should consider CSE for a career in data analysis/science. Data analysts perform data review, data validation, quality control, and cleaning; they develop and evolve Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes and data models; they create data processing pipelines to analyze disparate multi-source data; they prepare technical documentation and standard operating procedures; and they ensure data requirements are met for operational reporting, dashboards and ad hoc requests.
Data scientists model real world problems to forecast what might happen; they apply and develop machine learning techniques, they implement algorithms in efficient and scalable ways; they communicate analytical results to others in compelling and visual ways; they help to develop scalable solutions; and they mentor others and help others to communicate and gain understanding about data science.

Position type: Term and indeterminate positions, with a one (1) year probation period.

Salary Range:
UNI 07 level: $78,001 - $91,764
UNI 08 level: $83,250 - $97,942
These positions are currently eligible for a market allowance ranging from an additional $8,366 to $11,000.

Position Requirements
Education
University degree with extensive statistical, computational coursework; for example, physics, math, engineering, economics, data science, computer science, bioinformatics, etc. (preference may be given to those with a graduate degree).

Experience
Experience with extract, transform, load (ETL) activities including cleaning, transforming, and ingesting large, variegated and changing structured and unstructured data
Experience working with databases and database management tools
Experience scripting or programming in at least one open-source programming language (e.g. Python) or a statistical software package (e.g. R)
Experience collaborating with management, software tool developers and software tool users
Asset
Extensive (three years or more) background in software programming or scripting
Experience in developing and applying computational algorithms and statistical methods to find patterns and model, and predict relationships in large, disparate and evolving data sets
Experience in applying and improving machine learning techniques
Experience conducting data analysis and creating compelling communications in visual, verbal and written forms

Language Requirements
English Essential

Who Can Apply
Canadian citizens who can qualify for a Top Secret security clearance conforming to CSE’s standards.

Security Requirements
Candidates must have no criminal record.
The screening process involves a security interview, a polygraph test, a psychological assessment, and a background investigation covering a minimum of your last 10 years history, including credit and financial verifications. Ongoing substance abuse is a factor to be assessed as part of your screening process.

How To Apply
Applicants must clearly demonstrate in their application how they meet each EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE criteria. Failure to do so will result in the applicant being screened out of the selection process.

Notes
CSE is a separate organization and is not subject to the Public Service Employment ACT (PSEA). The organization has its own values-based staffing regime and as such, has the flexibility to determine qualifications for positions and how these positions will be assessed in a selection process.
CSE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage applications from women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minority groups. CSEC offers an assessment process which will accommodate the needs of persons with disabilities. If you may need such accommodation, please advise us.
Candidates must be able to provide proof of education credentials.
A written test will be used as a screening tool.
An interview and references will follow for candidates who are successful on the screening test.
The entire selection process – tests, interviews, security investigation – may take more than one year.

We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

A career within Cybersecurity and Privacy services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients implement an effective cybersecurity programme that protects against threats, propels transformation, and drives growth. job_title: Supply Chain & Logistics Analyst (1 yr Contract)
job_description:
Temporary, ContractLocation:
243 Consumers Road, Toronto, Ontario, M2J 4W8
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
Overview
Reporting directly to the Supply Chain and Logistics Director, the incumbent provides analytical support for all aspects for the Distribution Centre (DC) operations. The incumbent analyzes and monitors the inbound and outbound flow of all products in to the DC, out of the DC and in to the stores.
Primary Responsibilities
 Develops, prepares and monitors event import and replenishment purchase orders including container plans, letters of credit, transfer payments, load booking reports, amendments, customs clearance and seasonal schedules to ensure each program event is planned accordingly and to avoid delays. Completes all necessary documents and distributes to appropriate key stakeholders.
 Monitors shipment status and event tracking reports to liaise between Category Management, Global Procurement, DC’s and vendors and ensure products are received in time for event releases.
 Reviews and monitors DC activities through various inventory systems to provide status, adjustment and no ship reports etc. as required.
 Reviews, enters and prepares invoices for payment to ensure appropriate signing authority is obtained prior to submitting invoices to accounting for payment.
 Monitors and responds to email and telephone inquiries to resolve issues or concerns such as event releases, shipment status, inventory management systems and transportation etc.
 Reviews and monitors excess inventory from seasonal event stock to ensure DC’s maintain a pick accuracy of 99.7%, identify excess inventory and arrange overstock to be shipped to appropriate stores promptly.
 Reviews events and orders for new or closing stores with Operations and Retail Concepts to ensure stock is transferred and cancelled accordingly.
 Compiles data to review and prepare various reports for internal and external review.
 Monitors and responds to Marketing Call Centre inquiries and concerns
 Review of claims submitted by stores in the Store DC claims.
Skills, Experience & Education
Skills
This position requires a demonstrated level of initiative and judgment in order to organize and prioritize tasks, workload and projects. Courtesy, tact and diplomacy are required in dealing with colleagues in every day working relationships.
 Requires an understanding of basic duties and tasks to carry out straight forward procedures.
 Capacity to follow directives and fulfill requests with minimal supervision and takes limited discretionary action as required.
 Professional manner, tact, diplomacy and discretion in dealing with others.
 Ability to identify problems and draw upon a range of choices to formulate solutions.
 Adaptable to set and prioritize work with occasional exceptions. Able to work with diverse personalities and styles.
 Communicates with clarity, verbally and in one on one or group situations, or over the telephone.
 Computer skills to maintain databases and spreadsheets and produce accurate reports and documents.
 Knowledge of inventory management software and systems and logistical procedures such as customs clearance, shipping and tracking.
Experience
Greater than two years, but less than or equal, to three years logistics or equivalent experience.
Education
Post secondary education equivalent to a college diploma in business, supply chain, or related field.
Certificates, Licenses or Registration
N/A
Working Conditions
* Incumbents are required to exert the following physical effort; however, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Physical Effort
Much of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position with the frequent opportunity to stand or move about. The incumbent may be required to occasionally kneel, reach, bend, or stretch and carry light objects consistent with usual office materials such as, paper, files and other office supplies.
Physical Environment
Work is mainly performed in a comfortable office environment where there is minimal exposure to dust, fumes, temperature variance and other sensory attributes. Level of noise at any given time is mild to moderate and may experience frequent interruptions
Sensory Concentration
There is a frequent need to give close attention, much of the time requiring the use of two or more senses simultaneously.
Mental Stress
The incumbent may be exposed to situations which may cause mild mental stress. There are some pressures from meeting deadlines, multitasking, or producing accurate work. The stress levels felt would not be noticeably disruptive to the work nor would the unpleasant reaction be strong or persistent
Note: This job profile indicates the general nature and level of work expected of the incumbent. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the incumbent. The incumbent may be asked to perform other duties which may be assigned from time to time.
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.
Employment Type:
Full time

Temporary with Benefits (Fixed Term)
Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Permanent“The Power of Together”
Join Northbridge, a growing dynamic company that has a long and rich Canadian history in providing innovative insurance solutions to customers nationwide.
Northbridge Financial Corporation is a leading commercial property and casualty insurance company that’s been helping protect Canadian businesses for more than 90 years. We’re 100% Canadian!
We offer a wide range of creative solutions to our customers through our Northbridge Insurance, TruShield Insurance and Federated Insurance brands where we strive to create a fair and friendly culture, upheld by the foundation of our five corporate values: respect, passion, connectedness, creativity, and excellence.
By continually striving to challenge the status quo, and by focusing on helping the customers we have the privilege of insuring achieve the possibilities of their business, we’ve been able to build our reputation as one of Canada’s largest commercial insurance providers.
To help us continue to build on this success, we’re committed to attracting, developing and retaining the best people.
Be part of a team that’s passionate about making a difference every day, fuelled by our entrepreneurial spirit and where everyone owns a part of our success. Our company has had an amazing journey so far, and our future is full of new possibilities!
Located in the heart of Toronto’s Financial District, our head office is easily accessible by TTC and GO Transit, and within walking distance to the Eaton Centre, Air Canada Centre, Rogers Centre, and CN Tower. As a national property and casualty commercial insurance provider, we also have offices across Canada.
Position Summary
The Analyst, Data Governance is responsible for establishing and ensuring adherence to an enterprise data governance framework for data policies, standards and practices, both at the department and Business and Functional areas level, to achieve the required level of consistency and quality to meet overall business needs.
Do you have passion and curiosity for and about data? We are looking for a strong mix of skillsets, along with an attitude of relentless pursuit, problem solving and desire to learn!
What you will be doing:
Work with business subject matter experts and IT developers to gather business requirements for data definitions, and reference data.
Assist in the development, testing, and implementation of the associated data documentation, analysis, reporting, and process improvements
Assist in the roll out an enterprise wide data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to organization behavior policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools and data architecture
Make sure regulatory data is accurate and work with data stewards to correct existing data.
Work with other project streams to make sure data governance is adhered when rolling out projects
Work with data stewards to correct existing data
Perform special projects as assigned
Other duties as required
What we are looking for:
Post secondary education in Statistics, Business or related field of study – degree preferred
Bachelor Degree in a field related to data management strongly preferred
Accounting experience a strong asset
Minimum of 3 - 5 years in Data Analysis
Experience in the property and casualty insurance industry required
Experience in Data Governance is a strong asset
Familiarity with/experience within the P&C insurance industry and regulatory reports preferred (IBC and GAA)
Strong working knowledge of business operations, operational procedures, workflow and processing functions
Basic to Intermediate proficiency in SAS, Dbase
Basic to Intermediate proficiency/experience with SQL Server along with Data Profiling Skills
Advanced proficiency with Excel; Intermediate proficiency with Word and PowerPoint
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build strong relationships at all levels
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities
Strong collaborative skills and an ability to build consensus
Team player, customer focused, adaptable/flexible
What sets you apart:
Ability to plan, organize, and manage multiple demands and changing priorities, and deliver results.
Ability to work successfully within functional and cross-functional teams.
Demonstrated proficiency and resourcefulness in identifying and analyzing relevant data and defining critical issues and alternatives within established guidelines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated presentation, listening and coordination skills.
Ability to work in a dynamic, self-empowered environment and team atmosphere requiring minimal supervision.
Demonstrated track record in meeting deadlines, and effectively handling multiple assignments and tasks with accuracy while under tight time constraints.
Demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional and technical development.
What We Have to Offer:
Northbridge Cares program – volunteer day and donation matching
Generous paid time off, including personal days. Flexible work hours as well as early departure opportunities
Flexible Group Benefits Plan – medical, dental, insurances
Defined Contribution Pension Plan + Optional Group RRSP
Northbridge Employee Share Purchase Plan
Education Assistance Program
Employee Assistance plan
Staff Insurance - discount on home, automobile and pet insurance
Plus, the opportunity to contribute to the success of Northbridge through sharing your knowledge and experience while learning from others!
Application Process:
Northbridge welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Interested, qualified candidates are encouraged to apply below.
All offers of employment are conditional upon satisfactory background and reference checks, including a criminal record check, credit check, and employment and educational verifications.
