job_title: Supply Chain Analyst - SD Key User
job_description:
Our purpose is simple and compelling: To release the natural power of stone to enrich modern living.
ROCKWOOL products save energy and water and reduce CO2 emissions, protect buildings from the spread of fire; reduce waste; improve acoustic comfort, building performance and aesthetics; and enhance Precision Growing, thereby improving the efficiency of fresh food production.
While the stone we use may be millions of years old, what we do with it is cutting-edge. Every day, ROCKWOOL colleagues are developing and applying new technologies to release yet more potential of stone wool to enrich modern life.
Would you also be proud to enrich society like we do? now to join us as we improve modern living conditions for millions of people worldwide.
POSITION: Supply Chain Analyst
The ROCKWOOL Group’s main business area is building insulation, providing thermal comfort along with fire safety and acoustical comfort for all types of buildings.
This is the Role:
Responsible for gathering data and conducting analysis with the goal of improving the organizations’ s supply chain
operations.
Sets and or, works within the guidelines of decision authority
Respects, listens, learns and challenges others thinking in a constructive manner to help all to improve in everything that we do.
Produces solutions to various challenges and problems, and able to connect one issue with the bigger picture.
Analyses and structures information and communications to meet audience’s needs.
Seeks new opportunities and ways to improve.
Develops innovative products, processes, ideas and solutions.
Utilize computer systems and software in order to research, analyze and document failures and inefficiencies in the supply chain in order to improve overall supply chain effectiveness.
Supply Chain Reporting – Create and generate reports as required by Supply Chain Management using Business Warehouse and Rockbis queries.
Maintain Price records in SAP
Coordinate Online Price List updates.
Maintain external Customer data bases.
Generate monthly Claims report
Analyse Customer issues to develop tools and process to improve customer satisfaction.
Execute SD related projects, including testing, documentation, and analysis
Provide EDI support for SD and LES Modules – including but not limited to, new customer set ups, new carrier set ups, changes to current accounts, trouble shooting and problem solving
Liaise with GRIT EDI support team, perform system testing
Create and maintain documentation relating to EDI functions
Maintain SD Master Data (SAP)– new accounts, customer hierarchy, pricing and discounts
Create templates for uploads as required
Support Customer Service and Accounts Receivable staff with Master data issues
Liaise with Marketing Company to ensure price list data and format is correct
MM Master Data – Assist Optimization Manager with MM master data duties when necessary (vacation, sickness, projects)
Provide efficient and accurate data entry into business system
This is what you offer:
Accredited University / College Degree, Appropriate College or Trade Accreditation, or equivalent experience.
Computer literate (Word, Excel)
5+ years’ experience in a related functional area
Knowledge of SAP
Drive, commitment, self-motivation and high energy.
Ability to work under pressure,
Good communication skills,
Passionate and values driven and will embrace the company’s core values including integrity, honesty and trust
Problem solving abilities
Practical business sense
Ability to successfully manage multiple priorities and meet established deadlines in a fact paced environment
Interested?
If you recognize yourself in this opportunity, please apply, sending an English version of your resume.
ABOUT ROCKWOOL North America
At the ROCKWOOL Group, we are committed to enriching the lives of everyone who comes into contact with our solutions. Our expertise is perfectly suited to tackle many of today’s biggest sustainability and development challenges, from energy consumption and noise pollution to fire resilience, water scarcity and flooding. Our range of products reflects the diversity of the world’s needs, while supporting our stakeholders in reducing their own carbon footprint. Stone wool is a versatile material and forms the basis of all our businesses. With approx. 10,500 passionate colleagues in 38 countries, we are the world leader in stone wool solutions, from building insulation to acoustic ceilings, external cladding systems to horticultural solutions, engineered fibres for industrial use to insulation for the process industry and marine & offshore. We encourage you to join our team!

Burnaby, BCABOUT VEGA
Vega is a high-growth, natural health food and supplement company on Profit Magazine’s Profit 100 list of fastest growing companies the last five years with a passion for people. Our premium, award-winning brand is at the forefront of the plant-based, whole food revolution. Vega has been named one of the Best Workplaces in Canada and has been recognized as one of the Best Workplaces for Women. We honor a triple bottom line approach to business placing emphasis on people, planet and performance. Join a great team atmosphere with a driven, vivacious group of people.

OVERVIEW
An exciting and challenging position exists as a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst at Vega’s head office in Burnaby, BC. In this role, you will be responsible for ongoing corporate reporting across several data sources. Reporting includes measuring and monitoring our brands and relevant competitors’ performance through in-depth analysis of large amounts of data using a data warehouse, syndicated databases and reporting tools. As part of the BI team, the analyst will work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, and Finance to assist with forecasting, promotional assessment, and preparation of presentations for multiple uses. The BI Analyst will provide support to senior leadership on projects such as pricing, customer presentations, market trends, & promotional analysis.

You take customer service seriously, but still have fun at work with your Vega team. You show initiative in everything you do and are always looking for ways to improve. You are open to new ideas, and you know that feedback from others helps you grow and allows you to thrive. As a performance-driven individual, you create solutions for your team and show up every day ready for a new adventure. You believe in contributing to culture – not just talking about it – and you live (and love) the Vega culture: health, fitness, and striving for always better.

Work with IT to make improvements in our data warehouse and develop reports and dashboards in Tableau that will highlight trends and provide visualizations to be used by senior management as well as customer facing presentations
Assist in creating monthly presentations specific to market trends and customer performance
Educate the marketing, sales, and finance teams on customer and market trends through monthly presentations
May be required to assist in other areas not specifically outlined in this job description

Experience in data analysis & marketing analytics
Experience working with syndicated POS data is preferred (IRI, SPINS, Nielsen, Stackline and RetailLink)

Experience with reporting tools, Tableau experience a strong asset

Toronto, ONJob Description

The Analyst - Strategy and Interchange will be a member of the strategy, interchange and analytics team, which is responsible for managing the organization's pricing, analytics and strategy. The position will be based in Toronto, Canada and will report to the Senior Director, Strategy, Interchange and Analytics. The individual will be responsible for:Defining, developing and managing curated datasets, key business metrics and reporting across functional units at VisaProviding strong, effective business analytics for different initiatives in Canada; producing actionable insights that support decision-making for VisaSupport pricing and strategy solution development across a wide range of business topics
The individual will work with many different stakeholders in Canada and some at the global office in Foster City, California.
The ideal candidate will be an analytical, structured thinker, with excellent data skills, a creative problem solver, and the ability to synthesize and communicate findings to an executive audience. The position will be based in Toronto, Canada.
ResponsibilitiesDevelop and manage a broad range of reporting solutions in support of multiple functional groups within VisaWork with stakeholders across the Canadian organization as required, extracting, analyzing, interpreting and presenting Visa dataDevelop and communicate recommendations in a clear, professional, and impactful wayWork with cross-functional teams effectively, some local and some globalEmbrace teamwork while promoting a culture of openness and flexibilityWork closely with cross-functional and regional management teams on strategic projects, bringing timely and useful insight and analytical support

Qualifications

4+ years of professional experience in financial services, payments processing, and/or strategy consultingStrategic thinker with the ability to analyze and solve business issues or build strategies with intellectual and analytical rigor and attention to detailReal world experience using Hadoop and the related query engines (Hive / Impala)Extensive experience with SQL for extracting and aggregating dataProficiency with SAS as a statistical packageHigh level of competence in Python, Spark/Scala, and Unix/LinuxExperience with data mining and statistical modeling such as regression, clustering techniques, decision trees, etc. is requiredExperience with data visualization and business intelligence tools like Tableau or other programs

This Portfolio Data Analyst Position will support the Manager, Portfolio Management on the real estate portfolio management functions within the real estate team, covering both internal and external investments, direct, co-investments, equity, debt and fund real estate investment assets. Electronic platforms such as Microsoft Power BI, YARDI, ARGUS and others
Excel VBA, or SSIS generated excel ETL templates for data uploads associated with YSR (SQL) and SSRS Investment Asset and Portfolio level reporting; and
AIMCo Board and/or Client Real Estate Reports
Unlocking insights from both internal and external real estate data sources into actionable information/intelligence to enhance real estate team investment management decisions
Responsilites include:
Develop real estate investment management & performance metrics, investment reporting and investment data analytics to support a multi platform (such as MS Power BI, Orion BI and InvestorPlus) real estate BI level dashboards by geography, investment type, Investment Management team, Asset Manager, Strategy, and Pool to be updated on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis
Populating current and historical data series into YARDI using excel VBA macro generated ETLs, SSIS package produced ETLs, and ARES & manually developed/populated ETLs via FTP
Using other real estate platform property and portfolio information to update YARDI platform
Setup/execute YSR (SQL) or SSRS generated excel based reports as required
Real Estate data analytics for actionable information/intelligence and insights
Our Ideal Candidate
Strong academic credentials from a leading University; Bachelor’s Degree in Science (Mathematics, Statistics, Computing), or Business (Finance, Real Estate), or related field
Candidates with Excel VBA, and SQL Skills will be given preference
High degree of attention to details, ease with large data sets, ability to prioritize multiple tasks and deliver on strict timelines
Minimum of 2-3 years’ experience in a similar role at a leading real estate organization, private equity fund or investment bank
Creative problem solving and ability to translate data patterns into real estate business insights, cause/effect relationships and variables to increase predictive power of current and new models
Knowledge & Experience with Excel Pivot, Python, R, MS Office, YARDI, SSIS, SSRS/YSR, ARGUS Enterprise and SImCorp (SCD)/DataMart are an asset
Ability to autonomously prepare and present reports and presentations in an articulate manner to senior management
Strong Real Estate acumen

Oakville, ONJob Brief

The Threat Hunting Analyst shall have knowledge of, and experience in malware analysis, gathering

threat intel, mining Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) along with Incident analysis and handling. Should

be able to perform advanced analysis of adversary tradecraft, malicious code, and related capabilities.

Provides cyber threat and intelligence analysis for briefing and reporting. Develops and maintains

subject matter expertise of Advanced Persistent Threats and assists with Incident Response efforts.

Serves as the expert who shall be responsible for providing cyber threat and intelligence technical

support to assigned industry/customers. The Threat Hunting Analyst is also required to provide

technical support to monitor, correlate, identify, analyze, mitigate, manage, track and support

processes for all security incidents.

Responsibilities

Analyze available data sources, security tools, threat trends and lead security analysis efforts to identify attacks against the enterprise
Analyze logs, normalize and perform automated log correlations utilizing big data analysis or hunt tools to identify anomalous and potentially malicious behavior
Analyze network traffic to assist in testing and deployment of new signatures and use cases into client’s siem environment.
Analyze additional log, required for forensic investigation, following defined procedures and protocols.
Good understanding of Digital forensics on host or network from malware perspective, ability to identify anomalous behavior on network or endpoint devices
Ability to think like an attacker and a detailed understanding of offensive security
Must be able to critically examine an organization and system from a perspective of a threat actor and articulate applicable threats.
Facilitate use of technology-based tools or methodologies for incident response.
SIEM (Splunk or Elastic) experience in building custom queries, searches, creating correlated alerts, and dashboard.
Must demonstrate knowledge of tactics, techniques, and procedures associated with malicious insider activity, organized crime/fraud groups and both state and non-state sponsored threat actors.
Mining of Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) and how to use it in threat analysis
Perform event research specifically as it ties into APT and FO (Focused Operators)
Packet Analysis using known tools and techniques
Understanding of malware and its behavior
Perform security research, analysis, security vulnerability assessments and penetration tests
Provide support for Customer’s Vulnerability management program.
Ability to perform threat research and profile attackers
Proven track record of successful and innovative hunts that are completed in a timely manner
Thorough understanding of how to detect lateral movement within a network and thinking outside the box to discover the signal within the noise.
Required Skills

Good working knowledge of:
Threat hunting and Incident Response
Networking fundamentals
Security technology (Firewalls, IDS/IPS etc.)
Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration testing
Required Competencies

Ability to quickly learn new and complex concepts.
Strong analytical skills/problem solving/conceptual thinking/attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills across multiple levels of the organization
Nominal understanding of regular expression and at least one common scripting language
Organized, proactive, and requiring minimal management oversight.
Excellent verbal communication skills
Outstanding written skills for preparing reports and briefings
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Work Experience

1+ years of recent operational security experience (SOC, Incident Response, Malware Analysis, IDS/IPS Analysis, etc.)
Experience with several of the following topics:
Malware analysis
APT/crimeware ecosystems
Exploit kits
Cyber Threat intelligence
Software vulnerabilities & exploitation
Data analysis
Dark web intelligence
Certifications

Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)
GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH)
Certified Computer Security Incident Handler (CSIH)
Ability to obtain a DoD Secret security clearance

The Support Analyst 1 provides frontline customer support to clients by responding to interactions received via phone, ticket, email and fax. They also are responsible for fulfilling routine service requests and managing assigned Incidents (including resolving the more routine incidents).

Knowledge and application of the Information Technology Information Library (ITIL) best practices an asset.Ability to gather information, diagnose and analyze a variety of technical and non-technical issues and provide information and/or solutions as required. Well-developed analytical, problem solving, organizational and time management skills. Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing with clients, technical teams and other co-workers, work to schedules and adapt easily to changing priorities and business needs. Strong customer service and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on multiple projects in a team environment.

Company
The City of Vancouver is striving to become the greenest city in the world, and a city powered entirely by renewable energy before 2050. We are proud to be one of BC's Top Employers, Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and one of Canada's Greenest Employers. With employees that have helped Vancouver consistently rank as one of the world's most livable cities, the City values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve.
Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.


Main Purpose and Function
The Business Process Analyst (BPA) provides senior management with objective and comprehensive business and process analysis of the City’s processes, systems, and resourcing. The BPA provides recommendations based on comprehensive analysis performed with a view to continuously improve business operations using Lean Six Sigma principles; and help sponsors, process owners, and end users implement lean initiatives. Recommendations made by this position result in changes in methods, processes, resources, and procedures that may impact operational areas as well as staffing workloads, working conditions, and changes in positions or staffing levels.

Key Contacts and Reporting Relationships
This position reports directly to the Manager, Continuous Process Improvement in Finance, Risk and Supply Chain Management and works closely with directors, managers and staff in Finance, Risk and Supply Chain Management as well as key business representatives across the City. Works with front-line supervisors, departmental subject-matter-experts, external vendors, consultants and other organizations.

Specific Duties/Responsibilities
Leads, consult and participate in business process reviews of City Business Units, including provision of recommendations for opportunities for improvement
Lead Lean Six Sigma projects, including facilitating Kaizen events and Rapid Improvement events, conduct value stream mapping and identifies relevant KPIs,
Develop future state recommendations and build implementation plans for optimizing business processes and value streams
The value streams and processes that the role will be working on will be cross functional in nature and require the candidate to engage a number of business units and departments
Collect and analyze data to complete a current state analysis and optimize solutions
Identify implications and make recommendations for changes in processes and procedures that may impact on operational areas as well as staffing workloads, working conditions, and changes to positions or staffing levels.
Prepares and conducts presentations to, and/or facilitates decision-making for Department Management teams, Division/Branch Heads, Project Steering Committees, and Business Unit Managers.
Teach, mentor and support the project application of Green Belt candidates
Other duties as assigned

Minimum Position Requirements
Education and Experience:
A related bachelor’s degree (i.e. Commerce, Business/Public Administration, Public Policy or Economics).
A minimum of seven years of proven experience in process documentation, business process reviews, and reengineering techniques. Training, experience and knowledge in quality improvement tools, techniques and methodologies such as Lean and/or Six Sigma.
A minimum of five years’ experience at management level within the public sector or a similarly large multi-stakeholder organization. Management experience to effectively lead a business consulting team. Demonstrated experience implementing a business process re-engineering change.
Lean Six Sigma and/or Business Analyst certification (IIBA) certifications preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Detailed knowledge of business practices in effect at other local and more senior governments, and in private industry.
A thorough understanding of organization theory and design.
High degree of analysis using professional thinking.
Superior research and organizational skills.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills and presentation skills, across all levels of the organization.
The ability to think innovatively, solve complex problems and present solutions in clear and compelling terms.
Demonstrated ability to work with technical and non-technical staff.
Ability to manage change and assist people with adapting to change.
Ability to analyze and anticipate implications of system changes on work processes and procedures.
Ability to solve complex problems and build relationships.
Ability to build constructive and effective relationships at all level of the organization.
Ability to manage multiple priorities, large workloads and multi-task effectively.
High level of proficiency with MS Office applications.

At Loblaw Companies Limited, our purpose – Live Life Well – supports the needs and well-being of Canadians who make one billion visits each year to our stores.
Ambitious, right?
We excel at challenging convention and pushing beyond the limits of what’s comfortable. Our goal is a relentless customer-first commitment. We analyze. We challenge. We connect. We are innovators. Mississauga, ONThe Engine Diagnostics, Prognostics and Health Management team (DPHM) is dedicated to providing end to end solutions to improve aircraft reliability while reducing operating costs. Today’s flight monitoring systems are designed to automatically record critical flight parameters and provide visibility to events or exceedances. This helps the operator to make informed decisions about preventive maintenance, thereby reducing unscheduled maintenance, lowering operating costs, and increasing aircraft availability. DPHM’s advanced diagnostic solutions provides true value-added benefits that enable the operator to determine the best time to undertake maintenance on the engine and airframe. This can minimize costs by allowing for component repair instead of replacement and maximize engine time on wing.

Specific Position Duties
Support development and validation of highly automated engine oil system diagnostic, prognostic and health trend monitoring systems for various aircraft engine types including Turboprop, Turboshaft and Turbofan applications
Support development and implementation of advanced engine oil system trend monitoring algorithms for all Client engine types and models
Perform detailed analysis of engine oil sample lab results and develop advanced customer reports and operational metrics
Support development of SQL data tables for automatic collection of oil analysis records and integrate service solutions with P&WC customer web portal
Investigate system level issues related to aircraft gas turbine engine design, performance and operation
Investigate system level issues related to aircraft gas turbine engine design, performance, operability and operation.
Develop and implement scripts, algorithms, machine learning, data clustering and fault classification techniques within a relational database structure to manage, aggregate and search data in support of advanced engine oil system diagnostics and prognostics
Develop and validate engine and aircraft operational data cleansing scripts and filtering techniques to ensure accurate oil system trend service delivery
Requirements
Bachelor or Master degree in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering
Minimum of 3-5 years of engineering experience required in the field of aviation
Good oral and written communication skills to interface with customers
Background or demonstrated expertise in Air/Oil Systems Engineering and Aircraft engine design analysis
Strong computer programming skills using Python, R, VB and C#
Familiar with data visualization techniques using Matplotlib, HighCharts and/or PowerBI
Extensive experience with MS Office applications
Experience with MS SQL server 2012 and utilizing SSIS and SSAS to analyze large relational databases
Experience with application of statistical based tools in MATLAB and/or R Studio
Proficient at handling several analytical tasks concurrently
Understanding of aircraft engine data acquisition and current sensor technology

Boeing Global Services is hiring an Analytics Manager within its Boeing Vancouver Labs site to help design, develop and optimize the future of analytics
Summary:

Boeing Global Services is hiring an Analytics Manager within its Boeing Vancouver Labs site to help design, develop and optimize the future of analytics-driven products for the aviation industry. You will manage an industry-leading data science & data engineering team and be involved in all phases of the advanced analytics innovation, development and delivery lifecycle within the Boeing’s Digital Solution & Analytics business.

As key leader in Global Services Analytics, you will be working with internal business partners and outside customers to identify and define business problems, target appropropriate analytics efforts and drive execution excellence. As a Manager, you will be empowered to form and lead teams, inspire and grow world-class data science talent, and work collaboratively across the Boeing Global Services and the Aviation Industry to advantage our customers. Given the tight integration with digital products teams and business consulting teams, there will also be opportunities to support execution data strategies and digital transformation within Boeing Services and with our Aviation customers.

Since Boeing’s cross-functional teams and Boeing’s customers are located globally, the position will involve some travel, particularly to the USA.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Manage employees performing data science, data engineering and analytics product development activities.
Develops and drives projects and process improvements, sets operational goals and metrics, and oversees innovation, development & deployment of analytics capabilities embedded into Customer solutions.
Collaborates with business partners, such as product managers, software developments, IT, and data ops teams, to ensure effective integrated working teams aligned to solve business problems.
Work as part of the agile team to integrate capabilities on large scale projects, ensuring coherency across projects, product lines and strategic initiatives
Acquires and allocates resources for projects and processes, provides technical management of suppliers and leads process improvements.
Help drive requirements and data engineering execution in developing data science working environments and data flows to enable data science performance.
Develops and maintains relationships and partnerships with senior leadership, customers, stakeholders, peers, partners and direct reports to ensure customer needs are being met and team objectives are being accomplished.
Leverages technical experts and leaders to maintain and communicate vision, oversight, and approval of technical approaches, products and processes.
Manages, develops and motivates employees. Supports hiring and team development plans.
Promote the disciples of advanced analytics and help drive the organization to reflect a data-driven culture.


Demonstrated Knowledge and Skills:
You are customer-obsessed and data-driven
You are passionate about product innovation and creating industry level change
You have experience working on data-intensive projects, using modern data platforms and tools and advanced analytics methods and approaches
You are comfortable working with minimal direction and exercising considerable latitude in determining objectives and leading teams
You have strong communication skills, particularly in communicating the technical needs, approaches and benefits of advanced analytics
You are experienced in navigating and engaging internal and external stakeholders in complex, fast-moving organizational environments
You have familiarity with heavy-asset industries – aviation in particular
You have experience operating with remote, globalized teams with cross-functional skills and approaches


Education/Experience:
Previous management experience preferred, working cross-functionally to achieve objectives.
Master’s level degree in analytics-related field (Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, etc) an asset
Front line working experience in analytics, digital product development or data management preferred.

About us

Delphia's mission is to ensure your data is working for you. As a first step towards that end, we are building an online marketplace in which people can invest their data as assets, control how those assets are used, and realize the economic returns that their data generates. Through our various apps and services, we're building a new kind of company that re-thinks the value of privacy, data rights, and provenance to ensure your data always works for you.

Delphia is a growing (~25 people), multi-disciplinary team located in the heart of downtown Toronto. We started in January 2018 and have already graduated from Y Combinator and raised a sizeable Seed (led by Lerer Hippeau & Golden Ventures) and Series A (led by Real Ventures) rounds of investment, with continued interest from the investment community.

Whether we're tweaking the more delicate details of your data portfolio’s UI, or extracting signal from giant data sets, people at Delphia are creatives at heart. Our teams are continually iterating, solving hard problems, and collaborating to generate new forms of value and economic returns for our users. Working together, we want people to realize the real value of their data – and we're just getting started.

About the role

Delphia's market forecasting team is looking for a Data Scientist with a proven track record of building successful financial machine learning forecasting models. You will develop factors and models that can forecast various quantities of interests on thousands of companies worldwide by applying your analytical and predictive modeling expertise. You will generate and evaluate hypothesis that leverage our proprietary mass attitudinal and behavioural datasets in combination with social media data to fundamentally improve the Delphia's market forecasting abilities

Data Scientists at Delphia work closely with Data and Software Engineers to discover, prototype, and deploy factors and models at scale to accurately predict mass attitudes and behavior in order to understand and forecast large market shifts. You will work towards long-term ambitious research goals, while identifying intermediate milestones, solve complex forecasting problems and continuously improve the performance of our financial machine learning forecasting models.

You will also develop metrics and generate reports to measure and illustrate the value of ongoing experiences.

About you


You are passionate stock markets and finance and can easily generate hypothesis around factors that drive various markets.
You are an analytical problem solver and creative thinker that is passionate about machine learning and has outstanding analytical and modeling skills allowing you to quickly operationalize ideas and implement prototypes to validate an hypothesis.
You enjoy exploring and identifying patterns in data, develop and improve predictive models, and are interested in exploring any methods capable of efficiently and effectively generate features and improve forecasts on complex problems.
You can easily split problems and objectives into small experiences and continuously illustrate the value of your analysis while trying to reach longterm objectives.
You are a pro-active self-starter capable of taking responsibility for an initiative and working with minimal direction towards a broader objective.

Qualifications


3+ years experience with time-series modeling and forecasting including statistical analysis and machine learning techniques such as forecasting hierarchical or grouped time series, dynamic regression models, neural network models.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to explain technical concepts and analyses implications clearly to a broad audience and translate business objectives into actionable analyses.
Bachelor's degree or higher in an analytical area such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or any other relevant field.

We are looking for a great AI Data Analyst, to join Wysdom.AI – a fast-growing company providing the world's most advanced AI-based cognitive customer care solutions.
Wysdom is a mature full-stack virtual assistant platform that uses machine intelligence for cognitive customer care management over social, web chat, and voice. We give businesses a powerful new way to connect to customers, answer questions, and transact any time, using natural language.
Wysdom provides the framework, the tools, and a massive AI training data corpus to enterprises needing to quickly implement cognitive care. Our experienced team of AI experts continuously trains the system, ensuring businesses provide the best customer experience in whatever channel their customers choose.
We are growing and expanding our team — please join us as our AI Data Analyst based in our Richmond Hill Headquarters.
What is a Wysdom.AI Data Analyst?
Behind every amazing AI-based solution is a team of really smart people, with a passion for helping our clients deliver an amazing customer experience. Your core role will be to build analytical solutions which showcase performance of the Wysdom.AI solution.
As an AI Data Analyst, you will be responsible to help drive the success of our solution in the field. Part of your work involves building deep understanding of the AI training process, knowing what drives success, and partnering with clients to enhance their deployments.
Our clients are some of the top brands in the world. You will get a chance to be a part of how these companies are transforming their customer care operations into world-class digital experiences.
But what will I actually be doing?
The day-to-day role will involve writing queries, buildings dashboards, and developing analytical reports about product performance for our clients and executive team. You will work with SQL, Tableau and Python (among other tools) to create stunning visuals showing how Wysdom is driving impact for clients and helping them making their customers' experience even better. You may also present your work to clients and executives. There will also be opportunities to improve our AI processes and drive real change in our product through developing tools and processes to streamline AI training.
Typical day-to-day responsibilities may include:
Build efficient dashboards and reports for clients and our executive
Deploy, maintain and troubleshoot Tableau Server instances for our clients
Develop prototypes of our next-generation insights products
Create, review and edit our insights products to ensure clients can easily understand Wysdom.AI's impact on their business
Continually improve our insights products through performance improvements, new metrics and visualizations
Building and presenting dashboards for client demos
Beyond these day-to-day responsibilities, your sense of curiosity and analytical mindset will challenge you to dig deeper into the ways in which we can continually improve our solution, our success rate and the customer experience.
About You
University degree is a technical or mathematical discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering)
3 or more years of experience with Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server is strongly preferred, but experience with another data visualization tool is also acceptable (e.g. Mode, Qlik, PowerBI)
Strong SQL skills
Above-average Excel / Sheets skills
“All hands-on deck” mentality
Passion for delivering amazing results

job_description:
Dartmouth, NSA proudly Canadian retail company, Sobeys began in 1907 as a small meat delivery business in Stellarton, Nova Scotia. Today, Sobeys Inc. serves the food shopping needs of Canadians with approximately 1,500 stores in all 10 provinces under retail banners that include Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, and Lawton’s Drug Stores as well as in-store pharmacies, liquor and more than 350 retail fuel locations.
Together with our 125,000 employees and franchise affiliates and a collective passion for delivering exceptional food and shopping experiences, Sobeys’ purpose is to improve the lives of Canadians by helping them Eat Better, Feel Better and Do Better.

All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.


Overview
Sobeys is full of exciting opportunities and we are always looking for bright new talent to join our team! We currently have a Full time opportunity for an Analyst, Data Integrity to join our Merchandising Retail Solutions team based out of Dartmouth, NS.
Job Description
What you'll get to do in this fast paced role:
Develop and deliver metrics to measure data integrity, and assist the department in championing the CEO/CFO initiative within Sobeys
Assist in seeking external benchmarks and thought leadership to enable best practices that could be relevant for data integrity
Perform routine transaction processing across all functions
Facilitate the identification, development, implementation, and measurement of efficient and effective best practice processes across all Data Integrity functions based on strategies defined by management
Perform basic analysis or requirement gathering during project execution across functions and identify variances or exceptions
Problem/issue resolution while working alongside the Data Integrity management team for developing root cause analysis
Provide technical and analytical support to internal customers
Create, change, and implement documentation in the areas of training, process, and business requirements
Assist in the creation and maintenance of product and vendor listing attributes in all applicable Data systems
Support Category Management teams to ensure adherence to Data Integrity requirements
Provide ongoing data and feedback to the Supervisor Data Integrity for all team and Data related items
Adherence to Data Integrity processes and policies, and department SLA targets
Special projects, testing requirements, and tasks as assigned
Maintain discount program data bases

Job Requirements
What your resume will include and demonstrate to us:
Post Secondary Education and a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience.
Sound knowledge of SAP, Chainware, Trend, Kroll, EXE,PPT, and CMA is preferred
Retail and/or wholesale experience preferred
Database management experience and report writing preferred
High level of adaptability and flexibility coupled with change-management skills
SAP experience or analytical aptitude to mainframe systems is preferred
Proficient in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel
Solid experience in analyzing large amounts of data
Strong communicate skills (both oral and written)
Strong customer service skills coupled with the ability to meet service levels and deadlines
Exceptional attention to detail with a keen focus on process improvements
Ability to analyze data and provide value recommendations to leadership
This is an outstanding opportunity to join a leading Canadian company with a clear vision and focus. If you feel that this describes the kind of work you want to do, and you are excited about what Sobeys has to offer, then we look forward to reviewing your application. Please ensure that you take the time to ensure your profile shows us why you’re the most qualified applicant for the role.
Sobeys offers our employees many valuable benefits such as:
Growing organization
Competitive salary
Pension plan
Flexible health and dental benefits plan (eligible employees)
Ongoing Training & Development
Opportunity for internal mobility to other departments and/or promotions (for employees who are strong performers)
Sobeys is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process and will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process.

While all responses are appreciated only those being considered for interviews will be acknowledged.

We appreciate the interest from the Staffing industry however respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from Agencies.

Data Scientist
BrainStation is a global leader in digital skills training and development, offering a 12-week Diploma program in Data Science. BrainStation is currently seeking a Data Science professional to lead the delivery of our program through online and in-person teaching. BrainStation Educators are given the unique opportunity to teach, research, and work on real analysis problems, while simultaneously building the future of higher education.
Responsibilities
Lead our 12-week Data Science Diploma program
Help build a world class technical team
Deliver lectures and mentor the next wave of Data Science talent
Co-create BrainStation's full-time Data Science Program that will positively impact the lives and careers of hundreds of individuals across our campuses
Actively work on writing and researching new content to teach the most up to date skills in data science to our students
Apply BrainStation's "Agile Education" methodologies to the program to continuously improve the educational experience for students
Constantly improve your own skills, and apply these skills in collaboration with other BrainStation Educators in order to build the digital platform and tools needed to effectively deliver educational material
Define the education experience of the future
Successful candidates will have
3+ years experience as a Data Scientist or Analytics professional and a Bachelor's degree relevant to the subject matter OR 8+ years experience as a Data Scientist or Analytics professional
Experience building and leading teams
Strong command of querying and programming languages (SQL, Python, R), and visualization tools (Tableau, Python packages, etc.), as well as experience applying various methods of numerical and categorical modelling and machine learning principles
Practical experience designing and conducting experiments using a variety of tools and methods, and can speak to their complexities in a simple and logical manner
Experience in a teaching role, and be comfortable speaking to large groups and mentoring others on the job
An empathetic, friendly, and approachable demeanour
A proven ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
About BrainStation
BrainStation is a global leader in digital skills training and development, with courses, workshops, events, and corporate training offered online and in state-of-the-art campuses in New York, Toronto, and Vancouver. Founded in 2012, BrainStation has worked with over 250 instructors from the most innovative companies, developing cutting-edge, real-world digital training for more than 50,000 professionals and some of the largest corporations in the world. By 2025, BrainStation will have innovation hubs around the world, and will be empowering young minds, powerful politicians, fortune 500 CEOs, and the newest wave of disruptive innovators, on campuses and online.
Have you been to a campus or joined an online learning opportunity? We are actively seeking individuals that believe in lifelong learning and that have taken part in our On Campus or Online offerings.
NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.
BrainStation is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

Vancouver, BCTRIUMF is Canada's particle accelerator centre, and one of the world's leading laboratories for particle and nuclear
physics and accelerator-based science. We are an international centre for discovery and innovation, advancing
fundamental, applied, and interdisciplinary research for science, medicine, and business.
At TRIUMF, we’re passionate about accelerating discovery and innovation to improve lives and build a better world.
Equity, diversity, and inclusion are integral to excellence and enhance our ability to create knowledge and opportunity
for all. Together, we are committed to building an inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the
voices of our employees, students, partners, and the people and communities we serve.
We are currently accepting applications for a scientific programmer and analyst who will join the Data Acquisition
Group in supporting the various experimental programs and groups at TRIUMF, including TITAN and CMMS.
Additional responsibilities will include providing overall computing system support and maintenance tasks for the
Science Technology Department. Specific responsibilities include:
Linux system administration.
Participating in the development and maintenance of the custom DAQ system MIDAS software package.
Developing web tools and scripts.
Assisting with design and commissioning for various local and offsite experiments.
Maintaining proper documentation on all aspects of their work for operation and traceability.
This is an ideal opportunity for a resourceful individual who is eager to contribute to projects and shows initiative in
their work. You have a positive attitude and good team spirit and demonstrate a sense of timeliness in your tasks.
Your other qualifications include:
A BSC in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering Physics or equivalent and 5 years of experience in the
field of experimental physics.
Working knowledge of Linux system administration. Experience with MacOS and Windows is a plus.
Proficient in programming languages: C, C++, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Python, Perl.
Strong experience in web-based development.
Familiarity with techniques of particle detection is a plus.
Knowledge of the MIDAS DAQ systems would be an asset to your application.
Applicants must be legally able to work in Canada on a permanent basis (Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident).
TRIUMF is located on the south campus of the University of British Columbia in Vancouver, BC. We offer a competitive
total compensation package, including comprehensive benefits, attractive salary, and an excellent opportunity to
enhance your career portfolio in a high profile national research facility.
TRIUMF is an equal opportunity employer, and we welcome applications from all qualified candidates. Your complete
application package should be submitted by email to recruiting@triumf.ca and will include the following in one
complete PDF file:
Subject line: Competition 700
Employment Application Form
Cover letter indicating salary expectations
CV
Applications will be accepted until 2019-04-02

TemporaryWorking at the Hospital for Sick Children is not just a job it's a career. Our Staff are our greatest strength as they form our vision, carry out our mission, and represent our values. The mission of the SickKids Centre for Global Child Health (C-GCH) is to collaborate with national and global partners to improve the health of children worldwide through the advancement of child health education, and clinical research initiatives. Our purpose is to provide a single point of coordination for key programs, policies and external relations relevant to Global Child health.
C-GCH has partnered with several Canadian non-governmental organizations (NGOs) to lead and manage a robust monitoring and evaluation strategy across their individual reproductive maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health (RMNCAH) related projects, being implemented in Low and Middle Income Countries.
C-GCH is looking for a Research Analyst to work closely with the Principal Investigator and Senior Project Manager, to participate in the end-line evaluation of two multi-country RMNCAH programs. The Analyst will have strong qualitative skills and experience, and will support the development of the qualitative component of the evaluation, in collaboration with our NGO partners. The Analyst will also contribute to the analysis and reporting for the evaluation. Experience working with NGOs and in program evaluation is required.
Here’s What You’ll Get to Do:
Develop protocols for the qualitative component of the endline evaluation; develop the tools, interview guides, study protocols, etc, in collaboration with our NGO partners
Coordinate the application for Research Ethics Board approvals at both SickKids and Internationally
Interview and hire local consultants to undertake the qualitative data collection and analysis; work in collaboration with the consultant and NGO partners to review the analysis and interpretation
Document field activities, develop monitoring tools and data checks
Ensure field teams are adhering to project protocols and identify any deviations from protocol
Write reports incorporating the findings and triangulating with other data
Assist in the development of key messages, lessons learned, and knowledge translation strategies/outputs.
Develop strong working relationships with our partners and stakeholders
Attend relevant meetings, research rounds, and workshops to increase knowledge and skills
Assist with other research related activities, and protocol, report, and manuscript writing as needed.
Travel to project Countries (mainly in East Africa) for 1-2 weeks, 3-4 times over the year.
Here’s What You’ll Need:
Master’s degree in public health (or similar), focus on qualitative or mixed-methods
Experience in qualitative study design and analysis
Experience in descriptive quantitative data analysis in a health-related field is an asset
Experience with knowledge translation an asset;
Excellent written and verbal communication skills,
Experience working with NGOs in program evaluation or M&E an asset
Knowledge of health research methodology and study design is an asset
Demonstrated ability to be self-motivated and self-directed,
Demonstrated ability to:
Work independently, with minimal supervision, and within a team
Provide leadership and guidance to colleagues
Be self-motivated and self-directed
Utilize critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Pay close attention to detail while maintaining view of the larger scope
Demonstrated interest in and/or work experience related to:
the health of children and adolescents
health research in low- and middle-income countries
Ability to Travel – up to 20%
Employment Type: Temporary, Full- Time (one-year contract)

Wawanesa Insurance is a policyholder owned mutual insurance company that offers employees great stability and opportunity for growth.

We are currently looking for dedicated, driven, and enthusiastic individuals who thrive in an environment that welcomes change and are looking for an opportunity for diverse experience, advancement on a growing team.

Our Information Services team is delivering truly transformational change to both our business partners, and throughout our technology platforms. These initiatives have led to rapid growth and the need for new talent. If you’re interested in joining a team of motivated and skilled IT professionals, who are equipped with, and are actively working with today’s latest technology, consider this exciting Winnipeg-based opportunity!


JOB SUMMARY:
Working under general supervision, the Solution Analyst will be part of our data delivery team and contributes to Wawanesa success by designing, documenting, testing and supporting our enterprise data warehouse solutions to meet business stakeholder requirements.

You are someone that will have strong system and business analytical skills with a strong technical acumen with SQL query writing.


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Contribute to the analysis, design and documentation of both system and business requirements for application enhancements and projects.
Participate in requirement sessions with business and system teams.
Collaborate with multiple functions to ensure quality software
Create test cases based on requirements documentation and defect resolutions
Contribute to the communication of system solutions in business and technical terms.
Contribute to the resolution of both business requirements and system issues.
Follow established practices, processes and guidelines.
Knowledge of system standards and IS department established methodologies.
Perform other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:

Completion of post-secondary degree/certificate or equivalent experience.
Experience performing systems and/or business analysis or equivalent role is considered an asset.
Knowledge of data warehouse concepts and best practices.
Effective analysis and problem-solving skills for collecting data to analyze options.
Effective attention to detail skills to produce deliverables that consider the areas involved.
Effective communication skills to share information with others.
Effective planning and organizing skills to develop plans and meet deadlines.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Understanding of agile practices, scrum, Kanban and continuous delivery.
Experience using software development tools, such as JIRA, Confluence is considered an asset.
Experience with ETL tools such as Informatica, SSIS, FME is considered an asset.
Experience with Oracle, and/or MS SQL server is an asset.
Experience in programming languages is considered an asset.
Knowledge and experience in insurance industry is considered an asset.
Wawanesa provides its employees with a respectful, challenging and rewarding environment where they can maximize their potential while contributing to the company’s goals. Our employees are provided with highly competitive compensation packages (salaries, generous vacation allowance, leave top up, goal achievement plan, premium free benefits and a pension plan). Wawanesa provides a stable and rewarding environment for its employees in today’s challenging markets.

If you are interested in this exciting, challenging position with Wawanesa, please submit your resume and cover letter by clicking apply On-Line below.

Description
As our company slogan states, the Staples’ Supply Chain is Making Things Happen for our customers every day through our network of more than 10 warehouses, 300 stores, and hundreds of delivery trucks. And even though we already operate the best supply chain in our industry, we need talented individuals like you to help us leverage advanced analytics and optimization algorithms to achieve breakthrough performance levels.

Position Summary
The Data Scientist is responsible for applying analytical methods to improve decision-making across the Staples’ Supply Chain
Using mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, and mathematical optimization, the individual will play an important role in the tactical execution of optimal or near-optimal solutions to complex decision-making problems
These problems will come from all parts of the Staples’ Supply Chain and will include challenges like:
Developing inventory management procurement strategies that minimize Staples’ investment in inventory while achieving or exceeding service-level targets
Refining the Staples’ logistics network strategy to ensure facility locations and store / customer assignments are optimized to minimize variable costs
Enhancing and implementing product profitability / cost-to-serve models to ensure the right products are being stocked in the right locations
Primary Responsibilities:
Apply analytical methods to solve complex, data-driven business problems that will ultimately have a direct impact on the Staple’s bottom-line
Communicate results to management as needed
Research, design, and implement data models and innovative algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to realize actionable results
This role will be directly or indirectly supporting all functional areas within the Staples’ Supply Chain

Qualifications
Qualifications
Basic:
MS in Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field plus 1-3 years industry experience.
PhD in Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related (no industry experience required)
Experience with data mining, mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, and mathematical optimization tools, including linear programming, integer programming, mixed-integer programming, Markov decision processes, and multivariate analysis
Demonstrated analytical thinking, strategic problem-solving capabilities
Experience with financial acumen and data mining
Technically experienced with Power BI, Access and Excel
Preferred:
Knowledge and experience using major statistical analysis tools such as R, Matlab, or SAS
Experience working with development toolsets such as Hadoop, MYSQL, Teradata, NOSQL, etc.
Experience with financial modelling
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner with both technical and non-technical customers

Staples is committed to providing accommodation to people with disabilities throughout the job application and interview process to the point of undue hardship. If you require an accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact a Customer Care Representative at 1-866-782-7537.


Staples is an equal opportunity employer and an accommodation will be provided during the hiring process if requested.

Toronto, ONData Analyst – Analytics: Challenging, Impactful, Rewarding


WHO WE ARE: Paradigm is an innovative, flexible, leading-edge Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) company. As Canada's leading mortgage outsourcing company, Paradigm's mandate is to enable new and existing lenders with a cost effective mortgage operation solution that can quickly respond to market conditions, lead the market in innovation and ultimately provide mortgage consumers with great choice, vastly improving their mortgage experience.
PARADIGM CULTURE: Paradigm is committed to open and honest communication with our staff. We believe by being transparent, truthful and sincere, we can serve each other and our clients with integrity. Our culture can be summed up in one word: family. We work hard at creating an exceptional professional family here at Paradigm and do not take it for granted. Every initiative, new hire, company event and daily activities are focused on maintaining and fostering our Paradigm family because we know that our employees are undoubtedly the key to our success.
The Opportunity: As a Data Analyst you will bring our understanding of our clients to the next level and help us move forward confidently with data-informed decisions.
Role Specific Accountabilities include, but are not limited to the following:
Interpret data and turn it into information which can offer ways to improve a business, thus affecting business decisions through gathering information from various sources and interpreting patterns and trends
Conduct complex queries on our data warehouse to help teams get the data they need, and maintain key reports and dashboards to track operational and business metrics
Perform impactful analysis against large datasets using a variety of data analysis, extraction and visualization tools to report and communicate insights to internal and external stakeholders.
Work closely with the Operations, Product and Marketing teams to define and answer business questions in a measurable and actionable manner. What behaviors predict retention? What is the lifetime value of a customer? What effect will changes to the business process have on productivity?
Drive our data strategy by working with the technology team to identify, implement and maintain the systems we need to collect, verify, and analyze data
Define standards for data quality, and support the technology team in meeting those standards
Communicate and distribute data insights
Make recommendations about the methods and ways in which a company obtains and analyses data to improve quality and the efficiency of data systems
Educate everyone in the company so that they can use our reporting tools to ask good questions and answer them themselves
Educational/Technical Experience
A passion and curiosity for driving better business decisions through insight, data and analytics.
A Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science or business or equivalent
3+ years experience in an operational support, data science, or data analysis role
Expert knowledge of SQL
Proficiency in Python/PowerBI/VBA/Microsoft office tools
Personal Requirements
Strong analytical, problem solving, communication and organizational skills with a passion for learning
Self-motivated with the desire to continually acquire information and develop new skills to enhance job performance.
Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks of varying complexities, prioritize and meet deadlines and work well under pressure.
Team player that works well independently and as part of a team, willing to work on a variety of technical initiatives
Possess a positive, can-do attitude and enjoy making a difference in the business through contributions

Lower Mainland, BC$74,733 - $93,416 a yearDevelops, coordinates and maintains performance measures across the organization ensuring alignment with divisional goals and objectives. Prepares a variety of analysis and reports to provide accurate and up-to-date information to the management and Board of Directors for informed decision making. Provides guidance to analysts from other departments in KPI monitoring and reporting.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Collaborates with Senior Management on Corporate KPIs; leads requirements gathering, target setting, report design and delivery and documentation. Provides support related to corporate performance measures ensuring alignment with divisional goals and objectives and carries out analysis related to variances in corporate performance measures, recommending best practices to the Senior Management for problem areas.

Liaises with various departments to develop and prepare dashboards and periodic reports focused on various corporate performance measures and improvements across all functions. Prepares quarterly reports for the Board of Directors and TransLink indicating performance compared to targets and the previous year(s), and rationale for variances.

Develops and maintains KPI data dashboards. Develops business cases to support KPIs with strategic objectives and leverages available benchmarking resources for best practices; provides comparable performance measures from other transit systems and business enterprises to stakeholders towards informed decision making. Forecasts the implications of various alternatives to maximize the effectiveness of KPIs for organizational success.

Maintains data integrity of key performance measures ensuring accuracy and completeness of performance measurement, while also ensuring compliance with company’s standards, policies and processes and regulatory and other related requirements.

Provides guidance in KPI monitoring and reporting. Actively involved in developing and establishing KPIs. Ensures that the quarterly Key Performance Indicators (KPI) are consistent with expenditure forecasts, and verifies financial information used in the development of KPI budget projections.

Prepares ad hoc reports, presentation materials and related to performance measurement, and researches latest trends, best practices and other related data as assigned. Prepares various reports, in-depth analysis and recommendations for senior management and other working teams.

Participates in the development and implementation of a continuous improvement strategy by offering Business Process advisory services to other departments. Supports the delivery of better value and greater efficiency through the identification and elimination of unnecessary complexity within business processes and identification of better ways of working
Qualifications
Education & Experience:
The requirements for this job are acquired through completion of a university degree in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance plus five (5) years of progressive experience in performance reporting functions in a multifaceted organization.
Other Requirements:

Advanced knowledge of concepts, principles, practices and techniques pertaining to all aspects of performance measures, benchmarking, balanced scorecards and dashboards

Excellent knowledge of office software including word processing, spreadsheet and data management systems

Strong knowledge and understanding of the relevant concepts of data mining and data warehousing to be able procure and manage data

Strong analytical, problem solving and judgment skills to be able to interpret data and identify, diagnose, and resolve KPI related issues

Strong interpersonal skills to discuss and explain financial matters to business leader

Strong relationship management skills and ability to work across multidisciplinary teams and management levels

Strong time management, organization, verbal and written communication skills

Experience in leading and facilitating Lean/process improvements event is an asset

Advanced knowledge of Business Intelligence tools would be considered an asset.

Other Information
Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule
37.5 hours per week.

Toronto, ONAbout EPL
At EPL, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.

We help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. Our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in Canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use.

We have built our reputation on doing things really well. We have a bright, talented, and engaging team with a lot of passion for what we do: helping large energy users across North America reduce their energy/carbon footprints and quantifying energy costs.

The Role
Recent and projected growth has led us to search for a high energy professional to join the Building Analytics Team in our Toronto office. The person will join us at a time where we are experiencing outstanding company growth. A steep learning curve is anticipated. Key aspects of the role:

o Drive down energy use intensity at large commercial properties as part of our Building Analytics Team, ideally while enhancing the livability and health of these same facilities.
o Energy conservation studies and audits at large commercial buildings.
o Measurement and Verification (M&V) of energy and demand savings projects.
o Sub-metering system design and specifications.
o Studies/analysis related to sub-meter cost allocation and data analytics.

About You
We seek an intelligent person with strong problem-solving skills capable of handling a wide variety of technical challenges. High energy levels and a team-based approach are of great value; just as important is a determination to overcome obstacles. Above all, this person should look to establish and maintain a reputation for integrity over the long term.

Nominally, we seek an engineering graduate. Applicants in Engineering Physics, Math and Engineering, Electrical Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering will be given special consideration.

2-4 years of consulting experience delivering a range of energy conservation and building optimization services to large commercial properties. Services include; energy audits and feasibility studies, building performance optimization ( incl. commissioning and retro-commissioning), and M&V plans/verification.

Demonstrated experience as a valued member of a successful team is beneficial.

It is important that the applicant can communicate clearly and efficiently'

What to expect
People are the most important part of our company.

We have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. The success of our people drives the success of our company. Each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their rotations.

EPL team members also:

Unlimited Vacation & Flexible Work Hours (you own your time)
Vibrant workplace & regular team fun (events & activities)
Work with super smart and nice people!

$61,680 - $102,800 a yearInvestments & Treasury is responsible for the University’s investment program. The University’s endowments, at approximately $1.4 billion, are the fourth largest in Canada and provide approximately $48 million annually to support scholarships, research and salaries. The investment program is broadly diversified across asset classes and utilizes both public and private market strategies. Changing economic conditions require that investment policies and strategies be continuously evaluated to ensure that the long term value of the endowment funds are maintained after inflation and program spending in order to benefit future generations. Located in the heart of campus, Investments & Treasury is a dynamic team of nine (9) individuals working in a highly collaborative, innovative and professional environment. Under the direction of the Portfolio Manager, Public Markets & Reporting, the Investment Analyst is responsible for contributing to professional oversight, effective coordination and strategic management of the endowment assets.

Summary of Key Duties and Responsibilities include:

Provides support for the implementation, management, and monitoring of both internally and externally managed public market investments for a variety of asset classes and strategies.

Identify, analyze, manage, and monitor a portfolio of investment managers and strategies utilizing quantitative, qualitative and interpersonal skills:

Assist with written recommendations for appointing and terminating investment managers, investment advisors, consultants and custodians
Review, complete and amend public market investment management agreements and other legal and regulatory documents
Analyze investment manager performance and prepare comprehensive analytics and reports for internal and external stakeholders
Provide global capital market insights and monitor developments using quantitative and qualitative approaches for internal analysis
Coordinates investment performance reporting and compliance monitoring.

Assist in the preparation of investment commentary, performance and risk measurement, statistical and financial reports for internal and external stakeholders; this function includes working closely with the University’s performance measurement service provider:

Assist with the verification of portfolio transactions and rebalancing; this includes monitoring liquidity, ensuring capital calls are met, security settlement and optimizing cash levels
Ensure that custodial banking, investment and financial systems provide accurate, timely and complete information
Ensure that systems used for portfolio tracking and market data are maintained and updated
Monitor compliance with investment policies, regulations, and best practices by investment managers
Complete various surveys and quarterly reports
Performs investment research, portfolio design, and risk management.

Conduct research to identify new investment strategies and opportunities:

Constructively challenge research initiatives and portfolio positioning. Review current academic research and capital market conditions; identify developing trends and prepare reports recommending strategies to enhance returns or safeguard the portfolio’s assets
Provide insight on risk management and its application at the asset class level, total fund level, and investment policy level
Analyze and report sources of risk in order to ensure risk-return objectives and risk exposures align with investment objectives
Actively participates in the development of all investment related policies.

Assist in the research and formulation of the University Funds Investment Policy, University Endowment Spending Policy, Board Investment Committee Terms of Reference, and Statement of Investment Principles and Beliefs.

To be successful in this position, the candidate will have the following skills, abilities and qualifications:

Relevant undergraduate degree
Minimum of two (2) years of related experience preferred
Enrollment in or completion of graduate and/or professional certification (i.e. CFA, CAIA, FRM, PRM, MBA, or CPA)
Experience and familiarity with investment settlement procedures
Solid understanding of finance, capital markets, performance measurement, risk measurement and management, portfolio management, financial modeling, and sensitivity analysis
Proven understanding of economic and market trends, interest rates and currency markets
Knowledge of mathematical finance, statistics, fundamental micro and macro-economic concepts, and corporate financial analysis
Knowledge of economics, portfolio theory, and portfolio management
Proficiency with Bloomberg and/or other portfolio management tools
Understanding of financial markets and the ability to work within tight deadlines while maintaining a high degree of efficiency and accuracy
Strong written and oral presentation skills
Strong research and analytical skills
Attention to detail, organizational skills and the ability to make decisions under strict timelines
All Treasury positions require a Security Clearance Check
In accordance with the Administrative and Professional Officer Agreement, this full-time continuing position offers a comprehensive benefits package found at Faculty & Staff Benefits and annual salary range of $61,680 - $102,800.
