job_title: Pension Specialist, Member Services and Pension Analyst, Data and Employer Services
job_description:
The Alberta Teachers' Retirement Fund Board (ATRF) is an organization that takes pride in our outstanding investment management and exceptional plan member services, resulting in more than $16 billion of assets under management on behalf of more than 80,000 plan members.
As a growing and diverse organization, we're building for the future and require the skills and talents of people like you. Join our team in Edmonton, Alberta and be part of a high-performing, collaborative group that shares a purpose and a commitment to excellence.
Opportunity
In 2018, ATRF has embarked into a multi-year initiative called Project Lantern to ensure we continuously meet our evolving clients' expectations. Project Lantern is about assessing and modernizing how we deliver services to our members and employers for years to come. It is about understanding how our clients want to consume services, interact and transact with us in the future, while building on our existing solid foundation and service attributes that our clients appreciate. Enhanced experience for members, employers and ATRF staff is at the heart of this project.
We are seeking enthusiastic Pension Specialists in Member Services and Pension Analysts in Data and Employer Services to continue delivering exceptional Pension Services operations and allow resources to be allocated to Project Lantern. These permanent positions are members of the Pension Services team which has a broad responsibility in all aspects of the delivery of high quality pension services at ATRF.
Stakeholders
The Pension Specialists and Pension Analysts will partner with key individuals in various departments across the organization and will interact on a day-to-day basis with plan members, beneficiaries, other representatives and employers.
Responsibilities
As a Pension Specialist, Member Services you would be responsible for:
Ensuring accurate and timely processing of all member transactions including retirement, termination, death, reciprocal transfers and service purchases.
Processing and peer reviewing benefit payments and other transactions.
Providing excellent customer service by communicating with plan members and beneficiaries about their pension entitlements and responding to their questions and requests verbally and in writing.
As a Pension Analyst in Data and Employer Services, you would be responsible for:
Ensuring timely and complete reporting of employer data by fostering relationships, including providing training to employers on the reporting software and reporting processes.
Conducting reconciliations of the employer data and ensuring all required data for the administration of the plan are accurately reported and available for the benefit transactions.
Data management, analytics and reporting.
Qualifications and Experience
A post-graduate diploma in business or other relevant field, plus at least two years of experience in pension administration or related experience.
A Certified Employee Benefit Specialist (CEBS) or Pension Plan Administration Certificate (PPAC) designation or equivalent would be an asset.
Exceptional customer service. Have an interest in working directly with plan members and employers in a professional and highly regulated industry.
Strong communication skills, both oral and written. Being fluent in both French and English would be an asset.
Self-motivated with strong organizational and time management skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask and prioritize.
The ability to work efficiently and effectively in a team environment with minimal supervision.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and a strong aptitude for math.
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office as well as the adaptability to learn in-house systems.
The ability to identify inefficiencies with processes and recommend improvements.
As one of Alberta's Top Employers for the last three consecutive years we offer a competitive compensation package which includes:
100% employer paid benefits, defined benefit pension plan, health & wellness spending accounts, paid volunteer time and much more.
Excellent opportunities for professional growth and career development.
Learning and development supported through ATRF's education reimbursement program.
An engaging, inclusive culture where you can be you!
At ATRF, diversity is one of our core strengths. We are an organization that takes pride in ensuring the people we hire and the culture we create reflects and celebrates diversity of thought, background, and experience.
For a detailed job profile for the Pension Specialist position, click here. For a detailed job profile for the Pension Analyst position, click here.
To apply, submit resume and cover letter to resumes@atrf.com. Attention: Carrine Willocks, Recruitment Specialist.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.


Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

About Us

We are changing the way utilities manage our most precious resource: water. We provide water utilities with an Artificial Intelligence driven platform to help their staff make smarter decisions in real-time when operating their critical processes (i.e. water treatment, pumping etc). In doing so, we’re able to help utilities drive down their costs, enhance reliability and reduce risks to public safety.

We are thinking about the future, too. We are reimagining how the operational staff of the 21st century will interact with their critical infrastructure.

The Right Candidate

In short, we’re looking for impact-minded software engineers, data scientists and architects – those who are passionate about making the world a better place through artificial intelligence. You’ll be responsible for maintaining data structures behind billions of dollars in critical water infrastructure for Fortune 500 companies. We’re looking for ambitious, energetic, and talented individuals to join our purpose-driven community as you bridge the technical and business worlds to deliver products for the global water sector. You’ll have the opportunity to lead teams in building mission-critical systems and services for high profile clients globally using cutting-edge cloud technologies in an agile environment. We’re looking for individuals with a broad set of both management and technical skills.

What You'll Do


Build and optimize highly scalable, robust machine learning modelling pipelines for real-time applications
Optimize and scale in-house technologies such as optimization algorithms for industrial applications
Develop natural-language processing solutions, which augments internal data-model for robust and intelligent virtual assistants
Develop and augment pattern recognition solutions for large-scale anomaly and extreme event detection and root-cause analysis

1+ years experience with cloud technologies, specifically AWS
3+ years experience with Python Data science libraries (numpy, pandas, tensorflow, scikit-learn, etc)
2+ years experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and MongoDB
Demonstrated experience developing production level code
Strong project management and organizational skills
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment

Why we think you will love working with us.

Build something making a difference in the world. Have a big impact at an early-stage, VC-backed software startup. Work with a tight-knit community of experienced entrepreneurs creating socially-mindful technology.

Employee Stock Option Plan

Arctic Wolf Networks, Inc. (AWN) is looking for a Concierge Security Analyst (CSA). The CSA is front line Operations Center role, supporting our security services around the world. The CSA is an internal triage analyst who assesses inbound security data and communications, dealing with straightforward tasks and escalating to our Security Engineers as needed.

----------------------

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:
----------------------


Understand IT infrastructure and networking to be able to quickly dispatch security incidents with the help and guidance of Senior Security Personnel.
Triage customer requests, apply playbook driven solutions, initiate potential incident investigations through assignment to security engineers and may assist the engineers with use web-based resources to determine if a given event is potentially real, or more importantly that it is benign.
Attention to process and a willingness to learn are critical assets for the right candidate.
Strong communication skills and easily interact with a variety of different people and personalities. Success in this role depends on the effective dispatch of both security and communication triage events to the correct persons in a timely manner.
Understand the processes and systems Arctic Wolf uses, this will be critical in helping the Senior Security staff handle their customers as support specific customer requests.
Creating and amending runbooks that aid in expanding the knowledge of your peers
Continuously drive to learn new aspects of the security business.

AWN is a start-up and all CSA candidates should expect to be working with all parts of AWN, including engineering, operations, sales, marketing, and executive management. A positive can-do attitude is a must. A willingness to learn and try new things is critical. An ability to deal with uncertainty is a positive.

-------------------------------

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
-------------------------------


BS in Computer Science or 5 years in the IT industry required, university degree in a Computer Security program desirable.
A GSEC (SANS 401) certification is required. If you do not have a valid GSEC, you will be required to achieve it in the first 6 months of employment.

You will be required to attend trainings, seminars or webinars relevant to job role to enhance current knowledge base and skill set in order to improve job performance and efficiency. Attend at least one event in a year and should not impact job/project deliverables.

------------------------

EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS:
------------------------

Each successful candidate will be required to pass a criminal background check and an employment verification as a condition of employment.

Arctic Wolf Networks is a 24×7 work environment and CSA's are required to work shift work on a rotating basis. This position works on a 5-week shift rotation which combines 12 hour shifts and 8 hour shifts. This schedule also builds in learning and development time to invest in our team members and keep their skills sharp.

---------------------------------

Additional Skills and Experience:
---------------------------------


Security basics
Malware knowledge
Firewalls and IDS/IPS
Proxy and content filtering
Windows and Active Directory
Network and Security Auditing

---------------


Believe in being lean – we constantly Build, Measure, and Learn in all aspect of our business
Customer centric; we will be successful when we delight our customers
Provide compelling compensation packages – benefits, competitive pay, and excellent equity

If you are ready for a challenge, come work at Arctic Wolf Networks, make a difference, and be part of our success!

Waterloo, ONAthena Software is hiring a Senior Business Data Analyst to join our expanding team!

Athena makes Penelope, a case management software system for social service agencies and non-profits around the world. We have hundreds of clients on five continents - we estimate that more than 20,000 people use Penelope every day, and that our clients help over 1 million people each year.

About Athena

We are a group of 85, with employees located in Canada, United States, Australia, and the United Kingdom.

Our product is a unique, flexible and comprehensive solution for social service agencies, and this spirit is also reflected in our company culture of collaboration and commitment to community.

At Athena, we promote a team atmosphere, and believe very strongly in fostering a true work / life balance. Our company is owned and run by people with families - we know how important it is to spend time away from the computer and phone, and we hope you feel the same way.

What You’ll Do

As Senior Business Data Analyst, reporting to the Manager of Tailored Services, you will work with Athena Software’s clients and product team to develop common reporting data sets for Athena’s market sectors as well as custom client reports. You will tailor solutions to meet these needs by querying a Penelope (PostgreSQL) database, creating custom views and functions to facilitate updating and designing reports and creating data visualizations and/or data exports in multiple formats.

You gather and document requirements, and provide informed quotes for estimated effort.
You write SQL queries and create visual representations of data in third party tools such as Excel, Tableau, and XML.
You communicate with Athena’s clients regarding process and change requests, understanding the business issues and data challenges of their organization and industry.
You liaise with project and business leaders to interpret analytical requirements.
This position is permanent, full-time, and located in our Waterloo, Ontario headquarters.

Who You Are

You are a problem solver by design; analytical and client-oriented, you possess at least five years related experience in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Programming.

You have experience creating dashboard reports in Tableau (a Tableau certification is preferred).
You have strong knowledge of SQL and relational database management systems, with experience in querying databases with complex relationships between tables.
With outstanding written and verbal communication skills, you are able to succeed in a dynamic, driven environment, trail-blazing creative solutions to complex challenges.
You are able to learn new applications swiftly, independently, and with confidence.
You have expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
You have an Undergraduate University Degree or equivalent experience in Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science or Programming

You have sound understanding of Statistics and AI including (but not limited to) regression, clustering, classification, decision trees, time series forecasting, neural networks, deep learning, etc.
 You are familiar with Python, R, SQL languages in analytical contexts
Exposure to large data sets and distributed computing, data warehousing, data integration, and ETL/ELT tools will be a plus
Experience with ML frameworks/libraries e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe, Scikit-learn, Pandas, etc.
Exposure to tools and infrastructure needed to support data science efforts. Bonus for cloud technologies e.g. Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Azure will be a plus
Exposure to visualization tools, e.g. D3, Angular, Shiny, Tableau, Qlik, Data Studio, etc. will be a plus

Mississauga, ONTemporaryJob Description
REPOST
Position: Data Conversion Analyst
Status: Temporary Full Time
Dept/Health System: Information Services, HIS
Posted: March 26, 2019
Internal Deadline: April 2, 2019
Preparing for the implementation of our new hospital information system requires a dedicated team that brings together clinical and enabling expertise. We are excited to share an initial set of job opportunities to support this significant project.

Trillium Health Partners (THP) is a leading hospital with an outstanding record of performance, fiscal responsibility and quality patient care. THP operates on three main sites – Credit Valley Hospital, Mississauga Hospital, and Queensway Health Centre and offers a full range of acute care as well as a variety of specialized, community-based programs. THP’s mission is to create a new kind of health care for a healthier community. Guided by its values of compassion, excellence, and courage, THP’s strategic plan envisions a new approach to health – working in partnership to create an inter-connected system of care that is organized around the patient, both inside the Hospital and beyond its walls, by balancing quality, access and sustainability. With a vision for developing a common information platform that supports an efficient patient experience, common clinical best practices and continuity of information, THP has identified information and technology as key enablers on their journey to transforming care. For more information about THP, please visit their website at https://trilliumhealthpartners.ca.
The Position:

The Conversion Analyst will use their computer science and technical skills to support the implementation of the Health Information System (HIS). Reporting to the HIS Integration Manager, the analyst is a part of the HIS project team and are the primary support for the data conversions they are assigned and certified to complete.
They are responsible for analyzing, extracting, and formatting external systems data in order to bring that data into the HIS application; for the setup and configuration of the HIS conversion interfaces; for loading, testing, and organizing validation of external data within HIS; and, working closely with the interface team, application teams, and technical teams to ensure that conversions meet the expectations of the end users.

Here’s what you will get to do:
Identify and escalate risks associated with technical project tasks;
Coordinate application build requirements for conversion across teams;
Communicate with technical analysts and subject matter experts;
Define the transport method by which extracted source system data will be communicated to the HIS;
Troubleshooting the data transport mechanism;
Understanding HIS data structures and documenting technical specifications detailing target data elements;
Interpret the defined scope and defined business requirements for each dataset in the creation of each technical specification
Where HL7 conversions are involved, analyze and manipulating external data into an appropriate format for filing into the HIS;
Communicating with technical and external database analysts.
Achieve certification in the vendor’s application

Here’s what you need to have:
Acollege diploma or university degree in the field of computer science and at least 3-4 years equivalent work experience.
Microsoft BizTalk development experience and Microsoft BizTalk Certified Professional an asset.
Working knowledge of the .NET 3.5/4.0/4.5 Framework, including Visual Studio 2010, Visual Studio 2012, C#, ASP.NET is an asset
Excellent database skills including SQL server, SQL queries, data access optimization, database objects creation and optimization, TSQL is an asset.
Knowledge and experience using Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS)
Hands-on knowledge of Health Level 7 (HL7) and Extensive Markup Language (XML) messaging standards and structures is required.
Technical training in UNIX/Linux and/or Windows, technical infrastructure in a healthcare setting is preferred.
Experience in hospital information with an understanding of translating data from one system to another, interfacing techniques system work flow, working knowledge of data feeds and integration engine technologies.
Experience supporting and/or implementing moderately complex integration projects.
Healthcare application experience an asset.
Strong analytical, technical, and troubleshooting skills.
Able to learn in a self-directed, fast paced, rapidly-changing environment
Ability to analyze data, problem-solve, and clearly communicate solutions
Ability to understand organizational requirements and their impact on the technical aspects of a solution
Ability to work in a complex multi-communication-channel environment
Skill at tracking tasks, defining next steps, identifying owners, and holding people accountable
Ability to coordinate activities involving multiple players, including vendors, subject matter experts, interface engine developers, and end users, to design, configure, and test interfaces.
Ability to travel to the United States as required

Internal Candidates who believe they possess the necessary qualifications and experience for this position and who have been in their current position for at least six (6) months are encouraged to apply.

To pursue this career opportunity, please visit our website: www.trilliumhealthpartners.ca

Qualifications

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
A recognized collaborative team player with excellent interpersonal, negotiation and communication skills
Passionate ability to lead through influence and rally a team toward a common goal
Proven analytical ability and strong business acumen who is respected for your ability to translate large volumes of disparate data and information into clear findings and business cases

Job Summary
This position is responsible for the extraction, analysis and reporting of key data from all INVIVA and Specialty Prescription Services (SPS) pharmacy systems, including but not limited to, ISched, Salesforce Kroll, Shipmate, CMSV2, Cisco and Workforce management tools. This position will also use all available external resources to identify key trends within the infusion and pharmacy business landscape. In addition, this role is responsible for the preparation and maintenance of both the INVIVA and SPS dashboards on a national level and ensuring key trends are identified and reported to the Senior Team of both businesses. The role is responsible for identifying and monitoring business needs and determining system based solutions to the business problems.
The position will be responsible for acting as a bridge between business process and system management that will ensure a safe and well-structured database repository of all business related functions and associated reporting needs
This position has the capability to add and delete users in the INVIVA and Pharmacy systems under the direction of business leaders. This position will also have the capability to add or modify programs within system databases to ensure the data model for extraction of data is consistent.
Section A – Specific Responsibilities
Extraction and Analysis of data from all systems utilized by pharmacy (SPS) and INVIVA: Develop and utilize a process of inspecting, cleaning, transforming, and modeling data with the goal of discovering useful information , suggesting conclusions, and supporting decision making of National operations and management teams on a monthly or more frequent basis as required by the business.
Assess current reporting capabilities as well as determine reporting/data gaps and develop and or leverage reporting solutions to provide meaningful data and analysis to business leads.
Responsible to engage key stakeholders (Business Leaders, Finance, Programs) to determine and execute on reporting needs.
Responsible for development, maintenance and ongoing improvement of the INVIVA and SPS Performance Dashboards with regular reviews and presentations to the Leadership Teams on developing trends.
Integrate the data from the systems that is closely linked to operations and business requirements in order to formulate reports on Key Performance Indicators for the INVIVA and Pharmacy businesses on a schedule.
Under the INVIVA and Pharmacy leadership, responsible for software database administration including but not limited to: monitoring and managing user access, managing profiles of all physicians, nurses and clinics, managing all billing related activities set in the system
Collaborate all levels and departments within the organization to ensure business needs are met as well as evaluated regularly for continuous improvement.
Responsible for on-time, accurate reporting to finance for all information used for INVIVA and SPS manufacturer billing and vendor payment.
Set-up Medical Covering Physicians in INVIVA software.
Continue to understand the business data and reporting needs and the behavior of the software in order to deploy it and to troubleshoot problems.
Section B – Main Responsibilities
Data extraction, analysis and reporting from all key systems and software utilized by both businesses.
Monthly invoicing for all INVIVA Programs including accrual process, customer invoicing, physician payments and any other revenue related activities
Demonstrate the ability to adapt and influence the teams in order to effectively lead and manage change.
Identify and coordinate activities with staff and senior management, while collaborating with other department Managers to share information formally and informally.
Follow all McKesson Canada Guidelines, Policies and Procedures as they relate to general policies, IT policies.
Section C – Key Requirements
Degree or diploma in business administration, data management/System administration or equivalent.
5 or more year’s previous operational and system experience, in a clinical and/or pharmacy setting preferred.
Proven leadership abilities.
Strong communication skills, able to manage client relationships with a proven track record of exceptional customer service.
Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office and reporting analytic tools.
Able to identify key issues; creatively overcome internal challenges or obstacles.
High level of integrity, confidentially, and accountability.
Sound planning and execution skills, as well as be able to think on your feet.
Working knowledge of business and/or regulatory requirements with respect to this business.

Minto is an award-winning integrated real estate development, construction and property management company that has proudly created healthy communities and innovative places for people to live, work and play for over 60 years. The SharePoint Admin/Analyst, part of the Information Technology Operations team, will be responsible for supporting various business units in a real estate industry in gathering requirements, proposing designs and implementing solutions for our SharePoint platform. He/she will also be responsible in keeping the application layer up-to-date by monitoring, applying monthly security patches and completing regular house-keeping activities.
What you’ll be responsible for day to day to support current SharePoint 2010, 2013 and Office 365:
Plan and execute changes, additions and upgrades to all SharePoint Farms.
Provide front-end support for internal clients to troubleshoot and resolve user issues.
Provide back-end support and troubleshooting on issues with SharePoint services.
Work with project teams to create SharePoint solutions, including setting the requirements and scope, defining and designing solutions, building architecture and functionality, testing and user acceptance as well as providing training and support.
Work as a SharePoint change agent within Minto, continually promote SharePoint throughout the enterprise and work with business owners to enhance user adoption.
Provide strategic insight into the risks, benefits, and opportunities of various solutions as needed.
Provide input towards SharePoint governance, enterprise vision, strategy, policies, standards and best practices.
Configure Service Applications including Search Service, User Profile Service, and Managed Metadata Service.
Configuration of Managed paths, Permissions, Site Applications, Alternate Access Mappings
Design new and support existing Nintex workflows.
AvePoint Migration for data migration between SharePoint sites and from network folders.
PowerShell/Scripting experience from an automation and configuration context.
Documents, evaluates, and makes recommendations on solutions for optimization of procedures and processes, and system deficiencies.
Takes ownership in driving solution implementations, and conducts training and support where applicable
Understands and adheres to access security model for all solutions
Proactively initiates, develops, and maintains effective working relationships with team members through developing mutual trust, and collaboration
Takes pride in working in a team atmosphere by providing cross-functional support to other team members
Minimum Qualifications
8+ years of experience in Information Technology teams as a SharePoint Admin/Analyst with SharePoint 2010, 2013 and Office 365
Prior experience working in a client facing role as part of a larger project team
Experience in understanding business needs, and translating them into functional specifications
Team-oriented and collaborative
Able to communicate and adapt the language to different audiences either from business or technical.
Able to adapt in a fast paced, challenging and changing work environment without showing resistance on on-going priority changes by still accomplishing results.

The Senior Analyst will enable FreshBooks to derive insight from campaign and customer interaction data to generate growth via increased Trial to Pay conversion rates. You love to solve a problem and have a knack for translating data into insight and presenting that information to stakeholders. You will be collaborating with your manager and a team that includes other analysts, data scientists, marketers, financial analysts, and developers all working together to drive growth at FreshBooks.

Dashboards for core performance metrics
Complex analyses on customer trends and long-term performance

At least 3 years in data analytics and/or business intelligence

Halifax, NSPermanent$68,000 - $100,000 a yearExternal Job Description
Halifax Regional Municipality is inviting applications for the permanent position of Business Data Analyst in Halifax Regional Fire & Emergency. Preference for filling this position will be given to qualified African Nova Scotians, racially visible persons, women in non-traditional positions, persons with disabilities and Aboriginal persons. Please self-identify on your application form, cover letter or resume.
Reporting to the Division Chief of Communications & Technology, the Business Data Analyst will provide leadership, subject matter expertise, and support the Business Unit in the creation of a quality assurance and continuous quality improvement program and assist with evidence-based decision making. The Business Data Analyst is responsible for helping develop strategic policy and procedures for the collection and management of Fire and Emergency data, and to provide effective communication to coordinate collection efforts across the Business Unit.
The Business Data Analyst is responsible for research on current best practices in Fire and Emergency service provision, analysis of the current municipal service provision, and the development of recommendations to inform new Fire and Emergency strategies and service standards.
The Business Data Analyst will identify key findings of complex analyses to effectively present the findings to a range of audiences including citizens, community stakeholders, external agencies and HRM staff. The result of these analyses will be quantifiable recommendations for consideration by Regional Council to aid in optimum delivery of municipal Fire and Emergency services.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Improves the Business Unit's operating performance and quality assurance through identifying service efficiencies, service standards development support, standardization of policies, and researching and evaluating service delivery
Conducts research and data analysis based on industry best practice, technical standards and procedures, corporate policies and practices, legislation, and initiatives by all levels of government
Interprets data, analyses results using statistical techniques, investigates spatial distribution of data and emerging trends to inform data driven decision-making for proactive programs
Develops and updates strategies and policies as they relate to emerging priorities, trends, land-use, demographic and community risk changes
Coordinates the collection, storage and documentation of various data requirements across the Business Unit
Develops and implements detailed plans and recommends policies and strategies regarding specific data requirements
Compiles and maintains a database of Fire and Emergency data that is easily accessible to staff including, but not limited to, shared GIS shapefiles, FDM and CAD data tables and BI Tools.
Collects, prepares and presents data and statistics for staff, Council, management, and the public as needed
Writes reports and uses appropriate data visualization techniques to present results in a meaningful and appropriate format for audiences, including Regional Council
Liaises with other Divisions/Business Units to communicate new standards, and encourage consistency across data sources
Ensures Business Unit and Divisional interests are represented appropriately on various corporate and external initiatives and committees as needed
Establishes and maintains effective relationships with citizens, community stakeholders, HRM business units, external agencies and departments and Regional Council
QUALIFICATIONS
Education and Experience:
Post-secondary degree in Urban Planning, Public Administration or a related Social Science degree from a recognized institution. A graduate degree is an asset.
Minimum of two (2) years of demonstrated knowledge of research/program evaluation methodology, trends/analysis presentation and interpretation, project management and strategic planning
Demonstrated experience in Fire and Emergency services policy and program research and analysis specifically relating to current-term and long-term range planning considered an asset
Thorough understanding of data collection techniques, database management, and spatial data including Geographic Information Systems (GIS)
Demonstrated leadership in education or government is considered an asset
Technical / Job Specific Knowledge and Abilities:
Knowledge and skills in statistical methods, data analysis and interpretation, applied research, conducting literature reviews and current related best practices
Familiarity with extracting and interpreting Statistics Canada Census and National Household Survey data, and other data sources with attention to detail and accuracy
Demonstrated organizational and project management skills with the ability to meet competing priorities
Ability to work independently, take initiative, communicate effectively, prepare written reports, and make oral presentations with a logical presentation of facts and analysis to diverse audiences
A good working knowledge of the Halifax Regional Fire & Emergency service delivery model and associated data
Ability to work effectively under the pressure of tight time frames and rigid deadlines
Thorough knowledge of occupational health, safety and environmental regulations, and other applicable municipal, provincial, and federal legislation.
Security Clearance Requirements: Applicants may be required to complete an employment security screening check.
Please note - Testing may be conducted as a component of the selection process to assess technical and job specific knowledge. Candidates, who are selected for testing, may be tested in a group setting, scheduled at the employer's discretion.

Toronto, ONAbout EPL
At EPL, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.

We help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. Our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in Canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use. We have built our reputation on doing things really well.

We have a bright, talented, and engaging team with a lot of passion for what we do: helping large energy users across North America reduce their energy/carbon footprints, and quantifying energy consumption and costs.

About the Role
Recent and projected growth has led us to search for an Energy Data Analyst to join our Toronto office. Your smarts, passion and expertise will be applied to preparing building and portfolio level energy forecasts & budgets, and emissions reports for large commercial property owners. You will join us at a time where we are experiencing unprecedented company growth. A steep learning curve is anticipated. Key aspects of the role:


Create and/or verify annual energy consumption and cost models/forecasts for large commercial buildings, factoring in historical usage, projected utility rates, and weather patterns.
Perform utility rate research and compile utility rate assumptions across Canadian and US energy markets.
Monitor and maintain utility consumption models that directly impact forecast/budget activities.
Identify ways to optimize data acquisition, modelling and analysis processes and tools.
Assist in preparing GHG emissions reports for our clients using recognized industry protocols.

About You
You are smart and act with purpose. You feel successful and accomplished when you solve complex problems associated with data acquisition, modelling and analysis. High energy levels and a team-based approach are of great value; just as important is a determination to overcome obstacles.

You are consistent and cautious in your review and analysis of data sets, models and reports. You are skilled in your ability to hone in on and resolve data anomalies, discrepancies and variances. You have a keen eye for finding ways optimize and improve data analysis process and tools.

Nominally, you have an undergraduate degree in engineering, applied sciences, business/sustainability or another technical field (or equivalent experience).

You offer valuable knowledge and experience in energy forecasting, budgeting/cost allocations and/or emissions reporting. Practical experience and intermediate proficiency in SQL and Excel are expected.

You are organized and able to prioritize and manage several client requirements under set timelines. You can easily adapt and respond to impromptu requests from clients and peers.

It is important that you can communicate clearly and efficiently (verbally and in written form).

What to expect
The success of our people drives the success of our company. We have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. Each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their careers with our firm.

EPL team members also receive:

Unlimited Vacation & Flexible Work Hours (truly own your time)
Insured Benefits and Health Spending Account
Paid monthly transit pass

job_title: EHS Regulatory Analyst and Data Processor
job_description:
Montréal, QCAbout Nimonik

Nimonik helps companies respect environmental, health and safety and quality requirements. We believe that if all companies respected the regulations and standards, our environment would be cleaner, our workplaces would be safer and the quality of our products would be improved.

Job Description Summary

As part of our growth strategy, Nimonik is looking to expand our team who are passionate about safety, environment, and high-quality products. Interest in technology, great writing, and data management are also keys to success.

For this position, you will help Nimonik to expand and manage a database of environmental and occupational health and safety legislation and industrial standards in North America and around the world. This involves using Nimonik’s web-based tools to manage data; classify clauses and assign topics to them to help industrial and government clients to comply with legal requirements.
You will work as part of a growing team of amazing people and will report to your team leader. EHS Regulatory Analyst and Data Processor should welcome repetitive tasks but have the drive to eliminate them by improving and automating procedures and processes. You will have the option to accept opportunities outside of your regular job duties to grow your skills, contribute your expertise, or build your professional reputation.

Qualified candidates for EHS Regulatory Analyst and Data Processor will have education or experience related to environmental, occupational health, safety, or legal fields (familiarity with the US, EU, and Asian law is an asset) and at least full professional proficiency in English. Proficiency in other languages will be an asset or required for certain positions. For full-time employees, most of the work will be conducted at the Nimonik Head Office in Montréal; for part-time positions, remote work will be considered.

To Apply

Complete this brief test: https://goo.gl/forms/ZeFsNDojX5QaCJ7J3.

Successful applicants will receive a follow-up email.

Job Duties – EHS Regulatory analyst and Data Processor

Convert legal information into standardized database entries, using the available tools and methods to work as efficiently as possible according to our internal standards.

Complete the Nimonik EHS legal database with EHS-related documents, and keep the content up-to-date and accurate for the covered jurisdictions.

Ensure data is well-organized and follow industry best practices.

Classify legislative text clauses and assign topics to them.

Add metadata to all documents.

Help in creating audit protocols.

Organize and support the digitization of ISO 14001 and OHSAS 18001 legal registers.

Collaborate with Nimonik’s tech team to develop features and identify problems.

Requirements and Skills
Long-term view thinking, integrity, initiative.

Excellent accuracy and attention to detail.

Excellent communication skills

Curious and flexible, with strong self-motivation.

Familiarity with web technology.

A drive for self-improvement and improvement of the company.

Ability to conduct oneself professionally and conscientiously.

Education or experience and interest related to environment, worker health and safety, or public safety.
Education or experience and interest related to EHS auditing or legislation in any country are an asset. Other backgrounds will be considered if you include a compelling argument in your CV for why you will succeed in the role.

At least full professional proficiency in English, with the ability to quickly synthesize legal information into a short, easy-to-read summary that follows a required format.
Native or bilingual proficiency in French, Spanish, Chinese, and other languages is an asset.

EDUCATION, JOB-RELATED YEARS OF EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS

MINIMUM EDUCATION: Community college diploma or equivalent training (e.g. RPA, CET)

JOB-RELATED EXPERIENCE: One year or less

Knowledge & Skills

Technologist diploma is required, preferably Mechanical or related area.
Advanced skills in MS Excel. Strong MS Word skills. Working experience with MS Access or other database software would be beneficial.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Strong knowledge of units of energy / utility measurement and conversion calculations.

Good administrative skills including documentation standards.
Appreciation of financial reporting requirements.

None required.
Location

BGIS Building

Unito.io is a work collaboration tool based in Montreal and one of BetaKit's top startups to watch in 2018 (https://betakit.com/10-montreal-tech-companies-to-watch-in-2018/). We're a VC-backed SaaS company that makes people happier, organizations more productive, and software more powerful, all over the world.
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team. That person will work closely with the marketing, sales and product departments in order to instrument and analyze the data around every touch points of the customer journey, from the discovery of Unito to the platform's usage.
Her/his mission will be to leverage data to realize a cohesive customer journey and user experience. The Data Analyst will maintain, educate and enforce standard data terminology and best practices across the company.
What you will do
During your first few months at Unito, you will mainly focus on helping the marketing team improve conversion rates through data analysis with responsibilities like...
Identify missing data sets in the conversion funnel
Setup a signup funnel dashboard per traffic source with conversion rate goals
Perform website audit, compare it to previous websites, identify issues and opportunities to improve user engagement
Your other responsibilities will involve working with various departments. Here are some of the responsibilities you'll have:
Audit current product data sets
Identify missing data points to improve instrumentation
Identify Customer Journey KPIs with stakeholders
Work closely with dev team to improve tracking
Build dashboards to communicate about KPIs and unify terminology within the company
Provide insightful analysis to support recommendations for the Customer Journey
Refine taxonomy and build glossary
Participate in implementing customer research protocols
Implement product usage & usability dashboards
Level up the data analysis skills of everyone in the company
You are
B.Sc. in Management, Business Technology Management or equivalent
1-3 years experience in an operational role
Excellent knowledge of data analysis tools, from good old spreadsheets to query languages to modern data tools
Proven ability to develop flows and building new processes that simplify and facilitate the data journey
Solid ability to develop models for accurate reporting and analysis
Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy
Excellent time management and organization skills
Ability to work independently and drive towards an answer
Confidence with communication and presentation
Experience working with external stakeholders
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical techniques for analyzing datasets
It'd be nice if you
Have experience with Hubspot (or equivalent CRM system)
Have experience with analytics and tracking tools (Google Analytics, Amplitude, Keen, Segment)
Have experience in the B2B SaaS sector
Have experience mapping sales processes
Have experience in customer research
Are fluent in French
Who we are
We're taking on a major problem that people are passionate about solving: we make it easier to collaborate across teams. We don't make users learn new tools and change the way they work. By connecting work management tools, we allow managers, cross-functional teams, departments, and entire companies to benefit from seamless collaboration and improved communication. We sync projects across a number of tools, but our main focus is on Trello, Asana, JIRA, GitHub, and Wrike. This is a hard problem of semantics, synchronization, and APIs.
Our software is changing the collaborative work landscape and is the only software of its kind on the market. We pride ourselves in having one of the most talented and motivated teams in town. We've acquired tens thousands of trial users, hundreds of paying customers, hired 20 people, and connected 9 different applications together. We're on a mission to change how collaboration works between teams for almost any company in the world, and we've shown so far that we've got what it takes to succeed.
Culture
Our team is a family of humble and hungry individuals, varying in age (our founders span 3 decades), gender (almost at parity!), cultures, and backgrounds (11 countries). We prefer to focus more on the quality of our work, and less on things like policies or rules. We trust our team and encourage them to make independent decisions, ask questions, share ideas, and voice opinions. Everyone's voice is heard.
Here at Unito, we're huge on transparency, honesty, and execution. We have no tolerance for politics or hiding mistakes, and value flexibility, autonomy, fairness, and respect. We share achievements, all company metrics, and learn from failures together as a team.
Our team operates through areas of of responsibility that make everyone own of a part of the business. We are inclusive and welcoming, and dedicated to building a team of high performers. We want every employee to maximize his or her potential, learn, and grow within the company.
Benefits
Dental, health and travel insurance
Wellness spending budget for self-improvement purposes
Gorgeous new downtown office space located by metro Champs de Mars and Berri UQAM, plus reserved parking
Join our groups of runners, walkers, hikers, soccer or basketball players
If this position sounds like a good fit, we'd love to hear from you!
To know more about our hiring process, here's a blog post (https://unito.io/blog/the-modern-guide-to-hiring-millennials/) detailing how we go about it and what to expect when you apply for a job at Unito.

The Mining Parts Planning Analyst is responsible for the PLESN (Plan for every serial number) initiative across the Mining Division, which involves working with the Site Planners, the Mining Parts Analysts and Technical Parts Analysts in Quebec to ensure future inventory orders are being submitted to CAT. The Mining Parts Planning Analyst will also perform analysis for future rebuilds, new machines and past performances to develop a plan for our mining machines and ensure fill rates for large mine sites remain high and the logistic lead times are met and orders are prompted for both our Mining and Reman Businesses.


Internal applicants must apply online no later than March 29th, 2019 to be considered in a timely manner.
Responsibilities
Demonstrate safe, environmentally sound and healthy work behaviours at all times, in support of Toromont’s Health and Safety Policies, Programs and initiatives
Consolidate data from PLESN software in EMT and advise of data gaps or errors working with site personnel
Gather information from various sources, analysis and discussions with internal groups such as the site PSMs, Planners and Mining Parts Analysts in order to forecast 24 months ahead
Place future orders to ensure the supply chain can provide the required components to minimize customer downtime
Submit required reports for PLESN Program to CAT to include both Mining and Reman details
Review inventory levels, fill rates by site and discuss any roadblocks regarding orders and with the Site Parts Team and PSM to improve the logistics process in collaboration with the Planning Manager
Manage, approve, coordinate and execute buy back requests
Determine customer’s eligibility for large buy backs and acceptable pricing then communicate back to the site PSMs
Process returns and provide a sundry credit to the customers as required
Propose, forecast and order parts required for our customer mine sites to ensure PLESN strategy is met to include both the Mining and Reman Businesses
Requirements
Post-Secondary Education with a minimum of 2 years’ experience in a related industry and highly safety conscious
Knowledge of the Resource Industry products, customers and logistics
5-10 years’ experience working with CAT products
5 years of DBS experience
Customer centric with proven analytical, problem solving and time management skills
Effective communication and strong interpersonal skills to deal with internal and external customers at all levels
Collaborative with a sense of urgency and mindset for continuous improvement
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Self-starter, independent and a team player with high initiative and integrity
Ability to manage multiple and often competing priorities in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment
Highly proficient with Microsoft Applications with an advanced Excel knowledge and analysis of large data sets and pivot tables (MS Access and parts systems would be an asset)
Experience with Sequel/Query and extracting data would also be beneficial
Willing and able to travel and a valid Driver's Licence and clean Driver's Abstract

Toronto, ONWhy LoyaltyOne?
Are you passionate about leveraging your analytics experience to help more than one hundred of the world’s leading brands improve marketing outcomes and deliver differentiated performance? Are you looking to build an extraordinary career and expand your analytics expertise in one of the most respected analytics companies in Canada? For six consecutive years, LoyaltyOne has been recognized by Hewitt Associates as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada, demonstrating LoyaltyOne's continued commitment to providing a great work experience for its associates and a great service experience for its clients. Don’t miss this opportunity to take your career to a whole new level with LoyaltyOne.
About the Opportunity
The AIR MILES Reward Program Analytics & Insights practice is looking for a well-rounded Analytics & Insights Analyst to join our team in Toronto. We are looking for an analytics practitioner with a blend of proficient technical skills and strong business acumen. The Analyst plays an key role in the application & execution of consumer data and analytics to support the development of customer-centric business strategies and Loyalty Marketing for our clients.
Qualification:
Responsibilities
Subject Matter Expert in Loyalty & Marketing Analytics for the assigned client portfolio
Contribute to all phases of campaign management (ideation, planning, targeting, measurement, recommendation) with a focus in pre-analysis and post-analysis

Automate and make process and tool improvement suggestions to drive operational efficiency
Balance the demands of multiple concurrent projects while maintaining a high level of diplomacy

Problem solving skills coupled with the “can do” attitude

About LoyaltyOne

LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.

Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.

LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. Alliance Data® (NYSE: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. Burlington, ONAs Questica continues to grow we are expanding our professional services team, seeking team members with deep experience in SSRS reporting and related/ancillary skills.


The successful candidate’s primary role is the development of SSRS reports for the customers of our Questica Budget enterprise budgeting system. You will interact with internal resources and directly with customers, bringing your experience to the process of design and development of these reports. As technology evolves so will Questica’s, into the realms of Microsoft Power BI or similar technologies, and you will grow with us.

You will also be responsible for building SQL interfaces with 3rd party systems for data ETL. Most professional services team members assume an application support role as part of their regular work load. This additional responsibility works well for the team and employee alike.

The Questica Budget application is built on a Microsoft stack of IIS, C#, JavaScript, and SQL Server; it is hosted on client servers and in the Azure cloud; and allows end-user single sign-on via authentication technologies such as LDAP, ADFS, and SAML. You will be encouraged to contribute and enhance your experience in the installation, tuning, and configuration of these technologies.

 Primary Responsibilities

Work with Questica Project Managers, and directly with customers, to design and develop custom SSRS reports.
Build ETL processes in SQL to exchange data between Questica Budget and 3rd party systems
Handle multiple such implementations concurrently.
Additional Responsibilities

While some team members work exclusively in authoring reports, the successful candidate is likely to fulfil one or more additional functions within the professional services team …

Attain understanding of the Questica Budget system to provide application support.
Carry out system installation.
Trouble-shoot installation issues (database, server, network, firewall).
Provide expertise to other departments within Questica.
 Skills and Abilities

Essential

Microsoft SQL development using SQL Server Management Studio and/or Visual Studio
SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), ideally using Visual Studio Report Project
Above average written and verbal customer communication skills.
Other

Post-secondary diploma/degree or equivalent work experience.
Automated data migration/ETL in SQL.
Use of remote conferencing desktop software (GoToMeeting, TeamViewer, Zoom, etc.).
Able to work with managerial support but minimal oversight.
We Would Also Like to Hear About Your Skills In …

Application support.
SQL Server optimization.
Windows Server installation.
Microsoft Azure configuration and management.
PowerBI.
IIS (Internet Information Services).
Single sign-on technologies (ADFS, LDAP, SAML, CAS, Google Auth, Windows Authentication, etc).
Municipal / healthcare / education technology.

The Rewards

Competitive salary with RRSP matching
Comprehensive benefit plan
Intellectual and creative freedom
Ongoing training/skill development
Casual work environment
Location & Travel

This is a full-time role at Questica’s head office in Burlington, Ontario. Senior members of the professional services team are occasionally asked to travel to customer sites within the USA and Canada, however this is not a requirement of the role.


About Questica Inc.

We are a well-established entrepreneurial company of 75-plus employees, offering a modern work space in Burlington. Questica is a recognized leader in budget preparation, performance and data visualization software. With a focused on cutting-edge software development coupled with exceptional customer service, our customers receive maximum value for their investment in Questica. Our philosophy targets individual strengths not titles, and we expect you to be part of, and contribute to, the wider team.

job_title: Business Analyst - MBovis - Hamilton or Christchurch
job_description:
Hamilton, ONContractThe opportunity:

We are seeking a Business Analyst for a two year fixed-term role to assist with the eradication of the cattle disease Mycoplasma bovis. You will be working as part of a diverse team seeking to eradicate Mycoplasma bovis from the dairy and beef industries across New Zealand. The role has an operational focus and will assist in developing our operational data and information sets for management.

AsureQuality has been contracted by the Ministry for Primary Industries to implement all operational tasks associated with eradicating the disease. A new business unit has been established and operations are implemented via four regional offices. We are now seeking someone to ensure that service delivery targets are being met across all regions, and that the appropriate resources are in place. Working with the Operations, Technical and Compliance Managers, you will be developing reporting systems for the field operations, sizing up specification changes, providing monthly reports and assisting with resource supply and demand modelling. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to join our team and assist with the analyzing and implementation of systems and processes that will ensure a streamlined operation for the wider business unit.

About you:

Ideally you will have a Tertiary qualification in commerce or senior management, with proven managerial experience. You will be knowledgeable in people management and employee relations also. You will have experience in scenario planning or workload assessment and be proficient in data analysis. Previous experience with Primary Industries and an understanding of the dairy or beef industries would give you a distinct advantage. You will be able to think outside the box, challenge ideas and be able to work independently and also as part of a team.

About us:

AsureQuality provides biosecurity surveillance and response services to help protect New Zealand against exotic pests and disease incursions. We have a long history of working with MPI, successfully managing, developing and delivering capability and responding to incursions.

Join us today!

Seeking an analytics, data, and optimization maniac for digital products!
We are a digital product consultancy that plans, produces and manages digital products for clients, who operate in a diverse and broad range of industries and digital product types. The Digital Product Data Analyst collaborates closely with the Product Strategy and Product Management disciplines. You will participate in digital projects as the measurement, analytics and engagement expert. You will be responsible for selecting, configuring and harnessing a wide range of analytics and engagement tools with the goal of optimizing and improving the performance of each digital product. You will be a trusted advisor on each client's business and report how Apply and the products we manage are meeting client KPIs and ROI.

This is a full-time, permanent position.
WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
Measure, monitor, predict
Develop and implement analytics instrumentation strategies to measure and predict product KPIs.
Visualize, simplify ,and communicate data that helps product managers and client stakeholders make the best choices for their digital products.
Educate and support colleagues, internal partners, and clients in their use of data to answer business questions.
Continuous product improvement
Using various traditional and non-traditional tactics, such as A/B testing, predictive technologies (AI, machine learning), to achieve improvements in the areas of acquisition, activation, retention, referral, revenue.
Partner with product managers by providing actionable insights, and follow-through on the measurement of the impact of the recommendations, showing visible results for our clients.
Consulting and business development
Provide support to business development and engineering teams on business analysis, technology approach, analytics and engagement solutions.
Continuously share the latest trends and understanding of analytics and data science techniques, tools, approaches, methodologies, and solutions.
Identify emerging technologies related to digital product management; provide guidance on whether the company should adopt and implement them.
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
3-5 years working experience with digital analytics, product marketing and engagement tools (such as Mixpanel, Google Analytics, Leanplum, Optimizely for A/B Testing, MailChimp, HubSpot, Zapier)
Consulting, agency, or professional services experience a must
Experience connecting multiple data sources to construct a 360 degree understanding of digital product performance
Experience working with Business Intelligence Tools an asset (i.e. SQL database, Google Data Studio)
Experience using predictive (AI/ML) methods an asset
Committed to using methodical approaches to problem solving
Proven data instincts and clear understanding of the common pitfalls of digital analytics
Performance and results-oriented
Perceptive, a creative enthusiast, have a great sense of empathy for customers and users
Appreciates the importance of effective communication and presentation skills
Genuine passion for digital strategy and digital products

The Regulatory Data Management (RDM) Division is seeking a highly motivated individual to join their team of Regulatory Business Analysts. In support of OSFI’s mandate and strategic objectives, the successful candidate would work in partnership with internal and external data stakeholders to analyse and identify data collection needs.

Under the supervision of the Manager, Returns Data Analyst, the Regulatory Data Analyst works collaboratively with IM/IT and business units to optimize OSFI’s cross-sector requirements gathering and analysis.

Information on employment equity
In order for your application to be considered, you must submit a completed questionnaire. You will be required to demonstrate how you meet the education and experience criteria (essential and asset) for the initial screening, in answering online screening questions. It is NOT sufficient to only state that the qualifications are met or to provide a listing of current or past responsibilities. Rather, you must clearly demonstrate HOW, WHEN and WHERE the qualification was met through substantiation by examples. Information on your described education and experience provided in the screening questions should be supported by your résumé. Failure to provide the above information in the format required may result in your application being rejected from the process.

A written examination will be administered.

An interview will be administered.

Reference checks may be sought.

Please note that OSFI has offices located in Ottawa, Toronto, Montreal, and Vancouver. If you are screened in, you may be required to travel to one of these locations to complete assessment (exam, interview, etc.).

Candidates invited to an interview will be required to bring proof of their education credentials, in the form of a diploma or official transcript (original documents only). Candidates with foreign credentials must provide proof of Canadian equivalency. Consult the Canadian Information Centre for International Credentials for further information at http://www.cicic.ca/.

Candidates must meet all of the essential qualifications to be appointed to a position. A candidate may be appointed to a position even though he/she does not meet any or all of the asset qualifications. However, meeting these criteria is desirable and may be a deciding factor in choosing the person to be appointed.

Depending on the requirements of the position(s) being staffed from this process, for current or future vacancies, any or all of the asset qualifications, operational requirements, and organizational needs may be applied at the time of staffing. Candidates may be contacted and assessed against these criteria at any time during this process.

Achieving a representative workforce has been identified as an organizational need and may be applied in this appointment process. If this criterion is used, only those who have indicated that they are members of the specified designated group(s) will be considered.
A top down selection of candidates may be used in the determination of those to be given further consideration in the assessment process.

Persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice. Applicants are asked to indicate their preferred official language in their application.

For this selection process, our intention is to communicate with applicants by e-mail (including sending invitations for written tests and interviews). Applicants who apply to this selection process must include in their application a valid e-mail address and make sure this address is functional at all times and accepts messages from unknown users.

OSFI is named in Schedule V of the Financial Administration Act (FAA) and it offers the same pension and benefits plans as the core Federal Public Service. In addition to this, OSFI employees obtain a minimum of 4 weeks of vacation leave per year, earn a competitive salary, and are eligible for an annual performance bonus.

JOB DESCRIPTION
We believe that clothes — and how you make them — can make a difference.
Since 1853, we’ve been passionate about innovation to meet people’s needs. We invented the first blue jean. And we reinvented khaki pants. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines for our manufacturing partners. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do.
A company doesn’t last 160 years by standing still. It endures by reinventing itself, striving to delight its consumers, winning in the marketplace, and by remaining true to its values. We employ more than 17,000 people around the world – supporting great brands, including Levi’s®, Dockers® and Denizen®. Our employees are committed to progress, authenticity and collaboration.
JOB PURPOSE & CRITICAL RESULTS
The inventory analyst creates tools to optimize and maintain item level profiling and slotting strategies leading to increased operational efficiencies and improved service levels. In addition, the analyst will update the finished goods inventory and approve the Data Measurement Forms (DMF). You will effectively communicate and collaborate with support teams to re-slot all or part of the warehouse to stay in synch with the seasonal and core assortments.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Develop, implement and maintain slotting and replenishment tools; define item profiling scheme
Define and implement a reslotting schedule to either move small sets of items or reslot the entire warehouse
Analyze order patterns to correlate items with similar take rates and slot them accordingly
Develop standard operating procedures
Approve the DMF and update finished goods inventory.
Collaborate with warehouse operations to optimize material flows and pick paths.
Monitor the layout of the warehouse to optimize efficiency of distribution and inventory placement and assist with slotting in the warehouse to maintain effective use of space.
Provide regular updates to manager and operations teams on issues pertaining to storage and/or handling efficiencies; offers options for improvements or solutions
Report systemic problems to appropriate parties for timely resolution
Develop reports to ensure the slots assigned are comparable for the product received
Assist in developing wave management strategies
Perform ad-hoc analysis/reporting as directed by manager
Support order planning as required
Acts as backup to Allocation Analyst
REQUIREMENTS:
University/College degree with a focus on Supply Chain, Logistics, Operations, or similar technical area of focus...
3 to 5 years of warehouse operations or logistics operations experience
Strong attention to detail, analytical skills and problem solving abilities
Advanced proficiency with MS Office applications, Manhattan experience preferred
Self-starter, demonstrates initiative and commitment
Strong and effective interpersonal communication skills with ability to estabilish and maintain co-operative and effective working relationships
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to envision and implement ideas through executed solutions
Ability to organize, coordinate and direct others
Excellent time management skills
Ability to work independently and handle multiple responsibilities in a deadline driven environment
WORKING CONDITIONS :
Primarily works in a unionized, warehouse environment with exposures to conveyor noise, power equipment and dust.
Must wear safety shoes and adhere to all Health & Safety practices.
Minimal physical effort is required.
Walking and standing on concrete floors is considerable.
Numerous time constraints exist in order to meet customer requirements and deadlines.

Ottawa, ONJoin us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.
Our Professional Services team is growing. We’re hiring Clinical Trials Data Anonymization Analysts to support an expanding line of business. In this role you’ll be end-to-end responsible for anonymization projects of client data sets. Using our tools you will analyze and mitigate the risk of re-identification for trial participants whose data appears in clinical trial Structured Individual Patient (S-IPD) data sets. As an ideal candidate you learn quickly and can produce extremely accurate, precise work within tight timelines. You’re familiar with clinical trial data formats (CDISC SDTM, ADaM), medical / healthcare language, comfortable with numbers and statistics, and your excellent communication skills are complemented by strong technical acumen and the ability to meet tight deadlines.

Responsibilities:
Develop familiarity with our de-identification methodology.
Own assigned projects or project tasks and deliver such on time and with the required quality, providing timely and transparent status updates and managing client expectations.
Process clients’ clinical trials data set. Core responsibilities here include: Pre-processing (loading and cleansing) data sets, understanding and classifying tables, variables, and relevant relationships. and / or:
Identify and classify direct and indirect identifiers, measure and mitigate re-identification risk, determine and apply required data transformations.
Facilitate the creation of anonymization reports and other client deliverables.
Collaborate closely with other team members, ensuring that all work meets established quality standards and is completed on time. Participate in peer-reviews of work products.
Identify and communicate tool enhancements/refinements and relate defect documentation to developers and researchers.
Qualifications:
Exceptional detail-orientation.
Ability to understand and interpret structures and variables in clinical trial data sets.
Ability to learn our methodology and develop a thorough understanding of how directly and indirectly identifying information contributes to the risk of re-identification.
This is generally demonstrated through experience and comfort with scientific and quantitative disciplines for example, clinical research, STEM fields, etc.
Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills.
The drive to meet exacting deadlines and the flexibility to adapt to shifting priorities.
Ability to manage sensitive information with the utmost confidentiality.
Working experience with SQL (MS SQL server), SAS, R, and statistical analysis of clinical or healthcare data would be a great asset, but are not a requirement.
Nice to have / beneficial assets:
CDISC SDTM / ADaM working knowledge.
Ability to understand and navigate MedDRA terms and their hierarchy.
Medical writing or trial data programming experience.
Experience with Adobe PDF and MS Office products (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint).
We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes. Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there! We invite you to join IQVIA™
