job_title: Senior Actuarial Analyst, Data Science Team
job_description:
Markham, ONWhat you will do
Join an exciting team of actuaries, data scientists and engineers at the forefront of leveraging data to drive decisions at every level of our organization. The insurance industry is undergoing a transformation and you get to be in the driver’s seat of this data-driven, technology revolution.
You will work on impactful projects that range from predicting customer life-time values and optimizing customer journeys to incorporating novel data sources for building cutting-edge pricing and machine-learning algorithms. You will work closely with data scientists to bring cutting-edge models to market. This team is exploring the frontiers of the insurance business such as how to harness the data from connected homes and cars to deliver new types of products to customers.
As a senior analyst, you will be part of a dynamic team with exposure to different business stakeholders and direct influence on future products and innovative solutions. You will work on the proposal of innovative machine-learning and statistical models for practical applications that impact millions of customers. The team has already developed algorithms used in production systems and you will be part of the team that expands the scope of these algorithms. This is your chance to join the InsureTech revolution!
What you need to succeed
As a senior analyst, you will need the following skills and experience to succeed in the role:
2+ years of experience in general insurance industry including predictive modeling and working with large datasets. Experience in developing non-linear statistical model is preferred
Have cross-functional skills that allow you to straddle the worlds of data scientist and actuaries and bring innovation to model acceptance processes, sound model monitoring practices and end-to-end automation
Strong programming and problem solving skills to develop, test, validate, and maintain robust tools/models using supervised and or unsupervised techniques
Work with pricing teams to combine creative modeling knowledge with sound business judgment in developing sophisticated models to support rate implementation
Collaborate with business stakeholders to establish a vision and create a culture that treats data as a massive asset
Advance the department’s capabilities by creating and deploying long term tools to continually evolve the business
What sets you apart
Amazing people skills and able to translate and communicate complex algorithms to non-technical experts. Someone who understands that it is not enough to just have a great algorithm but important to generate buy-in for the solution from different stakeholders
A can-do team player who is willing to roll-up the sleeves and do whatever is needed to move projects forward. That means at times you will wear multiple hats and be a project manager, developer, modeler and chief communicator of solutions
Customer focused who builds effective relationships with internal partners, including claims, actuarial, underwriting, operations, and information technology
Results-oriented who demonstrates a sense of urgency and accountability for business issues
Expert subject matter expertise in insurance, rate regulation and predictive modeling
This role can be based in either our Markham location or our downtown Toronto location.
Additional Information
Aviva Canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. If you require an accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance. If you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the Talent Acquisition Partner who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation.

Who We Are

Founded in 2010, BEworks is an unconventional management consulting firm that applies scientific thinking to transform the economy and society. Our team of experts in cognitive and social psychology, neuroscience, and marketing answer our clients' most complex business questions, execute disruptive growth strategies, and accelerate innovation. Part of the kyu collective of companies since January 2017, the firm's client list includes Fortune 500 companies, not-for-profit organizations, and government agencies. BEworks was co-founded by Dan Ariely, renowned behavioral scientist, Kelly Peters, the firm's CEO and BE pioneer, and top marketing scholar Nina Mažar.

Culture is Really Important to Us

We’re a small but mighty team that loves to work hard and play hard. We operate as a collective, bringing some of the best practices from academia to life in our day-to-day work. Our Think Tanks provide a forum for peer review; our academic advisors provide guidance on research directions and experiment design. Our ongoing “lunch and learns” include Visiting Scholars sessions with amazing scientists, our Lab provides a channel for the pursuit of primary research, and our collaboration framework provides an opportunity for the ongoing development of your scientific knowledge and skills.

Job Description

BEworks is seeking a Data Analyst who subscribes to the vision of the importance of scientific thinking and is keen to apply it to real-world challenges. In this position, you play a key role in the planning and delivery of the BEworks Method, which is a fusion of the scientific method with management consulting. As a Data Analyst, you are detail-oriented, meticulous, and an analytical team player. You ask the right questions, effectively communicate across teams, and want an opportunity to help shape what data can offer to our clients.

Main Responsibilities:

CONDUCT RIGOROUS SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH by…

Gathering, analyzing, and synthesizing existing scientific research, including insights drawn from BEworks’ proprietary IP database as well as the scientific literature

Critically evaluating existing literature to identify how the research can be applied to client contexts, as well as identifying any research gaps (i.e., what has not been studied before based on psychological concepts or behavioral economic theory)

SUPPORT MANAGEMENT CONSULTING PROJECTS by…

Evaluating client data, uncovering client assumptions, and understanding their knowledge, intuition, and priors; auditing their experimental capability

Supporting the design and execution of both large and small scale randomized control experiments

CONDUCT STATISTICAL ANALYSIS by…

Cleaning and sorting raw data for analysis

Assisting with conducting statistical analyses

Interpreting and translating results from experiment outputs

Investigating and learning new analytic methods that can be applied to experimental data

COMMUNICATE OUR INSIGHTS by…

Writing and communicating scientific ideas and summarizing experiments in a clear and accessible way

Preparing business proposals to emphasize scientific experimentation and the importance of behavioral economics

HELP US SOLVE PROBLEMS by…

Participating in group sessions where we tackle business challenges using behavioral economics tactics

Qualifications

A masters degree in any applied quantitative discipline (preference for candidates with knowledge in psychology (preferably social, cognitive, or consumer), marketing (consumer behavior focus), judgment and decision making, or economics

Strong background in statistical analysis and experiment design with the ability to handle and clean large datasets

Candidate must be able to demonstrate proficiency in R programming (proficiency in other languages i.e. Python, SPSS, etc. are beneficial but not strictly required)

Ability to create data visualizations

Ability to meaningfully interpret analyses to a business audience is a must

Demonstrated ability to interpret data from both RCT and quasi-experimental trials

Demonstrated ability to work with complex econometric models

We are looking for individuals who have:

A passion for empirical behavioral research and continuous learning

The ability and desire to work in a highly collaborative (and frankly, sometimes noisy) team

A willingness to go the extra mile

Obsessive attention to detail

The conscientiousness to be deadline driven, organized, and able to prioritize multiple competing responsibilities

Strong verbal and written skills

A willingness to travel

We welcome and encourage you to apply even if you do not think you might meet all the specified qualifications above. Though we thank you in advance for submitting your application, only qualified, selected candidates will be contacted.

You must be legally eligible to work in Canada to apply.
BEworks is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We are proud to be in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), 2005 and the Integrated Accessibility Standards Regulation. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the recruitment and assessment (if applicable) process as required under BEworks' policies and procedures. Applicants must make their accommodation needs known when first contacted by the recruitment team.

Aviso Wealth:
A career with Aviso Wealth means being part of an organization dedicated to your success and career development. The Opportunity:
We’re looking for a QA Analyst to join our IT team.
Reporting to the Manager, Quality Assurance the QA Analyst will have thorough understanding of Software Testing Life Cycle (STLC) and Test Methodologies. In this role you will be responsible for all aspects of the STLC, including creation of test plans and test scenarios, manual & automated test case execution, defect reporting and verification and set up / configuration of QA environments. The QA Analyst will investigate production issues while collaborating with other departments during the investigation and reproduction of defects.
Who you are:
You take initiative, seeking out and owning opportunities to improve yourself, your team, and our business.
You’re comfortable in a fast-paced environment, maintaining a keen attention to detail even when under pressure.
You thrive in a collaborative environment, sharing your knowledge with your colleagues, and celebrating success as a team.
You’re a life-long learner, staying current on market events, industry news, and innovative trends and technologies.
You believe in sustainable financial strength, and you’re committed to long-term wealth solutions.
You consider the impact of your actions on your team members, our partners, our clients, and the places where we live and work.

Write and execute test plans, test cases and scripts to ensure quality coverage of all testing projects
Conduct all types of testing for third party software and internally developed applications.
Perform data validation, functionality and deployment process verification
Install software packages to QA and Training environments, configure, set up and review functionality
Develop and analyze SQL queries and reports to identify data discrepancies
Collaborate with other testers, business analysts, project managers and developers to ensure proper testing of all applications
Ensure continued integrity of existing production systems and new implementations
Troubleshoot and propose resolutions
Analyze formal test results in order to discover and resolve defects, bugs, errors and configuration issues
Ensure that newly implemented system features or enhancements meet user needs
Manage and own assigned deployment items from inception to final production release
Ensure that testing activities will achieve high quality software products, meet business requirements and system goals, fulfill end-user requirements and cross-browsing compatibility
Participate in meetings, walkthrough and presentations of new features as well as changes to existing functionality
Requirements
Your experience and skills:
3-5 years software testing of web and mobile products
Post-secondary degree in IT related area
Financial industry experience is an asset
Completion of IFIC course is an asset
Strong foundation in systems testing and software QA best practices, methodologies and techniques encompassing the full build, test, and deploy cycle
Strong computer skills and comfort level with technology and software release management
Basic to intermediate SQL scripting skills
Familiarity with Microsoft tools (VS, MTM and TFS)
Working knowledge of bug tracking systems such as Jira, BR-Track, Bugzilla
Knowledge of testing mobile native and web applications

Maintain inventory of equipment and parts as well as documentation of vendor activities.
Configure and test computer hardware, networking software and operating system software.
Recommend changes to improve systems and network configurations, and determine hardware or software requirements related to such changes.
Analyze equipment performance records in order to determine the need for repair or replacement.
Coordinate with vendors and with company personnel in order to facilitate purchases.
QUALIFICATIONS
Degree or IT related certification from accredited training institution.
A minimum of 1 year work experience in the support and maintenance of a multi-server environment with Windows Server, Exchange Server, and Active Directory.
Experience supporting, implementing and/or administering networks and hardware.
Knowledge of MDM, Blackberry Enterprise Server, active sync and experience with smart phone troubleshooting.
Experience in the use of remote support and remote control tools and technologies.

At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.
Job Description:
Sun Life has launched an ambitious journey to deploy data as a foundational pillar and strategy across the whole business. Be a part of an exciting and challenging opportunity by becoming part of the analytics community helping to accelerate the growth and application of data science capabilities.
As a Data Scientist, you will be part of a large analytics community and will be focused within the Individual Insurance & Wealth (IIW) management business helping the team by, but not limited to, mining data for business insights, analyzing and interpreting trends using statistical tools and techniques, reporting on business performance, and triaging code and data-related issues.
Within SLF Canada, IIW is one of the largest business units, with over 1,700 employees. Individual accounts for approximately 20% of worldwide earnings in the overall Sun Life Financial group of companies, and over 45% of Canadian earnings. We manufacture and distribute leading-edge life insurance, health insurance and wealth management products and solutions for over two million individual customers.
This role sits in the client experience insights team within IIW, a team focused on using data and analytics to understand our clients and how our business can best support them in achieving their goals of lifetime financial security and living healthier lives. The team supports the IIW marketing team, but this role will be focused on short to medium term special projects, tackling the most pressing business issues using data and analytics to change decisions and the way we do business.
Sun Life views success in this role related to 4 key characteristics:
Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles. Understanding business. We’ve got a lot of data, but it’s not going to turn itself into insights, and you can’t help with that unless you understand what the numbers mean. A passion for solving problems. The most successful data analysts don’t just spin data and give numbers, they solve the problem. Technical skills. How to wrangle structured data is a must (i.e., SQL) with strong SAS skills needed currently and the opportunity to move to other analytical tools (R, Python etc) as our data environment matures.
Accountabilities:
Analyze and interpret data to identify key insights and opportunities to better understand advisor and client behaviour through data mining client databases and other information systems, including analysis of CRM data, web and mobile applications to enhance the advisor and client experience
Help tackle key business problems via analytical work, from requirements specification, data gathering, analyst and statistical model building to presentations and adoption
Work closely with stakeholders across Sun Life as a subject matter expert in the individual client data and to understand their business problems and how data can be best leveraged to inform decisions
Ability to draw out business insights from analytical output and work with team leads to put together business recommendations.
Put together effective presentations of findings and desire to present to multiple levels of stakeholders
Leverage internal training, peers and other sources to continue to grow capabilities
An active contributing member to the analytics academy to help foster and grow the data science community at Sun Life
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
5+ years working with data (i.e., quantitative analysis experience, including handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reports)
Comfortable writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources
Experience with building predictive and prescriptive models in a business setting (i.e., regression, decision trees, deep learning etc.)
Expert using SAS to work with data, including macros
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau to aid in effective and concise oral and written storytelling and insights communication
Ability to work as a team to help deliver multiple projects with courage in managing expectations of team leaders
Demonstrated business acumen and ability to translate knowledge of audience insights into marketing strategies
Proven track record of successfully operating in a matrix environment with cross-function team participation successes
Strong partnering approach with a commitment to meeting internal and external business partners' unique needs and expectations
BSc in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science)
Nice to haves:
Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, re-insurance and casualty insurance)
MSc preferably in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science)
Additional statistical programming languages (i.e., Python/R)
Experience working with unstructured data
Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka, etc.

Respond with the first honest answer that comes to your mind. The best part about completing the assessment is that once you are done you will see a summary of your top five traits. We believe this information will not only help you in your career search with Sun Life but also be useful for your own personal development and growth.

Saskatoon, SKCareer Description
As a Data Analyst at Vendasta you will ask questions and discover the answers. For the Existing Enterprise division, you will be responsible for building and maintaining a variety of data channels required for monitoring business intelligence, success metrics, and user behaviour.

You will report directly to the individuals prioritizing your work and will leverage the interdepartmental analyst group to review, develop, and share information and analyses. The Data Analyst will be articulate, analytical, and a team player who understands the power of data. The Analyst must enjoy coordinating with interdisciplinary teams, learn quickly, and be comfortable working independently.


Responsibilities
Respond to ad hoc requests from various stakeholders, prioritizing tasks based on business value and urgency
Build and interpret internal dashboards and data, analyze results, and provide ongoing reporting
Provide prompt reports on monthly, quarterly, and yearly results for the division
Acquire data from a variety of sources to monitor business intelligence, analyze trends, and assess user behaviour
Assist with the generation of key SaaS metrics required to gain visibility into business performance
Monitor, maintain, and leverage Vendasta KPI databases to surface timely business intelligence
Assist with data gathering strategies that align with company goals
Push requirements to Vendasta Business Intelligence teams to leverage their tech/strategy
Coordinate with management to prioritize business and information needs
Develop and implement databases and other systems that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Coordinate with internal teams to ensure that required quantitative data is accessible, reliable, and maintainable
Assist product teams with the interpretation of quantitative data to aid in decision making and strategic planning
Skills & Qualifications
Experience performing statistical analysis
Competent in cleaning and formatting data
Proven ability to analyze and model data
Ability to interpret user behaviour data and collect associated metrics, such as NPS score, heat/scroll maps, conversion funnels, etc.
Familiarity with calculating key SaaS metrics (ARPU, Net MRR Churn Rate, LTV, CAC, LTV: CAC Ratio, etc.)
Familiarity with Google Cloud Infrastructure, App Engine, and tools (Bigquery, Data Store, Google Analytics, Data Studio, etc.)
Familiarity with databases and various querying techniques (SQL, NoSQL, API)
General knowledge of Python and agile development practices (would be considered an asset)
Knowledge of design principles and data visualizations
Awareness of key users to surface actionable insights (partners, local businesses, Partner Success Managers, Sales Reps, vendors, etc.)
Continuous learner with a drive to explore new technologies and processes
Analytical business sense as aligned to division strategies and goals
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Detail-oriented with a strong pursuit for truth and accuracy

Toronto, ONAre you a go-getter? Do you want to work in a fast-paced modern environment? Are your SQL skills better than all your friends? Are you passionate about data, efficiency and Business Intelligence? Do you love Application Development? Are you a creative out-of-the-box thinker?
If so, IPG Mediabrands has the perfect opportunity to get your career to the next level!
Working in a growing team, the Data Warehouse Engineer is responsible for managing the data load processes for our Data & Technology Solutions team.
You will predominately be working with a variety of data sources, including APIs, relational databases and flat files and will be responsible for extracting & loading them into a Data Warehouse using SSIS & Python scripting for the team of Data Analysts & Report Writers to then visualize in BI Reports & Dashboards for IPG Mediabrands Agency clients (internal and external).
This role will involve maintaining current SSIS packages and API pulls for various sources (including Facebook & Google) and then working to extract new metrics from other new sources as and when they are identified.
You will participate in all aspects of the report creation process, from the initial requirements gathering meetings with internal teams to learning how to gather the data from various external sources, to modelling this data for efficient reporting. Then by using the SDLC, follow through on these steps in designing & creating the necessary database objects before the design & development of the extract, transform and load process to populate them.
Responsibilities:
Managing Data Load processes from multiple data sources using Python API calls and MS SSIS ETL packages. This will include maintaining a scheduled load process & upkeep of existing packages as well as new ones that you will design & develop.
Designing & development of customized load packages from existing and new data sources based on client requirements.
Make recommendations for improvements to management & senior management on improvements for existing API Calls or Extract pulls.
Assist Data Analysts in Ad-Hoc BI report requests including identifying necessary data sources, fields and metrics needed before writing queries to obtain the report output where necessary.
Debug existing application software and create patches and hot fixes when necessary.
Work closely with team during QA to facilitate quick diagnosis & resolutions for the identified defects
Documentation of all processes & code including upkeep and maintenance of software design documentation and traceability matrixes in accordance with organizational standards
Mentor other team members with an aptitude for learning on how to work with API’s.
Participation in DBA tasks on MS SQL Server data warehouse (shared with rest of team).
Immediately integrate & work closely with established team.
Required Skills
Extremely Strong SQL and PL/SQL skills with ability to work independently with stored procedures, functions, views & materialized views to write complex queries against large datasets.
Fluent in Python scripting & C#, jQuery and .Net Web Forms (Nice to have).
3+ years of experience working with MS SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) including demonstrated knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices & procedures with the tool. Experience of cube building with MS SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) (Nice to have).
Demonstrated experience of various RDBMs reporting databases (MS SQL Server & MySQL) including knowledge of data modeling for reporting data warehouses such as star schema, snowflake schema designs.
5+ years of experience working in application development including demonstrated understanding of full Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Demonstrated logical thought process through appropriate & inquisitive questioning.
Good understanding of IT operations including standards, protocols, methods & processes, ticketing systems, configurations.
Basic knowledge of Database Administration tasks & processes.
Proficient user of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).
Extremely keen sense of attention to detail, excellent listening and communication skills (verbal and written).
Eagerness to learn new tools, technologies, concepts as well as knowledge sharing within the team on your own experience.
Post-secondary education in computer sciences, engineering, social sciences or related fields.
Experience working in a related field or media planning related experience would be a great asset & will be beneficial in your application, but is not required.
Experience with Dashboards and Data Visualization Software (Tableau or Domo) would be a great asset & will be beneficial in your application, but is not required.

job_title: Marketing Intelligence Data Analyst (MIDA) - Apply by: Friday, March 29th
job_description:
Windsor, ONCenterLine (Windsor) Limited is a recognized industry leader in manufacturing standard and custom
designed resistance welding, spot welding, arc welding and metal working equipment. We apply state of
the art technology to the design and manufacture of robotic weld lines, configurable fastener welders,
weld guns, cylinders, electrodes and other welding accessories. Our people are our key competitive
advantage in today’s global market. CenterLine (Windsor) Limited continues to evolve and diversify to
remain a valued partner to its customers and a respected member of industry. Our success is built on the
foundation of innovation, efficient design management, excellence and the guarantee of quality service.
CenterLine (Windsor) Limited requires a self-motivated individual to fill the position of Marketing
Intelligence Data Analyst (MIDA). The successful candidate will be responsible for all market research
tasks and processes that support CenterLine’s Sales & Marketing Strategy requirements. The MIDA will
use established industry best practices, tools, market knowledge, marketing experience and education to
perform all task and responsibilities of this role. This position reports to the Marketing Manager.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Identify, data mine and correlate existing company wide data to create effective measurement
processes that track sales and marketing effectiveness and provide actionable business
development insights.
 Develop, monitor and maintain market behaviour models for use in developing forecasts and data
sets for business development needs.
 Analyze customer sales and capability data from internal and external resources to classify and
measure customer needs and satisfaction for use in identifying sales opportunities, prospect
targets, new markets and market conditions affecting product demand.
 Collect, analyze and manage market data (competition, industry, emerging technologies, etc.) to
measure the market share, the effectiveness of sales and marketing strategies and to recognize
market developments impacting current corporate objectives.
 Effectively communicate research findings to the Management Team including; sales forecasts,
market trends, market profiles, customer profiles, competitor profiles and customer satisfaction
survey results.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
 Bachelor of Commerce degree (Marketing major)
 Market research and business management experience required
 Excellent quantitative skills that allow for successful measurement of markets, sizing and metrics
 Strong organizational and critical thinking skills
 Excellent oral, written, listening and optic skills
 Ability to multi-task and work with minimal supervision
Interested candidates should apply to careers@cntrline.com

job_title: Monitoring Analyst, Data Center and Facility Operations
job_description:
Calgary, ABInformation Technologies is currently seeking a Full-time Regular Monitoring Analyst.
Reporting to the Associate Director, Enterprise Communications and Data Centre, the position will function as part of Information Technologies supporting a broad range of enterprise technologies, IT facilities and IT services across the University of Calgary Campuses.

The role will be called on to assist with the monitoring and support of IT and facility related technologies within the supported Data Centre locations and IT services across the University as a whole. There is a high volume of work, in a very complex environment, intricate problem-solving and moderate levels of stress associated with the position.

Work may require the management of competing interests with satisfactory outcomes for all involved. Works where there is ambiguity, continuous change, and shifting priorities between supporting research, learning and administrative environments. The position requires regular upgrades of skills, and demonstrated knowledge of department processes as technologies and tools change. In some emergency situations on call or call out may be necessary.
Position Description
Summary of Key Responsibilities (job functions include but are not limited to):
Technical
Develop/test/implement new monitors for enterprise level IT components
Maintain and keep monitoring environment updated
Assist with planning coordination of data centre installations
Take responsibility for his/her own learning and skills development by staying current with latest technology trends, unit procedures, and IT processes
Follow all standard procedures and identify those that may not be in place
Adhere to all IT policies
Communication
Ensure that management and other team members are kept informed of all activities and progress of work by sharing accurate information regarding service events, projects and activities
Explain technical information to clients with little or no technical background, and translate customer needs into requests for service
Work collaboratively and interact respectfully and persuasively with a variety of internal and external contacts
Develop and maintain positive working relationships within the IT group and with clients
Liaise closely with other departments within IT to facilitate efficient workflow
Documentation
Prepare clear, well-written reports and documentation
Maintain and develop standard operating procedures
Maintain/verify asset information within the CMDB
Create and maintain rack level elevations and data centre layouts
Identify, document and escalate opportunities for process and/or tool improvement
Leadership
Seek a team approach to service delivery, as appropriate
Must demonstrate the ability to reconcile differing perspectives, develop consensus, and secure cooperation and support from customers and other IT team members
Other
Take responsibility for his/her own learning and skills development
Work collaboratively in a team environment to deliver timely and effective IT services
Work in a high volume environment with frequent interruptions and changing priorities
Work within or exceed the commitments made to the University community
Ensure that all actions are aligned with the organization's strategic direction, ethics, values and professional standards

3-5 years of experience directly related to enterprise monitoring, data centre coordination and CMDB management
Undergraduate degree or Technical School diploma in a related IT or network communications field
A+ certification is an asset
ITIL Foundations certification is an asset
Working knowledge of the following technical skills:

Enterprise server/storage/network technologies
Knowledge of current operating systems (Windows, Linux, etc.)
Data Centre technologies
CMDB
DCIM software/technologies
Excellent organizational skills with ability to prioritize and meet competing deadlines
Must possess excellent customer service skills
Ability to relay technical information to clients with little or no technical background, and an ability to translate customer needs into requests for service
Demonstrated ability for detailed work by assisting with recordkeeping or updating knowledgebase documentation as required
Ability to perform heavy manual labour work related to equipment installation or removal
A valid Alberta driver's license is required to facilitate travel to all Data Centre locations
Working knowledge of current IT tools (i.e. Whats Up Gold, ServiceNow) is an asset
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Excellent oral and communication skills
Excellent understanding and follow through on oral and written instructions

Markham, ONJOB DESCRIPTION
Primary Function:
This role assumes responsibility for the execution of online tactics designed to optimize and enrich the representation of products on acklandsgrainger.com. The Online Content Analyst will report directly to the Online Search & Merchandising Manager and is an affiliated team member of the Acklands Grainger eCommerce department. This role will work closely with our Online Search & Merchandising Manager, to execute the day to day operations of online merchandising and taxonomy management. This role is a full-time position based out of our NSC at 123 Commerce Valley Drive East suite 700.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities
This role is responsible for the execution of the strategies and tactics associated with optimizing the way product categories are presented and merchandised online. Responsibilities include:
Maintaining and optimizing the online product hierarchy as part of the NPI workflow.
Ensuring online hierarchy efforts are aligned with efforts from several key internal business partners, including the Online Merchandising, Product Management and STEP/hierarchy teams
Determining the optimal way to group and merchandise like products for display online; executing and maintaining the online grouping strategy
Partnering with product management team members to enforce the consistency of the online product representation, focusing on but not limited to:
Product descriptions
Product Hierarchy and categorization
Technical attribute selection & population
Category product images
Additional product meta data
Develop and maintain promotional and seasonal product hierarchies.
Benchmarking the acklandsgrainger.com online shopping experience versus its competitors; translating findings into strategic action.
Assisting in the testing and integration of new online and offline features and functionality
Collaborating with our Product Management French translation resource will maintain the French hierarchy and product movement changes
Pull extracts for web and merchandising product data and hierarchy data based on ad hoc requests to support team members of the eCommerce team.
Preferred Education & Experience
Must have 2-3 years of experience in large, multi-channel organizations with:
2-3 years of related eCommerce, product merchandising, or product management experience
Proven success working in teams with dynamic, analytics-driven, multi-channel work environments
Understanding of Product Information Management systems and product data management methodologies; experience with Stibo Systems (STEP) is an asset.
Experience collecting and managing product-related digital assets (product imagery, PDF documentation, etc.)
Experience with faceted on-site search engines; Endeca or Solr a plus.
Experience with the interpretation and analysis of web analytics
High attention to detail / proven organizational skills
Familiarity with product taxonomy research; demonstrated ability to translate research into tactical actions
Strong communication skills, detail orientation and business acumen
High-level knowledge of the MRO (Maintenance, Repair, and Operations) industry and industrial products a strong plus
Adept at prioritization and multitasking
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Strong systemic thinking and problem solving skills
Demonstrated interpersonal and relationship building skills
Strong Microsoft Office skills

TemporaryJob Description
REPOST
Position: Interface Analyst
Status: Temporary Full Time
Dept/Health System: Information Services, HIS
Posted: March 26, 2019
Internal Deadline: April 2, 2019
Preparing for the implementation of our new hospital information system requires a dedicated team that brings together clinical and enabling expertise. We are excited to share an initial set of job opportunities to support this significant project.

Trillium Health Partners (THP) is a leading hospital with an outstanding record of performance, fiscal responsibility and quality patient care. THP operates on three main sites – Credit Valley Hospital, Mississauga Hospital, and Queensway Health Centre and offers a full range of acute care as well as a variety of specialized, community-based programs. THP’s mission is to create a new kind of health care for a healthier community. Guided by its values of compassion, excellence, and courage, THP’s strategic plan envisions a new approach to health – working in partnership to create an inter-connected system of care that is organized around the patient, both inside the Hospital and beyond its walls, by balancing quality, access and sustainability. With a vision for developing a common information platform that supports an efficient patient experience, common clinical best practices and continuity of information, THP has identified information and technology as key enablers on their journey to transforming care. For more information about THP, please visit their website at https://trilliumhealthpartners.ca.
The Position:
The Interface Analyst will use their computer science and technical skills to support the implementation of the Health Information System (HIS). Reporting to the HIS Integration Manager, the analyst will be certified and is a part of the HIS project team and are the primary development and support contacts for the HIS interfaces they are assigned to. They coordinate the analysis, technical design and triage all issues necessary to implement and support their assigned interfaces and work closely with the project manager, application teams and technical teams to ensure that interfaces meet the needs of your end users.

Here’s what you will get to do:
Managing the entire cycle of interface application development, including analysis, design, specification, implementation, go-live and support
Working closely with application teams, subject matter experts and third-party application experts to determine the business needs for interfaces, document the requirements, and configure the interfaces per the requirements
Working with this group to diagnose and resolve interface-related issues, and participating in their projects as needed
Coordinating various interface-specific tasks and activities like testing, build, cutover planning, and go-live
Working with interface engine developers to develop data-translation routines and methods to support application and external systems' data and format needs
Driving the interface projects, working with the interface project manager to ensure that results are achieved and deadlines are met
Providing proactive support by monitoring live interfaces and collaborating with experts to provide
permanent resolutions to problems
Transition HIS interfacing support to operations at the end of the HIS project.
Achieve certification in the vendor’s application
Here’s what you need to have:
A college diploma or university degree in the field of computer science and at least 3-4 years equivalent work experience.
Microsoft BizTalk development experience and Microsoft BizTalk Certified Professional an asset.
Working knowledge of the .NET 3.5/4.0/4.5 Framework, including Visual Studio 2010, Visual Studio 2012, C#, ASP.NET is an asset
Excellent database skills including SQL server, SQL queries, data access optimization, database objects creation and optimization, TSQL is an asset.
Knowledge and experience using Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS)
Hands-on knowledge of Health Level 7 (HL7) and Extensive Markup Language (XML) messaging standards and structures is required.
Technical training in UNIX/Linux and/or Windows, technical infrastructure in a healthcare setting is preferred.
Experience in hospital information with an understanding of translating data from one system to another, interfacing techniques system work flow, working knowledge of data feeds and integration engine technologies is an asset.
Experience supporting and/or implementing moderately complex integration projects.
Healthcare application experience an asset.
Strong analytical, technical, and troubleshooting skills.
Able to learn in a self-directed, fast paced, rapidly-changing environment
Ability to analyze data, problem-solve, and clearly communicate solutions
Ability to understand organizational requirements and their impact on the technical aspects of a solution
Ability to work in a complex multi-communication-channel environment
Skill at tracking tasks, defining next steps, identifying owners, and holding people accountable
Ability to coordinate activities involving multiple players, including vendors, subject matter experts, interface engine developers, and end users, to design, configure, and test interfaces.
Ability to travel to the United States as required

Internal Candidates who believe they possess the necessary qualifications and experience for this position and who have been in their current position for at least six (6) months are encouraged to apply.

To pursue this career opportunity, please visit our website: www.trilliumhealthpartners.ca

Conagra Brands has the most energized, highest-impact culture in food. Our people persistently challenge and disrupt marketplace/business conventions and we are respected for our great brands, great food, great margins and consistent results. Conagra Brands, be part of building something BIG.
Position Summary:
The objective of a CPFR Analyst is to develop, analyze, and recommend forecasts at both the store and distribution center level. The role of this position is to partner with the Customers Replenishment Managers to implement strategies, maintain service levels, and support promotional activity. This position will also collaborate internally with supply chain, customer service, and logistics to maintain best in class service to the customer.
Position Responsibilities:
This position requires independent decision-making that impacts revenue for customer and for ConAgra Foods.
Reviews forecast accuracy exception reports and make recommendations for forecast changes to Customer replenishment team and ConAgra Supply Chain Team.
Identify daily store out of stocks and root cause. Recommend business process changes to improve future in-stock. (Late truck, demand variability, incorrect forecast, miss-shipments)
Perform gap analysis before/after forecast changes and communicate issues to Replenishment Managers.
Manage ordering system to maximize opportunities and growth for ConAgra products while minimizing errors (i.e. item set up, item forecast)
Make recommendations on adjustments to Economic Order Quantities (pallet vs. multi-layer vs. layers)
Maintain service levels including fill rate, OTD compliance, in-stock, inventory levels (WOS), to maximize inventory effectiveness.
Make recommendations to facilitate forecast expectations, event plans, promotions, and projected lifts in sales trends.
Monitor orders through customer supply chain and Replenishment planners/Business Analysts to avoid over/under inventory situations.
Recognize and avoid potential issues by using strong analytical skills and customer specific knowledge and recommend ideas to improve service levels.
Forecast changes in order patterns and timing brought on by change in distribution, planogram changes, seasonality, and promotions to coordinate with supply chain and the customer
Meet (at least) quarterly with customer replenishment planners/business analysts to discuss forecast and promotional plans and discuss opportunities for improvement.
Qualifications/ Education/Experience/Skills:
2 year Logistics experience through Customer Service or Supply Chain required.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills with demonstrated proactive problem-solving skills.
Understanding of logistics and inventory management concepts.
Ability to analyze information and provide a business case that is actionable.
Technical skills that allow for ease in learning new systems.
Capability to troubleshoot and resolve data quality issues.
Self-motivated and able to work with little direction.
Extreme attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
Ability to manage many details and tasks with a high level of accuracy.
Ability to manage dual roles of Customer advocate and Company employee.
Strong written and verbal communication skills to work with customer, sales and supply chain.
Proficient in Microsoft Office skills, including Word, Excel, and Power Point required.
Experience in Retail Link a plus.
College degree preferred.
Ability to travel upon request

$53,857 a yearPermanentThe Royal British Columbia Museum is one of Canada’s great cultural treasures. Our collections, research, presentations and programs enable us to tell the stories of BC in ways that enlighten, stimulate and inspire.
Under the general guidance of, and in consultation with the Digital Manager, the incumbent will manage development and maintenance of Royal BC Museum database systems including but not limited to the following: a museum and archives collection management system, an integrated library system, and a digital asset management system. As well, this position will help develop a collection location system. This position manages technical projects within the museum and archives, including liaising with contractors and partners. This position also works closely with users, creating and implementing training programs for the systems identified above.
Job Requirements/Qualifications:
Along with formal education in computer sciences or library sciences you possess strong skills as a data analyst for large complex systems. You have database administration experience and are comfortable querying large datasets using SQL for the purpose of identifying patterns of data corruption, performing bulk updates, or writing custom reports. As well, you are comfortable with project administration, working with users and implementing training programs. Ideally you will have work experience directly related to museum, library and/or archive collections, with knowledge of associated data standards and schemas. In addition to a data analyst skillset, you have proven experience managing complex projects along with developing procedures and standards. Your creativity, enthusiasm and confident nature enables you to succeed in a team environment while your results orientation and ability to demonstrate initiatives ensures the job gets done and organizational goals are met. You will possess a high degree of flexibility, and the ability to manage and refocus priorities.

Salary/Wage: $53,857
Job Application Process:
We offer an attractive compensation package, which includes a competitive salary, excellent benefits, a fabulous location and the chance to work in an organization passionate about preserving, protecting and sharing the wonders of the human, natural and archival history of BC.

Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance

Toronto, ONAbout Us

We’re a leading financial technology company in the institutional debt capital markets - the largest capital market globally and the lifeline of finance world - that is laser focused on transforming how global investment banks, institutional investors, corporations and governments can better execute transactions, price discover and engage with each other. Overbond is building a first-of-its-kind cloud-based platform that makes new bond issuance digital, transparent, and secure. Our team consists of individuals with deep expertise, from both a technical and industry perspective, that are truly motivated by the fact that we are making a significant impact on how global capital markets operate. We value sharp minds, integrity, high performance, collaboration, and purpose. Our mindset is to innovate and challenge convention. At Overbond, we believe that change is the only constant and that problems are opportunities in disguise.

The Opportunity

This exciting new role is available as part of the Overbond product team expansion. The position is a unique opportunity to build creative solutions for complex problems using cutting edge technology. As an expert in data science, you will be in charge of the architecture, integration and analysis of large data sets used for developing machine learning models and generating business insights. We are seeking experienced data scientists who are excited about utilizing latest statistical, machine learning, and predictive analytics techniques to transform unstructured data to creative solutions that will have direct impact on the business of our clients.
What You'll Do
Collect, analyze and visualize colossal datasets using a variety of emerging technologies to help solidify our understanding of users and improve product decision-making
Design, build and maintain an expanding set of robust predictive models and applications to drive forecast accuracy
Lead data science initiatives to recommend actionable business insights using big data analytics and machine learning techniques
Leverage distributed and open-source computing tools for recommendations, classification, regression, and feature extraction, from logistic regression to matrix factorization, to deep learning neural networks
Prepare detailed documentation to specify data sources, models and algorithms used and developed
Collaborate with the engineering team to deploy models and algorithms in production
Effectively communicate data insights in a non-technical manner to key stakeholders and senior management team
What You'll Need
Bachelor or Masters degree in relevant disciplines (Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Electrical/Software Engineering)
5+ years of experience in data mining, machine learning and statistical modeling
Solid understanding of the underlying statistical theory and predictive modeling lifecycle
Proven track record of building and demonstrating business value from predictive models and data products
Highly proficient in building statistical and algorithmic models with complex and large data sets such as supervised statistical learning, times-series analysis, regression analysis, data visualization and deep learning
Capability to architect highly scalable distributed systems, using different open source tools
An entrepreneurial mindset, likes working in an agile environment, driven to ship frequently
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Team-oriented, pragmatic, self-starting
Likes to learn and grow with teammates in a highly collaborative and open environment
Understanding of, or interest in, finance and investments
What We Offer
The challenge and opportunity of joining an exciting startup company
Opportunity to work on a real product with very demanding paying enterprise clients
Lots of opportunity for learning and self-development
Ability to contribute in all stages of product development
Successful candidate(s) will have a truly exciting opportunity to be part of the industry leading financial technology company changing the way how global investment banks, institutional investors, corporations and governments access the capital markets. The candidate will work with top notch industry professionals and will be given ample amount of opportunities to learn and contribute.

Edmonton, AB$72,444 - $94,964 a yearThe Policy Analyst is responsible for conducting research, analyzing data, and developing policy options required to develop the Department of Energy's upstream mines and minerals policies. The position plays a critical role in ensuring that policy options are well thought, relevant data are analyzed, all stakeholders are engaged, and research is properly conducted for policy and regulation development. The work environment is complex and the position must consider a wide variety of energy and non-energy issues affecting Alberta's mines and minerals royalty and tenure systems. This position leads and/or coordinates in-depth policy development processes and works with multidisciplinary teams.


This position will require strong verbal and written communication skills in producing briefings, presentations, cabinet reports, and communications materials on a broad range of energy-related issues. Your highly developed consultation/engagement, facilitation and interpersonal skills will help you coordinate working groups; liaise extensively with operations, legal, agencies and policy representatives; and participate on departmental, cross ministry, and industry committees related to energy development. The work undertaken by the Policy Analyst ranges from well-organized work plans to exploratory, emergent research and strategy development in the fields of energy information, policy, program, and regulations. Since the work covers the full range of Crown-owned mines and minerals, curiosity, mental flexibility, and interpersonal skills are fundamental attributes for the position. Communication, teamwork, and building relationships are essential for success. Having strong analytical and data processing skills are also a critical asset for this position.


The competencies that are critical for success in this role are:

Drive for Results - Knowing what outcomes are important and maximizing resources to achieve results that are aligned with the goals of the organization, while maintaining accountability to each other and external stakeholders.

Creative Problem Solving - Advanced problem solving and critical thinking skills are required to develop recommendations for management, founded on excellent research and analysis skills and the input of multiple stakeholders and/or data sources.

Systems Thinking - Ability to map and synthesize knowledge of Alberta Government business goals, economic and environmental policies, challenges, and potential roles for the Alberta Government and other jurisdictions to address these challenges.

Agility - Demonstrated ability to develop creative and durable recommendations to address complex issues involving multiple stakeholders with various responsibilities and areas of influence. Ability to work with minimal supervision is required


Qualifications

University degree in a related field (e.g., law, business, economics, finance, political science, engineering, or natural resources sciences) plus 4 years of progressively responsible related experience is required. Demonstrated experience with policy development and implementation OR demonstrated understanding of Canadian and global energy industries and systems is required. Project management experience and a related master?s degree will be considered as assets. Additional assets include a master's degree. Equivalencies will be considered.


Salary

$2,775.64 to $3,638.48 bi-weekly
($72,444 to $94,964 annually)


Notes

This competition may be used to fill future vacancies across the Government of Alberta.


How to Apply

Online applications are preferred. Applicants are advised to provide information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience and relevant examples of required competencies.


Note: As only one file can be uploaded, please ensure your cover letter, resume and any other related documents are submitted in one file. Please ensure that this document is saved using the following naming convention (Last name, First name_Job ID Number). Applicants who apply online will be able to track the status of this competition.

It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS) - http://work.alberta.ca/immigration/international-qualifications-assessment-service.html It is recommended that applicants include the assessment certificate from IQAS or any other educational assessment service as part of their application.


Closing Statement

We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

If you require any further information on this job posting, please call (780) 427-2111. If this competition is closed as per the closing date noted above, please continue to check http://www.jobs.alberta.ca for a listing of current career opportunities with the Government of Alberta.

job_title: Sr. Analyst, Store Operations and Labour Analytics
job_description:
Brampton, ONLieu:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
C’est toute une décision que de se joindre à une entreprise. Nous offrons des perspectives d’emploi à des personnes qui, comme vous, sont travaillantes, dynamiques et fiables.
Pourquoi ce role est-il important?
Role Mandate:

We are looking for a talented and motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our Store Operations & Labour Analytics team. You will be working with various stakeholders to understand their operations, data structures, and analytical requirements to enable data driven insights. This role will require you to utilize your analytical skill set to identify opportunities to improve store P&L, service model, productivity and colleague engagement. More so, you will be partnering with and provide support to store colleagues, specialist teams, and regional store operations management teams.
Accountabilities:
 
Summarize vast amounts of in-store and operational data to develop reports and models to solve business problems;
 
Analyze reports to identify opportunities to better manage cost, improve store department schedules and best practices within the labour system;
 
Support the Store Operations Team/Labour Engineers in identifying and resolving business risks;
 
Evaluate new data sources and help define more effective ways to communicate data with our business users;
 
Working with our IT and BI teams to create data processes that are accurate, consistent and efficient to process large amount of data quickly to meet reporting needs;
 
Write SQL to efficiently retrieve information from business data sources to support different kinds of reporting needs;
 
Use SAS to manage large datasets, perform ad hoc analytics, and build predictive models;
 
Stakeholder management: Engage with key stakeholders within store operations to ensure their reporting and analytics needs are fulfilled.
Role Requirements:
 
Post-Secondary education in Mathematics, Business, Computer Science or Statistics;
 
Exceptional analytical skills and proven capability to drive insights from data and analytics;
 
Ability to independently deal with relevant analytical and BI tools (SAS, MicroStrategy, BOXI, Excel, etc);
 
Proficient in SQL - query optimization and syntax knowledge;
 
Ability to self-organize multiple tasks well and to complete them on time with a clear focus on quantitative results;
 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
 
Willingness to work well in a fast-paced team environment;
 
Ability to “think outside the box”.

job_title: Internship in Public Policy and Entrepreneurship
company_name: CFIB - Canadian Federation of Independent Business
job_location: Canadian Federation of Independent Business29 reviews
job_description:
$2,500 a monthPosting Job Description
The Canadian Federation of Independent Business (CFIB) is a non-partisan, not-for-profit advocacy group representing the interests of 110,000 small and medium-sized businesses in Canada for more than 47 years. It was born in reaction to a piece of public policy that, at the time, would have been devastating to the Canadian independent business sector.

In conjunction with Scotiabank, we are offering a four-month Public Policy and Entrepreneurship Internship in our Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, Ottawa, Halifax and Charlottetown offices (six positions). The positions will run from early May to late August.

CFIB has taken great care in developing a Public Policy and Entrepreneurship Intern Program that will not only advance our small business members’ priorities, but will also provide a meaningful and enriching opportunity for the intern.

Scope of Responsibility:
Reporting to a member of the legislative team, you will be responsible for the research, analysis and writing of a specific project relevant to our small business members. The project has been pre-selected based on its compatibility with the Intern Program and CFIB’s legislative agenda. We strongly encourage interested candidates to check out our research and advocacy work at www.cfib.ca. At the end of four months, the project may be considered a component of CFIB’s public advocacy work on these issues.

Highlights of Responsibilities:
In consultation with and direction from the local senior analyst, you will:
Refine the project plan and develop weekly completion targets
Meet agreed upon weekly completion targets
Gather relevant data from CFIB member surveys, government and other sources
Analyze data and write draft final report
Work collaboratively with other CFIB Public Policy and Entrepreneurship Interns and CFIB colleagues across Canada
Provide research assistance on other small business issues, as necessary
Provide office administrative help and assist small business members, as necessary
Qualifications:
Candidates must possess:
Desire to learn more about the small business sector and its role in the Canadian economy
Interest in government relations/politics/public policy
Strong research skills to undertake qualitative and quantitative analysis, check sources and facts, and develop key arguments
Superior written communication skills
Commitment to accuracy and thoroughness
Expertise in word processing, spreadsheets and graphs
Proven ability to work interdependently in a collaborative environment with colleagues in a small office environment
Ability to step in to help keep the office running (answer phone, administrative tasks), if necessary
Good interpersonal skills
Objectivity and non-partisanship
Fluency in English language is a requirement (written, oral and reading)
Notes:
Both active students and recent graduates of relevant post-secondary education are encouraged to apply. Preference will be given to those students able to complete the internship without interruptions.

Remuneration:
$2,500/month gross (paid bi-weekly, less statutory deductions)

Writing sample:
This application process requires a sample of written work you have completed. The writing sample should be a brief example of your research and writing abilities. The sample does not necessarily have to be related to small business issues. For example, you may want to use a portion of a paper that you submitted for a school course. Please keep your writing sample to two pages. If needed, further samples may be requested from short-listed candidates.

Note: CFIB will be reviewing applications as they are submitted. We encourage you to apply early. All applications will be acknowledged; however, please note that only those applicants that meet the criteria will be contacted for an interview.

Please ensure to apply for the job posted in the location of your choice and indicate in your cover letter, which city you are applying for.

CFIB is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities through the interview process and while employed. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Are you passionate about data analysis and looking for an opportunity to positively impact your community? If so, the Business Analyst (Data Analyst) position at Toronto Community Housing may be for you!
The Business Analyst (Data Analyst) will be part of the Data Governance team, reporting to the Data Governance Manager within the Information and Technology Services (ITS) department.

Data Analysis

Research

Contributes to ideas and actions towards continuous improvement of processes within master data and data quality
Participates in research projects with external and internal partners
 What you’ll need
University Degree in computer science, MIS or other relevant specialty/discipline
University degree in computer science, MIS is preferred
3 years - Previous experience in data analysis and data modeling, 3-5 years’ experience is preferred

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate architectural concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences
Excellent analytical skills, work well in a demanding dynamic environment and meet overall objectives
Nice to have:
Previous experience in data conversion initiatives
Ability to manage multiple demands within tight timelines
Demonstrate good problem-solving abilities, and have initiative and show sound judgment
Attention to detail and ability to work effectively under time constraints are required
Ability to exhibit maturity, reliability and stability by adhering to commitments is critical in order to maintain business credibility
High level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity

What’s next

Job Summary:
The individual in this position will play a key role in supporting Canada Cartage’s Applications, with a focus on warehousing/logistics. This portfolio currently encompasses the 3PL/Warehouse Management System, Customer Web Portal, Shipping Platforms and smaller Ancillary Systems. The applications are a mix of 3rd party systems with some customizations and internally built applications.

The individual will administer the 3PL/Warehouse systems while ensuring day to day issues on these systems are supported in a timely manner. They will also act as a Subject Matter Expert for all internal initiatives relating to these applications. This is a key role in ensuring the ongoing smooth operation of the business and becomes the natural go-to person for both resources within the technical team and the business community.

Job Responsibilities:

Application Support
Log, prioritize, troubleshoot, route and monitor all support incidents or questions relating to the applications supported. The applications could be COTS vendor applications or internal applications.
Assist internal teams with troubleshooting, technical support and other issues relating to the applications supported.
Perform root cause analysis to determine the cause of recurring issues and either fix or provide recommendations toward solutions.
Mentor L1 staff or Super Users within the Business departments on activities they support in the systems.
Manage the upkeep of the application. Ensure that the application is updated routinely and functioning at an acceptable performance level. This would involve working with the Infrastructure team to ensure sufficient resources are provisioned.
Continually drive improvements within the support processes by identifying opportunities for automation or transforming processes into something simpler. You may have the opportunity to then drive those as small projects.
Subject Matter Expertise
Be a Subject Matter Expert for the Applications being supported. Progressively understand the current functionality, keep up with future enhancements on the product roadmap, and assess capabilities in competing applications within the same domain.
Provide feedback into various projects’ Solution/Design phases that involve the application portfolio. Assist the team members by providing system requirements and/or test cases for initiatives concerning the applications.
Prepare training documentation/SOPs and train both users and other trainers on system use.
Support process mapping and SOP building for business processes undertaken using the application set.
May participate in testing activities within the supported applications by preparing test plans and test cases, managing or executing the tests, capturing results and ensuring defects are raised to the Project Manager or Vendor.

Relationships & Communication
Use effective communication and listening skills with internal customers, external customers, vendors, and team members within the IT department while troubleshooting system issues.
Professional communication with current and new customers.
Be flexible and astute in tailoring communication to different audiences. Example: Technical/vendor vs every day users
Build and maintain strong relationships with key day-to-day users of the system such that you can reinforce proper use of the system and become a change agent during project rollouts.
Manage the relationship with the Application vendors. This will involve routine touchpoints to ensure open issues are being addressed promptly and escalated for further attention as required.

Experience & Skills:

Must haves:
Experience working within the Supply Chain along with a good understanding of the business lifecycle managed within the Applications supporting it.
Strong analytical & prioritization skills
Excellent communication skills (written, verbal, listening and presentation).
Keen to learn and understand new technologies and their applicability
Ability to work with minimal supervision and also the work well with a cross-functional team to achieve organizations goals.
Active person who shows initiative and enjoys a challenge
Able to handle multiple initiatives in parallel but recognizes the importance of prioritization
Completion of Post-secondary degree in an analytical specialization (Engineering, Sciences or Business with IT concentration preferred).
Technically competent with Microsoft Office suite of products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio.
4 or more years working in the capacity of an Application, Systems, Technical or Business Analyst
Proficient within HighJump 3PL System or other Warehouse Management Systems including RF functionality
Understanding of Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) within Warehousing standards
Nice to haves:

IT industry certifications

Project Management skills

Toronto, ONAbout EPL
At EPL, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.

We help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. Our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in Canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use. We have built our reputation on doing things really well.

We have a bright, talented, and engaging team with a lot of passion for what we do: helping large energy users across North America reduce their energy/carbon footprints, and quantifying energy consumption and costs.

The Role
We seek a smart and passionate professional to join our Data Integrity and Support Team. You will be given the opportunity to contribute in several areas, with a view to growing into a larger role within EPL over time. A steep learning curve is anticipated. Initial contribution areas include:

o Support with ongoing maintenance of client and account info.
o Continuously work with utility providers to maintain accurate billing and consumption data.
o File management responsibilities including downloading data and scanning documents.
o Use data processing tools to maintain integrity of incoming data.
o Load data from multiple sources into our system; manage data flow and address issues.
o Stay on top of regular procedures to ensure nothing ‘slips through the cracks’.

About You
Intelligence and a commitment to team work are of great value; just as important is a determination to overcome obstacles and solve challenging problems. Excellent client service and relationship-building are critical to everyone’s role at EPL.

A post-secondary education (degree or diploma) is required. We are open to candidates from various programs of study, provided you are good with numbers, have an eye for detail, are organized, and can adapt well to shifting priorities and schedules.

Strong computer skills are required, particularly with Microsoft Excel. Base level experience with SQL is an asset.

Its expected that you can communicate professionally, clearly and efficiently; both verbally and using email.

What to expect
The success of our people drives the success of our company. We have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. Each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their careers with our firm.

EPL team members also receive:

Unlimited Vacation & Flexible Work Hours (truly own your time)
Insured Benefits and Health Spending Account
Paid monthly transit pass

Join our community of super-smart and nice people, who are doing good and valuable things.

Prepare monthly utility reports (including consumption, prices, costs, variances against budget and last year actuals)
Assess and verify projected energy savings provided by energy programs
Assist Measurement and Verification (M&V) staff to evaluate energy savings for completed energy programs
Analyze utility cost savings for the M&V of energy efficiency retrofit projects
Support energy program managers for utility/energy data analysis, etc.

Reporting to the Leader Intellectual Property Access & Marketing, the Intellectual Property Analyst analyzes all business and technical factors affecting corporate intellectual property transfers and existing corporate Intellectual Property (IP), data access and information security policies. Primary duties include:
Understand current and future business applicability for corporate intellectual property.
Foster a culture within The Corporation that is supportive of IP management, innovation and collaboration.
Possess knowledge of a variety of external client and internal business unit applications, operating systems and databases where intellectual property and electronic data may reside.
Maintain an inventory of IP and data products available to internal and external customers.

Build strong internal networks to raise corporate IP awareness, capture opportunities, connect to relevant City staff and support collaboration.
Collaborate with and maintain strong relationships with internal IP stewards to develop IP transfers design and improve business processes, and influence policies and rules affecting IP.
Collaborate with internal IT staff and act in a project leader role to commercialize IP.

Experience identifying, protecting and facilitating the development of Intellectual Property assets and negotiating and drafting agreements for the protection of intellectual property assets and their creators' rights would also be considered an asset.
Applicants must have proven analytical and problem solving skills as well as strong organizational, time management, interpersonal, communications, presentation, project management, database and application development skills along with a strong knowledge of IP principles and the Internet as a warehousing and distribution mechanism.
Equivalent combinations of experience and education may be considered.

Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.

Amazon’s Sourcing team – part of the Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) organization – develops and deploys machine learning models to help Amazon’s businesses worldwide anticipate supplier performance as we order and stock the right inventory for our customers. We are seeking a Data Scientist with strong machine learning, analytical, communication, and project management skills to join our team. As part of multi-skilled team engineering teams, and with product owners, you will help identify and solve complex prediction problems to improve inbound supply chain systems modelling supplier behaviour so we can offer products to our customers with confidence we will deliver on time. Also, you will develop metrics and reports to measure our impact on Amazon’s business. In a typical day, you will work closely with retail leads, product managers, engineers, and various business groups.

You are an individual with outstanding analytical and machine learning modelling abilities, excellent communication skills, good business understanding, and technically savvy. The successful candidate will be an analytical problem solver who enjoys diving into data, is excited about investigations and algorithms, can multi-task, and can credibly interface between technical teams and business stakeholders.
