Your stakeholder management skills, as much as your knowledge of Information Technology (IT) policy best practices in the IT and government sectors, and project methodology, will drive your success in this permanent, full-time position as a Senior Policy Analyst, with the City of Toronto.


Reporting to the Manager, Strategy, Policy and Issues Management, you will play a lead role in developing and delivering the corporate IT policy program for the City of Toronto. As a Senior Policy Analyst, IT, you will use a best practices approach in providing leadership and coordination in the design, development, implementation, management, monitoring and evaluation of the divisional IT policy program.


Major Responsibilities:

Your primary responsibilities as Senior Policy Analyst-IT will be varied. Specifically, you will:

Implements detailed plans and recommend policies and procedures regarding program-specific requirements.
Manages the day-to-day operation of all assigned staff on a project basis, including supervising, motivating and training staff, as well as encouraging and ensuring effective teamwork, high standards of work quality and organizational performance, continuous learning and innovation.
Manages the design, development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of IT policies.
Secures compliance with sensitive legislation such as privacy laws and with general information and technology “best practices” and strategies in knowledge and information management through the appropriate research, analysis and development of policies, standards and procedures.
Provides advice on complex and possible controversial positions to senior management and Council through the development of papers, briefing notes and staff reports.
Manages IT Policy processes in conjunction with Information Technology Subject Matter Experts across the City.
Plans and implements the City’s corporate IT Policy program based on “best practices” in the IT and government sectors.
Conducts “best practices” research on topical IT Policies and emerging trends and related issues affecting the City of Toronto’s architecture.
Provides professional IT consulting and advisory services to the City’s business divisions and other Information & Technology (IT) work groups, as well as eCity projects.
Provides advice to senior management through the development of position papers, strategies, briefing notes, presentations and staff reports.
Facilitates and negotiates agreement between and among various parties and stakeholders to achieve common goals for delivery of IT Policy processes across the organization.
Manages the relationship with internal and external stakeholders in order to benchmark the City’s standards, including standards and practices against external organizations, as well as to achieve internal consensus where needed.
Key Qualifications:

Your application for the role of Senior Policy Analyst, should describe your qualifications as they relate to:

Post-secondary education in Public Policy, Business Administration or a related discipline and/or the equivalent combination of education and/or experience with relevant information technology or business systems experience.
Considerable experience providing strategic advice, policy/program development, research and evaluation in a large scale public or private organization.
Considerable experience consulting and establishing effective working relationships with all stakeholders including clients, management and staff at all levels.
Considerable experience in the development and deployment of research methodology, and policy particularly in the analysis and assessment of a broad range of IT issues, trends and directions.
Considerable experience in project leadership by mediating, negotiating and facilitating projects and work teams.
Strong stakeholder management, partnership and relationship-building skills to initiate and nurture strong working relationships with colleagues throughout the IT Division, corporation and external community, to achieve mutual goals and objectives. Highly developed interpersonal skills and demonstrated proficiency in conflict resolution in complex, multi-stakeholder situations.
Strong oral and written communication skills to prepare and present detailed research proposals, methodologies, standards, project plans, and reports.
Superior project management and team leadership skills to provide project planning and leadership on concurrent standards development projects and to manage deadlines and competing priorities
Excellent strategic, analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Strong analytical thinking skills to apply several analytical techniques to break apart complex problems into component parts, identify several solutions, and weigh the value of each.
Technical skills to operate various software programs to prepare own materials.
Ability to be strategic to understand and assess the external impact of trends and issues on internal standards and planning.
Knowledge and understanding of: Project methodology, IT governance structure, decision-making processes and service management (including COBIT and ITIL).
Knowledge of the City's legislative framework and decision-making processes would be an asset.
Knowledge and understanding of: IT standards (hardware, software, telecommunication, security, data, ISO, ANSI, IEC, IEEE, ISACC, INCITS, etc.) would be an asset.
Equity, Diversity and Inclusion:
The City of Toronto is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment where all employees and members of the public feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the public and the communities in which we live and serve.


Accommodation:

If you are an individual who requires accommodation to apply to this position, due to disability under the Ontario Human Rights Code, please email us at application.accomodation3@toronto.ca, quoting job ID #2320757 and the job title. The City is committed to providing Code-protected accommodation throughout its hiring process. Please visit Hiring Policies and Statements for further details.

Who you are

You’re an aspiring appraisal professional looking to learn from the best, so you can become the next top appraiser. You enjoy analyzing data, gathering market research, and following a project from start to finish.

You contribute to a better appraisal by identifying errors, compliance issues and other anomalies.

Support and/or manage the day to day operation and ongoing development of Visa’s suite of product benefits.

Provide subject matter expertise, insights, benchmarking, and recommendations on issues and opportunities affecting Visa’s affluent benefit roadmap; includes staying abreast of, and reporting on, competitive trends related to product benefits

Conducting analysis, pricing, business casing, concept / proposal development, and 3rd party negotiation that may be required to deliver new benefits.

Incumbent will create articulate presentation decks / material for client briefings and meetings
Build team process and onboarding documentation

3+ years of professional experience at ideally a financial institution, payment network, consulting, technology, or travel and lifestyle benefits organization

Excellent problem-solving skills

We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to launch our new analytical framework for predicting consumer behavior in the mortgage buying process. In this role, you will work closely with Product Management to analyze potential data sources, design key modeling capabilities, and develop new systems for continuous improvement. Nomis is the market leader in bringing pricing optimization to retail banking and you will be responsible for achieving the same level of success as we enter the US Mortgage industry.

Responsibilities

Build analytical models and solutions to help users understand the price elasticity of customer segments and make better data-driven decisions.
Design systems for dynamically recalibrating models to account for new market insights
Partner closely with product leadership to analyze key data sources for understanding and predicting customer behavior.
Develop pricing models to simulate profitability from pricing strategies and forecast changes to a bank’s customer credit portfolio
Gather and process data at scale (scripts, scraping, APIs, database queries, etc.)
Desired Skills

Creative problem solver: Passionate about answering questions with data and always learning.
Structured thinker: Understand how to break down complex problems into the key components where data science and machine learning can be used to improve solutions.
Highly productive: Work with limited oversight on a day to day basis. This role is intended for somebody who is passionate about data and developing solutions to improve our products.
Python and R proficiency
MS or PhD in CS – 3+ years of experience (BS with 5+ years of experience in quantitative analysis) developing production ML models to solve problems and ability to transform concepts into practical solutions
Experience building solutions with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, Spark MLlib, SciKit Learn, etc.) for real-time inferences
Experience contributing to or developing code leveraging scientific and machine learning libraries in Python (e.g. numpy, pandas, scikit-learn) and deployed in a production environment, including participating in code reviews and collaborating with infrastructure and other engineers
2+ Years of Python, Typescript (familiar with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React or Ember), NodeJS or similar programming language
Experience with Flask or Django
Experience with large scale, concurrent application is a plus
Experience in SQL is a MUST
Ability to write very complex SQL queries. ETL experience a plus
Ability to work with data and platform engineers to implement ML pipelines
Ability to perform independent research and analysis of complex data sets and communicate insights derived from this research to other stakeholders
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with ability to work across teams in a fast-paced environment

UNEX-1900000514

This position is open to all qualified staff throughout the Lakeridge Health commencing March 4, 2019 and closing at 11:59pm on March 11, 2019.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Coding Quality Analyst will be responsible for: day to day operations related to coding and abstracting and will perform regular audits on coding/abstracting ensure quality of coding and adherence to coding standards. In addition, the incumbent will train new coding staff, facilitate the accurate coding and electronic abstracting of all in-patient and NACRS discharges, carry out technical functions involving Meditech, 3M and CIHI (specifically by maintaining the integrity of the dictionaries on all computer systems), coordinate & process Corporate month end activities, schedule and download upgrades/updates to 3M, as well as monitor, review & implement findings from 3terra DQA. The successful candidate will support the Health Information program by bringing forward quality concerns, potential solutions and developing & monitoring quality indicators for coded data. A key component of this position is the development and delivery of education to the broader team. In your role, you will be liaising with all levels of staff, physicians and external vendors and users. You will participate in the hiring, training, orientation, of new coding staff as well as further training and orientation of existing staff. You will also be responsible for monitoring of the staff performance.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Certification with active membership in CHIMA;Progressive experience coding within a Health Records Department;
Recent related significant experience in a supervisory and leadership role;Excellent working knowledge of CCICD-10-CA coding and electronic abstracting;
Proven knowledge of the following methodologies;Case mix group (CMG);Complexity and age adjustment;Resources intensity weight (RIW);Comprehensive ambulatory care classification system (CACS);Demonstrated knowledge of Meditech and 3M abstracting;Proven excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office applications;Demonstrated organizational skills with the ability to prioritize workload and meeting workload requirements;Demonstrated effective communication, judgement and interpersonal skills;Demonstrated understanding and ability to adhere to the customer focused/patient centered philosophy;Demonstrated ability to be an effective team player;
Proven ability to work productively within a stressful environment while handling a large volume of work;
Demonstrated commitment to our core values of Compassion, Innovation, Courage and Trust;Demonstrated understanding of and commitment to Lakeridge Health's comprehensive safety programs and practices including staff safety, patient safety, and environmental safety and participation in regular in service education sessions in this area;Proven good attendance record with the ability to maintain this same standard; and,Must be willing to travel from site to site and provide own transportation.

NOTE:
This is a corporate position and while the home base is Oshawa, workload will require the individual to travel and work out of any LHC site to support quality coding.

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:

This position is open to all qualified staff throughout Lakeridge Health.

The terms and conditions of employment are in accordance with Lakeridge Health's policies and procedures.

Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the recruitment and assessment process as required under Lakeridge Health's Employment Accommodation policy. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

Whitby, ONPosition Title: FACILITIES SERVICES ANALYST

Organizational Relationship: Chief Facilities Officer


Summary:

Under the direction of the Chief Facilities Officer and the Senior Manager of Facilities Services, responsible for the accumulation of School Condition Assessment data compilation/analysis, facilities efficiency and effectiveness analysis, maintenance of the School Facilities Inventory System, updating of the VFA system and eBase and providing accounting assistance for all areas within Facilities Services.


Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Provide leadership with the accumulation of School Condition Assessment information as well as continuing to develop improved methods of providing information to senior administration and stakeholders.

2. Liaise with departments throughout the Board to gather, synthesize and present accurate information.

3. Develop multi-year analysis of facility condition and improvement information to facilitate the identification of future funding requirements and expenditures.

4. Develop tracking and reporting structures that will provide management with trending information of productivity of the Facilities Services Department’s key performance indicators.

5. Through project review and accounting analysis, prepare on-going updates, as well as a final audit binder of construction and major projects. This would also include facilitating updates to the SFIS system as well as the VFA system (a Ministry coordination software program).

6. Coordinate and implement the necessary updating processes to the Ministry of Education’s School Facilities Inventory System and VFA, to ensure the accuracy of information.

7. Prepare, develop and co-ordinate monthly financial reporting of various departments within Facilities Services, including facilitating the Board’s year end accounting process.

8. Assist with the preparation of the annual budget of the Facilities Services Department; including revenue analysis.

9. Provide training and assistance to Facilities Services staff to ensure that the Board’s accounting procedures are followed.

10. Perform account(s) analysis and prepare reports (including feasibility studies) as required, such as costing of vandalism.
11. Maintain and update new construction and major projects data in eBase.

12. Perform VFA reporting required in conjunction with Ministry Financial reporting periods.

13. Prepare statistical information and reports for Senior Management and Trustees as required.

14. Perform other duties as required.


Qualifications:

1. Post-secondary degree/diploma in Business Administration/Accounting or equivalent, plus five years progressive experience including project leadership, or an equivalent combination of education and related experience.

2. Knowledge of building systems and facility management is an asset.

3. Technical understanding of Ministry of Education reporting requirements, funding models (including capital, school condition improvement and school renewal), and Capital Asset requirements.

4. Proficient with computerized financial systems, software applications and spreadsheets.

5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to work independently as well as part of a team.

6. Prior school board sector experience is preferred.

POSITION: Distribution/Allocation Analyst
EMPLOYMENT STATUS: Exempt
REPORTS TO: Demand Planning & Distribution Manager
LOCATION: Sephora Field Support Center (FSC) – Toronto

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Distribution/Allocation Analyst works in partnership with the Category Merchant, Supply Chain, Operations, Merchandise Planning and Demand Planning Teams to achieve optimal store inventory levels while maximizing profitable sales and bottom line results. The Distribution/Allocation Analyst applies analytical skills to distribute product to multiple store formats across Canada.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

Determine optimal store allocation and replenishment based on the Merchant strategy, merchandising plan, store size and sales performance
Provide data and recommendations to influence the development of department/class level plans
Assist in the development of department/class level allocation strategies
Ensure allocations and replenishment is completed by the required timelines for DC processing to ensure product arrives to pre-defined store set-up dates.
Manage the inventory levels for product categories through analysis of trends, exceptions, rate of sale, minimum order quantities and minimum presentation quantities.
Store level in stock and sales analysis with the goal to increase in stocks
Maintain a well-balanced inventory in each assigned classification to maximize sales while minimizing obsolescence
Partner with Planning/ Merchandising team to identify and communicate sales and inventory trends or issues.
Monitors and manages store side forecasts for newness and core SKUs to ensure in stock targets are met.
Management of all Hotline Online Store Requests for respective brands.
Provide inventory analytics with information to maximize sales and profits
Share responsibility with the merchants, merchandise planning and demand planning team for Weeks of Supply, age of stock, and stock to sales (category and store) provide analysis and provide recommendations as required.
Analyze and report all in-season sell through results. Evaluate performance of promotions and key programs to extract learnings. Complete ad-hoc analysis or reports as required in a timely matter as it relates to allocations, sell-through, and inventory
Compile store grading analysis based on required timelines and liase with merchandising, merchandise planning and demand planning teams to review proposed store clusters/grades.
Collaborate with operations, districts store specialists, to ensure timely product allocations to new and/or renovated stores or any special store request or concerns.
Effectively communicate expected store delivery flow to DC Operations and Operations team and troubleshoot any issues
Provide feedback and recommendations for various processes and applications to improve efficiencies in everyday tasks and assigned projects.
Ad Hoc Analysis, Projects/ Reporting as requested.

CORE COMPETENCIES:
Analytic Skills: Ability to think objectively and interpret meaningful themes from quantitative and qualitative data
Financial and Business Acumen: Ability to evaluate financial and business indicators and translate data into actionable information to drive results; proficiency in retail math
Problem Solving & Decision Quality: Able to use rigorous logic and methods to solve problems with effective solutions
Influencing & Negotiation: Can present ideas and directions that lead others to action
Systems and Tools Acumen: Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, and have aptitude to learn technical applications quickly
Collaboration: Able to build constructive and effective relationships with a broad and diverse group of business partners
Possess strong organizational and time management skills

REQUIREMENTS:
Post-Secondary Education in Finance, Supply Chain and/or Business preferred
1 – 2 years of Allocation and/or Supply Chain Experience required
Strong numbers aptitude; able to compile statistical reports
Problem solving and analytical skills
Strong organizational and time management skills; able to handle multiple priorities
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Flexible; team player.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
SEPHORA has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora was acquired by luxury group Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, SEPHORA COLLECTION. Sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. Sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the Beauty Studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from Personal Beauty Advisors, and exclusive retail technology SKINCARE IQ, COLOR IQ, and FRAGRANCE IQ. Sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

Flinks is a data company that empowers businesses to provide better financial services to consumers, by connecting users' bank accounts, providing financial insights and credit risk intelligence. Driven by the belief that data should belong to consumers, Flinks connects to over 250 million financial accounts. Trusted by hundreds of world-class companies, Flinks helps them digitize their processes, improve their user experience and reduce delinquency. We're following the path of some of Canada’s leading tech companies including Shopify, Wealthsimple, and Slack, with a nomination at the Canadian Innovation Awards for top New Startup of the year. Flinks tech is a core-to-business component for companies that are reshaping the world of finance - TransferWise, WealthSimple, and hundreds other FinTechs. Flinks currently has two offices in Canada, one in Toronto (Wework space - 240 Richmond Street West) and one at Montreal (1001 Rue Lenoir suite 116).

About the Job
We are looking for a Data Scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights.

In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine-learning and research.
Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions.

Your tasks in this role include :

Identifying valuable data sources and automating collection processes
Undertaking preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyzing large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Building predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combining models through ensemble modeling
Presenting information using data visualization techniques
Proposing solutions and strategies for business challenges
Collaborating with engineering and product development teams

About you
You are eager to operate and learn in one of Canada's fastest growing startup - fast pace, high autonomy, high accountability work culture.

Core skills/qualifications:

3-4 years + Machine learning, Deep learning, Data mining
Python
SQL
Agile environment
Experience using business intelligence tools and data frameworks (Hadoop)
Analytical mind and business acumen
Strong math skills (e.g. statistics, algebra)
Nice to have : Big Query, Azure, AWS - Data ETL development - Google Cloud suite

By joining our team, you will have opportunity to provide direct support to health services and community based programming. You will build and support strong working relationships with First Nations and Inuit communities, families, and individuals, with a focus on improving health outcomes and reducing health risks.
Duties
Do you like a challenge when you come to work? If so, the position of a Benefits Analyst could be the perfect opportunity for you. You will receive a high volume of incoming calls from our clients and stakeholders in a fast paced call centre environment. Due to the high volume of requests you will learn how to prioritize your day as you will have continuous interruptions, responding to inquiries over the phone and processing fax requests. This could be an opportunity for you to develop new skills and further develop skills you already have; such skills include attention to detail, improved computer skills, communication skills, conflict management, workload management and prioritization.
Work environment
Non-Insured Health Benefits is a unit of Indigenous Services Canada which is the Federal department responsible for helping First Nations and Inuit people of Canada to maintain and improve their health, while respecting individual choices and circumstances.
Intent of the process
A pool of qualified candidates will be established and may be used to staff identical or similar positions with various tenures such as permanent , specified term, acting, assignments/secondments, or deployments. Toronto, ON$70,000 - $85,000 a yearCrafting something unique takes more than good ideas: it takes a group of dedicated professionals who aren’t afraid to try something new, make it better, and then make it perfect.

If you’re looking for a job that stretches your creative muscles, and gives you the chance to be better every day, this is the opportunity for you.

At VISO, we’re always searching for ways to innovate. Whether in our groundbreaking custom lighting designs, our company culture, or our business strategies, we know that being better is the only way forward. That spirit has fueled our success for over 25 years, and has driven us to be unique, uncompromising, and exceptional in everything we do.

Now we’re looking to add a new member to our analytics team: someone with expertise, technical ability, and a positive, collaborative attitude.

That’s where you come in

As our new Business Analyst, you’ll be responsible for a range of financial duties: things like reporting, data management, costing and analysis.

A big part of this role involves working with our new ERP software, EPICOR. Here you’ll manage end to end business processes, and identify, define, and analyze business requirements. You’ll also support our software transition by being a resource for EPICOR, and contribute to change and product management.

Succeeding in this role means always looking forward to new opportunities, whether that involves improving our systems for efficiency, finding new applications, or furthering our business goals.

Business analysis is an integral role in our company, and you’ll learn all about our core operations as you gain experience with us. If you can deliver on and exceed the expectations of this role, there will be plenty of chances to grow into more senior positions and responsibilities.

Along with relevant experience, we’re seeking someone who:

Takes initiative – you have the drive and independence to finish projects and tasks on your own, and know how to meet deadlines.
Loves learning – constant improvement is your motto: you are an innovator who’s always looking for a better way.
Excels in group settings – you’re as good with people as you are with analysis, and can use strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with anyone who can lend a hand.
Thinks creatively – you’re strategic and excel in problem solving. You aren’t afraid to try different approaches, and know how to switch tactics when things aren’t working.
Working @ Viso

This will be a full-time, permanent position with hours from 9-5, Monday to Friday. We offer a competitive compensation package, which includes a salary between $70,000 and $85,000 per year, commensurate with your experience. You’ll also get full medical and dental after a trial period, as well as free parking, and potential for bonuses.

We do work culture a little bit differently at VISO. Or office is pet friendly, and we encourage people to be themselves at work. As a group we love collaboration, and maintaining the fun, positive, family-like environment of our workplace is a top priority.

If you want to join a team that’s supportive and always looking to do better, we want to hear from you.

Qualifications
Experience in business analysis, preferably in manufacturing or a related industry
Bachelors degree in business or a related field
Strong business communication skills, and ability/interest in working directly with clients
Proficiency with ERP software, including EPICOR
Demonstrated ability to implement new software/systems related to business analytics
We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “Help” button in the application.

We will review applications, and look forward to hearing from you.
Please send your resume and cover letter to hr@visoinc.com with the subject title “Business Analyst”.

We look forward to receiving your resume!

Toronto, ONTucows is a quiet, but very successful, twenty-year-old global Internet services company. From its humble beginnings as a software sharing platform, Tucows is now the world’s second largest domain registrar and provider of wholesale Internet services, and through its brand, Ting, is revolutionizing mobile and Internet access in the U.S. Today, 600 Tucows employees work in 10 offices worldwide and help generate over $300 million in annual revenue. They’ve also helped Ting become one of the top-rated mobile providers.
Description:
Tucows is looking to add a new member to our Analytics, Insights and Reporting team. Together, we’re responsible for all of the reporting, analytics, data flows, visualization, and related business intelligence operations within our quickly growing company.
We’ve got a lot of data, and we’re looking for someone to help us get the most out of it. To do that, you’ll need to be comfortable working end to end in the data pipeline; from extracting data from source systems into our data lake, to building visualizations and dashboards in Looker and everything in between.
You will work with business, product, and engineering stakeholders to understand their needs and priorities, as well as to collaborate and ensure that their reporting requirements are captured in the development process. You’ll then build and work with data pipelines, acquiring data from source systems and moving it through our data hierarchy, from messy and raw to clean and aggregated. Lastly you’ll explore the data with visualization tools and statistical techniques to help make our products better and to improve the experience of our customers.
Key Skills and Experience:
Top-notch communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills
Excellent math and statistical analysis skills, especially as they pertain to business and experimentation
An interest and proficiency in the presentation and visualization of numbers and statistical data
Ability to understand business imperatives and drivers, find relevant data correlations, and create processes by which the data correlations are translated to information flows that help drive the business
1-2 years of quantitative analysis work experience
2+ years experience handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reports
Strong expertise with an SQL language, as well with as database structures and data lake architectures
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Google Suite
Nice to Have:
Experience with Pentaho Data Integration
Experience with Looker
Proficiency with Python
An understanding of the principles, tools and processes of data science
Oracle PL/SQL
Experience with Kafka
Education:
Post secondary education in a technical field, or B.S./M.S.

Job Description
The Day & Ross Transportation Group is currently seeking a full-time Operations Analyst for our Freight division in Hartland, NB.

Day & Ross Freight is committed to an exceptional customer experience. We achieve this by being: authentic, committed, caring, trusted, and enthusiastic.

As an Operations Analyst, you are the owner of data collection, analysis and presentation for the Operations Team. It is your responsibility to ensure your work is completed in an accurate and timely format.

This position is all about data collection, analysis and presentation to support improvement initiatives.
To be successful in this position, you will be able to do the following (not an exhaustive list of responsibilities):
Own the collection and analysis of operations KPI.
Identify potentially inaccurate points within the data, validate source of data and confirm accuracy to ensure understanding of the data.
Create awareness, identify issues, problems, opportunities.
Use a data analysis method to support the determination of root cause solution as related to gaps in performance measures. The data analysis prepared will be used to impact efficiency and improvement, therefore accuracy and presentation becomes a key component.
Recommend solutions when it comes to the measurement process and collection of data. Bases decision on how their actions impact by understanding the impact that data they are presenting plays within business decisions.
Prepares all dash-board reports and display in a user friendly format. Presentation of data to department with explanation to support findings. Quality based on mutual respect, friendly, customer focused.
Provides accurate data/presentation and translates the relevant data to achieve business objectives.
Provides support with change initiatives by providing relevant data to the team to demonstrate the requirement for change.

To be qualified for this role, please ensure your resume clearly displays some or all of the following:
Computer skills – accuracy, MS products, data and statistical analysis, exposure to Operations Management techniques is preferred
Advanced communication skills (written and verbal)
Superior time management skills
Manage multiple tasks with the ability to focus and work independently on projects with appropriate guidance
Deadline driven environment
Team player focused
Results focused
Education – University or technical training with a focus on data analysis
Previous experience in similar data analysis roles required; within the transportation industry an asset

job_title: RES O 24R - Research Analyst **CLOSING DATE AMMENDED
job_description:
Research Analyst
Research Officer R24
An eligibility list may be established.

Bring your strong analytical and technical skills to this dynamic opportunity

The Education Analytics Branch enables the K-12 sector in B.C. to be a world leader in the use of education data to support program and strategic planning, system performance and quality delivery of personalized education. The Branch oversees the management, security and stewardship of education data and client services. The Education System Outcomes Unit is responsible for reporting on education system performance; for supporting Ministry program areas and School Districts and Schools in their use of data to make evidence-based policy decisions; for overseeing the administration and reporting of the Student Learning Survey; for fulfilling data requests and releases (e.g. government partners, legislated representatives such as RCY and FNESC, and researchers); and for enhanced data visualizations and analysis.

The Research Analyst develops and implements technical solutions to identify, and summarize for various audiences, the key information and trends that impact student achievement. As well as the Ministry and other government organizations, external organizations and researchers use the results of this work to improve understanding of the educational system and service delivery. The Research Analyst will spend much of their time providing expert consultation on technical requirements for the ministry’s data needs, manipulating large data sets within a data warehouse environment, reviewing data sets for quality and consistency, and summarizing data for diverse audiences utilizing data visualization tools and visualization dashboards. The position works with ministry program areas, management, professional and administrative staff and external contractors to support data-driven decisions across the entire K-12 system. The Research Analyst plays a lead role in the on-going maintenance of the current Education Data Warehouse (EDW) and in the development of an improved infrastructure and data model.

The BC Public Service is an award winning employer and offers employees competitive benefits, amazing learning opportunities and a chance to engage in rewarding work with exciting career development opportunities. For more information, please see What We Offer.

The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.
The BC Public Service is an inclusive and accessible employer. Please advise the hiring manager if any accommodations are required to assist you to ensure equitable participation.
For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact Nicole.Gardner@gov.bc.ca. DO NOT SEND YOUR APPLICATION TO THIS EMAIL ADDRESS. For more information about how to complete your job application, add/edit your resume and for more useful tips when applying for jobs, please refer to the Your Job Application page on the MyHR website. If you are still experiencing technical difficulty applying for a competition, please send an e-mail to BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca, before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible to assist you.

NOTE: Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.

Job Requirements:
In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience as outlined below:
Bachelor’s Degree in statistics, mathematics, public or business administration or social science field, or related field.
Minimum two years of experience with SQL programming.
Minimum two years of experience with relational and/or object data modelling, data analysis, data warehousing techniques, data management principles, structured analysis and design.
Experience using statistical and data mining packages, including open source tools like R.
Preference may be given to applicants who have any of the following:
Two years of experience with Visual Basic programming.
In-depth Excel spreadsheet experience, including Excel automation.
Experience conducting qualitative and quantitative research.
Experience with data visualization tools, including Tableau, Oracle Business Intelligence
Experience and familiarity with Ministry of Education datasets (demographics, results, transition, and satisfaction).

Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be assessed on the Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies as outlined in the attached Job Profile located in the Additional Information section at the bottom of the posting.

A Criminal Record Check (CRC) will be required.

APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Cover letter required: NO - Please do not submit a cover letter as it will not be reviewed.

Resume required: YES - A resume is required as part of your application, however, it may not be used for initial shortlisting purposes.
Questionnaire: YES (COMPREHENSIVE) - As part of the application process, you will be prompted to complete a comprehensive online questionnaire to demonstrate how you meet the job requirements. Please allot approximately 60 minutes to complete the questionnaire.

IMPORTANT: Comprehensive questionnaire responses will be used to shortlist applicants against the job requirements. Please ensure you include all relevant information about your educational accomplishments and employment history including job titles, start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and your accountabilities and accomplishments.

Domestic students must meet ONE of the following criteria, to be eligible to work as a Student Assistant/Student Research Assistant:
1. The domestic student must be enrolled in, and maintain, a minimum of one or more (3 credit) courses at Douglas College throughout the work term; OR

2. The domestic student must have been enrolled in, and maintained, a minimum of one or more (3 credit) courses at Douglas College in the term immediately preceding the work term and has indicated an intention to enroll at the college in the term immediately following the work term; OR

3. The domestic student must be enrolled in, and maintain a minimum of two or more (3 credit) courses at another accredited public post-secondary institution in British Columbia throughout the work term

International students must meet ONE of the following criteria, to be eligible to work as a Student Assistant/Student Research Assistant:
1. The international student is enrolled in full-time studies at Douglas College, throughout the academic year; OR

2. The international student, who is not a Douglas College student, but is an international student at another accredited public post-secondary institution in B.C., has a valid Study Permit that has the notation – “May accept employment on or off campus if meeting eligibility criteria as per R186 (F), (V) or (W). An original copy of a Social Insurance Number (SIN) and an original Study Permit are required by law before commencing work at Douglas College.

Strong organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple projects, prioritize and work in a fast paced team environment and meet tight deadlines.

The Data Analyst works with corporate data assets to ensure accuracy and integrity of all recorded data. They collaborate with key stakeholders throughout the organization to understand their unique business processes and related source systems. Upon gaining an understanding of this, the Data Analyst is responsible for independently producing assignments in alignment with our objectives of data quality, organization, analysis and reporting. You will take into consideration the company’s commitment to our seven Core Values such as Sustainability (people, the planet, and profit) in the planning and implementation of all actions related to your area of responsibility.
Perform detailed analysis of company data sources to identify, model and understand our how it flows and supports business decision making
Work with key stakeholders to identify, create and deliver reports and dashboards according to requirements. Make recommendations on opportunities for continuous improvement
Develop an enterprise data roadmap for established company-wide data principles and integration of data assets into the corporate data warehouse
Support the development and maintenance of a data dictionary and business glossaries
Identify data discrepancies and quality issues. Work to ensure data consistency and integrity of all corporate data
Support and participate in the Enterprise Information Governance and Master Data Management programs
Participate in data related discussions with stakeholders across the company
Remain current with new developments in data management practices and technologies to support and improve data management services
Maintain strict data confidentiality by analyzing and mitigating data security risks
Follow and adhere to all given instructions including work procedures, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP)
Strictly adhere to and observe all safety policies as outlined in the company policies and training sessions
Other duties as assigned

Requirements

Technical
Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in a scientific field of study, preferably computer science, database design, programming or business and systems analysis
Minimum of five (5) years' working experience in data analysis including database development, data modeling, relational and dimensional modeling and information management and analytics
Working knowledge of PowerBI or other Business Intelligence (BI) tools
Ability to produce information products for clients with a variety of BI tools
Proficient in writing optimized SQL queries, including all features up to SQL 2017
Awareness of industry trends and best practices in data mining, data analysis and dashboard design
Experience in Human Resources (HR) and financial systems, specifically HR Analytics would be considered an asset
Attributes
Excellent analytical skills with highly developed problem-solving ability and the ability to break problems down to bring clarity to complexity
Good communication skills and a collaborative approach, able to work in cross functional teams to achieve results
Self-motivated and proactive attitude, actively identifies opportunities to add value to the company
Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and prioritize tasks
Interest in people data and/or HR information systems

job_description:
Toronto, ONBusiness System Analyst

Job Purpose & Summary

Reporting to the Manager, Business Systems Analysts, the Business System Analyst provides system analysis, software deployment, testing and application support on projects, enhancements and operations related to one or more business system applications (e.g. Core Banking System, Account Opening/Loan Origination System, Customer Relationship Management System, etc.). The Business System Analyst collaborates with business partners and colleagues to identify user requirements, perform business process and systems analysis, assess process improvement opportunities, and support overall project solutions. In addition, this role is considered a subject matter expert in the business process(es) their assigned system(s) supports.

The ideal candidate for this role is detail oriented with strong analytical and communication skills. Experience working in the financial services industry is considered an asset.

Lead requirements gathering and analysis

Document system business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
Document system data and process flows
Lead and/or participate in application functional testing, acceptance testing and end-user training
Provide subject matter support to business and IT projects
Manage system change requests
Write and manage queries on the system database
Provide second level technical support to employees for applications, third party integration points and databases
Monitor vendor ticketing systems and ensure all issues are accurately and timely documented
Use strong communication skills to clearly explain both the concept and details of new functionality or new processes to business stakeholders
Assist with the development of metrics within system related technology and business organizations

Undergraduate degree in Business, Technology or a related field
Business Analysis Training or Certification
2-3 years in a related position (i.e. Business Analysis or Banking Systems Analyst role)

Credit Union or other Financial Institution experience, considered an asset

Strong understanding of Business Process Management
Strong research and analytical skills
Strong organizational and prioritization skills
Strong interpersonal skills and communication skills
Proven problem-solving skills
Requirements Management
Keen to understand and learn unfamiliar processes

Good knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL)
Experience with Relational Databases

Business Process Management tools (e.g. Visio)

Responsible for pricing strategies as well as developing, implementing and leading projects that optimize revenue, increase site utilization and broaden the market for GSD services.

Reporting to the Manager, Integrated Planning & Effectiveness, the Learning Analyst ensures successful planning, development and implementation of new decision support solutions at the divisional and institutional level. This includes identifying the needs of multiple administrative groups, OLFMs, on campus faculty and students, proposing data analysis and other needs-based solutions that will meet those needs, developing project plans that include end-to-end project support and ensuring the successful implementation of those plans.
MAJOR DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Independently designs, develops and applies solutions in consultation with key stakeholders to improve student success and/or institutional effectiveness.
Identifies, integrates and validates appropriate data and other information sources to respond to requests.
Develops and manages detailed project plans and documentation that define overall project schedules.
Arranges and conducts frequent collaborative work sessions that require sustained periods of focus from all parties in order to achieve acceptable solutions.
Manipulates databases and other data sources including queries required to meet institutional research and reporting needs.
Researches, recommends and implements business intelligence tools and processes including data mining, modeling and visualization techniques to identify trends, patterns and connections within the data.
Designs and integrates the data in meaningful visualizations/dashboards to empower data-supported decision-making.
Designs and implements communication strategies to ensure regular communication and transparency with faculty, leadership and staff through the use of tools including wikis, websites, meetings and emails.
Uses discretion when responding to requests and resolves conflicts among stakeholders as they arise.
Establishes, documents and communicates processes and procedures to ensure new solution implementation is successful.
Reviews existing research related to learning analytics, data-supported learning design, student persistence and uses that information to recommend next steps for implementation for the institution.
Participates in special projects and development of analysis.
REPORTS TO
Manager, Integrated Planning & Effectiveness

QUALIFICATIONS
EDUCATION:
Bachelor’s degree in an appropriate analytical discipline plus post-graduation education leading to a certificate or certification in a field related to data visualization, business analysis, decision support or predictive analytics

EXPERIENCE:
Five years of experience including:
Two years’ experience gathering, synthesizing, evaluating and interpreting data to produce actionable information
One year experience using data visualization tools (e.g.: Tableau) to build dashboards and user friendly reports
One year leading collaborative work group in the completion of tasks that require high levels of concentration

REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITIES & KNOWLEDGE
Analytical ability in order to collect, analyze and report data; analyze and interpret discrepancies, issues or problems to ensure data accuracy and integrity
Ability to manipulate data to produce meaningful reports and obtain advice when precedents are unclear or unavailable and determine methods for ensuring compliance with functional/ organizational policies and procedures
Acute attention to detail and ability to maintain accuracy
Demonstrated advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Power Point in a Windows environment including, but not limited to, experience making mathematical and statistical calculations, pivot tables, graphs, etc.
Advanced knowledge of data visualization and applicable software such as SAS, SPSS and Tableau
Knowledge of SQL scripting language
Exceptionally high level of initiative to solve complex problems
Independent ability to plan, develop and apply solutions, with or without technological requirements
Ability to plan, organize and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines

WORKING CONDITIONS
Sitting at desk and computer for long periods of time; general office conditions

Smiths Falls, ONLegalization has opened up the recreational cannabis market in Canada, and the global demand for medical cannabis continues to expand. In this exciting new environment, Canopy Growth’s mission is to be the No. 1 cannabis company in the world. We’re looking for incredible people to join us on the journey.

The Company

With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production and operations spanning five continents, Canopy Growth Corporation (“Canopy Growth”) is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world. It is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC), and is part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries — including its flagship, Tweed, and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand — are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls, Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of its success, and takes pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity. Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue and increase our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Inventory Control Manager, the Inventory Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data to determine the optimal level of inventory to keep on hand to support customer service. The ideal candidate is experienced with MRP/ERP systems and has sound knowledge of supply chain processes.

Responsibilities

Monitor inventory performance to optimize stock levels to meet customer service (in stock) objectives, ensure inventory accuracy and to identify non-productive inventory (surplus or obsolescence)
Continuously analyze and recommend improvement in local supply chain to improve service
Coordinate stock levels during product introductions/de-listings to minimize shortages/disposals
Ensure inventory and related processes, transactions, and records are accurate and sufficient
Collaboration with internal teams to ensure customer/market requirements are properly reflected and supported in inventory investments
Develop stocking recommendations for various product categories to support growth
Manage transfer shipments based on stocking plans
Maintain on-going and effective working relationships with Sales, Customer Care, Warehouse, Production and Shipping groups
Daily updates on stock status prepared and circulated
Working through large amounts of data while ensuring data integrity
Inventory analysis and reporting of various metrics associated with product availability

Experience

2 years’ experience in an analytic role
Strong technology skills, including Microsoft-Office, e-Commerce platforms, systems, CRM databases, report preparation and multi-channel communication
Resolve problems by analyzing data and identifying problems
Excellent organizational, analytical and communication skills (oral and written)
A strong sense of personal integrity

Other Details

This is a full time position based out of Smiths Falls, ON.

Calgary, ABData Scientist
Location: Calgary, AB, CA
Company: Imperial
Job description
We are seeking Junior and Senior Data Scientists for Imperial’s Digital Accelerator's data science group who can solve business problems by leveraging machine learning, optimization and other analytical techniques in a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, strategic partners and subject domain experts

The Upstream Digital Accelerator (UDA) is a new digital accelerator within Imperial conceived to leverage the power of digital technologies (including AI) to solve highly complex problems across Imperial oil and gas operations, spanning conventional, mining, SAGD and other thermal recovery methods.

Operating within an Agile framework, with multi-disciplinary teams, ideas from the business are quickly actioned and converted into usable products (MVPs). To this end the UDA offers a fast-paced, exciting environment and access to a diverse set of problems. Strong support from the CEO and senior management, and a close working partnership with Imperial’s asset team ensure endless opportunities to create significant impact on the business.

With access to massive data sets, immense computation power and challenging, previously unsolved problems, UDA is an ideal place for Data Scientists to push the boundaries of what they know and can achieve. As an example, a recent project saw the use of 60 stacked XGBoost models feed predictions into a custom built numeric gradient descent optimization algorithm on a 100 GB dataset to significantly improve recovery rate from mining operations.
Furthermore, UDA encourages its members to showcase their work to the data science community through publications, conferences and seminars.

As a new and rapidly expanding group within Imperial, the UDA provides a unique opportunity for Data Scientists to pioneer the use of cutting edge analytics in upstream oil and gas.

As a Data Scientist, you will:
Work as a member of the Imperial Digital Accelerator with a team of highly talented Data Scientists, led by a Principal Data Scientist, to unlock substantial value from operations
Work on previously unsolved, highly complex, diverse problems across Imperial upstream assets in a fast-paced Agile environment
Understand and translate business requirements into technical, end-to-end execution plans for predictive modeling
Be involved from the early stages of defining data needs and sourcing data, all-the-way through to creating production ready predictive models
Work with Principal Data Scientist to set the strategy for analytical execution
Lead efforts in data quality, consistency and correctness
Ensure your models and analytics are tested with the end users and iterate as needed
Communicate key metrics to stakeholders, as you progress through delivery
Mentor and guide junior members of the team through the modeling process
Keep up to date with the latest advances in the data science field
Publish innovative and breakthrough work in conferences and journal
Qualifications
Academic:
MS in machine learning, computer science, statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, economics or related quantitative field is preferred
PhD in a quantitative field is an asset

Other:
Experience leading small teams
Experience implementing machine learning algorithms across a range of complex supervised, unsupervised learning problems
Experience working on complex, ill-defined engineering problems
Experience leading end-to-end modeling including translating the business problem into an analytical approach and delivering results
Experience with problems that involves optimization expertise
Strong programming skills in at least one object oriented programming language
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audience, excellent communication skills
Strong expertise in operations research and optimization
Previous domain expertise in energy/ industrial goods
Experience working in cross-functional teams, building production quality and large scale deployments in an Agile environment

Start date: May 1, 2019

Location: Calgary, AB
Your benefits
A company committed to career growth - we recruit those who are interested in a career with Imperial and prefer to develop and promote people from within. Our career management process means that you will likely perform a number of unique, challenging roles during your career.
Successful networking and mentoring programs - enables you to spend time with managers from across the organization to learn about other departments and opportunities. Also allows you to connect with peers at a similar experience level.
Commitment to safety, ethics & continuous improvement - these standards are the reason Imperial is an industry leader. You will work for a company that upholds safety and ethics ideals and continues to seek out ways to improve.
Exceptional benefits program - includes competitive savings, retirement, and healthcare plans that you can customize to meet your individual needs. A comprehensive relocation package is provided, if required. Educational and physical fitness financial assistance programs round out our benefits package.
Continuous learning environment - encourages you to augment your skills and capabilities.
If you are talented, driven, and want to make meaningful contributions that really impact environmental, safety and bottom line objectives, then you owe it to yourself to apply with Imperial.
Early Professional Development Program - provides you with the opportunity to specialize in a specific area of expertise or develop skills in a variety of different areas. You will quickly be given large areas of responsibility and will be encouraged to take on stretch assignments as you progress.
Competitive vacation package - provides you with three weeks of vacation (the first year is pro-rated based on your hiring date) and one scheduled Friday off per month and five floating days annually for use at your discretion with approval.
Who we are
A leading member of Canada’s energy industry, Imperial offers exciting opportunities across our upstream, downstream and chemical, and corporate divisions. We are committed to high standards, applying technology and innovation to meet energy demands in a safe, reliable and environmentally sound manner. No matter what your career path, we provide the platform to elevate your goals and achieve your ambitions, while providing support through wide-ranging programs and benefits.

Toronto, ONPosition Overview:
Jack of all trades, and master of many? In this newly created role, you bring a wealth of technical and business acumen to the table. Your reporting, research and analytical skills are second to none. This role is split into two parts – reporting and research and analysis.

In the Reporting portion (primary focus), you will create and maintain dashboards, board/steering committee presentations, SLA/KPI reports, Scorecards, SOX (Sarbanes Oxley Act) compliance dashboards and any other reporting required by the IT Group.

In the Research & Analysis portion (secondary focus), you will use your deep understanding of the IT realm to perform research and build business cases for Technology and Related projects.

And lastly, to keep the role dynamic, you will participate on special projects as required.
Key Responsibilities:
Create and maintain dashboards, board/steering committee presentations, SLA/KPI reports, SOX compliance reports, Scorecards and any other reporting required by the IT Group:
Gather required data from systems, vendors, and required sources in various formats (raw, formatted, etc.) in order to aggregate in a presentable manner
Setup a framework to allow for pulling and reporting data in the required cadence (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, etc.)
Setup process and policy to measure variances to agreed SLA’s, KPI’s
Adapt presentations based on audience level (e.g., board-level vs. department-level)
Revise/maintain SLA’s in partnership with the business
Other kinds of compliance reporting as required
Research and build Business Cases for Technology and related projects:
Research various solutions and create compelling business cases reviewing options in an unbiased manner
Create TCO and ROI models to support recommendations
Participate in evaluation of technology and value
Work independently, hands-on, and through others as needed
Work with various lines of business and stakeholders, ensuring all business requirements are captured
Stay abreast of new metrics for Governance (including SOX), KPI, SLA reporting for IT Organizations
Stay abreast of emerging technologies that would benefit the business
Assist in special projects, departmental invoicing, and perform other duties as required
Work with minimal supervision
In building business cases, you will gather requirements, create competitive analysis, solution comparison, RFPs, RFQs, and any other work required to complete the business case(s).
Education, Qualifications and Experience
A post-secondary education in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration and/or relevant experience
Gathering, analyzing, documenting and reporting data related to IT internal control processes over financial reporting
Coordinating efforts across multiple IT functions and departments to ensure SOX compliance requirements are met within required deadlines
Responsible for identifying internal control deficiencies and ensuring the timely implementation of corrective actions
Sarbanes Oxley Compliance testing on IT controls and documentation
Significant interaction with key business process managers and IT management
Interaction with IT third-party vendors managing and/or supporting the company’s internal controls
Completing GAP assessments on IT controlled environments involving SOX Controls
Reviewing external service providers through SSAE18/SOC reports and Complimentary End User Controls
Performing deficiency assessments of SOX IT controls and preparing reporting
Reviewing and documenting with management exceptions identified during walkthroughs or testing of controls
Maintaining an inventory of all SOX IT deficiencies
Working with process owners to develop management action plans for SOX IT deficiencies, monitoring the status, and testing for completion by the due date
Supporting business partners with remediation activities of SOX deficiencies
Supporting Internal and External Audit testing of SOX IT controls
5+ years working in an IT Analyst role performing similar Responsibilities (preference given to candidates that are strong in the Reporting portion)
5+ years experience with creating executive-level presentations, dashboards, scorecards, and reports to various levels of an organization focused on IT
5+ years experience with enterprise reporting platforms (SSRS, Tableau, etc.)
5+ years hands-on experience with various application and technology stacks
Possess high organizational and planning skills
Works effectively and independently in a dynamic environment
Responsible, takes ownership of work, and follows through to completion
Possess a high attention to detail and highly analytical
Able to learn new technologies quickly with minimal supervision, self-starter
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to clearly articulate and document business requirements, designs, installation plans, etc.
Ability to maintain productive business relationships
Personable; Tactful; Collaborative
Knowledge, Skills and Attributes
Working knowledge on SOX Compliance and COSO (or similar) internal controls framework
Strong working knowledge of business processes and controls, including IT Change Management, User Access Management, End User Computing and Entity Level Controls
Experience in auditing/reviewing the work of external service providers including working knowledge of SSAE18/SOC reports and Complimentary End User Controls
Adapting to Change: Have the ability to anticipate change, is open to new ideas, processes, product lines, and technologies. Treat these changes as opportunities for learning. Is able to view potential changes from a bigger picture and different angles to gain a more complete understanding of its possible impacts.
Communication: Demonstrates strong skills in all forms of communication; able to deliver convincing, knowledgeable and well-articulated written and verbal statements both internally and externally. Persuasive and skillful presenter, who encourages candid and open communication within the team.
Continuous Learning and Development : Actively pursues self-development on an on-going basis, demonstrates willingness to take on challenging tasks. Regularly seeks and applies feedback as part of personal and professional growth. Encourages others to learn and continually looks for ways to improve the business.
Customer Centricity: Makes best efforts to identify customers’ real needs, and to address these needs with value-added and customized solutions. Acts quickly to not only meet customers’ needs but to exceed their expectations.
Delivering Results : Creates detailed action plans, sets realistic goals, identifies success criteria; Demonstrates accountability and promotes a sense of urgency; Accepts responsibility for the outcomes of group efforts and holds others accountable for their work.
Organizational Commitment : Demonstrates the right behaviors for working efficiently and effectively in an entrepreneurial environment. Always makes sure that his/her decisions and actions will be in the best interests of Canada Goose and its customers.
Teamwork and Collaboration: Develops collaborative working relationships within and across functions. Cultivates a relationship of trust and credibility across functions to ensure long-term effectiveness. Capitalizes on the diverse perspectives and talents of the whole team in accomplishing objectives.
Understanding the Business: Is able to make informed, well-founded decisions and recommendations quickly, supported by facts and business judgment.

Job Description:
carter's inc. Canada (TGCC), a growing national retailer of children's apparel, requires full-time Analyst,Transportation and Distribution for our Distribution Centre (DC) located in Cambridge, Ontario.
Communicate effectively and professionally on a day to day basis with internal and external customers.
Responsible for approving booking requests from vendors and processing for receipt at the DC.
Liaise cross-functionally with various departments to resolve/coordinate logistics issues.
Ensure data accuracy in the ERP, TMS and various Carter’s systems to provide inbound shipment visibility to various audiences.
Analyse and action daily and weekly transportation reports to support inbound prioritization between DC leadership and Freight forwarders.
Analyse current and future product flow to identify and action capacity network constraints and bypass opportunities
Focus on analysis by looking at the full supply chain- factory to Store and determining when goods arrive in DC and when they leave for stores.
Identify collision points to determine what we can more proactively do- hold at yard, temp space, 3pl or if time allows to convert to bypass.
Conduct comprehensive analysis of end-to-end supply chain data to provide recommendations to leadership on how to effectively manage current and future space constraints, provide retail and wholesale customers with visibility and plan for future growth
The role will be located at our Distribution Centre with up to 40% travel to our corporate office located in Mississauga, ON.
La société carter's inc. Canada (TGCC), un détaillant national de vêtements pour enfants en pleine croissance, est à la recherche d’une personne pour le poste à temps plein d’analyste des transports et de la distribution à son centre de distribution (CD) situé à Cambridge, en Ontario.
Communiquer de manière efficace et professionnelle tous les jours avec les clients internes et externes.
S’occuper de l’approbation des demandes de réservation des fournisseurs et du traitement de la marchandise reçue au CD.
Établir la liaison à tous les niveaux entre les différents services pour résoudre les problèmes et régler les questions de logistique.
Garantir l’exactitude des données dans le système de planification des ressources de l’entreprise (PRE), le système de gestion des transports (SGT) et autres systèmes Carter’s pour assurer la visibilité des expéditions reçues auprès de différents publics.
Analyser les rapports de transport quotidiens et hebdomadaires et prendre les mesures qui s’imposent dans le but de favoriser l’établissement des priorités pour les expéditions entrantes entre l’équipe de leadership au CD et les entrepreneurs de transport.
Analyser l’acheminement actuel et futur des produits pour déterminer les contraintes de capacité pesant sur le réseau et découvrir des moyens pour les contourner.
Se centrer sur l’analyse en examinant la chaîne d’approvisionnement complète de l’usine aux magasins et en déterminant le moment de l’arrivée des biens au CD et de leur départ vers les magasins.
Reconnaître les points de collision pour déterminer ce que nous pouvons faire de façon plus proactive – garder dans cour, espace temporaire, fournisseurs de logistique de tierce partie (3PL) ou, si le temps le permet, conversion vers une voie de contournement.
Réaliser une analyse approfondie des données relatives à l’ensemble de la chaîne d’approvisionnement dans le but d’émettre des recommandations à l’équipe de leadership sur la manière de gérer efficacement les contraintes d’espace actuelles et futures, d’assurer la visibilité aux acheteurs au détail et aux clients-grossistes et de planifier la croissance à venir.
Le candidat choisi travaillera à partir de notre centre de distribution et sera appelé à se rendre au siège social de Mississauga, en Ontario, jusqu’à 40 % du temps.

Skilled at multi-tasking and able to react quickly to frequent priority shifts
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Strong problem solving skills, including use of judgement and decision making
Must be detailed oriented and possess the ability to maintain focus in a high activity distribution setting
Excellent customer service skills, working with both internal and external partners
Detail-oriented and well organized

Compréhension et connaissances approfondies des systèmes de logistique et systèmes de gestion intégrés des douanes les plus récents et des systèmes de transport fondés sur l’infonuagique
Connaissances pratiques approfondies de toutes les applications Microsoft Office – des compétences intermédiaires à avancées du logiciel Excel sont obligatoires

Victoria, BCThe Research Analyst reports to the local Market Research Director or Senior Research Analyst. The Research Analyst is responsible for supporting the development of local research output and thought leadership. Specifically, this position provides support for gathering and analyzing local market data and interpreting this information to identify trends in the market. Output of the analysis is used to produce research deliverables to be included in pitch and/or proposal materials and reflects opinions of various market dynamics. The Research Analyst is also accountable for accurate and proactive maintenance of third party and proprietary databases with local market data, as well as pulling data from said systems to support thought leadership and forecast development. This position is not specific to a service line, but may specialize by property type.
Job Description

Key responsibilities include:
Conduct property level analytics or retrieve comps

Receive requests and collect all input and documentation
Create and analyze market data spreadsheets
Utilize inputs provided to develop market comps
Review analysis with Research Supervisor
Participate in development of local requests for research information for pitch and/or proposal materials with Research Director and Marketing

Receive requests for data and/or analysis from Research Senior Analyst, fee-earner, or marketing team
Perform research analysis for pitch and/or proposal materials to develop pitch and/or proposal materials
Consolidate information for pitch and/or proposal material content
Work with Senior Research Analyst and Marketing to organize data for presentations
Support Research Supervisor in creation of market analysis and work with Marketing Specialist to publicize market analysis to social media platforms and website
Manage research databases

Proactively reach out to fee-earners, Managing Principal, and regional research teams to actively update and maintain databases within a defined frequency
Routinely cleanse databases and update with new information
Work with Project Coordinators to update databases after deal closes with deal terms and transaction information
Work with Senior Research Analysts to accurately cleanse data in databases
Generate and maintain statistical reports
Reporting relationship

Role will report to the following:
Solid line reporting to Managing Principal
Dotted line reporting to Regional Research Director
Metrics

Role will be evaluated on the following:
Quality of written market narrative
Service Delivery: Request Turnaround Time and Quality
Data quality
Pursuits supported
Center of Excellence reporting/participation
BACKGROUND AND EXPERIENCE

Demonstrated experience should include:
Bachelor’s degree required
Professional acumen, demonstrated interest in real estate leasing and capital markets business
Economically versed
Experience in data entry/data management and time series analysis/forecasting
1-3 years’ experience in real estate or business for other positions

Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to successfully resolve problems with minimal direction
Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills

Strong knowledge of economic data and analytical tools
