We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.


To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com


What You’ll Be Doing

You'll be joining CIBC's Fraud Contact Centre. As a Associate Analyst Fraud Controls you'll monitor client transaction and provide a wonderful client experience while mitigating fraud losses to CIBC & Simplii Financial customers. You'll identify, analyze and conduct investigations of client transactions through debit cards, ATMs, over the counter (OTC) deposits at branches and other banking channels to determine possible fraud or unusual activity.


How You’ll Succeed

Analysis – Exercise decision making skills while reviewing customer’s profiles, transactions, banking history and cheque images to minimize loss and protect CIBC and our clients privacy.
Data Collection – Compile data and investigate alerts/referrals to make recommendations and take appropriate action. Accurately document all actions taken including the resolution reached and the decision made by updating the appropriate databases for each file investigated.
Collaboration – Interact directly with CIBC clients, branches and other stakeholders via telephone to communicate information relating to suspected fraudulent activity. Develop and maintain relationships with CIBC partners and other Client Account Management (CAM) teams to compile data, complete investigation, reach resolution and share best practices

Who You Are

You can demonstrate experience in COINS/ECIF, PRM, RCM, Netquery and Webview.
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond and deliver results.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know

POSITION PURPOSE
Sustainalytics is seeking qualified ESG analysts to join its ESG analyst team. This new position presents an exciting opportunity to conduct company ESG analysis that will form a part of our newly-released flagship ESG Risk Rating. Asset owners, investment managers and other investment professionals leverage the ESG Risk Rating and its underlying research to enhance investment processes. The role involves ESG risk and controversy analysis for companies, as well as contributing to client meetings and thought leadership. You will join a growing and strategically important team and contribute to the development of a vibrant community of sector analysts. You will engage in training and development programmes which support your career development to become a top ESG analyst. The ideal candidate will have both a background in capital markets and sectoral expertise. We are currently hiring for the Mining and Materials sector and the Oil and Gas sector.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Research, analyze and rate the ESG risks and involvement in controversies of companies in the mining or oil and gas sector.
Prepare company ESG Risk Rating reports to be published in Sustainalytics’ Global Access portal;
Research and track ESG trends and issues relevant in your sector of expertise;
Contribute to responding to client queries and support clients in integrating your research insights into their investment decision-making;
Contribute to the development of intellectual capital and internal and external thought leadership.
QUALIFICATIONS
Graduate degree in related discipline (business, finance, environment and/or social science);
At least 2 years of relevant work experience but we are ready to welcome more experienced candidates as well;
Strong knowledge and understanding of the financial services industry and SRI/RI market;
Knowledge of mining or oil and gas industry processes and technologies is considered an asset
Capital markets background; MBA/CFA considered an asset;
Excellent research, analytical and writing capabilities;
Presentation skills (both in spoken and written formats), e.g. ppt skills, client interaction skills;
Alignment with Sustainalytics’ mission, vision and values;
Resourceful, flexible and embraces change and innovation;
TO APPLY
If this opportunity sounds appealing to you, please submit your application using the form below. All applications will be treated with the highest level of discretion and will be accepted until close of business on March 31, 2019. However, as we will start interviewing sooner, we advise you to apply as soon as possible.

In keeping with our ongoing efforts to represent the diversity of our community, we strongly encourage people from diverse groups to apply. Sustainalytics is committed to providing accommodations for individuals with disabilities, upon request.

Sustainalytics thanks all applicants for their interest, however only those applicants requested to participate in the interview process will be contacted. Sustainalytics accepts applications directly from applicants only; no employment or recruitment agencies, please.

Your privacy while being in contact with Sustainalytics is one of our fundamental commitments here. Review our Privacy Policy to find out more about how we handle the personal data you provide us during the recruitment process. Should you have any questions or concerns, contact us at Data Protection.

HEALTH INFORMATION DATA QUALITY ANALYST
HEALTH INFORMATION SERVICES
REGULAR FULL-TIME

The Data Quality Analyst will be responsible for monitoring, assessing and addressing data quality issues with a view to developing standards for the Health Information Department that are in keeping with national, provincial and hospital directives. The Data Quality Analyst will be responsible for addressing coding queries, identifying data quality issues, and developing documentation and/or education as required, to support the HIM Specialists. The Data Quality Analyst will also be responsible for conducting reviews and implementing other measureable assessment tools with regard to data quality. The Data Quality Analyst will assist in Win Recs updates and provide system maintenance as needed and will assist in report writing for quality assurance purposes. The Data Quality Analyst will also be responsible for the collection and maintenance of CIHI databases (DAD & NACRS) and ensure their comprehensiveness and accuracy to optimize hospital funding, and to certify that CIHI deadlines are met.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
" Run regular coding audits and establish controls to co-ordinate a comprehensive quality assurance program.
" Develop and revise procedures and provide direction in coding and abstracting.
" To provide education and to lead discussions on data quality issues.
" Run monthly data quality and error edit checks and ensure corrections are completed.
" Ensure policies, procedures, manuals and resource materials and computer applications are available and current.
" Create reports for data edits and statistics.
" To address internal coding queries and source out expert guidelines in order to address the queries.
" To conduct periodic reviews, e.g. re-abstraction studies, in order to assess data quality.
" Implement and instruct staff on capturing new and present QBP's to ensure maximal hospital funding.
" Run monthly data quality checks to ensure QBP's are not missed or incorrect.
" Attend and update staff on an ongoing basis related to QBP and HBAM changes and additions.
" Utilize internal and external data quality tools and reports to identify opportunities for coding revisions that will ensure completeness and accuracy of coded data.
" Collect Discharge Analysis Database (DAD), Canadian Joint Replacement Registry (CJRR) Emergency Room, Day Surgery and Oncology (NACRS) Emergency National Ambulatory Care Reporting System (ERNI) and NACRS LITE coded data and submit files to the Canadian Institute for Health Information (CIHI) for statistical reporting and hospital funding.
" Monitor and download submission reports and other statistical reports from CIHI, Access to Care (ACT) and Ministry of Health and Long Term Care.
" Ensure that coding staff are scheduled appropriately to meet weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly deadlines.
" Code and abstract records as needed to assist with meeting deadlines and to ensure coding proficiency.
" Models continuous learning and self-improvement behaviour and encourages these among staff.
" Actively promotes team problem solving and team decision making activities.
" In the absence of the Manager provides oversight of staff and operations of the department.
" Run weekly report for staff to search for missing and mandatory data.
" Input missing data, perform edit checks and create data submissions with deadlines to meet Ministry of Health and Long Term Care guidelines.
" Download and monitor hospital specific compliance and quality reports.
" Participate in ERNI teleconference and act as hospital liaison in ensuring that required information is disseminated to appropriate staff.

QUALIFICATIONS:
" Graduate of an approved Health Information Management program.
" Current certification with the Canadian Health Information Management Association.
" 3 to 5 years' experience in a hospital setting with a focus on Health Information Management, specifically coding and abstracting.
" Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively, both in written and verbally.
" Proficiency in the use of MED2020 Winrecs and Meditech applications, including report writing capabilities, and the Microsoft suite of products (Word, Excel, Access and Outlook)
" Extensive knowledge of Canadian Coding Standards.
" Knowledge of Ontario funding models, specifically Health Based Allocation Methodology (HBAM) and Quality Based Procedures (QBP's).
" Understanding and application of current healthcare regulations which promote protection of personal information.
" Proficiency in use of computer applications. Namely Med 2020 Winrecs, Meditech, Microsoft Office (Word and Excel), Folio and Crystal Reports.
" Compliance with CHIMA mandatory continuing education credits.
" Providing required direction and guidance to Health Information Specialists.
" Serving as a hospital resource for data quality related matters and impacts of new funding methodologies.
" Optimizing quality of coded data, especially in the context of HBAM.
" Ability to coordinate and manage special projects

Qualified and interested applicants are encouraged to apply by clicking the "Apply for Job" button and proceed with the necessary steps. Please note that although we appreciate each and every application, only candidates selected for interview will be contacted.

Threat Intelligence Analyst plays a key role in identifying security threats, and providing the necessary research to drive initiatives which will improve our security posture.
Using indicators and intelligence from a variety of sources, you will identify, analyze and quantify security risks in our systems and processes. You will provide intelligence and risk assessments to security investigators, fraud investigators, technology teams, and organizational leaders in order to assist with decision making and influence risk mitigating strategies.

You will apply your analytic knowledge and tradecraft to use data analysis tools, to produce insightful details into security threats. You need to be highly motivated, and resourceful in finding ways to access security-relevant information, and turn it into actionable intelligence. You will be the owner of security intelligence data for our group.
This is a highly visible role that requires partnering with multiple organizations and technical teams in order to extract the intelligence and effect change. You must have the experience and capability to create and present documentation to champion security causes. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential. You must be experienced in working with data to analyze and detect trends, outliers, and have advanced analytical, mathematical, and quantitative abilities.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

Location: National Support Centre (NSC), 2124 Oxford Street East, London, ON


What we look for in teammates and what we offer:

What’s in it for you? Emco offers an outstanding career opportunity, substantial room for growth, development, and continuous learning. Emco offers a competitive compensation package based on the candidate’s personal performance, all within a fun, dynamic and collaborative team environment


Business Description:

Emco is one of Canada’s largest national distributors of building products for the residential, commercial and industrial construction markets, with over 250 Profit Centre (PC) locations across Canada. Emco has leading positions in each of its businesses, with opportunities for tremendous growth and is continually developing new methods to efficiently serve its growing customer base. Emco’s National Support Centre (NSC) is a high performing team of professionals focused on providing value-added services to enable Profit Centre success.


As the ideal candidate you will possess:

University Degree, Major in Accounting or College Diploma, Major in Accounting
Strong communication skills
Play to Win attitude and professionalism
Self-starter and strong attention to detail
Displays the desire for continuous self-improvement
Ability to develop a high level of trust and respect from internal customers
Works well in a team environment
Analytical ability to identify key issues and opportunities for improvement
Bilingual communication is considered an asset


Expectations and Responsibilities:

As a Purchases and Payments Analyst at Emco’s NSC, you will be primarily responsible for providing leadership in all aspects of the purchases and payments process for over 250 Emco Profit Centres across Canada.


General Expense Invoice Processing:

Review all invoices submitted for payment to ensure they are authorized by the appropriate signing authority and that they are coded with valid expense and sales tax general ledger codes
Ensure all invoices received are processed within 24 hours and follow-up with PCs if additional information is required
Continuously communicate with the financial analysts to ensure that only valid expense general ledgers are used and to ensure that capital expenditures are not paid without an authorized appropriation request
Continuously communicate with the Manager of Tax to ensure that all expenses are coded with the proper sales tax GLs and to develop an awareness of special tax situations for certain expenses (i.e. non-deductible expenses, requirement to self-assess HST, PST and QST)
Quarterly reviews of sales tax GL accounts should identify no correcting entries for incorrectly coded sales tax GLs
Take ownership of setting up and closing utility accounts with local providers and proactively communicate plans to the PCM
Process all authorized invoices into ReadSoft and setup new expense vendor invoice templates
Create and load invoice batches to Trend and ensure that batch details are added to the monthly expense control workbook
Monthly expense control workbook must be current at the end of each business day
Take ownership of the signature specimen master file and ensure that it remains updated with all authorized signing authorities for each PC and department.


Support the Payment Process

Analyze the pre-selection payment report, which details the amount to be paid the next day. Communicate this to the treasury analyst to ensure required approvals are obtained from the bank
Run the payment selection files in order to create the files required to print cheques and EFTs
Load files to the bank website for payment approval and provide supporting backup to administrators for approval.
Obtain approval from financial analysts to print and sign cheques for disbursement. Provide cheque files to treasury analyst to load to the bank website.


AP Mismatch Reporting and Support:

Create and distribute AP mismatch reports to enable PC teammates to review current AP mismatches with inventory vendors
Proactively support PC teammates within the AP support function in order to help PCs resolve mismatches in Trend and make necessary journal entries.
Document purchasing best practices in order to enable PC teammates to prevent AP mismatches
Create training materials in order to enable PC teammates to follow-up on and correct AP mismatches
Analyze AP mismatch data and make recommendations for process improvement


Vendor Master File Support:

Maintain the vendor master file including the following information: vendor type, terms, discounts, payment method, tax information etc. Continuously review the file to ensure that all mandatory vendor information is current and accurate.
Proactively support the vendor setup process by working with PCs to obtain all required information on new vendors


Other Duties

Administrate Max Recall to ensure all invoices are loaded for PCM review
Review and follow-up on all unprocessed invoices and credit reports
Reconcile the VISA Inventory purchase card process to ensure all such inventory purchased is accurately quantified in Trend
Review EMEEI report on a daily basis which details a listing of all invoices that failed to load to Trend and follow-up to resolve any issues
Support the acquisition payables process including entering invoices, costing POs, reconciling AP, selecting invoices for payment, creating and issuing cheques


National Support Centre Collaboration:

Work closely with other NSC teams (IT, Accounting, Internal Audit, Freight, Product and Pricing etc.) to ensure compliance with best practices and encourage process improvement
Implement a proactive approach to finding efficiencies within the purchases and payments process
Collaborate with other NSC teams to provide world class customer service

Job Description:

Montréal, QCCompany Overview / Présentation de l’entreprise:
Chez Nuance, nous donnons aux gens la possibilité d'interagir naturellement avec leurs divers appareils connectés et le monde numérique autour d'eux. Nous créons un monde où la technologie pense et agit de la façon dont les humains le font en concevant des modes d'interaction avec la technologie plus intuitifs.

Notre technologie agile utilise des analyses et des algorithmes avancés pour transformer l'inanimé en animé et transformer des processus complexes en processus simples.

Rejoignez notre équipe entreprise ... un excellent service à la clientèle commence ici. Nous concevons des assistants virtuels facilitant le service client intelligent. Les clients de diverses compagnies peuvent maintenant facilement trouver les informations dont ils ont besoin en utilisant tous les canaux qu'ils préfèrent.

At Nuance, we empower people with the ability to seamlessly interact with their connected devices and the digital world around them. We are creating a world where technology thinks and acts the way people do by designing the most human, natural, and intuitive ways of interacting with technology.

Our nimble technology uses analytics and advanced algorithms to transform the inanimate into animate and reduce complicated processes into simple ones.

Join our Enterprise team…great customer service starts here. We design virtual assistants for intelligent and effortless customer service helping customers find the information they need using whatever channel they prefer.

Toronto, ONThe Company
-----------

Our mission is to connect the world's photographers. Every month, millions of people from around the world use our website and mobile apps to find, share, and get rewarded for the world's most inspiring photography.

------

The Job
-------

As a data analyst you will bring 500px's understanding of our Community and Licensing business to the next level and help us move forward confidently with data-informed decisions. The Data Analyst is responsible for contributing to creation of KPIs and dashboards, conducting business impact analysis, evaluating product usage and trends, and using data to find business growth opportunities. The Data Analyst reports to the Data Team Lead and will collaborate with Senior Leadership to influence Licensing related decisions and performance.

------

What You'll Be Doing
--------------------


Interpret data and turn it into information which can offer ways to improve a business, thus affecting business decisions through gathering information from various sources and interpreting patterns and trends
Conduct complex queries on our data warehouse to help teams get the data they need, and maintain key reports and dashboards to track operational and business metrics
Build and maintain dashboards and reports that enable the Senior Leadership, Product, and Marketing teams to: drive business decision-making, drive performance and answer business questions in a measurable and actionable manner
Tell data stories to stakeholders by drawing insights from data analysis, bringing insights together to formulate the story and making recommendations for actions
Help your cross-functional team with data reports and data discovery by optimizing self-serve BI solutions and providing SQL support
Develop data collection plans and ensure the integrity of data collected
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns of user features and activities
Analyze trends in image usage via image metadata, sales reports, categories and keywords
Work with the technology team to identify, implement and maintain the systems we need to collect, verify, and analyze behavioural data
Define standards for data quality, and support the technology team in meeting those standards
Communicate and distribute data insights, tailoring presentations and findings to audiences across all levels of the organization

------

What the Ideal Candidate Will Have
----------------------------------


A Bachelor's or Master's degree in statistics, computer science, math, physics, or a related quantitative field
1-2 years professional experience of consultation to internal groups or departments
Expert knowledge of statistical sciences: statistical modelling and data mining
Expert knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL
Proficiency in querying MySQL and Redshift databases
Excellent analytical skills including cohort analysis, funnel analysis, AB testing, and lifetime value analytics
Hands-on experience with Python and/or R.

You'll get bonus points for:

Experience with community based platforms
Experience with commercial licensing an asset
Knowledge of third party tools like Optimizely, Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Braze
Knowledge of advanced data analysis topics such as: causal inferences, data simulation, or correlated data analysis (e.g., survival analysis, longitudinal analysis, time series analysis and forecasting)
Working experience with python libraries for data wrangling, visualization, mining and modelling (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Statsmodels, SciKit-Learn, NLTK)
Working experience with R packages for data wrangling, visualization and modelling (e.g., reshape2, dplyr, stringr, lubridate, ggplot2, car, forecast, randomforeset, Caret, survival)
Knowledge of business intelligence such as SaaS metrics, time series forecasting, or pricing analysis
Knowledge of data warehousing and ETL

------

Perks
-----


Interesting technical challenges
Competitive salaries
Flexible hours
Catered lunches, snacks and drinks
Great health and dental benefits
Professional development opportunities

------

Our Interview Process
---------------------


Phone screen: < 30 min conversation with a hiring manager
Tech challenge: a take-home test to analyze a sample of0pxdataset and build an insightful presentation
In-person interviews: 3-5 hours at our office where you'll meet multiple members of our team

------

Diversity
---------

We believe diverse teams perform better, and we seek to increase our overall team diversity. We make active efforts to reduce the impact of unconscious bias in our hiring process.

As well, the Analyst/Administrative Assistant provides confidential administrative and secretarial assistance and research support to the Executive Director, Recruitment Services and to the Recruitment Services team. Vancouver, BCWe are hiring for a Data Scientist!

PayByPhone is looking to hire a talented Data Scientist to join our new and expanding Data Analytics team. In this role, you will get the opportunity to partner with the business and stakeholders to help solve urgent business needs from a data perspective.

Here's what you'll do:

Develop and set up analytical tools and platforms to enable tracking and testing of marketing, product and business performance
Use sound statistical methods for testing business-level hypotheses and answering desired business questions
Process and analyze large amounts of data combined from internal and external sources to identify possible trends and patterns
Assist in the design of fair evaluations for marketing campaigns, and A/B tests for product features
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, marketers, designers, and stakeholders to translate business insights into decisions and actions
Present facts and findings to enable data-driven decision making to company leadership and other stakeholders
Work closely with the Data Engineering team to improve our data collection, data storage, and data processing systems

Are Naturally Curious, you have a passion for big data and solving unique business problems in a dynamic technical environment.

Don't Hesitate To Obtain What You Need from data to transform it into an insightful story.

Love To Explore Big Data Sets and take the time to explain your findings to others. Your work makes a huge impact on improving business results, and you know it.

Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Biostatistics or a similar quantitative field is preferred.

Success in this role looks like:

You'll be consistently working alongside business stakeholders on a day-to-day basis on various business problems with confidence. People know when to come to you.

About us:
Here at PayByPhone, our strength is in our people: a talented team behind a fantastic product. We are a creative, ambitious and driven multi-disciplinary group. We value learning and fun as we innovate to help millions of consumers pay for parking easily and securely. Our teams are growing; but not without you.

Together, we're on a mission to simplify the world of mobility payments – one parking spot at a time. We're one of the fastest-growing mobile payment companies in the world and process over 90 million parking, transit, and bike-share transactions a year in cities across North America, Europe and Australia. Our teams help millions of consumers easily and securely pay for parking and transportation without the hassles of waiting in line, carrying change, or risking costly fines.

Now, with a recent acquisition by Volkswagen Financial Services, our growth has a global focus and we can't do it alone. We need the right people working with us to help reach our lofty goals and we want it to be you.

Montréal, QCLockheed Martin Canada RMS Configuration and Data Management (CMDM) team is seeking Junior Configuration Data Management Analyst. This position will provide Configuration Management (CM) and Data Management support to multi programs. The Data Management (DM) discipline ensures the Contract Data Requirement List / Subcontract Data Requirement List (CDRL/SDRL) requirements are identified, recorded, assigned to appropriate disciplines, and tracked in accordance with DM Standards (Formal Data Management).

DM creates and monitors the CDRL/SDRL submittal schedule. DM resolves data issues, distributes schedule notices for pending data submittals to ensure on-time delivery and creates status reports for management review and action. DM reviews the deliverable program data to determine completeness and submits to the customer as specified in the contract.

The Configuration Management (CM) discipline works closely with the program execution and engineering teams to manage the technical baseline. CM tasking in this role will include the use of CM tools for configuration identification, configuration control, configuration status accounting, configuration verification and audits, product release and delivery and provide solutions to a variety of CM technical challenges.

Daily responsibilities include establishing and maintaining program CM systems, including the program documents and managing configuration baselines, ensuring all required process steps have been completed prior to release and documenting released configurations. Position requires great attention to detail with respect to managing hardware development environments and program technical data, understanding of ITAR processes and strong presentation skills. Candidate must be an advocate of continuous process improvements.

Employee TypeFull Time
Business Environment
Lockheed Martin Canada is the Canadian-based arm of Lockheed Martin Corporation, a global security and aerospace company employing 98,000 people worldwide, including nearly 1,000 Canadians. By applying innovative approaches of our highly skilled and experienced Canadian workforce, we have been Canada’s trusted defence and aerospace partner for over 75 years. We operate major facilities in Ottawa, Montreal, Halifax, Calgary and Victoria and work on a wide range of major programs from advanced naval technology products and unmanned systems software to providing delivery and in-service support of the latest military aircraft to commercial engine repair and overhaul capabilities.

Above average oral and written communication skills

Self-Starter, willing to learn new tools and work with a variety of technical and non-technical disciplines
Ability to pro-actively interface with team members
Data Management and/or Configuration Management Experience
Experience working in an Engineering design environment, interfacing with Hardware, Systems, Software and Test Engineers
Proficient in use and administration of Windchill PDM

Vancouver, BCQuietly Insights helps content marketers focus on their strategy by measuring, analyzing, and summarizing data into actionable recommendations. From content ideas to competitive intelligence, Quietly Insights delivers actionable recommendations straight to your inbox.

Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, as a Data Scientist for Quietly, you will help the product team enhance the “brain” of Quietly Insights, our content marketing recommendations platform. Evaluate our existing approaches, data points, and database structure to provide feedback and improvements
Identify metrics that are predictive of high performance in content marketing and recommended best practices for data collection
Collect and clean data from various sources (web analytics, social analytics, CRM, etc.) to identify how these sources can integrate with one another to reveal factors related to content marketing and implement findings into a model for predicting content marketing success

You have a degree in data science, statistics, big data or something similar

You have experience in software development, data munging, natural language processing, knowledge-based systems, databases, statistics, machine learning and data visualization.

Background in mathematics, physics, statistics or comparable multivariable calculus and linear algebra
Experience with AWS
Experience producing client- and consumer-facing data visualizations
Experience with messy, ‘real-life’ datasets and data munging
Experience working with marketing data

TO APPLY

Apply including a resume and a cover letter which summarizes your experience in data science. If available, please also include any relevant projects, papers, notebooks or GitHub repositories that demonstrate your experience.

PermanentUnder limited supervision, maintains and upgrades servers and infrastructure components, including databases and associated peripheral storage and network server devices. The Server Analyst II will plan, design, install, administer, monitor, manage, and optimize enterprise servers and related components to achieve and maintain consistent high performance, maximum availability, and reliability of the municipality’s business applications, systems, and data. This will include configuring all new implementations, and developing processes and procedures for ongoing management of the complex server environment.
Primary responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Manages Microsoft Exchange Server collaborative application products, including installation, configuration, troubleshooting, planning, design, implementing, upgrading, maintaining and lifecycle-replacing of electronic e-mail, calendars, contacts, and tasks; provides support for mobile and web-based information access and data storage applications.

Serves as a cornerstone for escalating server issues, and provides timely response to escalations.
Manages network resources and access to those resources using active directory.
Manages Active Directory Domain Services and roles including LDAP, DNS, DHCP, etc.
Configures, manages, and maintains servers using virtualization techniques/tools.
Defines and performs server backups and recovery procedures ensuring availability and accessibility to corporate data/information; monitors and tests system performance and provide performance statistics and reports.
Provides web administration support by overseeing and maintaining web server configuration.
Plans and implements server upgrades, maintenance fixes, and vendor-supplied patches.
Assists with implementation and provides post-implementation support for internet and intranet-based applications.
Follows server security monitoring and reporting policies, procedures, and technologies; provides input into developing and/or reengineering of policies, procedures, and technologies.
Develops and maintains operational procedures, documents test results, makes recommendations for improvements.
Leads, coordinates, and participates in key process improvements as they relate to the client/server environment.
Recommends and executes, with appropriate authorization, modifications to the server environment in order to improve efficiency, reliability, and performance.
Develops and maintains server and data center component documentation.
Creates Windows scripts as required and conducts research on server hardware, software, and protocols in support of procurement and development efforts; reports findings as requested.
Configures, installs, maintains and troubleshoots Citrix and Blackberry servers.
Responsibilities may require evening and weekend work, as well as on-call availability on a rotational basis.
Performs other related duties as required.


Qualifications

Two (2) year Diploma in a computer-related program, with emphasis on Enterprise Network Servers and Data Security combined with five (5) years of experience in advanced server systems in a complex Microsoft Windows server environment (Server 2008R2 and Server 2012) , with active directory structure and tool usages including user, printer, and share administration required.
Experience configuring, managing and maintaining Windows Server 2008 and Windows Server 2012.

Server and applications support skills, and strong knowledge of patch management and performance tools.
Ability to follow direction and work independently, demonstrating initiative/ creative thinking while making sound, logical decisions.
Ability to investigate and analyze information, and to draw logical conclusions, with strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Understanding of project management methodology with high degree of precision/accuracy in documentation and investigation.
Client-focused, with an ability to deliver operational support and manage problem resolution through effective interpersonal communication and follow-up.
Strong team player and ability to work to collective goals, time management parameters, and organizational effectiveness metrics.
Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills and proven ability to read/understand complex technical manuals.
Must embrace an environment of continuous learning; upgrade knowledge and skills as required.

company_name: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
job_description:
Toronto, ON$23.76 - $31.70 an hourThe General Adult Psychiatry and Health Systems Division and the Translational Addiction Research Laboratory (TARL) at the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health are seeking two (2) Research Analyst positions to assist with new and ongoing clinical research trials in mood, anxiety and substance use disorders. Reporting to the Principal Investigator / Qualified Investigator, your responsibilities will include: Recruitment, screening, consenting and follow-up of study participants, data collection and database maintenance, preparation and maintenance of subject research records, maintenance of regulatory binders and preparation of reports. Competency in following best practices and SOPs will be expected. You will also be responsible for assisting with grant, ethics and CTA applications, data analysis, and preparation of presentations and manuscripts. You will provide regular updates to the Principal / Qualified Investigator and/or research coordinator and provide support to the research team in other research-related duties. Administrative support may also be required. This position will involve interactions with scientists of various research backgrounds and a strong interest in clinical research and translational science. You will support a workplace that embraces diversity and encourages teamwork. This position is primarily located at 100 Stokes Street, with the possibility of supporting research occurring at 33 Russell Street and 250 College Street.

Qualifications:
The successful candidates will have a Bachelor's degree in addition to one (1) year of clinical research experience. Previous experience with randomized clinical trials is a valuable asset. Knowledge of MS office and data entry/analysis programs (e.g. REDcap) is required. This position requires very strong interpersonal skills, combined with well-developed critical thinking abilities, flexibility and initiative. Strong writing skills are mandatory. Candidates require the ability to explain complex issues in plain language both verbally and in writing. Candidates should possess the ability to work independently and as part of an interdisciplinary team. Previous exposure to the mental health field (particularly research) will be an asset. Experience in conducting structured clinical interviews such as SCID will be an asset. Candidates require the ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse backgrounds. Bilingualism (French/ English) is considered an asset.

Please note: This full-time, contract (1 year) is part of the OPSEU bargaining unit.
Salary Range: $23.76 to $31.70 per hour.

CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.
CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.
As an employment equity employer CAMH actively seeks Aboriginal peoples, visible minorities, women, people with disabilities, (including people with who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges), and additional diverse identities for our workforce.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If contacted for an interview, please inform us should accommodation be required.

Smiths Falls, ONLegalization has opened up the recreational cannabis market in Canada, and the global demand for medical cannabis continues to expand. In this exciting new environment, Canopy Growth’s mission is to be the No. 1 cannabis company in the world. We’re looking for incredible people to join us on the journey.

The Company

With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production and operations spanning five continents, Canopy Growth Corporation (“Canopy Growth”) is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world. It is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC), and is part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries — including its flagship, Tweed, and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand — are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls, Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of its success, and takes pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity. Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue and increase our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Canopy Growth is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Supply Chain Analytics team. As a Data & Visualization Analyst, you will help lay the data foundation of the company to be data driven. You’ll have a chance to collaborate with various teams in the supply chain and logistics organization to understand different data and reporting requirements.

The ideal candidate has the following traits:

Passion to be surrounded by data and finds excitement in diving into the deep end to extract insights others don’t see
Is detailed oriented and has the ability to react quickly in a dynamic business environment
A passion in unpacking and solving complex problems
Work with structured and unstructured data to solve problems like:
Identifying and centralizing data to be the most trusted source of information in the company
Assist the business in realizing the value and importance of data in their respective business areas

Responsibilities

Define ETL processes for consolidating data from transactional / operational systems
Build and expand the data dictionary
Produce regular reports and analysis using a range of data analytics tools
Support the business in creating ad hoc reports and troubleshooting reports
Be the data evangelist and help enable the business to be power users
Drive data quality improvements and collaborative effort towards unified enterprise Business Intelligence services
Write systems queries using SQL (MS SQL and MySQL), workbooks (MS Excel & Google Sheets), and other platform-specific query languages
Track project and task requirements, issues, deliverables, and acceptance criteria for reports and dashboards
Other tasks as assigned

Experience

Understanding of Supply Chain functions and data requirements (planning, procurement, logistics, transportation, scheduling, etc.)
Experience with a range of data analysis and presentation tools such as Excel and Google Sheets, Tableau, Power BI, SSRS, Cognos, Splunk, Sumo Logic, Salesforce Einstein, Crystal Reports, ZAP BI/SDMA etc.
Desire for tailoring your work into user-friendly dashboards in enterprise ERP and CRM platforms (SAGE X3, NetSuite, SAP, Oracle, Salesforce, etc.)
SQL knowledge and ability to write complex queries
Understanding and ability to build OLAP Cubes, Dimensional and Relational Data Models
Comfortable with ETL, integrations, field mappings, and other data dictionary responsibilities
Experience performing statistical, time series, and cross-sectional analysis on large data sets a plus
Python data programming experience (R, NumPy, Pandas) a plus

Other Details

This is a Full Time position based out of the Ontario Area. Must be able to travel to Smiths Falls on a regular basis to collaborate with internal clients.

We appreciate the interest from all candidates, and promise to review all applications, but we will only be contacting those who best fit the requirements. If you don’t hear from us, don’t fret; every resume we get is kept in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

One last note: the chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

Thank you so much for your interest in Canopy Growth.

Ottawa, ON$52,854 - $149,416 a yearHelp bring research to life and drive your career forward with the National Research Council of Canada (NRC), Canada’s largest research and technology organization.

We are looking for a vibrant and dynamic Technical Business Analyst to support our National Programs and Business Services Branch. The Technical Business Analyst would be someone who shares our core values of Integrity, Excellence, Respect and Creativity.

National Programs and Business Services (NPBS) aligns Business professionals to NRC Research Centres and programs, providing business expertise and Intellectual Property (IP) support in a coordinated and responsive manner. This centralized approach allows NRC to prioritize and channel resources in order to grow its diverse business in a strategic and pro-active way.

The Technical Business Analyst (TBA) provides competitive technical and business intelligence analysis services to its internal clients in the NRC Research Centres, advises on technology commercialisation strategies, and evaluates and makes recommendations to support NRC’s intellectual property (IP) strategy. In doing so, the Analyst develops leading edge industry insights that build on the existing business acumen and result in improved understanding of risk and uncertainty in the evaluation of new potential programs/investment opportunities.

The incumbent participates in market analysis, technology forecasting, technology road mapping and business planning activities as requested by NRC Divisional, Research Centres and Program Management and Client Relationship Leaders. The incumbent supports NRC’s leaders in identifying and making effective decisions on the key marketing challenges, improving their competitive intelligence, developing future programs and strategies, and responding to market situations for the business through the development and application of insightful and objective competitive and business analysis.
Screening Criteria
Applicants must demonstrate within the content of their application that they meet the following screening criteria in order to be given further consideration as candidates:
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Science, Engineering or Business Administration. Bachelor’s degree with extensive related business experience may be considered.

Master’s degree in Business Administration would be an asset.

For information on certificates and diplomas issued abroad, please see Degree equivalency
Experience
Significant experience writing in-depth analysis reports including market assessments, industry profiles and corporate profiles.
Significant experience in technology commercialization, bridging client needs and market trends.
Basic experience in the provision and use of competitive technical and business intelligence services.
Condition of Employment
Reliability Status
Language requirements
English
Information on language requirements and self-assessment tests
Assessment Criteria
Candidates will be assessed on the basis of the following criteria:
Technical Competencies
Superior knowledge of analysis tools as well as where and how to find multiple sources of information.
Ability to collect, organize, synthesize, and analyze data.
Working knowledge of the various technical domains required to support internal clients.
Solid knowledge of current and emerging technologies, market awareness and key stakeholders in providing client support.
Ability to summarize findings, develop conclusions from various data sources and write reports and recommendations.
Basic knowledge in the development of value propositions, IP valuations, Return on Investment (ROI) analysis and economic impact modeling.
Behavioural Competencies
Management services - Communication (Level 3)
Management services - Client focus (Level 3)
Management services - Results orientation (Level 3)
Management services - Teamwork (Level 2)
Management services - Conceptual and analytical ability (Level 3)
Technology extension - Business understanding (Level 3)
Competency Profile(s)
For this position, the NRC will evaluate candidates using the following competency profiles: Management Services; Technology Extension

Relocation
Relocation assistance will be determined in accordance with the NRC's directives.
Salary Range
This position is classified as a Research Council Officer (RCO), a group that is unique to the NRC. The RCO group uses a person-based classification system instead of the more common duties-based classification system. Candidates are remunerated based on their expertise, skill, outcomes and impacts of their previous work experience. The salary scale for this group is vast, from $52,854 to $149,416 per annum, which permits for employees of all levels from new graduates to world renowned experts to be fairly compensated for their contributions.
Notes

NRC employees enjoy a wide-range of benefits including comprehensive health and dental plans, pension and insurance plans, vacation and other leave entitlements.
Preference will be given to Canadian Citizens and Permanent Residents of Canada. Please include citizenship information in your application.
The incumbent must adhere to safe workplace practices at all times.
This position is being advertised internally and externally simultaneously, however first consideration will be given to internal NRC applicants.

job_title: Systems Developer, Investment Data and Analytics
job_description:
Vancouver, BCSystems Developer, Investment Data and Analytics
Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group Ltd.
Vancouver
As passionate developers, we are faced with complex investment data and analytics problems that are ideally solved with technology. Applying technology to investment problems has been key to the firm’s success and plays an increasingly significant role in the evolution of the firm and the industry. Our high performance in-memory KDB systems track a large universe of over 50,000 potential investments and performs meaningful analytics on over $71 billion dollars of assets.
We recently formed a strategic technology team to create higher levels of intelligence, efficiency, and scalability in investment data and analytics. Investment data drives programmed analytics that bring insight internally to portfolio managers and externally to clients. This is a fantastic opportunity that encourages professional growth and clearly positions developers to contribute.
The team is headquartered and deeply rooted in West Coast Vancouver. We place high value on maintaining an entrepreneurial spirit and creating a culture where each of us has opportunities to succeed.
What You’ll Be Doing
Developers play an essential role in securities data management and portfolio analytics. Our high performance systems are leveraged across a broad range of investment styles and asset classes. You own the entire software life cycle:
Collaborate with data managers, investment analysts and portfolio managers across the firm to analyze interesting investment process problems.
Design, plan and implement high caliber innovative systems solutions in an entrepreneurial spirit.
Keep data management and post trade analytics systems running smoothly through enhancements and support.
About You
Programming Knowledge – you have an undergraduate, graduate, or post-graduate degree in a computer-related field OR exceptional programming skills gained through your work experience.
Strong Problem Solving Skills – you possess an analytical mind and enjoy solving problems. An ability to perform deep thoughtful analysis and discover solutions is required for this role.
Investment Knowledge – understanding investment analytics is needed for you to contribute effectively. Investment knowledge is preferred and interest to learn more about this complex domain is key.
Passion for Technology – we work with several programming languages (Kdb+/Q, Java, C#, Angular/Typescript) and upfront knowledge is not required. If you are passionate about technology, learning new languages and concepts is natural and fun.
Passion for Operational Excellence – you have an approach and track record in achieving operational excellence where personal drive, high quality work, and getting things done are critical success factors.
Collaborative Communication – you have a collaborative spirit that helps you to work well with others and you communicate effectively.
About Us
Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group provides investment management services to individuals, advisors, pension plans, institutional investors and foundations. The firm has offices across Canada and internationally in New York, London and Chicago. Through our affiliated investment managers we are responsible for the investment of over $71 billion in financial assets.
We are looking for junior/intermediate/senior developers. If interested, email your resume to careers@cclgroup.com with “Systems Developer – Investment Data and Analytics" in the subject line.
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, but only those candidates short-listed for interviews will be contacted. No telephone calls or recruitment agencies will be accepted.

$62,719 - $71,508 a yearTechnical Analyst
Information Systems R24


STEP into a career with one of BC’s Top Employers since 2009.

The Liquor Distribution Branch (LDB) is one of the largest distributors and retailers of beverage alcohol in Canada, generating a net income of approximately $1.08 billion on annual sales of approximately $3.3 billion in fiscal 2016/17. LDB has a workforce of approximately 4,000 full and part-time employees, operates 197 retail stores across the province, oversees the operations of approximately 220 Rural Agency Stores and has the role of wholesaler to approximately 700 private liquor retail outlets and 10,000 licensed establishments.

The LDB is a unique government entity that operates with similar independence to a Crown Corporation under the direction of a General Manager and CEO.
In February 2018, the LDB was assigned to distribute, wholesale and sell non-medicinal cannabis inclusive of a government owned online channel with a mandate to support government’s key priorities of protecting children and youth, ensuring health and safety standards, and keeping the criminal element out of the supply chain. Effective October 17, 2018 the LDB has added wholesaling and retailing of non-medical cannabis –named LDB Cannabis Operations to the existing business of wholesaling and retailing of Liquor.
LDB’s Information Technology Division (IT) provides reliable, responsive and secure systems and services to support LDB in operational excellence and delivering superior customer service.
The LDB’s Information Technology Division consists of six departments and 23 distinctive units, with 200+ FTEs. IT has adopted a multi-sourcing strategy and leverages a combination of internal and external expertise, including outsourced services, contracted services and shared services, to deliver the IT mandate of supporting current operations and future business needs. Strategic plans, governance of standards and risk management are all developed internally to support Divisional and Corporate goals.
The Technical Analyst supports the development of systems changes/enhancements through the various phases of the application development life cycle and undertakes integration project work which has a significant impact on client departments. This position is responsible for supporting the planning, analyzing, designing, developing, testing and implementation of effective solutions to meet requirements and maintaining and enhancing assigned systems as necessary.
This position oversees system applications’ maintenance and enhancements from small to medium initiatives entailing both short and long term projects that may be either of a self-contained nature or ones which require the assignment, coordination and monitoring of work performed by other team or project resources to support the business objectives of the BC Liquor Distribution Branch.
The Technical Analyst emphasis project control, coordination of project performance and economic utilization of resources assigned to the project and in-depth systems analysis to deliver key benefits to LDB departments.

To be considered for this opportunity, applicants must submit a cover letter and resume clearly identifying how they meet the qualifications necessary for this position. This information will be used as part of the selection process.

Lightspeed is seeking a full-time Senior Data Analyst to join our Data team. Reporting to the Director of Corporate Development and Business Analytics, this role is responsible for developing and maintaining analysis that helps our entire organization make better, faster decisions. If you're organized, ambitious, and intelligent with a mind for statistics and analysis with experience working in Excel, SQL, and Python or R, then this may be the position for you. The ideal candidate will have experience analyzing, presenting, and interpreting complex data sets.

Now we get to brag about us: Lightspeed provides retailers and restaurateurs the simplest way to build, manage, and grow their business while crafting a better customer experience. Deliver accurate and cleanly-built work

Job Description
The Crude Scheduling Team within Shell Trading Canada is responsible for managing the physical delivery of Shell’s water-born and land-based crudes in the country. The team of schedulers works within the trading teams and help optimize overall profitability through its commercial acumen and expertise in blending, scheduling and refinery operations. The successful candidate will have the unique opportunity to join its Crude Operations team and be a part of its global trading network. This job offers a challenging opportunity to support the traders by analyzing many sources of information with the goal of maximizing profitability.

The vacancy is one of 9 positions within Commercial Operations team. Together, the team is responsible for managing the logistics (marine, pipeline, trucking and rail) of all crude and condensate movements. The team of schedulers works within the trading teams and help optimize overall profitability through its commercial acumen and expertise in blending, scheduling and refinery operations.

Beyond these key deliverables, the Scheduler is expected to “own the molecule” and understand the operations and commercial implications. The Scheduler plays a critical role in the Crude Trading Operations organization and is expected to manage losses, prevent profit leakage, and analyze / report on all aspects of crude movements within our remit.

Other accountabilities include:
Manage crude scheduling to pipelines, terminals, and third parties and ensure alignment of supply and production commitments.
Proactively support traders and develop a detailed and extensive understanding of supply and logistics to provide commercial feedback and value add.
Provide solutions and ideas to maximize/improve profit on existing deals and/or explore hidden value/options.
Liaise with Shell Entities, Third Party counterparties and team members to resolve and eliminate issues impacting schedules, supply and settlements.
Effectively communicate trading needs to traders/schedulers and other team members.
Ensure that day-to-day orders and schedules are prepared accurately and timely.
Manage tanks and inventories.
Perform the daily task of quantifying and analyzing discrepancies between the plan, schedules and actual performance. Analyze and communicate results to the responsible parties to take necessary corrective actions. Escalate issues when need be.
Lead or support the month end process for reporting production volumes and inventories in systems and for group to reconcile gaps.
Provide backup coverage for other scheduling desks and for volume movement actualizations.
Interface with Traders, Schedulers, Contract Management Team and Crude Analysts toresolve Customers / Vendors issues in a timely fashion.
Comply with various government reporting requirements.
Support Continuous Improvement throughout the organization
Contribute to maximizing commercial value

Calgary, Alberta

Shell is a global group of energy and petrochemicals companies with over 90,000 employees in more than 70 countries and territories. In Canada, we have operated for over a century and are a major producer and marketer of oil, gas and petrochemicals, Canada’s largest producer of sulphur and a significant oil sands developer. We deliver energy responsibly; operate safely with respect to our neighbours and work to minimize our environmental impact. We are in search of remarkable people who will thrive in a diverse and inclusive work environment to deliver exciting projects locally and globally. People who are passionate about exploring new frontiers. Innovators and pioneers. People with the drive to help shape our future.

The individual in this position will proactively work with all levels of management within ADS and TransUnion to drive business and revenue opportunities as well as provide senior management with valuable industry/market and customer driven insight that will be leveraged in the business planning and product development processes. Calgary, ABA leader in automating intelligent industrial operations.
At Canvass Analytics, we are disrupting the way industrial operational data is being used to make critical business decisions. Our disruptive, leading edge AI-powered analytics platform transforms plant operations, giving them predictive insights that enable autonomous operations.
In mere days, the Canvass AI software platform can enable Fortune 1,500 industrial companies to automate complex production processes, improve quality, reduce energy consumption, generate new revenue streams and create new markets by producing higher grade products. Canvass Analytics' customers include leading energy, manufacturing, food and ag, oil and gas, and metals and mining companies around the globe.
We're an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. Our business is founded by a team of seasoned revolutionaries who are building the next generation of AI-powered analytics to transform the Industrial industry. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.
Who we need
Reporting to Steve Kludt, the CTO, who believes in failing fast but fixing it faster, our new Data Scientist will build our Reinforcement Learning models and coach a young team. This is a chance to use advanced quantitative and statistical analysis techniques to drive business innovation and to help solve some of the most complex processes in the Industrial sector. This is an opportunity to contribute to the development and deployment of modern artificial intelligence, machine learning, deep learning, operational research, semantic analysis, and statistical methods for finding structure in large data sets.
What's in it for you
The opportunity to step up. You want to inspire and influence the work of a team and introduce or reinforce best practices.
The room to experiment. You want to join a company that's at the forefront of cutting-edge technology, and you want the autonomy to research and experiment. Use your machine learning know-how and coding expertise to collaborate with other Data Scientists and identify new techniques.
The chance to evolve with us. You want to solve the unique, complex problems we are facing and design algorithms for use cases we see in this space, taking us to the next step in the AI IoT market.
Who you are
You are a Data Scientist with a powerful combination of academic and practical experience; from theory to building out the architecture, you have the skills, the innovation, and the drive to be an active player on our team. You like to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty. When facing a complex challenge to solve, your favourite route is to start by writing Python code in Tensorflow to see what can be accomplished with the data. You are excited by the chance to support both high volume big data training of models, as well as working with real time streaming data, edge analytics, working with those types of technologies.
As the new Data Scientist Lead, you will:
Guide the work of the team, removing roadblocks, creating solutions and making things happen.
Coach, mentor and develop the skills of junior Data Scientists, ensuring satisfaction, instilling a passion for what they do and fostering a collaborative culture.
Introduce and implement processes and workflows based on best practices.
Build relationships with Google's Gradient Ventures, the Vector Institute to collaborate on the Reinforcement Learning issues.
Work closely with the Product team to disseminate knowledge and skills specific to the operational requirements, collection, and handling of Industrial operational data.
Interpret and utilize mass quantities of data to generate innovative hypotheses and insights.
Use a sophisticated statistical method to solve problems, leveraging up-to-date academic research and techniques.
Quantitatively test hypotheses about data used to create models that increase the performance of predictive models for supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning use cases.
Design and implement novel experiments to better understand current operations and create models to optimize processes.
Our new Data Scientist Lead has:
The education. You have a Masters or Ph.D. in Mathematics.
The experience. You have expertise in building and deploying AI-based models. An Industrial background would be nice to understand what we're trying to solve. You understand how to look at a business problem and identify creative ways to solve that problem with the data available.
The passion for working with data. You are continuously researching, prototyping and testing.
The hands-on leadership. You are a natural leader who can listen, collaborate, influence and build trust. You are a champion for your team with the ability to inspire high-quality work and a positive environment. You can provide perspective and keep the team focused on critical deliverables and tasks. You can effectively manage conflict, make barriers disappear and negotiate personnel issues.
The communication skills. You can build strong collaborative relationships and work closely with teammates across different departments. You have the verbal and written skills to clearly and confidently express your ideas and your thought process to clients, succinctly translating complex, technical language to tangible business concepts.
Why join us?
Are you looking to join a venture that is paving the way of the next industrial revolution? Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for the Industrial sector. We are changing the way Industry thinks and uses AI, and it's getting noticed everywhere. We've been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Our Founder and CEO, Humera Malik, is one of the 2018 RBC Canadian Women Entrepreneur Ones to Watch Award Winners. Canvass is backed by Google's Gradient Ventures.
What's it like to work at Canvass? This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes. We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions. We appreciate the efforts, innovation, and results of our team. We offer:
Access to a highly dynamic, innovative, and passionate leadership team.
An opportunity to be part of a global company that is transforming the global Industrial market with AI.
A diverse and inclusive company culture.
A competitive salary.
A commitment to supporting your career development.
All of the benefits of OneEleven membership including peer groups, open networking opportunities and more.

At Agnico Eagle, our values never waver. We believe in trust, respect, equality, family and responsibility. Why? Because they express who we are and they have helped us succeed in business for over 60 years.

We value you – your unique set of skills and experience. We value your willingness to build those skills and make a meaningful contribution to our company. Description:
The Senior Data and Reporting Analyst will work at our corporate head office in downtown Toronto and assist in the cleanup and maintenance of our HR Master Data shared across multiple HR applications. The role is critical in bringing and maintaining consistency of HR data management practices across the organization.

Reporting to the HR Systems Manager, the Data and Reporting Analyst will collaborate with the HR Regional team, the Corporate HR team and the HR Systems teams to lead and deliver the HR data integrity project. The project will be run in 3 phases and the key responsibilities by phase outlined in the following responsibilities.
Responsibilities:

Phase One: Discovery and Analysis

 Interpret national/provincial/federal regulations to determine implications to current HR data management and reporting practices.
 Identify system and business logic rules in data management to identify data quality gaps and business impacts. Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes (e.g. client onboarding), policies, systems and data management practices.
 Audit existing data to identify issues related to accuracy, completeness and integrity. Interpret data issues to identify corrective actions for reporting practices.
 Identify opportunities to standardize and centralize HR data.

Phase Two: Data Cleaning and Data Management Standards

 Design the New Data Management and Reporting Practices to ensure HR Data integrity, accuracy and completeness.
 Seek out industry trends to generate and recommend alternative approaches to managing workforce related data and reporting.
 Test new data flows and remediate issues.
 Data Error Resolution by responding to, correcting and identifying the root of data errors - work with the Data Stewards (local payroll and HR use) to ensure HR data integrity, to clearly communicate errors, resolution procedures and new data management practices.
 Train Data Stewards in the application of the new data management practices, if needed.

Phase three: Maintenance of data - execute and optimize Data Management practices

 Support regional team in the maintenance of the data management practices. Serve as a Data Governance & Management communication point of contact to all stakeholders.
 Run bi-weekly Data Audits and correct triggering practice.
 Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to optimize the data management practices.
 Document finding regarding data challenges and corrections needs.

And all other ad hoc duties as assigned.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

Qualifications:

 5+ years of experience on HR related projects with data impact.
 5+ years of experience as a Data Reporting Analyst
 Excellent working knowledge with MS Office applications (MS Excel in particular) and Visio.
 Knowledge of database principles and SQL language
 Strong organizational skills, prioritization and results orientated to handle multiple tasks/projects and to work independently.
 Good interpersonal skills and ability to work in a multinational organization (Canada, Mexico, Finland, Sweden).
 Systematic thinker, data and analytical abilities.
 Strong mathematical and literacy skills, complemented by excellent visual accuracy skills, accuracy and attention to detail.
 Experience with data manipulation, data transfer automation, analysis and reporting.
 Ability to interface with management, users, and information technology professionals to solve complex business problems.
 Availability to travel in Canada and abroad.
 Languages: English (mandatory). French, Spanish or Finnish an asset.
Knowledge of:
o HR data concepts as they pertain to all HR processes and impact in other corporate processes (Accounting, Maintenance, Health and Safety, etc.).
o Process and data analysis practices and guidelines.
o Internal audit methodology and practice.
o Global HR processes, practices and technologies.
 Experience in:
o Previous experience using HRMS mandatory. Previous work with JD Edwards is an asset.
o Project Management or Change Management practices.
o Data mapping and data integrations between multiple systems.
o Data audits against multiple/complex criteria.
o Analyzing complex data from multiple perspectives and providing optimization recommendations.

Optez pour une carrière enrichissante avec nous!
...............

Cutting edge solutions? Working for a brand that people know and love? We’ve got you covered!
We reach over 60M users internationally and have been named one of Apple's best apps for 2018. Not to mention we are a trusted, reliable and dependable brand that inspires…we have been ranked 12th overall in the Ipsos’s annual study of Canada’s 100 Most Influential Brands – being #1 for Canadian Brands!
The Opportunity
As our amazing Digital Analyst, you will create sophisticated, insightful and interactive reports, generating insights for audience and yields for our digital platforms, and provide recommendations to solve complex business problems and create awesome customer experiences. This role works with the Digital Services team to grow The Weather Network and MeteoMedia business in Canada, U.S. and emerging markets. You are key in assisting platform owners and internal stakeholders to understand customers and competitors by leveraging data from multiple sources across all our digital properties (i.e. websites, mobile and tablet applications) and within the industry. You have a passion for data, a strong background in quantitative analysis using the latest technologies and a gift for extracting actionable insights!

A day in the life of a Digital Analyst:

Support the analytic needs of the Digital Services business unit by using tools from Google Analytics, Google Optimize, Firebase and others to analyze user data.
Have a deep understanding of how consumers interact with our digital properties and relevant research within the Digital, Mobile and Advertising space to forecast trends
Work closely with the Business Systems team to extract insights and identify key trends within our standardized reporting
Report and analyze user path and engagement activity data across our digital properties
Be investigative and proactive in finding the data that answers the “why” of user behaviour.
Lead our consumer testing process through developing, creating and executing multivariate or A/B/ tests that drive fundamental improvements to the site and app experiences that improve customer experiences and grow the business.
Exhibit a high-level expertise in understanding the data and developing the strategies across platform feedback, surveys, testing, CRM systems and market research.
Own the platform optimization and targeting strategy – work with the steering team to develop algorithmic models to drive insights and further the knowledge base of our user traffic
Work closely with the platform business leads to assist in data visualization for presentations and assist with their decision making
Architecting the procedure and process for how to test and learn and resolve all key debates on design and functionality on all websites and apps
This role manages and analyzes inbound and outbound traffic, assesses performance of our external partnerships, search and other syndicated partnerships with 3rd parties that drive traffic to The Weather Network properties.

This is what YOU have:

BA/Business degree/MBA from an accredited college or university in Business, Finance and/or Marketing focus
Established track record in digital analytics or similar role and at least 3 years of working with Google Analytics, Google Optimize, App Annie, Big Query and SQL
Broad understanding of analytical processes including but not limited to data management, forecasting, optimization, predictive modeling, and visualization

But what really makes you stand out is…

Passionate about digital analytics using large scale data (framing – execution – presentation)
Strong collaborator, yet able to work independently and manage multiple projects/responsibilities
Highly effective communicator; able to clearly articulate key learnings or concepts to non-technical partners; excellent presentation skills
Passion for finding the stories the data can tell
Can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; anticipates and adjusts for problems and roadblocks
