PermanentWhat is the opportunity?

As Machine Learning (ML) methods grow in importance at RBC, it is essential for Enterprise Model Risk Management (EMRM) to establish policies and procedures to control model risk and regulatory risk for these classes of models. A machine learning engineer is needed to focus full-time on implementation of ML validation plans to prepare for widespread adoption of ML models and ensure that EMRM stays current with industry and academic developments in the field. A significant component of this role is to work with the ML research scientists in the team in order to assist implementation of the research methodologies and also design reusable code to improve validation efficiency.

What will you do?

Participate in cutting edge research in machine intelligence and machine learning applications
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, neural networks, model validation, and model implementation
Use machine learning, data mining and statistical techniques to create new scalable and predictive models
Research and implement novel machine learning & statistical models/approaches across multiple industries working with cross-functional business teams
Model risk management guards against possible adverse financial, regulatory, and/or reputational impacts arising from the use/misuse of models
A failure to effectively prepare for and manage emerging model risk related to Machine Learning would subject RBC to unwarranted potential financial, regulatory, and reputational risks
Partnership with EMRM ML validation research scientist that will consist of: employ ML solutions to validation problems, such as development of benchmark models and assist in coding and implementation of the research outputs and create modular scalable ML validation tools.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have

M.Sc./ PhD in Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering or a similar discipline
2+ years of relevant experience or education in machine learning engineering
Proficient programming skills in Python, R and SQL
Familiar with popular ML frameworks and libraries (tidyverse, xgboost, Pytorch, Keras, Tensorflow, airflow, pandas, numpy, etc)
Comfortable with command line tools in a Linux or Windows environment e.g. Linux (bash, Powershell, ssh, etc)

Nice to have

Experience with version control using Git
Exposure to the Big Data ecosystem (Spark, Hadoop)

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, and stock where applicable.Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.Opportunities to do challenging work.Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

DAI

Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. We are searching for a Criminal Intelligence Analyst who is passionate and knowledgeable. If you can see yourself working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where you can really make a difference, Toronto Community Housing is a place for you!
The Criminal Intelligence Analyst will receive and assesses criminal intelligence information of a confidential nature, will analyze information, prepare reports, make recommendations on assigned projects and provide technical guidance to their direct reports, Field Intelligence Officers.
What you’ll do
Research and/or receive, evaluate and analyze information associated with daily operations and assigned projects.
Review published articles and police/CSU reports to detect trends and patterns of criminal activity.
Create and/or search computerized and manual filing systems for information in response to inquiries. Maintain the security and integrity of confidential files and oversees general filing system.
Gather and analyze relevant information to draw inferences regarding the scope, methods, intentions and vulnerabilities of groups or individuals involved in criminal activities.
Perform analysis of information to support criminal and social disorder investigations and response strategies. Analysis performed may include spatial, statistical and trend/pattern analysis, among other methods.
Produce specialized analytical products such as association charts, crime maps, linkage analysis and suspect profiles.
Produce analytical products and documentation for court actions. This may include tribunal and or court trials. Incumbents may be asked to appear in court as expert witnesses to support the aforementioned information.
Liaise with external law enforcement agencies
Summarize and present completed analysis at daily, weekly and monthly meetings with senior staff. Information presented can include updates, recommendations for action and criminal event series/crime problems.
Disseminate information to authorized personnel in accordance with legislation and the TPS memorandum of understanding. Act as a liaison with internal and external agencies. Establish and maintain contact with experts, analytical counterparts, educators and researchers.
Prepare reports and illustrations, make recommendations, attend meetings and make oral presentations on research findings or on new analytical products or techniques. May be required to testify in court, at an Inquiry or at a Hearing.
Prepare and present comprehensive analytical reports.
Assist with strategic planning and the deployment of resources.
Recommend investigative strategies based on information gathered.
Produce information for public release relating to the education and prevention of criminal activity.
Perform typical duties inherent to the position (i.e. assists with the training of new members).
Participate in formal on-the-job training courses in electronic data processing operations and analytical methods.
Crime Stopper tip intake
Other analytical and related duties as required.
What you’ll need
Minimum of three years related experience in researching, analyzing, interpreting information, and statistical analysis including forecasting trends, and identifying issues.
Degree/Diploma in Criminology, Mathematics, Statistical Analysis or Geography, or other related post-secondary education or police experience and associated criminal intelligence analyst training and experience.
Experience working in a policing or law enforcement environment an asset.
Experience in report writing and business case preparation.
Knowledge of TCHC and TPS policies, standard operating procedures, regulations and operations impacting the assigned work.
Knowledge of investigative tools and techniques.
Supervisory experience is an asset.
Must be proficient in Geographic Information System (GIS), Structured Query Language (SQL) and statistical software.
Highly developed research, analytical and interpretive skills with knowledge of research design and methodologies and practical application of such research.
Well-developed time-management skills with the ability to work independently and use own initiative to organize projects and set priorities; ability to meet tight deadlines.
Strong problem resolution skills to be able to overcome daily issues/problems.
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written.
Superior team-building skills and the ability to work effectively with various levels of management.
Ability to perform spatial, strategic and tactical analysis.
Ability to perform research.
Ability to summarize and present complex information in a coherent and understandable manner both verbally and written.
Skill in preparing technical reports to an academic standard.
Skill in preparing and making recommendations based on analyzed information.
General understanding of legislation pertinent to assigned area, and of court procedures and requirements regarding evidence and expert witness testimony.
What’s next
Once you apply, we’ll review your resume to determine if your skills and experience match the qualifications for the role and only qualified candidates will be contacted for next steps. If you move forward, the process may include an interview, written/practical test, and reference check.

Job Description

The Cineplex Digital Media division of Cineplex Entertainment is currently recruiting for a Senior Data Analyst, reporting to the Manager, Research & Insights. The Research & Analytics team is a highly involved team of data professionals who love what we do! We are seeking a talented, enthusiastic and client-focused Senior Data Analyst to join our team.
The Senior Data Analyst oversees and conducts the conversion of data into insights that will lead to informed business decisions. As the Analytics team is small but efficient, he/she will work autonomously with Cineplex Digital Media’s top management and executives to present strategic insights that build a stronger company. The Senior Data Analyst will handle multiple simultaneous tasks and will be expected to remain effective and functional under pressure and aggressive timelines.
In this role you will apply your analytical talent to our rich data environment in order to build intuitive dashboards and insightful business reports. You’ll be an expert problem-solver, delivering insights about the business to a variety of audiences and answering tough questions in an intuitive and understandable way.

Qualifications

Education and technical skills:
Master’s degree in a technical discipline, such as Mathematics/Analytics
Relevant discipline in an undergraduate degree
Experience:
Technical fluency with SQL is mandatory, intermediate Python/R for data modelling is required
2+ years of B2C analytics and business intelligence experience
Superior quantitative analysis ability and experience including campaign design, measurement, data mining and predictive analytics
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as PowerBI and/or Tableau
Strengths:
Must be client facing, and a highly collaborative team player who can influence across and up without reporting line authority.
Intellectual curiosity and passion for digging into data and mining it for insights
Strong time management and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage own workload while multi-tasking in order to meet deadlines.
Ability to create and deliver impactful presentations for different levels of audience across the organization
Key Responsibilities:
Be the Subject Matter Expert on all things analytics for CDM, own and be knowledgeable on CDM’s and Cineplex corporate’s database schemas and ways to manipulate this data to benefit our clients
Work alongside the technical support and operations team to drive operational efficiency and improve data quality
Design dashboards and reports, and create data visualizations to identify trends and drive business insights
Work with internal resources or vendors to conduct market research to augment insights drawn from the customer database.
Work on ad-hoc projects as specified by the Analytics team’s road map and its application to the Product team
Additional Information

Interested applicants please apply today.
While we appreciate all interest, only those candidate selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Cineplex Entertainment’s standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.
No Agency Calls Please

Assessment accommodation
When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
Intent of the process
The advertisement is for the creation of an on-going inventory which management will access as needs are identified. It is anticipated that the first draw will occur at any time after 3 weeks from the original posting. The number/timing of subsequent draws each year will be determined based on operational requirements.

Applicants will be able to apply and/or update their information on an ongoing basis.
Initial screening will utilize self-screening where applicants will be required to respond to a series of questions, this will include indicating which/how many of the example essential experience they have and providing the who, what, when, where/why of said essential experience.

For each draw, after screening on education and experience, those who are screened In may be invited for further assessment on remaining essential qualifications (competencies/qualifications).

Once assessment is completed the results will be valid for a minimum of 12 months. During this period if an applicant is redrawn from the inventory the previous assessment will apply, this would include those who did not qualify. After the period has expired the individual may be reassessed should they be referred on subsequent draws from the inventory.


The pool(s) created from this process/inventory can be used for temporary or permanent staffing for same and/or equivalent positions.
Positions to be filled: Number to be determined

Your résumé.

Research Analyst
Research Officer R21

An eligibility list may be established.

Bring your strong analytical and technical skills to this dynamic opportunity

The Education Analytics Branch enables the K-12 sector in B.C. to be a world leader in the use of education data to support program and strategic planning, system performance and quality delivery of personalised education. The Branch oversees the management, security and stewardship of education data and client services.

The Education System Outcomes Unit reports on the population and demographic characteristics of the education system, the performance of students in that system, and operational characteristics (e.g., number of educators, program enrolment) for the ministry, school districts, schools and the public. The Unit develops visualizations and provides data, analysis and information to support and promote evidence-based policy decisions throughout the education sector.

The Research Analyst responds to requests for information by developing and conducting qualitative and quantitative research and communicating conclusions and recommendations through briefings, presentations, and various data and information reports. The Research Analyst will spend much of their time manipulating large data sets within a data warehouse environment, reviewing data sets for quality and consistency, and summarizing data for diverse audiences. The position works with ministry program areas, management, professional and administrative staff to support data-driven decisions across the entire K-12 system.

Toronto, ONOverview:

This opportunity is for an analyst that is dynamic and inquisitive and who is self-reliant but also able to benefit from the mentoring of senior colleagues. The successful candidate for this role will work with national caliber clients and business partners in the automotive leasing and remarketing sectors.


The Company:

Canadian Dealer Lease Services, Inc. (CDLSI) is an acknowledged leader in the Canadian automotive leasing service sector and is the exclusive leasing partner for several top automotive brands in Canada. CDLSI manages the Customer Service, Accounting, and End of Term (EOT) operations for our partner brands. Our EOT Remarketing group is exclusively responsible for the remarketing of vehicles returned by lessees at the end of their leases and works to get the best value for our supported OEMs and banking partner for these returned vehicles.


Description:

The open position will specialize in providing the business information and analytics for management to actively manage the end-to-end vehicle remarketing process. This will include quantification of key aspects of the vehicle return and inspection process, segmentation of on-line and physical auction results, and other associated processes. Solid analytic experience is a must for this role.

The successful candidate will work with several external partner companies and internal stakeholders. Large amounts of data will need to be intelligently processed to derive key business information in a timely enough manner to support active remarketing decisions by senior staff or the needs of other internal and external stakeholders. The best candidates for this role will have the ability to improve, if warranted, current internal processes and data stores and representations and also be able to work with external partners to improve their data and processes.


Skills & Experience:

The successful candidate will need to have practical understanding of analytic tools and underlying statistics involved. Experience can come from a combination of education plus exposure in a work environment. A minimum of 2-3 years’ work experience can come from a combination of academia, the civil service, or the private sector for transportation, banking, engineering and other business driven markets.


Tools utilized should include at least a few Excel, MS ACCESS, VBA, and other related applications. Ability to work with SQL queries is desirable but not essential. Strong communication skills (written and verbal) are a must.


Reporting Analyst Task Areas:
 Producing monthly, weekly, and ad hoc reports plus some daily reports
 Lessee and vehicle segmentation reports
 Early termination metrics
 Profit/Loss reporting to OEM
 Operational process reporting
 Input for database maintenance

· Various other types of proprietary reporting
 Contributing to ongoing improvements to reports, processes, and systems

CDLSI does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable law.

job_title: Junior Software QA Analyst - Reporting Data Source
job_description:
We are looking for a Junior Software QA Analyst to join our QA team working on the Reporting Data Source and Integration areas of our flagship C55 product.

Reporting Data Source (RDS) is a data source for the generation of on-demand reports using third-party client tools such as Microsoft Excel of other BI and Reporting tools.

C55 also has a number of customer specific integrations that allow data transfer between C55 and other customer specific systems.

Key Responsibilities:

This position provides an opportunity to use and improve your skills in:

Integration and testing of newly developed product features, largely focused on integrations with the product’s database
Regression testing of existing features prior to the release of new product versions
Creation of test plans to enhance our constantly growing suite of QA tests to improve test coverage
Experience in source code control and life cycle of large software projects
Hands-on experience with web technologies used in sophisticated web products which are complex, data intensive, and challenging to test

Experience/ Skills :

Hands-on experience with SQL and Relational Database
Working with financial data and reports and querying databases
Experience using Web Service Clients and web technologies used in sophisticated web products
QA testing of sophisticated software products: analysing requirements specifications and identifying scenarios to test, testing features against requirements, writing test plans and creating test data, documenting test results and issues found
Working with defect tracking and test management systems

Our technology stack includes: C#, ASP.NET, HTML, JavaScript, and Oracle

What’s it like here?

Copperleaf has defined a culture that fosters excellence, a world-class team of innovators that inspire one another to learn and improve. We cultivate an atmosphere of openness and support where all opinions and ideas are valued and encouraged, and where teamwork is key to success. We value a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

As one of the top 20 Fastest-Growing Software Companies in Canada, winner of the BC Tech 2016 Emerging Company of the Year Award and 2017 Adoption of Technology Award, Copperleaf is a dynamic and disruptive high-tech organization offering exciting opportunities for growth and innovation.

job_description:
$6,189 - $7,821 a monthMethods Analyst II - Business Intelligence Statistical Analyst 2020 March 18
Job Number
: 35897
** This posting is for 1 Full-Time Temporary position that may be extended up to 18 months in accordance to Section 18.02 of the Collective Agreement **

The Edmonton Police Service (EPS) requires a highly organized, dedicated individual to provide strategic and operational analyses for the Business Intelligence Production Section in relation to crime statistics and business intelligence. Specific responsibilities of this position will include:

Develop corporate business intelligence reporting solutions.Conducting statistical analysis to support operational business analysis.Using statistical, analytical and modeling tools to identify impacts and crime trends.Conducting business analysis to increase efficiency and build business process improvement models.Researching analytics trends related to intelligence led policing, public safety and workload management.Consulting with internal and external stakeholders to document analytical business requirements, to ensure analytical products meet business needs.Collecting data, developing analyses, ad hoc queries and reports that meet business requirements.Testing and validating reports following EPS quality assurance processes.Communicating and collaborating with internal and external stakeholders.Other related duties as required.
Qualifications
:
University degree (preferably at a master's level) in statistics, mathematics, management sciences or related degree.A minimum of four (4) years directly related working experience.Proficient in database collection, database mining, and statistical analysis.Proficient in Microsoft Excel and SPSS.Experience in using the IBM Cognos BI tool set or similar BI application.Experience in using Geographical Information Systems (GIS) would be an asset.Experience in project management methods and software would be an asset.Familiarity with police data and data models would be an asset.Ability to collect, analyze and interpret data and statistics using quantitative and qualitative methods.Ability to prepare and present complex statistical reports.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Ability to exercise judgment and discretion in completing assigned tasks.Ability to communicate clearly at the executive level.Exceptional analytical, problem solving, oral and written communications skills.Applicants may be tested.THE EDMONTON POLICE SERVICE WILL CONDUCT AN ENHANCED POLICE INFORMATION CHECK ON THOSE CANDIDATES WHO HAVE BEEN SHORT-LISTED.

Hours of Work:

33.75 hours per week, Monday to Friday.

Salary Range:

21M, Grade 030: $45.84 - $57.93 (Hourly), $3,094.60 - $3,910.30 (Biweekly), $80,769.19 - $102,059.94 (Annually). The rates quoted are in accordance with a collective agreement between the Union and the City of Edmonton that expired on December 22, 2018.

General:

Civic Service Union 52 members are asked to send a copy of their application to the union office.The City of Edmonton thanks applicants for their interest in this opportunity. Candidates considered for the position will be contacted.We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome diversity and encourage applications from all qualified individuals.
The Province of Alberta is a party to the Federal Agreement on Internal Trade, the Trade, Investment and Labour Mobility with British Columbia and the New West Partnership Trade Agreement with British Columbia and Saskatchewan. All of these agreements promote labour mobility between the Provinces. Applicants may obtain information regarding recognition of extra provincial credentials at www.newwestpartnershiptrade.ca.

CanadaScience-Metrix is an internationally recognized research evaluation company specializing in the assessment of science and technology (S&T) activities. We work with government, educational, non-profit or private organizations that perform scientific research or deal with S&T activity funding and management. Our services enable evidence-based decision-making, strategic planning, and outcome assessment processes. Our team has developed a unique and specialized knowledge base and techniques and contributed to the development of new indicators and new quantitative methods, most notably in bibliometrics.
We believe in the strength of collaboration and we are searching for talented individuals to join our team. If you strive for excellence, have an inquiring mind and are fascinated by science and innovative projects, you could be the candidate we are looking for!
POSITION DESCRIPTION
Science-Metrix is in search of a policy analyst to join our team in an entry- or intermediate-level role, depending on your experience working with bibliometric data and/or conducting research & innovation policy analysis. Entry-level policy analysts will contribute to:
 project proposal development, by conducting background research (literature reviews, environmental scans);
 project execution, by interpreting data (analyzing bibliometric findings, reporting on their relevance to a client’s local policy or operational context); and
 general policy knowledge within the firm, by assembling syntheses of major developments in the research & innovation policy sphere (following new budget releases, extracting key elements, circulating a synthesis among internal staff).
In addition to the junior-level tasks, intermediate-level policy analysts will also contribute to:
 study design, by providing critical input regarding the relevance of various methodologies to the operational and policy context of the client;
 client communication, by liaising between data analysts internally and policy-oriented clients;
 project leadership, by managing workflow of internal teams on small- to medium-sized contracts;
 thought leadership in research & innovation policy, by conducting research at Science-Metrix, presenting at conferences, publishing journal articles and/or writing online content.
REQUIREMENTS
 Understanding of and passion for research & innovation policy as well as the functioning of the science, technology and innovation spheres (volunteer and academic experience are assets)
 Strong data literacy, interest in quantitative analysis
 Strong communication skills and “people skills” (especially for intermediate level)
 Academic degree, any field (PhD is an asset)
 Very strong written English, decent spoken French (other languages are assets)
 Proficiency with MS Office suite, especially Word, Excel (pivot tables and SQL are assets)
 Ability to deliver work on time even with evolving schedules (project mgmt. experience is an asset, especially for intermediates)
 Ability to strike a balance between rigour and value to the project
 Ability to overcome obstacles proactively, independently and creatively

$78,001 - $91,764 a yearReference number: 48199-CSE(OC)2019 Closing Date: 2019-06-07

Job Summary:
The Geospatial Analyst manages and implements geospatial projects, provides geospatial solutions, and delivers complex analytical products to a wide array of internal customers. The Geospatial Analyst consults and provides expert geospatial advice to intelligence analysts and their teams as well as to decision makers. They perform in-depth spatial analysis on a wide range of issues and using a wide range of data types. They perform research on geospatial topics and implement new technologies, techniques, and initiatives. The Geospatial Analyst provides mentorship and training to analysts looking to incorporate spatial analysis into their workflows.


Position Type:
Term and/or indeterminate positions can be staffed from this process, with a one (1) year probation period.
Salary Range:
UNI-07 level: $78, 001 TO $91, 764
The salary is under review.
Position Requirements:
Education:
Successful completion of a secondary school diploma.
University degree in geographic information systems (GIS), geomatics, geography, OR a bachelor’s degree in any field PLUS a diploma or certificate in GIS.
Experience:
Recent experience* performing spatial analysis with desktop GIS applications, preferably ArcMap and/or ArcGIS Pro.
Recent experience leveraging web GIS platforms like ESRI’s Portal (including Insights), for
creating and sharing spatial data.
creating web map applications like dashboards and story maps.
A strong understanding of the fields of geography, spatial analysis, and cartography.
Recent experience is defined as having performed the duties in the last two (2) years.
Preference may also be given to applicants with one or more of the following:
Experience leveraging geo-statistics and performing spatio-temporal analysis.
Experience with ArcGIS Model Builder or basic python or GeoTime.
Experience identifying training needs, developing training material and delivering training.
A passion for thorough analytical workflows, attention to detail, thirst for continual learning, and top-notch customer service.
Genuine interest in troubleshooting and resolving complex cartographic, GIS and analysis-related issues.
Competencies:
Accountability/Autonomy
Cognitive Thinking Skills
Interactive Communication
Service, Work in a Team
Achieving Results
Change & Innovation
Collaboration
Lead & Motivate
Strategy & Vision
Knowledge of Domain Tools and Technology
Domain Analysis and Research
Target Knowledge and World Context
Language Requirements:
English Essential
Who Can Apply:
Canadian citizens who qualify for a Top Secret security clearance; conforming to CSE’s standards.
Security Requirements:
Candidates must have no criminal record. The screening process involves a security interview, a polygraph test, a psychological assessment, and a background investigation covering a minimum of your last 10 years history, including credit and financial verifications. Ongoing substance abuse is a factor to be assessed as part of your screening process.
Why join CSE?
CSE has been named among the top employers in the National Capital Region
Attractive compensation and benefits package (insurances, pension)
State-of the art new building, encouraging collaboration, agility and innovation
Flexible hours, compressed work week
Complimentary on-site 24/7 fitness centre, and access to fitness classes for a minimal fee
Nearby access to banking, daycare, shopping, movies etc.
Access to exceptional career development opportunities


How to Apply:
Applicants must clearly demonstrate in their application how they meet each EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE criteria. Failure to do so will result in the applicant being screened out of the selection process.
If you meet these requirements, you may submit your candidacy online by clicking “APPLY” at the bottom of the page.
NOTES:
CSE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage applications from women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minority groups. CSE offers an assessment process which will accommodate the needs of persons with disabilities. If you may need such accommodation, please advise us.
CSE is a separate organization and is not subject to the Public Service Employment Act (PSEA). The organization has its own values-based staffing regime and as such, has the flexibility to determine qualifications for positions and how these qualifications will be assessed in a selection process.
We thank all applicants for their interest in CSE. However, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
Candidates must be able to provide proof of education credentials.
The entire selection process – tests, interviews, security investigation – may take more than one year.
You can request that the process be conducted in the official language of your choice.
Overtime and standby duty may be required.

Montréal, QCNext Wireless Group is looking for a Data Scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights.

In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine-learning and research.

Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions. As the first “data guru” of the company you will have to build the right tools to display all the KPIs and reports needed. You will work on ad hoc finance projects and your insights will be more than helpful to help the company develop its business.

Responsibilities:
Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processesUndertake pre-processing of structured and unstructured dataAnalyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patternsBuild predictive models and machine-learning algorithmsCombine models through ensemble modelingPresent information using data visualization techniquesPropose solutions and strategies to business challengesCollaborate with Engineering and Product Development teams

Toronto, ONOnline local listings and directories don't organize themselves – they need to be corralled, curated and coaxed into shape. It's a hands-on responsibility that can only be handled by the digital equivalent of a shepherd; somebody who knows LPM (local presence management) like the back of their hand; whose attention to detail is borderline supernatural; who knows how to make Excel verify data, pinpoint errors, and someone who is obsessively proactive and able to investigate and resolve issues before they even come up.
Right now, DAC Group is looking for just such a Digital Shepherd (or Operations Support Analyst if you want to get all formal) to join the growing team of "Geeks with Personality" at our Toronto headquarters. Sound like your kind of gig? Then we want to hear from you.
Responsibilities
Manage client's location data across DAC's publisher network, including various search engines, online directories, maps and social networks
Manage multiple client programs, all with varying priorities and timelines
Input client LPM (local presence management) information into internal DAC systems
Work with Account teams to analyze and improve upon client data
Liaise with Account teams and publishers following launch of clients work
Analyze incoming data feeds from clients, and process any updates where required
Work closely with Account and Client services team to ensure we are exceeding client expectations
Requirements
1+ year in related field
Post-secondary education in similar field of interest
Proficient in data analysis
Highly skilled working knowledge of MS Excel
Exceptional written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
Excellent computer skills and conversant with all Microsoft applications and Internet fundamentals
High attention to detail
Ability to handle a flexible changing environment
Excellent time management skills
Awesome Perks:
Free Parking
Free Breakfast and Snacks daily
Free Gym in Building
Casual dress every day of the week
Profit sharing
Public transit access (3 min walk to Leslie Subway Station)
Office location surrounded by green space
Professional development allowance
An active social committee
Company shutdown between Christmas and New Year's

Ellesmere, ONThe Business Analyst is responsible for conceptualizing, creating, and publishing key reports to be distributed throughout the contact centres. This role will also be integral for creating and developing the workforce forecast, the successful candidate will be expected work with the workforce management team to aid in making accurate recommendations to the contact centres. The successful candidate will also be a key player as part of our data centralization initiative, to consolidate and centralize various data streams, and work internal customers to understand reporting requirements.

Position Responsibilities:
Be seen as the active lead Analyst on the team, be the visible "go-to" person for direction on day to day activities for contact centre reporting
Provide insightful data that will enable the review and/or creation of KPIs throughout the contact centres
Provide and/or assist with accurate forecasting to the workforce management team
Perform complex analytics and deliver recommendations, produce ad hoc reports when requested
Work with Operations and provide key data required in order to improve operational efficiencies and create best practices and procedures
Conceptualize, create, and publish daily, weekly, monthly, yearly reports as required, work with contact centre managers and operations to assess reporting needs .
Act as the prime and liaison between Operations and Reporting to assist with data centralization and automation initiatives, responsible for or assisting with data base administration if required

Knowledge/Experience Required:
Internal Candidates: Must fulfill minimum time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+, Meets Expectations and Consistently Demonstrates)
5+ years of analytical experience (ideally in a retail environment)
Expert-level proficiency with MS Excel, SQL, familiarity with cloud-based database administration and storage, i.e. Google Cloud
Experience in project management an asset
Strong analytical skills with the ability to extrapolate pertinent information from various sources (reports and spreadsheets) and analyze data for recommendations.
High proficiency with SAS or other statistical software, able to understand and utilize advanced forecasting and statistica/data modeling techniques
Familiar and proficient in data analytics/visualization tools such as Tableau, Microstrategy, etc…
Understanding of relational databases and data flows/tables, able to assist with data centralization initiatives
Excellent communication skills; collaborative with effective interpersonal skills; able to work across departments
Strong customer focus with business acumen, problem solving skills and results orientated
Self -directed, ability to work with limited supervision

Parnell, ONOur Company

The Kraft Heinz Company is revolutionizing the food industry – we will be the most profitable food company powered by the most talented people with unwavering commitment to our communities, leading brands and highest product quality in every category in which we compete. As a global powerhouse, Kraft Heinz represents over $26 billion in revenue and is the 5th largest food and beverage company in the world. At Kraft Heinz, to be the BEST food company, growing a BETTER world is more than a dream – it is our GLOBAL VISION. To be the best, we want the best – best brands, best practices and, most importantly, the best people.
It's a Question of Taste

Do more, be more. Whatever your aspirations, experience something exceptional at Kraft Heinz. We'll give you the freedom to determine your own direction and deliver in your own style. Outperform our expectations and you'll move forward faster than you ever thought possible. Come ready to dream. Come eager to grow.


Get a taste of what your career could be at kraftheinzcompany.com/careers.
Job Description
The Finance Analyst supports Kraft Heinz to make well-informed commercial decisions through:
Supporting strategic planning through preparation of budgets and monthly forecasts
Analysing and reporting on actuals against budget/forecasts
Month end reporting and analysis
Preparing reliable and insightful reports including monthly, ad-hoc and reporting for head office
Providing financial information to internal stakeholders for decision making and challenging assumptions
Assist with internal and external audits
Identifying and assisting with business process improvements
About you
The successful candidate will demonstrate:
Tertiary qualification in Accounting, Finance, Commerce or related discipline
At least 2 years’ relevant work experience
Exceptional analytical skills with ability to simplify and present complex data

Ability to work under pressure and perseverance to work through issues to resolution

We are a Company that is dynamic and exciting, and one which dreams big. If you are passionate about what you do and enjoy working in a culture that is transparent, collaborative and one where you can make a difference every day, then this is the place for you. Kraft Heinz promotes a culture of ownership and meritocracy, that you could be a part of.
If you think you are up for the challenge that this role offers, then don’t hesitate apply NOW!
Only people who are eligible to work in New Zealand or who are certain they can gain eligibility through immigration processes should apply. Evidence will be required.

DealerTrack, a business of Cox Automotive, is looking for a Data Analyst who will be responsible for the design, maintenance, and on-going support of operational and compliance reports as well as dashboards. This individual will ensure optimal efficiency by monitoring work quality as well as delivering reports, statistics, data analysis, and recommendations for improvement. The Data Analyst will also work with various organizations across the company to facilitate process and product improvements.

Primary Responsibilities and Essential Functions
Communicate insights and suggest improvements based on data and observed trends
Develop and present standard and ad-hoc reports and analysis to stakeholders across the organization
Perform proactive and reactive analyses to ensure data integrity
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Present information using data visualization techniques
Performing exploratory data analysis, generates and tests working hypotheses, and uncovers noteworthy trends and relationship
Implement algorithms to power user-facing data-driven features
Be a champion for data science by helping business users understand algorithms outputs thru meaningful metrics and visualizations.
Develop python scripts/methods for a range of subject areas by conducting research on existing Python and R libraries for agent based, predictive, inferential, and optimization models;
Support visualizations and client reporting through meaningful dashboards, graphics and maps;
Use strong analytical skills, business acumen and attention to quality to provide data and analysis to assist in solving complex problems

Qualifications
BS/BA in related discipline
2-5 years of experience in related technology field OR MS/MA and generally 2-4 years of experience in related technology field
Knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence suite (SSIS,SSAS, SSRS) and Microsoft BI Publisher
Hands on experience in SQL and RDBMS (Oracle & SQL Server)
Excellent interpersonal, leadership, and presentation skills
Must be able to work with minimal supervision as this position requires owning initiatives from inception to execution


About Cox Automotive
Cox Automotive Inc. makes buying, selling and owning cars easier for everyone, while also enabling mobility services. The global company’s 34,000-plus team members and family of brands, including Autotrader®, Clutch Technologies, Dealer.com®, Dealertrack®, Kelley Blue Book®, Manheim®, NextGear Capital®, VinSolutions®, vAuto® and Xtime®, are passionate about helping millions of car shoppers, tens of thousands of auto dealer clients across five continents and many others throughout the automotive industry thrive for generations to come. Cox Automotive is a subsidiary of Cox Enterprises Inc., a privately-owned, Atlanta-based company with revenues exceeding $20 billion. www.coxautoinc.com
Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual’s age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Statement to ALL Third-Party Agencies and Similar Organizations: Cox accepts resumes only from agencies with which we formally engage their services. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, Cox employees, Cox hiring manager, or send to any Cox facility. Cox is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.

Burnaby, BCJob Summary

Start a rewarding career! iData’s mission is to empower healthcare device manufacturers to succeed in making intelligent, data-driven decisions. We provide industry research that assists Fortune 500 companies across the globe to make strategic marketing and business decisions.

Who We Are:

iData’s mission is to empower healthcare device manufacturers to succeed in making intelligent, data-driven decisions. We provide industry research that assists companies across the globe to make strategic marketing and business decisions.

Our Entry-Level Market Research Analystapplies a scientific approach to market monitoring. They are responsible for secondary research concerning medical devices and markets, and primary phone research with key opinion leaders and other participants within the medical market, in addition to data analysis and report composition.

We are a young and dynamic office, looking for applicants with drive, creativity, energy and a positive personality to fit with our amazing team. This is a great opportunity for new graduates to become exposed to the medical devices market.

What You’ll Be Doing:

Conduct primary phone research with key opinion leaders across the globe.
Conduct secondary research concerning medical devices and their associated markets.
Analyze qualitative and quantitative market data.
Create market forecast models.
Report composition.
Writing industry journal articles regarding emerging/growing industry trends.
Job Type / Category

Full Time, Permanent Position

Required Education, Skills and Qualifications

Bachelor Degree, preferably with a focus in Biology/Life Sciences, Economics or Business.
Medical and/or pharmaceutical industry experience is an asset.
Experience in working with quantitative and qualitative data.
Outstanding oral and written communication skills, with the ability to produce professional technical documentation.
Excellent organizational, multitasking and time-management skills, with a strong sense of responsibility and adherence to deadlines.
Detail oriented accuracy in all work and communication.
Strong critical thinking and analytical problem-solving acumen.
Team player with good collaborative skills and the ability to quickly adapt to change.
Enjoys a fast-paced, dynamic, challenging and team-oriented work environment.
Internet savvy and fluent in MS Office.
Flexible availability to service our clients’ unique global demands.
If this describes you, please send your cover letter, resume and post-secondary transcript to jobs(@)idataresearch.net .

Please note that due to a high volume of responses, only qualified, short-listed candidates will be contacted. All other resumes will remain in our database for future consideration.

Dorval, QCDescription
Are you passionate about reaching new heights, teamwork and making a meaningful contribution? Do you picture yourself as a valued member of an industry-leading organization? If you answered yes to these questions, Air Canada is seeking enthusiastic individuals to join the diverse and vibrant team working together to lead the growth and expansion of Canada’s flag carrier.

Air Canada sponsors 8 defined benefit pension plans. The plans' assets are managed by a wholly owned subsidiary of Air Canada and are held in a diversified portfolio of traditional asset classes (bonds and stocks), alternative investments (derivatives, infrastructure, private equity and real estate) and portable alpha strategies (hedge funds and tactical asset allocation) worth over $19B. The assets are invested by internal and external managers. The Investment’s team of 49 professionals is located in downtown Montreal.

Reporting to the Director, Hedge Funds & Alternative Investments, the analyst will contribute to manage the portfolio of hedge funds and alternative funds, monitor and supervise the external managers, provide consistent and top quality analysis in order to assist in the strategic decisions pertaining to the portfolio.

Participate in the search and evaluation of hedge fund and alternative fund managers
Provide ongoing research coverage of the hedge fund industry, to identify industry trends and market intelligence and communicate the findings and such insights to the Team
Produce performance reports of alternatives and hedge fund portfolios to clients
Involved in strategic and long-term asset allocation within the portfolio
Monitor on a continuous basis the evolution of the hedge fund and alternative funds, as well as the assets within the various funds
Produce concise written summary reports on a quarterly basis
Perform various quantitative and qualitative analysis to help in the day-to-day management of the pension plans’ assets
Assist in performing modeling and calculations to analyze and quantify the performance and risks of various strategies
Conduct market research and maintain a continuous knowledge of the general market conditions
Maintain close relationships with various parties, including external managers, consultants and investment peers
Perform other duties as assigned or required and act as a resource person for team members as necessary


Qualifications
University graduate degree in finance, actuarial science, math or other related field. Master degree is an asset.
Additional qualifications such as CFA, CAIA, & FRM designations is an asset
A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience
Experience in hedge fund and alternative institutional environment
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office tools (PowerPoint, Excel)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Demonstrate a strong working knowledge of the hedge fund industry and the various strategies
Fully bilingual (French/English)
Knowledge of derivative instruments
Skilled with the manipulation of large quantity of data, and at preparing reports summarizing pertinent information
Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner under pressure
Rigorous, disciplined and well organized (efficient, high quality, well structured work)
Strong analytical skills with a sense for detail
Fast learner
Team player
Strong interpersonal skills
Ability to work well independently
Free to travel from time to time

LINGUISTIC REQUIREMENTS


Bilingual (English and French)

Diversity and Inclusion
Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Toronto, ONPermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

As a Replenishment Analyst you will work in partnership with the Category Management and Forecasting teams to introduce exciting new products while maintaining and developing our existing product assortments. At the intersection of Supply Chain and Merchandising, this role is a cross-functional opportunity that is integral to the organization due to the high level of accountability and the critical impact of outcomes to the bottom line.

All analysts hired into the program will participate in a comprehensive two-week education and training program to gain exposure to key components of Canadian Tire’s Supply Chain and Merchandising practices as well as the foundational tasks required to succeed in the role.

What you’ll do

Successful candidates will be responsible for managing the replenishment of specific product lines within the Canadian Tire assortment. Analysts will focus on managing and optimizing replenishment plans in support of regular, promotional and seasonal dealer ordering patterns, and will act as the single point of contact between Category Management teams and Supply Chain.

All analysts in the program manage relationships with suppliers from North America and offshore by planning demand cycles and smoothing channel operations to manage the flow of inventory. You will work closely with several cross-functional groups within Canadian Tire to ensure visibility to forecasted demand and timely flow of goods from suppliers, into our Distribution Centres, and out to our stores. Success will be measured by the ongoing improvement of key metrics in your line such as inventory management, receipt management, and service level to our stores. Other responsibilities may include:

Negotiation with suppliers for additional manufacturing capacity/inventory and shorter lead times

Supporting merchandising initiatives by ensuring that supply chain solutions are in place to effectively service our customers

Collaboration with key stakeholders such as Buying Teams, Suppliers, Marketing, Associate Stores and Distribution

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

UNIVERIS, headquartered in Toronto, Canada, is a privately held company and is the leader in enterprise wealth management for the Canadian market. Founded in 1991, UNIVERIS has over 100 staff and 23 leading financial services clients representing over 14,000 financial advisors on the platform. It offers the most comprehensive wealth management solution for financial advisors in the credit union, banking, insurance and investment dealer sectors.

UNIVERIS is a world-class technology platform that boasts a number of firsts in Canadian mutual fund distribution including real-time processing, web access, built-in compliance, plus GIC and segregated funds processing capabilities. Technology innovation is one of the cornerstones of Univeris' product development strategy and through its Evergreen approach to technology, new features and capabilities transparently integrate into the platform.


ABOUT THE ROLE


The Data Specialist will engage with cross-functional stakeholders to advance the Univeris Data Steward and Data Conversion Solutions, optimizing the use of technology and automation. This self-starting leader will be able to collect, prioritize, and analyze data and data management requirements across each of data integrity, data scrubbing, and complex data conversion. This specialist will have extensive experience in data management, transfer, integrity management, including expertise in modern technologies (ETL) to build, implement, and optimize the conversion process. This individual will be responsible for cultivating working relationships with clients in order to identify needs and deliver high-quality data conversion projects, seeing the client through the inquiry, planning, analysis, development, testing, execution and go-live support stages of the data conversion process. This position is part of the Customer Success COE and reports directly to the VP of IT Services and Customer Success.


SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES

Evaluates, analyses, identifies, prioritizes requirements to implement ETL (Pentaho or similar) technology to renovate and optimize data conversion initiatives

Evaluates, analyses, identifies, prioritizes requirements to optimize the Data Integrity tools

Evaluates, analyses, identifies, prioritizes existing documented processes, protocols, procedures to optimally commoditize Data Conversion and Integrity documentation

Leads data conversion projects following the Univeris Data Conversion Framework, analyzing opportunities for optimization and automation - including implementing new technologies.

Develops strong relationships with all cross-functional team members including Delivery Managers, Product Managers, Release Management, Business Analysts, Quality Assurance Analysts, Systems Analysts, Developers, IT staff and Clients

Evaluates and implements ETL tools and software packages
Liaises as required with internal Subject Matter Experts and IT support staff and provides input to sizing and configuring the production and conversion environments.

Leverages SaaS, Infrastructure, DevOps, Architecture (enterprise and data), and Technology groups to advance the Data Steward practice

Acts as a technical expert and provides guidance and training to clients and staff on data conversion and application use.

Provides input to data conversion project plan, estimates, timelines, risk management plan and communication plan

Requirements gathering, analysis and documenting the system-to-system data mapping, data validation, data enrichment and data transformation rules

Analyzes the client operating model and data, and identifies potential functional and data gaps.

Creates conversion specifications based upon client’s current platform and the desired organizational model, delivering an ETL package and operational model.

Imports, maps, transforms, analyzes, validates, corrects, loads, audits and reconciles client data between the source system, the Univeris EWMS platform and other data sources

Guides the client to execute data integrity verification programs and to correct data issues.

Works closely with the client to set realistic targets and manages expectations and timelines.

Provides support to the client before, during and after the conversion, identifying areas of risk and creating solutions to prevent or mitigate risk.

Works with and leads outsourced resources as required.

Accountable for the overall success of the data conversion projects and for the client's ability to operate on the Univeris EWMS platform with the converted data

Develops effective relationships with clients, working with the client from initial inquiry, through design, development, system installation, data conversion and support stages.

Works with client to explain the data conversion methodology, explaining the benefits of the Univeris EWMS platform, and providing accurate resolutions and solutions to Client problems related to data conversion.

In the installation and support stages works with client to build and deliver the ETL tool and operational model.

Works with the client to establish accurate and realistic timelines for test and production conversions.

Develops and delivers client training for the operation of data cleanup utilities that are part of the Univeris EWMS platform, customizing the training delivery based on client need, knowledge and skill level.

Provides on-going support to the client following the production conversion to ensure operational fitness using the converted data.

Creates and maintains Data Conversion and/or System Implementation documentation specific to each project based on the Univeris Data Conversion and System Implementation frameworks.

Engages in communities of practice, meetups, to advance the Univeris Data Strategy best practices and technology innovations

Proactively identifies own training needs.

Education

Toronto, ONHello, it’s a new day, and it’s time to answer the call to elevate your career and make life accessible for all.
Our purpose is to make life accessible
Our compassion and knowledge set us apart. With kindness and expertise, we support individuals by delivering the right mobility, accessibility, personal care, and daily living solutions. We believe that providing people with comprehensive solutions empowers and fulfills us all.

If you want to help our clients experience their most vibrant lives while growing your own career in a nurturing, learning-focused and supportive environment - you will love being part of Motion.
Who we are
Motion is Canada’s leading provider of comprehensive and customized mobility and accessibility solutions for a wide variety of clients from children to elderly adults. Who we need
Reporting to the Director of Business Improvement, we are adding a Business Analyst to our team. The simplification and standardization of inventory management and baseline inventory practices.
Development and implementation of an effective inventory control strategy to minimize waste and inventory variances.
Development of nationwide KPI’s for inventory and warehouse management.
Design, creation and implementation of documentation including warehouse SOP’s, processes and policies.
Who you are
You want to join a national organization undergoing an exciting period of transformation. You want to spearhead change initiatives resulting in significant business improvement and customer satisfaction. You are drawn to the bigger cause of Motion and want to be part of making life more accessible.
You are a clear and effective communicator with a passion for continuous improvement. You believe in the power and efficiencies of Lean processes. You are entrepreneurial and creative. You are an inquisitive and high-energy team player who takes a strategic approach to managing and driving change.
What you will do
Lead and implement key strategic projects, focusing on Inventory and warehouse management. You will own and drive improvement projects with the goal of improving quality, reducing costs, increasing productivity and improving cycle time by reducing wasted time, rework, etc.
Inventory & Analysis. Every mobility device we process is custom to our clients, as a result we rely on our warehouse to play an integral role in keeping our operations running smoothly. Work closely with the regions and head office to perform analysis of our inventory and ensure we are utilizing our inventory effectively, purchasing the right equipment, maintaining solid inventory data.
Be a role model. You will exemplify excellence in continuous improvement (CI). You will identify opportunity, develop sustainable targets and embed practices within the business. You will work with leadership to create an environment for learning, team goal alignment and accountability removing barriers to these objectives.
Report. You will liaise with finance and other members of the organization in assessing, tracking and reporting the financial benefit of a project. You will provide management with project status updates, feedback, and appropriate reporting on key responsibilities and objectives.
What you bring
The education. You have a Bachelor Degree and possess practical financial and business acumen.
As the Expertise, you also have demonstrated success in:
Inventory reduction best practices.
Project management.
Business optimization and process improvement.
Business transformation.
Continuous improvement process- in quality, sales, distribution and operations.
Cost savings.

The analytical and collaborative approach. You can foster a positive working environment, encouraging adoption and buy-in of continuous improvement initiatives. You have outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, and can relay complex concepts to audiences at any level, gaining trust and nurturing a collaborative team approach. You are comfortable providing feedback and following through to track improvement.

Progressive experience (2 - 8 years) willing to hire a junior to more seasoned professional provided that individual has some logistics, manufacturing or material handling experience.

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. This is a unique opportunity to join the International Transportation Operations Team from within the Canadian Tire group of Companies located in our Vancouver office. Our mission is to harmonize the movement of containers from the ports to keep a regular flow of freight moving into our Supply Chain. The team celebrates 100+ years of experience in the local Vancouver gateway and enjoy sharing ideas with each other every day to come up with new ideas. We look forward to welcoming a new person who brings experience and is willing to grow with us.

The Operations Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and maintaining operational and financial measurements related to the transportation of all ocean container movements in Vancouver. The expectation of this individual is to become the Subject Expert in all aspects of the “post” operation and be in a position to offer recommendations to the team on potential cost saving ideas to promote productivity. The analyst will also be responsible for preparing and understanding month end results, accruals, quarterly reviews, driver scorecard and numerous other relative KPI’s. The participation in implementation and testing of new projects will be also expected from the candidate where his/her global knowledge will be useful to test and improve current systems in place.

Manage daily driver expense by balancing container movement to all facilities served by VANOPS to our 3rd party service providers.

Monitor performances of third-party transportation providers against set service level targets and expectations and drive improvements.

Act as a Subject Expert for all operational processes and play a key role onboarding new carriers.

Upgrade, automate and improve reporting and analytic tools for the team.

Compile financial and operational data to support monthly and yearly Business Reviews

Assist and develop further processes with 3rd party service providers to balance the exchange of information

Monitor, review and reconcile invoices

Drive productivity improvements and efficiencies within the transportation usage to benefit CTC supply chain and transportation.

Gain experience and knowledge with CTR processes and systems

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

Proven track record working effectively in a team environment where problems are solved regularly.

2 years + of Logistics/transportation or industry-related experience.

Experience in Retail Distribution, 3PL and/or Federal/Provincial regulations

Familiar with the processes associated with import/export of goods in/out of Canada

Halifax, NSJob Description
Data & Analytics Specialist ( Contract role- 6 months guaranted and with a high potential of extension for 12 to 18 months)

Aon’s Data & Analytics team oversees the largest proprietary database of commercial insurance placement information in the world. As a Data & Analytics Specialist, you will become an integral part of the Analytics value chain for ARS Canada. Based out of the Halifax office, you will support and collaborate as part of a virtual national business analytics team.

This position will provide insight into branch and corporate career streams within the organization and provide individuals with technical knowledge of insurance industry along with data management fundamentals.

Your responsibilities will be focused around contributing to and expanding upon ARS Canada’s data capture and analytics strategies as outlined below:

Job Responsibilities:
Working with colleagues across the country to ensure the timely and accurate collection of policy data points
Extracting policy level data points from emails and electronic files for input into our systems
Proactively collaborating with Broking teams to capture insurance market information
Coordinating Account Executive and Broker data quality reports in collaboration with regional Analyst team
Resolving data quality issues as they arise
Hosting regular status update meetings with assigned offices to collect required data points
Collaborating with other Data & Analytics Specialists on data clean up initiatives
Acting as a subject matter expert and resource for assigned offices on data and reporting matters

Required Experience:
Post-secondary education an asset – background in business/analytics and/or an interest in the insurance industry an asset
Microsoft office proficiency, with focus on Excel and PowerPoint
Strong attention to detail required to ensure accuracy of inputs
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills will be essential in order to successful collaborate with virtual teams
Organizational skills with the ability to prioritize under competing deadlines while managing expectations
We offer you

A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon:
Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.

Aon is committed to a diverse workforce as an Employment Equity employer (Women, People with Disabilities, Aboriginal Peoples, and Visible Minorities).

Job Title: Dental Special Authorization Analyst

Department: Federal Administered Programs

Competition: 4827

Employment Type: Full Time, Permanent

Location: Moncton

Closing Date: March 31, 2019

The Opportunity

If you are looking for an opportunity in a challenging, fast-paced and team-oriented work environment with a leading local organization, the career you’ve been looking for may be waiting for you at Medavie Blue Cross.

The Federal Administered Programs (FAP) Medical Authorization Centre- Dental specializes in the authorization and reimbursement of dental benefits.

As a MAC Dental, Special Authorization Analyst in our 12 Millennium Drive, Moncton office you will develop a high level of knowledge in the programs we administer. In this role you will respond to requests from clients and providers in both official languages.

Shifts may vary during the hours of operations of the Medical Authorization Centre-Dental, between 8:00 am – 6:00pm, Monday to Friday.

Key Responsibilities:

Receive, pend and process requests for dental services that require special authorization consideration, prepare packages that require review from dental consultant.
Administer processes for special authorization decisions through the interactive use of telecommunications and applied on-line technology;
Call and or draft requests for additional information from dentist and / or dental specialists for more information or diagnostics when necessary or requested by the dental consultant;
Update requests according to decisions rendered to allow for real time adjudication when the dental treatment authorized is rendered.
Create and send the appropriate decision letter to the client and / or provider to notify them of the outcome of their request.
Utilizes dental background, knowledge and experience to assess requests.
Liaison with the customers and other health care professionals to ensure treatment requests are appropriately administered.
Provides a positive and efficient customer service experience for providers and clients.

The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to:

Have the ability to work quickly and accurately under pressure of time restraints;
Have the ability to work on your own and as a team member;
Be well organized, with excellent time management skills;
Have excellent oral and written communication skills;
Demonstrate mature and professional judgment and decision making ability.

As the ideal candidate, you possess the following qualifications:

Education: Successful completion of a recognized post-secondary Dental Assisting or Dental Hygiene program.

Work Experience: The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 1 year experience in a dental environment. Experience working in an office and or customer service experience would be considered an asset.

Other Qualifications: Experience with quick and accurate data entry and knowledge of claims processing, eligibility and claims systems would be considered an asset

Computer Skills: Experience working with the Microsoft Office Suite

Language Skills: Bilingualism would be considered an asset.


We would like to thank all candidates for expressing interest. Please note only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
Medavie Blue Cross is an equal opportunity employer.

Descartes (TSX:DSG) (NASDAQ:DSGX) is the global leader in providing on-demand, software-as-a-service solutions focused on improving the productivity, performance and security of logistics-intensive businesses.
