LOCATION: Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB)
JOB NUMBER: 27684

Why you should join us:
We know our future is data informed and technology enabled, and we are at the forefront of unleashing the powers within this space to create energy for a better world. This isn’t new to us, as we are innovators. Did you know we were the first organization to commercially deploy Autonomous Haul Trucks in the Oil Sands? We leverage leading edge technology for operational excellence such as 3D printing, virtual reality, and drones to name a few. If predicting events, building simulations, applying machine learning and deep learning techniques, and artificial intelligence are your jam, then this may be your opportunity to join us in making a step change across all our business areas (Upstream, Downstream, Corporate Functions) through the power of data.
You will use your expertise to:
Advocate, evangelize and build data-fueled products that help our clients improve outcomes
Analyze and profile large, complex, multi-dimensional datasets with a variety of tools
Provide insight to leading analytic practices, design and oversee interactive learning and development cycles, and produce new and creative analytics solutions that will become part of our core deliverables
Work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas
Lead applied analytics initiatives that are used across the breadth of our data solutions
Research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms and models to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targets outcomes
Use data science techniques to find data patterns, anomalies, and optimization opportunities
Provide expertise on mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire organization
Tackle and solve complex analytical problems using quantitative approaches
Interpret, translate and communicate analytical findings to business stakeholders and through visualizations
We’d like to review your application if you have…
Must-haves (minimum requirements):
Three to 10 years of progressive experience in advanced analytics or a quantitative field
A Bachelor or Master’s degree with a focus in data science, computer science, analytics, actuarial science, statistics, operations research, mathematics, data mining, economics or a related quantitative field (e.g. epidemiology/public health, geomatics)
Proven proficiency with analytics scripting languages such as Python, R, SQL and statistical analysis environments such as MATLAB, SPSS or SAS
A deep understanding of predictive modeling and statistical concepts, machine learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithms
Strong communication, dynamic and critical thinking, and story-telling ability (through data) to influence and propose analytics strategies and solutions that challenge and expand the thinking of everyone around you
Alignment with our values of: safety above all else, respect, raise the bar, commitments matter and do the right thing
Preference for:
Experience in mining, In Situ, refineries, cyber security, geology, and/or a corporate/functional business background
Experience with unstructured data (e.g. image recognition, audio analytics)
An accredited professional statistician (PStat)
Where you’ll be working, your work schedule, and other meaningful information:
You will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 – 6th Ave S.W.
Hours of work are a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday, with the potential for extended work hours based on business needs
We are currently recruiting for five Data Scientists to join our Calgary team
Ad-hoc travel may be required based on business/project need

Why Suncor?
We are Canada's leading integrated energy company with a business portfolio that includes oil sands development and upgrading, offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. Our global presence offers rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute, and grow in a variety of career-building positions. We live by the value of safety above all else – do it safely, or don’t do it. Our strong track record of growth and a focus on sustainability mean tremendous potential for the future. Learn about our mission, vision and values.
In addition to rewarding job opportunities, we offer an attractive employee package, including:
Competitive base salary, compensation programs, and an annual incentive program
Flexible benefits package
Rewarding pension and savings plans

Vancouver, BCWe are looking for a collaborative teammate to join our team, working with both Vancouver Product teams and the rest of the Data team, located in San Francisco and New York. Our data informs us of the impact we are having on the world, and you will be part of a team that is instrumental in architecting and building our data infrastructure. You will understand our company's goals and proactively inform their direction with data so that our product can help more teams do great things.

Designing and analyzing experiments to measure the impact of new product features

Adding new metrics and aggregations to our data warehouse to make new classes of questions answerable
Building models to predict the growth trajectory of different customer segments

job_title: DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (DIGITAL AND DATA SCIENCE)
job_description:
Toronto, ONDIGITAL DATA ANALYST (DIGITAL AND DATA SCIENCE)

POSITION CODE: 2019-079
LOCATION: The Globe and Mail, Toronto
SALARY: Commensurate with qualifications and experience

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Analytics team at The Globe and Mail is looking for a Digital Data Analyst with strong fundamental skills in data analysis and visualization. This role will be instrumental in helping us make sure that everything we do is informed by data. The primary responsibilities for the analyst will be to model large volumes of data to design and implement custom reports and dashboards, and perform complex ad hoc analysis using raw data to extract useful insights and identify key trends.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analysis: Modeling and interpreting large volumes of data, identifying trends and extracting insights. Reporting the results and insights back to the relevant stakeholders.
Data Visualization: Create, maintain, enhance and automate various dashboards and reports that provide insights into user behaviour while keeping in mind business needs and goals.
Requirement Gathering and Documentation: Assist with documenting data sources, relationships between data entities and business concepts, and methods of calculation and measurement while understanding stakeholder needs.
MUST HAVE QUALIFICATIONS:
Quantitatively focused bachelor’s degree with at least 3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
Experience working with Level of Detail, Table, and Window functions in Tableau.
Experience working with analytical (OLAP, HTAP, etc.) databases (Teradata, Snowflake, BigQuery, etc.)
Command of analytical SQL (ex. Window Functions & Frames, Group Sets, Cubes, Rollups, etc.)
Experience with of at least one of the following: Python, Scala or JavaScript.
Knowledge of inner workings of various web analytics tools (i.e. knowledge of beacons, data processing and enrichment)
Comfortable working in a ‘self-serve’ capacity as a data analyst (i.e. retrieving and modeling your own data when so required).
Experience gathering stakeholder requirements with a demonstrated ability to get to the bottom of specific business rationale
Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Ability to thrive in fast-paced environment with tight deadlines
REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Data Visualization skills and at least a year of experience working with Tableau
Working knowledge of web analytics tools such as Omniture or Google Analytics
Good understanding of SQL and relational databases.
Working knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, HTML
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods
Experience deploying tracking via Tag Manager(s)

At Bond we design creative and innovative solutions for our clients, all with the goal of helping them build ever-stronger loyalty to their brands. That can take us in some pretty amazing directions, and as a Sr. Data Analyst you’ll have your hands on the wheel as we drive the future of loyalty.
So take a moment to ask yourself this: Do you love working in a fast paced environment with multiple top tier clients? Are you a data storyteller? Are you looking for an opportunity to make a difference managing a customer relationship management platform? Yes? Good. This could be a great opportunity for you. And us!
As our Sr. Data Analyst, you will:
Develop insightful post marketing campaign analyses with highly relevant and effective recommendations
Prepare powerful presentations that tell the story
Compile data from various sources, analyze the data and create in-depth analyses
Identify trends, interpret program activity, profile customer segments and decipher segment migration
Design insightful dashboards for KPIs and program metrics
Build and interpret program performance analysis related to retention, redemption, profitability, and points liability metrics
Contribute to set-up and design of communications, applying sound campaign structure, call-to action and responder logic
Apply strategic thinking to determine the right analytical methodology to find the answer to a business question
Present analysis results and recommendations to our senior-level client executives
As our Sr. Data Analyst, you will have:
Min 5 years’ experience in marketing insights and analytics (mandatory), business intelligence, statistics or other analytical methodology
A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
High proficiency with SQL and other analytical programming language (R, Python)
Outstanding written and oral presentation skills
Proven working experience with Tableau and other BI tools
Knowledge of statistical modeling a plus
Minimum 3 years’ experience in a professional services environment
Demonstrated experience presenting quality work
The ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
The ability to work within a matrix environment
The ability to work under tight deadline pressures
Why Join Us?
Bond Brand Loyalty is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.
We’re 400(ish) people working tirelessly together to make the world a more loyal place. You’ll be joining a hyper-talented team with a galaxy of skill sets ranging from research to creative to digital and beyond. You’ll have an excellent opportunity to grow, learn and make an impact as we tackle some of our client’s biggest business challenges.
If you’re looking to build your career, build your skills and build bonds apply today! We're growing and have multiple roles available.
Bond Brand Loyalty welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

ContractAs a Senior BI Analyst you will work independently on complex information management activities that include the identification of source data (multiple source systems); responsible for data analysis & documentation; data mappings; SME on the source business processes and systems; retrieval of data from information management environment through the use of SQL query and different analysis tools.

Significant expertise in translating business requirements into technical specifications.
Experience of leading requirements gathering activities using workshops and interviews (with client teams'). Proficient in Business and Systems Analysis techniques.

Conducts data analysis of source systems' comprising of business applications, industrial automation system and GIS based systems. Strategically partners with the client business units to become knowledgeable about core business functions, processes and workflows and their related technologies.
Solid communication skills to work with client teams to identify and document data integration requirements including but not limited to source data identification, data mapping document (from source-to-target), data transformation requirements, data quality, data integrity requirements etc.
Strong understanding of product development and the supporting technology requirements
Prior experience in systems such as SCADA, IBM-Maximo, MS CRMS etc. is preferable
Qualifications:
BS in Information Systems, Computer Science/Engineering or related discipline.
8+ years of hands-on experience as a Senior Business Analyst (ideally in Business Intelligence projects).
Able to produce quality documentation.
Ideally, involved in a data warehouse development project from start-to-end. Skilled in developing Source-to-Target data mapping documents.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to research, identify and resolve data integration issues.
Ideally skilled in MS Excel and SQL query writing for data extraction, analysis, scrubbing, cleansing, reporting etc.
Working knowledge of data warehouses such as SQL Server, Oracle, Amazon Redshift, Teradata etc. is ideal.
Please note this is a one-year contractual position in Qatar.

Edmonton, ABPosition Title:  Supply Chain Process AnalystPosition Type: Intermediate, Full-time, PermanentDepartment: OperationsLocation: Edmonton, AlbertaStart Date: April 7, 2019Organization SummaryBased in Edmonton, priMED is a leading designer, manufacturer and marketer of single-use medical products to customers worldwide. The company has its corporate head office in Canada, international operations and three wholly owned manufacturing facilities in China. priMED is an ISO 13485:2016 registered company and recognized as one of Canada’s 100 Best Managed Companies (2017, 2018).Departmental OverviewThe Operations department is responsible for priMED’s production, inventory management, and moving inventory domestically and worldwide. This includes all aspects of supply chain and logistics operations including inventory planning, connecting with suppliers and customers to ensure production capacity is maximized, collaborating with various departments to develop a strategic plan, and ensure delivery of products to various customers and partners worldwide.Position OverviewThe Supply Chain Process Analyst (SCPA) is responsible for developing decision support tools that will assist the Operations department in making important strategic business decisions. This includes planning and monitoring of an inventory management system along with analyzing unique costing opportunities. In addition, this position is responsible for managing the rebate program and administering ad hoc sales reports when necessary.The SCPA is a key member of priMED’s success and requires exceptional communication skills, team involvement, interpersonal skills and professionalism in order to perform day to day job tasks. They will analyze the structure, operations, and work instructions in place and propose, plan, and implement improvements.Working RelationshipsThe Supply Chain Process Analyst reports directly to the Senior Operations Planner. Other close internal working relationships include the Director of Operations, Customer Service & Logistics Manager, Senior IT Manager, Finance team, Product Managers and the Sales & Business Development teams. External working relationships include Distributors, Customers and Contractors.ResponsibilitiesThe Supply Chain Process Analyst works closely with the Senior Operations Manager and business stakeholders and analysts to model and mine priMED’s supply chain data. The following is a list of the high level activities/deliverables:Conducting and generating revenue and cost analyses for existing business and new business opportunities.Assisting the IT systems development team in the distribution of defined periodic sales reports.Maintain, manage and process rebates and reporting for GPOs, Distributors, Customers and Third Party Logistics Providers.Updating, maintenance and communicating new Customer commitments to priMED contracts internally and externally to Distributors.Ongoing maintenance of priMED Master Agreement list including advanced notifications to Senior Management of expiring Agreements.Assist and support Senior Operations Planner in preparing annual budgets and mid-year budget re-forecasting.Conduct research and process analysis to determine efficiency and effectiveness of policies and programs in place.Conduct assessments and propose improvements to methods, systems and procedures in the Operations department.Work within an ISO 13485 GMP Quality PolicyOther tasks as directed by the Senior Operations Planner and Director of Operations.Working ConditionsAttention is shifted from one job task to another frequently during the day. Therefore, time and priority management abilities in addition to excellent communication skills are essential for this position. Accuracy, attention to detail and the ability to multi-task are also necessary.Examples of mental effort include:Processing, reviewing and revising database informationInterruptions come from requests for assistance or new tasks as directedMulti-tasking abilities and time management skills are required for this positionConcentration, computer skills, assembly skills, reading comprehension, personnel skills, etc.Communicating with Customers, priMED Staff, and Senior Management will be required.Examples of physical effort include:Working in a seated or standing position, at a desk 6-7 hours/dayLifting a box or other objects up to 40 lbs, as required.QualificationsPost-Secondary Education – Masters degree in Project Management.Strong track record for attention to detail and enthusiasm towards learning.Advanced proficiency with Excel and other Microsoft Products including Access.2-3 years of demonstrated and measurable success in analytical positions with a decision support function.Experience working with Sage 300.Experience working with Arena Simulation softwareExperience working with General Algebraic Modeling System (GAMS) softwareExperience working with MATLAB softwareExperience in the Healthcare industry would be an asset.Ability to read, understand and interpret reports and other dataAbility to use various analytical tools to meet job requirementsOrganized problem solver capable of thinking quickly on their feet and excelling in a dynamic, performance-driven, results-oriented work environment.Demonstrated excellence in analytical ability, coupled with excellent verbal and written communication skills.Excellent organizational skills and ability to meet tight deadlines in an environment of competing priorities.Able to work independently and as part of a team.Willingness to work irregular hours as per business requirements.Hours of WorkThe Supply Chain Process Analyst is a full-time, permanent role. Typical office hours are 8:00 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday. However, actual hours may vary depending on business volumes and work outside these hours may be required and will be discussed and agreed upon with the Senior Operations Planner in advanced. Some travel may be required.How to ApplyThis position is available and interested applicants can submit their cover letter and resume in a single document via the Indeed application form.We thank all applicants for their interest. Only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.NOTE: This job posting is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Analytical Thinking: 3 years (Preferred)Process Analysis: 3 years (Preferred)Assessing Operations: 1 year (Preferred)Education:Master's Degree (Required)

Vancouver, BCJob no: 502284
Brand: Finance
Work type: Full time
Location: British Columbia
Categories: Business Support

Data Reporting Analyst - Vancouver

About the opportunity

As part of our Americas Business Intelligence Team, the Data Reporting Analyst is responsible for assessing business analysis needs including gathering requirements, analyzing source system data, and developing proof-of-concept data models and visualizations. In addition, the candidate will dig deep into company data to uncover insights and information to help drive profit, process improvements and best practices.


Duties and Responsibilities

Designing and developing enterprise-wide data analysis and reporting solutions (as opposed to reporting silos)
Converting functional requirements into technical solutions
Analyzing data from multiple internal and external sources
Helping visualize technical data in a way that is meaningful to business decision makers
Understanding, interpreting and applying business rules to ensure a high level of data integrity and consistency
Engaging and consulting with team members on new data, business needs and opportunities to improve system effectiveness
Scrutinize and assemble raw data from multiple sources, generate reports, automate best practices and build dashboards that facilitate efficiency, profit gains and productivity
Work with operational stakeholders and the project management team to assess needs and document requirements
Testing, reconciliation and validation of data and coordination of UAT for production-ready products
Recommendations on process changes and best practices
Skills / Experience

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience with SQL and dimensional modelling
Experience with data transformation/ETL and proof of concept development
Experience with tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI or other visualization and analysis tools
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to develop relationships at all levels
High level of commercial acumen and professionalism
“Agile” in both personality and development philosophy – a high degree of flexibility and the ability to deal with change and a high-pressure work environment
A team-focused individual that enjoys collaboration and can “leave the ego at the door “Highly creative and outside-the-box thinker who believes “it’s always possible”


If this sounds like you, come on board with a global organization, and one of Canada’s 50 Most Admired Corporate Cultures!


We thank all candidates for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Our promise is to provide an environment with equality of respect, dignity and opportunity for all our employees. We value an inclusive and supportive workplace which truly reflects the diversification of our society. Flight Centre Travel Group is committed to providing a barrier-free pathway throughout our recruitment selection process. If you require accommodation because of a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please let us know in advance by contacting our Recruitment Team at fccareers@flightcentre.ca

The Measurement and Research team is responsible for development and execution of an enterprise-wide brand and customer experience measurement programs as well as decision-support research within GWL Lifeco. The insights generated from this team are used to guide strategic and tactical improvements to Lifeco products, processes and customer service experiences.
Supporting the Manager, Data and Research Operations, this role is responsible for managing and monitoring the research pipeline for the entire team; and for creating and updating process documents for the Measurement and Research Team.
The Data and Research Operations function within this team works closely with business stakeholders to:
1. Ensure that relevant data requirements are mapped and extracted for each new survey;
2. Support ongoing survey data enhancements (add, modify, delete) as data and systems capabilities change or evolve.
Accountabilities:
Execute thorough QA Tests as part of the survey deployment process
Manage the customer feedback mailbox
Work with business teams to ensure new survey data requirements are mapped and extracted
Work with business tech teams to update survey metadata for existing programs as systems and data capabilities evolve
Develop and update (as needed) the comprehensive CX Measurement Process Document
Manage the MR Team Kanban board, Research Pipeline, SharePoint Site and JIRA requests
Participate actively in team meetings and huddles
Actively invest in developing data, research and analysis skills
Qualifications and Competencies:
Post-secondary degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, business or data analysis, operations management
3 years’ experience working with data in a list management role, with emphasis on mapping, extracting and analyzing data for research campaigns
Prior experience in data and business analysis as well as process documentation
Knowledge of SQL and Tableau would be an asset
Superior written and oral communication skills
Process management skills
Ability to multi-task and deliver quality work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
Experience with transforming and manipulating data in Excel
Understanding of the CX and MR practices within the business context
Basic knowledge of the Canadian and global insurance industry
Basic knowledge of corporate IT infrastructure
Discover your opportunity….Apply today!

Great-West Life offers competitive compensation, great benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance, wellness account and personal days not to mention onsite cafeteria and fitness facilities. If you’d like to join our team submit your information online and introduce yourself.

Together Great-West Life, London Life and Canada Life serve the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.

Great-West Lifeco would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

$80,880 - $101,100 a yearPermanentPLEASE APPLY THROUGH UBC CAREER WEBSITE https://hr.ok.ubc.ca/careers/staff/JOB CODE: Job ID33190 - further details of job description can be found there.Salary Range: Annual - Minimum $80880 to Midpoint: 101100 to Maximum $126376This position leads the assessment of domain specific research tools, methodologies, and resources for computationally- and data-intensive research.This position will serve as a liaison and will advise researchers and research groups on the facilitation, assessment, design, and implementation of complex digital research infrastructure (DRI) research data management solutions specific to the methodological needs and imperatives of the UBC research community.This position will also focus on training, liaising with experts, and research project consultations and assistance for the UBC research community system-wide.EDUCATION/WORK EXPERIENCE:Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. A minimum of 5 years of experience, in-depth knowledge of applications and the business requirements supporting them or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience supporting the research community and working in environments involving multiple stakeholders. Previous knowledge and experience providing ethical and analytical subject matter expertise on the assessment of domain specific research tools, methodologies, and resources for computationally- and data-intensive research.FURTHER DETAILS AT UBC CAREER WEBSITEWORK PERFORMED:- Provides research data management expert liaison and training to UBC researchers system-wide on best practices for such topics as data management plans, data collection, analytics, tracking, transfers, and data quality procedures- Liaise and coordinate with the Library in supporting researchers with the evaluation and implementation of data management plans- Advises researchers in resolving data problems and ensures data is managed consistently by advising on standard operating procedures for the acquisition, processing, analyzing, and transferring of research data.- Participates in the assessment, coordination, training, and knowledge mobilization for researchers in the use of digital research infrastructure (DRI) systems, research tools and best-practices.- Provides strategies to build awareness of local and national training and support initiatives.- Advises researchers on various aspects of computational analysis including access to appropriate DRI and software, workflow optimization, and data management.- Advises researchers on determining and documenting computational and storage requirements on grant proposals and national platform resource allocation competitions.- Serves as ARC research data management subject matter expert on national, regional, provincial, and institutional committees and advisory panels where appropriate.- Works with DRI service providers nationally, regionally, provincially, and institutionally in the development of and access to secure state-of-the-art DRI resources- Coordinates with ARC team with respect to the support of domain specific research data management platforms, tools, and software on the ARC system.- Work with the Library coordinating research data deposits and metadata descriptions- Advises researchers on use of research data management software tools, platforms, and workflows.- Works with partners across government, industry, and local communities to build partnerships and relationships beneficial to UBC researchers- Engages with local communities at UBC to benefit researchers through communication, collaboration, and coordination between relevant groups and departments on campus.- Provides input for establishing policies and procedures pertaining to data management, maintenance, and utilization.- Leads the assessment of researcher needs utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to identify priorities, information flow, content needs; and recommends options.- Identifies, elicits, and documents research requirements and communicates requirements for the implementation of digital research infrastructure solutions.- Researches and evaluates vendor supplied applications, provides customized recommendations and solutions for systems and applications.- Analyzes and reviews existing or proposed system features and integration, security, scalability and performance requirements with researchers, analysts, and team members.- Communicates with stakeholders of varying technical ability and subject matter expertise.- Builds and maintains good working relationships and collaborates with others to achieve objectives.- Provides consultative services for the development of policies and procedures- Manages small to medium sized projects and related budgets.- Provides technical expertise, training, and consultation to other staff.- Works with teams to develop large grant applications with significant computing needs- Compiles and analyzes metrics.- Maintains appropriate professional designations and up-to-date knowledge of current information technology techniques and tools and provides input to strategies for ongoing support and upgrade of these systems.- Performs other related duties as required.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $80,880.00 to $101,100.00 /yearExperience:applications & business management: 5 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's Degree (Required)

The Alberta Electric System Operator is responsible for the safe, reliable, and economic planning and operation of the Alberta Interconnected Electric System. We provide open and non-discriminatory access to Alberta’s interconnected power grid and also facilitate Alberta’s competitive wholesale electricity market which, in 2018, had 201 participants and approximately $6.6 Billion in annual energy transactions.
Summary of Position:
 The Transmission Analytics Analyst supports forecasting and analytics activities and initiatives development and project delivery. Analytics responsibilities include: forecasting data and statistics, economic efficiency analysis, congestion assessment, and cost analysis and benchmarking as needed for transmission projects. Additionally will act as project liasion to coordinate the design, analysis, and testing of forecast and analytics accuracy, research and define opportunities for transmssion analytics to aid and augment the AESO’s ability to analyze the transmission system. This role requires flexbility to work on multiple projects and to deliver results on a timely basis.

The ideal candidate has a solid understanding of the Alberta electricity market, have extensive knowledge of power market simulation/optimzation model and will be able to quickly learn electric transmission systems and planning processes.

Accountabilities:
Represent forecasting and analytics subject matter expertise on cross departmental connection/system study initiatives
Provide technical leadership on all aspects of forecasting assumptions and documents needed in transmission projects and provide sign off on key steps with regards to project filings.
Key liaison between the Transmission Analytics Support Team and other AESO departments to facilitate collaboration, goal alignment, and learning exchange and integration.
Evaluates potential inefficiencies in current procedure and researches, develops, and creates plans to enhance forecasting and analytics tools and interfaces.
Ongoing development of Nodal model to ensure credible nodal analytics, streamlined process and quality documentation.
Deliver short-term and long-term of key nodal analytics and perform nodal analysis in support of connection and system projects.
Maintain the cost benchmark database to track and share transmission cost information with other disciplines in the AESO and maintain our external web cost benchmark interface.
May serve as a witness representing the AESO in an AUC regulatory proceeding.

Education / Degree / Certification:
A Bachelor’s degree (BA, BS) or equivalent education, training or experience in Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering or closely related field.
An advanced degree (MS or PhD) is preferred.

Job Experience:
5-7 years experience in energy market research, forecasting and/or analysis, and Alberta electricity market fundamental modeling.
Experience with data querying, maintenance, and use of databases (SQL server, Oracle) required.
Experience with statistics, economic and demographic impacts on loads, and generator operation/characteristics desired.
Experience in SAS, market simulation modeling, and/or load forecast (electric industry experience with utilities or ISO preferred).
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects concurrently, meet defined time lines, with conscientious attention to detail.
Strong skills in collecting and analyzing and evaluating complex information, and drawing logical conclusions.
Ability to work with limited direction at a professional level of responsibility, independently and within a team environment.
Excellent writing and self-editing skills
Strong organizational, communication and interpersonal skills
Experience in transmission cost assessment desired

Application deadline: April 5, 2019, at 11:59pm MDT via AESO Careers

The Alberta Electric System Operator, and its members, officers, employees and agents (collectively, the "AESO") is committed to protecting personal information provided to it. By submitting your personal information to the AESO for the purpose of pursuing employment with the AESO, you hereby consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the AESO, in accordance with the provisions of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act of Alberta, as amended from time to time.

job_title: Data Scientist and Modeler, Industry Economics
job_description:
Data Scientist and Modeler, Industry Economics (12-month contract)
This is a new opportunity for a Data Scientist and Modeler to be part of a large multi-year project. If you want to put your strong technical skills and passion for applying those skills to database construction and analysis, as well as model building to work every day then this role is for you - please apply!
Reporting to the Associate Director, this is a 12-month contract role with the potential for extension/permanency and is available immediately. This position is located in our Ottawa office.

Principal Duties

Assess how new external data sets could contribute to our research projects.
Filter and organize large amounts of information/data for analysis and model building.
Support research projects of varying complexity utilizing your knowledge of quantitative research methods and programming skills.
Assist and contribute to research projects both independently and as part of a team.
 Build labour market models
Build web-based data dashboards.
Prioritize multiple tasks and work effectively to meet deadlines.
Produce high quality work and consistently demonstrate professional values in all aspects of work and interactions with collogues and customers.
Skills and Qualifications

A advanced degree (Master’s or PhD) in a quantitative field, e.g. Economics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science.
Up to three years of experience in a role which makes extensive use of programming for data analysis.
Ability to program in R and one other programming language (Eviews, Python, Stata, Matlab, etc.).
Extensive experience handling large datasets in Excel (especially VBA).
Experience with visualization software, such as PowerBI or Tableau would be an asset
A creative mind in using data to answer all types of questions.
Ability to communicate programming and data concepts to a broad audience.
Experience writing programs which require an eye for efficiency would be an asset.
Experience with forecasting economic time series would be an asset.
Knowledge of basic labour market economics would be an asset.

Toronto, ONAbout Us:
SnapTravel is a conversational commerce (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AOFWv4REqls) startup, allowing millions of users around the world to book their travel over messaging.
We are working on complex problems within NLP (understanding and replying to ambiguous human messaging), Conversational Commerce (optimizing conversions and user behavior over chat) and Machine Learning (choosing the best hotel automatically from a large data set with complex market dynamics) to push the boundaries of tech and travel globally.
SnapTravel has a fast-moving & transparent environment where everyone works as a team with complete transparency. We value data-driven decisions and risk-taking actions that add value to both the user and the team.
About the Role:
We are looking for a Financial Analyst to join our team and help SnapTravel scale to the next level! As a Financial Analyst you will be responsible for supporting our Finance team with all initiatives around financial reporting, planning and analysis for our core Hotels business, driving hundreds of millions of dollars in annual revenue. You will bring expert-level Excel skills and a strong foundation in Finance & Accounting to the team, and will work on high-impact projects around forecasting, month-end closes, and the preparation of financial materials for our Leadership team to make better decisions that will drive business growth.
Challenges You'll Solve:
Accounting & Bookkeeping: you will build and execute on all of our standard accounting processes, ensuring that our monthly financials are completed accurately and on-time; this includes high-volume vendor payments, settlements, posting transactions and all month-end close activities
Planning & Analysis: you will assist in the rigorous analysis, planning and reporting around our financial results to our Finance Manager and leadership team. This will include maintaining the integrity of our accounting systems, diving deep into data and performing ad-hoc analyses around financial results
Operational Excellence: you will use your incredible attention-to-detail and high degree of accuracy to be the single source of truth for all financial reporting; you will assist in the preparation of many different financial materials across the business
About You:
You have at least 1 year of experience in a Finance or Accounting role, ideally with a focus on analysis and reporting
You have incredible attention-to-detail, and can be relied upon to provide thorough, well-reasoned and accurate results
You can work with a high degree of self-direction and you have the ability to thrive in a fast-moving environment
You have expert proficiency in Excel, and ideally have worked with Tableau and Xero in the past
What To Expect:
After applying, you'll receive an email with all of this info. So feel free to skip it for now.
Review - you'll hear from us within 48 hours of applying
Phone Call - a quick call to learn who you are (resumes suck, we want to know the real you!)
Interview - a chance for you to chat with our Finance Manager, share your background and learn more about us
Onsite Interview - 90-120 min onsite with our Finance Manager and 1-2 other leaders to tackle a whiteboarding problem and work through some challenges collaboratively
Final Interview - connect with the rest of the team, more Q&A to ask us about SnapTravel; deeper dive into culture and team; meet the Cofounders
The Perks:
Compensation: top of market salaries and equity; full benefits package
Flexible Work Arrangements: work from home, work remotely, take vacation... do what makes sense for you. This includes a holistic Parental Leave policy.
Top Talent: work with the best in the world, including Engineers and Leadership from Google, Facebook, Wish, Twitter, Asana, YouTube, Uber and more.
Build Something Great: most importantly, build a product used by millions around the world - have ownership, have impact, and do great work.

Mar 16, 2019
Company: Coast Capital Savings Federal Credit Union
Location: British Columbia (CA-BC), [[custlocation]]
Job Type: Full-Time

Together, we help empower you to achieve what’s important in your life.


What’s the job?
The Digital Market Research Analyst is responsible for supporting the Digital Experience team (DEX) by keeping abreast of the current competitive digital banking market landscape. The digital savvy candidate will have a natural curiosity for digital innovation, emerging banking technologies and have a keen interest on the latest fintech market. In addition to having to identify and fill knowledge gaps on industry trends and competitor (traditional & new) strategies and activities, the candidate will also have excellent story-telling abilities to articulate their findings in written and verbal form. Objectives of this role will include the evaluation of a wide variety of banking solutions via 'Mystery shopping' techniques.

What you’ll get to do:
Play a key support role in advancing competitive insights required to support journey mapping, persona development and user experience testing.
Promote and support the vision of instilling data and analytically based culture within the organization. Acts as the advocate in the discipline of Business Intelligence
Measure, report and make actionable recommendations to help drive measurable improvements to the digital channels in line with Coast Capital’s strategic goals.
Coordinate and facilitate lunch & learn reviews and other related digital banking strategy workshops
Develop, maintain and foster a network of information sources for internal teams, stakeholder and other partners within Coast Capital Savings
Provide point-of-views on Digital Banking industry through 'mystery' shopping
Conduct in-depth competitive intelligence research and analysis using a variety of industry tools (i.e., Forrester, Gartner, Surviscor)
Analyze and report on competitive research results. Develop actionable recommendations for the Digital Experience team and overall management
Work in collaboration with Digital Insights Analyst to provide qualitative analysis with competitive research
Collaborate with Digital UX and Corporate Research teams in collection of the member insights
Support in developing competitive research objectives and appropriate methodologies, scope, and parameters of studies to help shape and influence CCS corporate and business lines strategies and enterprise strategy planning, innovation and execution processes
Define and report on competitive metrics (i.e., latest industry ranking, market strategy & presence)
Develop concise, audience-appropriate, presentation-ready, actionable reports based on strategic insight on the overall Digital Banking landscape
Provides expertise in the design and maintenance of competitive matrices & techniques (battle cards, product canvases, internal and external presentations, etc.)

Who are we looking for?
2 years in Competitive Research / Market Analytics field with a preference of experience in qualitative digital analytics. Experience in eCommerce or Digital Banking Products preferred.
Strong focus on using Secondary research, mining various enterprise data sources and reports, identifying trends and opportunities for the purpose of growing and advancing CCS digital banking channels
Experience in keeping up-to-date with competitive and industry trends & practices
Capable of presenting a point of view. Create presentations that focus on industry insights while clearly articulating points with supporting data where appropriate
Leverage knowledge management tools and or communication techniques to share insights broadly across the organization. Ability to consider different communication preferences various across internal audiences
Takes ownership for stewarding the Digital Strategy team's competitive knowledge base by continuously maintaining reports & data. Own the building and ongoing updating of the competitive research portfolio
Works with internal stakeholders to compile current knowledge and identify gaps needed to make better decisions
Bachelor's Degree or a diploma requiring 3 - 4 years of full-time study in the research or related field
Ability to conduct scope business analysis including workflow analysis, business information requirements and models
Ability to understand and interpret website statistics.


Why join Coast Capital Savings?
We don’t mean to toot our own horn, but…
We improve Canadians’ financial well-being through providing simple financial help.
Employees do what’s best for our members. Every day.
We believe in being a great corporate citizen so we invest in our local communities by donating our time, money and expertise.
Our employees take advantage of the many opportunities to grow their careers.
Employees love having a cool place to work, which includes wearing their jeans on Fridays & Saturdays and being recognized with a virtual (and, at times, an actual) high-five.
Our inspiring leaders help our employees develop their talents and encourage them to be their fabulous selves.
We have a unique culture where we take our business seriously, but ourselves, not so much.
In 2017, we earned double kudos by being named one of BC’s Top Employers and one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies – two of the nation’s most coveted business ads, may we add.


Does this position inspire you? If so, apply today at Coast Capital Savings.

Job Description

Senior Business Analyst

Reporting to the Director, PMO, the Senior Business Analyst position is a pivotal role in the delivery of high quality services to our customers. The Senior Business Analyst works under general direction and is responsible for combining advanced analytical skills with tactical leadership skills to contribute to the quality, effectiveness and efficiency of all work completed under their guidance.

We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst who will be the vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product’s features.

The successful candidate has been a product owner in an agile process, is great at communicating with developers, testers and designers, is detail-oriented and loves digging into requirements to understand what the requirements are and delivering them in a demonstrable way.

Responsibilities

Work closely with clients to gather, understand and define business requirements
Own and develop a relationship with clients, working with them to optimize and enhance our integration
Convert business requirements into development user stories, ensuring clear acceptance criteria are defined and understood by the delivery team
Be aware of common sources of technical issues and questions, and make recommendations to the project team
Communicate key insights and findings to the project team
Work closely with the project team to ensure requirements are understood and questions are answered
Maintain the project requirement backlog ensuring complete coverage and prioritization of requirements
Help in release planning by identifying gaps and dependencies amongst requirements
Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve the monitoring and discovery of issues and deliver better value to the customer
Maintain a Quality mindset and contribute to regular reviews of project team deliverables
Assist with UAT testing

Position Specific Competencies

Service Orientation: Go above and beyond regular client and organizational expectations by offering added value
Accountability: Balances organizational, team and individual commitments
Communication: Adapts communication to respond to an audience or situational requirements
Teamwork: Encourages others to participate in team activities, ensures teams are working effectively
Leadership: Promotes and builds internal commitment
Problem solving: Analyzes complex issues to develop approaches or solutions that are considered forward thinking and best practice
If you relate to the above statements, join us! We are looking for a new colleague to take on the challenge of transforming the world of healthcare and making a difference in the lives of generations of people.

Qualifications

7+ years experience in Business / Systems Analysis
A degree in IT / Computer Science
Proven experience in eliciting and documenting requirements
Experience working on Software Development projects
Experience in analysing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
Knowledge in generating clear and concise process documentation
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Ability to travel

Fredericton, NBJob Brief

A Junior Threat Hunter should demonstrate good understanding of security threats and shall perform analysis of security alerts before publishing it to the customer and carry out further enhancement of alert catalog by gathering threat intel, validating Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) as a part of the Tier I team. Provides quality analysis of event log using big data platform such as Splunk for briefing and reporting. Serves as the first line of contact for the customer for day to day operations and analysis support to assigned industry/customers. The Threat Hunting Analyst is also required to provide technical support to monitor, correlate, identify, analyze, mitigate, manage, track and support processes for all security incidents.

Responsibilities

 Analyze logs, normalize and perform automated log correlations utilizing big data analysis or hunt tools to identify anomalous and potentially malicious behavior
 Analyze network traffic to assist in testing and deployment of new signatures and use cases into client’s siem environment.
 Analyze available data sources, security tools, threat trends and lead security analysis efforts to identify attacks against the enterprise
 Analyze additional log, required for forensic investigation, following defined procedures and protocols.
 Must be able to critically examine an organization and system from a perspective of a threat actor and articulate applicable threats.
 Facilitate use of technology-based tools or methodologies for incident response.
 SIEM (Splunk or Elastic) experience in building custom queries, searches, creating correlated alerts, and dashboard.
Should contribute to mining of Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) and shall be responsible for its use in threat analysis for assigned customers/industry.
Packet Analysis using known tools and techniques
Understanding of malware and its behavior
Perform security analysis, security vulnerability assessments
Provide support for Customer’s Vulnerability management program.
Proven track record of successful and innovative hunts that are completed in a timely manner
Good understanding of how to detect lateral movement within a network and thinking outside the box to discover the signal within the noise.
Required Skills

Good working knowledge of:

Threat hunting and Security analysis of log data
Understanding of SIEM tools, such as Splunk, Elastic etc.
Strong Networking Security fundamentals
Security technology (Firewalls, IDS/IPS etc.)
Good understanding of Vulnerability Assessment
Required Competencies

Ability to quickly learn new and complex concepts.
Strong analytical skills/problem solving/conceptual thinking/attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills across multiple levels of the organization.
Nominal understanding of regular expression and at least one common scripting language.
Organized, proactive, and requiring minimal management oversight.
Work Experience

0-1 year of recent operational security experience (SOC, Incident Response, Malware Analysis, IDS/IPS Analysis, etc.)
Experience with several of the following topics:
Exploit kits
Cyber Threat intelligence
Software vulnerabilities & exploitation
Data analysis
Certifications

Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)
Trained in Networking Security
Excellent verbal communication skills
Outstanding written skills for preparing reports and briefings
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to obtain a DoD Secret security clearance

Ottawa, ONMedical cannabis markets are rapidly expanding in Canada and around the world. Recreational cannabis is on the horizon. Now is your chance to join the largest, most recognized cannabis producer in the country as we set off to build something amazing, relying on established but ever-evolving brands.

The Company

Hi.

Canopy Growth Corporation ("Canopy Growth") is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC) and part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries, including its flagship Tweed and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand, are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis. With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production, and operations spanning five continents, Canopy is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of our success and take pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration and diversity. Our employees stem from a wide range of professional backgrounds; each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

This position will assist the IT team by analyzing data, and creating reports. The candidate should be familiar with SQL development, and knowledge of various tools to assist with the data reports.

Responsibilities

Requirements gathering and specifications for ERP reports, dashboards, workflows, forms and more
Designing, creating, and maintaining Crystal, SSRS, and Sage SDMA data reports
SQL Development
Data analysis and visualization

Experience / Qualifications

Solid understanding of SQL development
Experience with data analysis tools such as Excel, Tableau, Splunk, Sumo Logic, Wave
Analytics, Crystal Reports, etc.

Business Need / Purpose of Role

The program manager will also ensure that the total available hours are optimized and attains maximum utilization on a national level for mining and aggregate.

Fully implement the new C4S system to manage WMC service activities;
Provides day to day first line support with C4S

Links with HRM operations supervisors with the assignment of technicians for specific needs;

When needed, manages the sub-contractors orders for larger HRM field service contracts or outages;

Company
The City of Vancouver is striving to become the greenest city in the world, and a city powered entirely by renewable energy before 2050. We are proud to be one of BC's Top Employers, Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and one of Canada's Greenest Employers. With employees that have helped Vancouver consistently rank as one of the world's most livable cities, the City values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve.
Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.


Main Purpose and Function
The Business Process Analyst (BPA) provides senior management with objective and comprehensive business and process analysis of the City’s processes, systems, and resourcing. The BPA provides recommendations based on comprehensive analysis performed with a view to continuously improve business operations using Lean Six Sigma principles; and help sponsors, process owners, and end users implement lean initiatives. Recommendations made by this position result in changes in methods, processes, resources, and procedures that may impact operational areas as well as staffing workloads, working conditions, and changes in positions or staffing levels.

Key Contacts and Reporting Relationships
This position reports directly to the Manager, Continuous Process Improvement in Finance, Risk and Supply Chain Management and works closely with directors, managers and staff in Finance, Risk and Supply Chain Management as well as key business representatives across the City. Works with front-line supervisors, departmental subject-matter-experts, external vendors, consultants and other organizations.

Specific Duties/Responsibilities
Leads, consult and participate in business process reviews of City Business Units, including provision of recommendations for opportunities for improvement
Lead Lean Six Sigma projects, including facilitating Kaizen events and Rapid Improvement events, conduct value stream mapping and identifies relevant KPIs,
Develop future state recommendations and build implementation plans for optimizing business processes and value streams
The value streams and processes that the role will be working on will be cross functional in nature and require the candidate to engage a number of business units and departments
Collect and analyze data to complete a current state analysis and optimize solutions
Identify implications and make recommendations for changes in processes and procedures that may impact on operational areas as well as staffing workloads, working conditions, and changes to positions or staffing levels.
Prepares and conducts presentations to, and/or facilitates decision-making for Department Management teams, Division/Branch Heads, Project Steering Committees, and Business Unit Managers.
Teach, mentor and support the project application of Green Belt candidates
Other duties as assigned

Minimum Position Requirements
Education and Experience:
A related bachelor’s degree (i.e. Commerce, Business/Public Administration, Public Policy or Economics).
A minimum of seven years of proven experience in process documentation, business process reviews, and reengineering techniques. Training, experience and knowledge in quality improvement tools, techniques and methodologies such as Lean and/or Six Sigma.
A minimum of five years’ experience at management level within the public sector or a similarly large multi-stakeholder organization. Management experience to effectively lead a business consulting team. Demonstrated experience implementing a business process re-engineering change.
Lean Six Sigma and/or Business Analyst certification (IIBA) certifications preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Detailed knowledge of business practices in effect at other local and more senior governments, and in private industry.
A thorough understanding of organization theory and design.
High degree of analysis using professional thinking.
Superior research and organizational skills.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills and presentation skills, across all levels of the organization.
The ability to think innovatively, solve complex problems and present solutions in clear and compelling terms.
Demonstrated ability to work with technical and non-technical staff.
Ability to manage change and assist people with adapting to change.
Ability to analyze and anticipate implications of system changes on work processes and procedures.
Ability to solve complex problems and build relationships.
Ability to build constructive and effective relationships at all level of the organization.
Ability to manage multiple priorities, large workloads and multi-task effectively.

Job Location: Canada-British Columbia-Burnaby

Department: FES Business Applications, Transformation and Projects

Job Type: Temporary, Full Time

Start Date of Employment: 22-Apr-2019

Hours of Work: 0830 - 16:30

Work Site: 1795 Willingdon Avenue, Burnaby


Job Summary:
Reporting to the Director, Financial and Employee Services Business Applications, Transformation, and Projects the primary focus of the Business Analyst, Business Applications is to ensure that business applications in the designated portfolio meet the business needs of the Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA). The Business Analyst supports and maintains business applications within the portfolio, recommends improvements and standardization where feasible, and ensures effective utilization of systems. Other responsibilities include trouble shooting of assigned applications, project co-ordination for upgrades or enhancements to applications, and participating in the development of Service Level Agreements and Disaster Recovery Plans. In addition, the Business Analyst, Business Applications conducts training of staff on the functionality of the business applications. The Business Analyst works closely with the Information Management Information Technology Services (IMITS) staff who are responsible for the technical functions related to the business applications.
Duties/Accountabilities:
Participates in development and maintenance of business applications including taking leading roles in needs identification, requirements definition, and managing project work plans.
Coordinates and implements system upgrades and system tuning to ensure maximum performance, security and stability of the business applications taking into consideration client requirements and the technology of the platforms.
Develops functional support procedures for such areas as application installation and testing, and ensures application support documentation is developed and maintained including backup schedules and disaster recovery planning. Develops and communicates plans for planned downtime.
Installs, configures, tests and maintains applications in support of approved projects. Manages deployments into UAT and production environments . Carries out post-implementation reviews and makes recommendations for improvements.
Maintains and improves contact center operations by monitoring system performance; identifying and resolving problems; preparing and completing action plans; completing system audits and analyses; installing upgrades.
Supports and manages 2 servers. Responsible for creating and maintaining user accounts. Creates and implements network maintenance plan, including regularly updating operating systems and databases with the latest updates. When employees have an issue with their workstation, support initial diagnostics to determine whether the issue is hardware or software.
Support and maintain SQL databases and PowerBI Visualization Tool on in-house servers.
Ensures that documentation regarding business applications and tools in use is appropriate and complete. Provides staff training and orientation, and develops supporting instructional material. Develops and maintains reference documentation such as workflow charts, user instructions, manuals and reference materials on business processes, policies and procedures.
May be required to provide input into the development and submission of the annual operating budget and capital planning requirements; monitor expenditures, identify variances from approved budgets, generate financial impact summary reports and recommend corrective action.
Performs other related duties as required.

Qualifications:

A level of education, training and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science or related field, plus a minimum of five (5) years recent related experience in an information systems technical application support environment.
Proven hands-on experience with expert knowledge and understanding of complex applications and/or development tools such as PeopleSoft ERP, MS CMS2008, and MS SharePoint.
Experience with Contact Centre functional support, system monitoring and data analysis (preferably Genesys Interactive Intelligence).
Database design and data architecture management. Proficient in report design and development using various tools including MS Power BI, MS excel and Dax Scripting. Proficient in SQL and other data manipulation languages; proficient in ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) a plus.
Server administration (preferably SQL Server).Working knowledge of TCP/IP, DNS, LAN and WAN to maintain server functionality, as well as working knowledge about firewalls, proxy and databases to keep network and user information secure.
Skills and Abilities
Demonstrated understanding of the Systems Development Life Cycle. Strong enterprise experience in supporting applications in a complex environment. Ability to analyze technical application problems and recommend optimal solutions. Ability to work under pressure and multi-task without direct supervision. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills, able to communicate complex ideas in simple terminology. Customer focused with ability to facilitate and encourage cooperation between diverse operational groups and skill sets. Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
Health & Safety
In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of PHSA, employee safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA, and as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all employee safety aspects of this position.

Toronto, ONAbout EPL
At EPL, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.

We help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. Our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in Canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use.

We have built our reputation on doing things really well. We have a bright, talented, and engaging team with a lot of passion for what we do: helping large energy users across North America reduce their energy/carbon footprints and quantifying energy costs.

The Role
Recent and projected growth has led us to search for a high energy professional to join the Building Analytics Team in our Toronto office. The person will join us at a time where we are experiencing outstanding company growth. A steep learning curve is anticipated. Key aspects of the role:

o Drive down energy use intensity at large commercial properties as part of our Building Analytics Team, ideally while enhancing the livability and health of these same facilities.
o Energy conservation studies and audits at large commercial buildings.
o Measurement and Verification (M&V) of energy and demand savings projects.
o Sub-metering system design and specifications.
o Studies/analysis related to sub-meter cost allocation and data analytics.

About You
We seek an intelligent person with strong problem-solving skills capable of handling a wide variety of technical challenges. High energy levels and a team-based approach are of great value; just as important is a determination to overcome obstacles. Above all, this person should look to establish and maintain a reputation for integrity over the long term.

Nominally, we seek an engineering graduate. Applicants in Engineering Physics, Math and Engineering, Electrical Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering will be given special consideration.

2-4 years of consulting experience delivering a range of energy conservation and building optimization services to large commercial properties. Services include; energy audits and feasibility studies, building performance optimization ( incl. commissioning and retro-commissioning), and M&V plans/verification.

Demonstrated experience as a valued member of a successful team is beneficial.

It is important that the applicant can communicate clearly and efficiently'

What to expect
People are the most important part of our company.

We have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. The success of our people drives the success of our company. Each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their rotations.

EPL team members also:

Unlimited Vacation & Flexible Work Hours (you own your time)
Vibrant workplace & regular team fun (events & activities)
Work with super smart and nice people!

Schomberg, ONInventory Analyst

PURPOSE OF THE POSITION

The Inventory Analyst is responsible for entering, monitoring and analyzing inventory system in a timely, efficient and accurate manner.

SCOPE

The Inventory Analyst is responsible for providing all inventory related financial, and administrative work processes. This includes processing purchase orders, receiving documents, production orders and shrinkage reports as well as monitoring divisional transactions. It also includes inventory month end procedures as well as any other ad hoc reporting requests from the management team.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Entering divisional purchase orders, receiving reports, production reports, shrinkage reports, and ensuring that the information received is current, and accurate.
Monitoring divisional inventory movements ensuring that each division is maintaining their records in a timely and accurate manner.
Manage the flow of inventory information and paperwork throughout the company.
Assist the Operations Team in modifying and maintaining the standard costing models.
Maintain the company's ERP system (SAP Business One) with regards to all inventory related processes. Ensure that the Item Master is coded, entered and adjusted correctly.
Participate in Period End closing activities by assisting in the production of reports, analyses and reconciliation related to the purchasing, production, shrinkage and finished goods inventory
Manage the semi-annual physical inventory counts as well as periodic spot checks.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Post-secondary education in Accounting or related field.
2 - 3 years of related inventory and/or accounting experience.
Exceptional data management skills. ERP related experience or education is an asset.
Good oral and written communication skills. Must be able to interpret and explain data.
Ability to analyze and solve problems.
Strong organization and prioritization skills, with the ability to meet time deadlines.
Proven ability to multi-task.
Ability to thrive in a fast paced environment with flexible working hours
Excellent computer skills (Microsoft Office, Power Point, Excel)

Job Title: SharePoint Admin/Analyst
Location: Ottawa
Why join Minto?
Minto is an award-winning integrated real estate development, construction and property management company that has proudly created healthy communities and innovative places for people to live, work and play for over 60 years. Our business is comprised of four entities ( Minto Communities Management Inc., Minto Communities Florida, Minto Properties Inc., Minto Group Corporate Office ) with operations in major cities spanning across Canada and the United States. As we continue to evolve and grow, we believe in hiring the best people who are as committed to creating incredible experiences for our customers as we are. In turn, we offer incredible benefits and career growth for our employees including a competitive total rewards package, Minto Learning Centre courses, tuition reimbursement, flexible summer hours in many locations and much more. Join Minto to find out how you can be a part of it all!
The Opportunity OR What we’re looking for:
The SharePoint Admin/Analyst, part of the Information Technology Operations team, will be responsible for supporting various business units in a real estate industry in gathering requirements, proposing designs and implementing solutions for our SharePoint platform. He/she will also be responsible in keeping the application layer up-to-date by monitoring, applying monthly security patches and completing regular house-keeping activities.
What you’ll be responsible for day to day to support current SharePoint 2010, 2013 and Office 365:
Plan and execute changes, additions and upgrades to all SharePoint Farms.
Provide front-end support for internal clients to troubleshoot and resolve user issues.
Provide back-end support and troubleshooting on issues with SharePoint services.
Work with project teams to create SharePoint solutions, including setting the requirements and scope, defining and designing solutions, building architecture and functionality, testing and user acceptance as well as providing training and support.
Work as a SharePoint change agent within Minto, continually promote SharePoint throughout the enterprise and work with business owners to enhance user adoption.
Provide strategic insight into the risks, benefits, and opportunities of various solutions as needed.
Provide input towards SharePoint governance, enterprise vision, strategy, policies, standards and best practices.
Configure Service Applications including Search Service, User Profile Service, and Managed Metadata Service.
Configuration of Managed paths, Permissions, Site Applications, Alternate Access Mappings
Design new and support existing Nintex workflows.
AvePoint Migration for data migration between SharePoint sites and from network folders.
PowerShell/Scripting experience from an automation and configuration context.
Documents, evaluates, and makes recommendations on solutions for optimization of procedures and processes, and system deficiencies.
Takes ownership in driving solution implementations, and conducts training and support where applicable
Understands and adheres to access security model for all solutions
Proactively initiates, develops, and maintains effective working relationships with team members through developing mutual trust, and collaboration
Takes pride in working in a team atmosphere by providing cross-functional support to other team members
Minimum Qualifications
8+ years of experience in Information Technology teams as a SharePoint Admin/Analyst with SharePoint 2010, 2013 and Office 365
Prior experience working in a client facing role as part of a larger project team
Experience in understanding business needs, and translating them into functional specifications
Team-oriented and collaborative
Able to communicate and adapt the language to different audiences either from business or technical.
Able to adapt in a fast paced, challenging and changing work environment without showing resistance on on-going priority changes by still accomplishing results.
Minto is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. Should you require accommodation or support in any aspect of our recruitment and selection process, we will work with you to meet your needs.
