JOB SUMMARY:
The Market Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for tracking the trends and events happening across the corporate learning market to help inform our product, marketing, and sales strategies. As the expert in the market, you'll work to arm decision-makers across our organization to make more informed choices, and help shape our go-to-market strategy. Reporting to the VP, Corporate Product Management, you'll have a prominent role in driving strategy and direction, including recommendations for partnership or acquisitions.

HOW WILL I MAKE AN IMPACT?

What will you do day-to-day? Everything from participate in industry analyst briefings, support sales conversations, prepare market update slides or decks for a variety of audiences, create competitive debriefs on specific companies in the market, summarize market news and events, attend conferences to collect market intelligence...all activities to build and share your market expertise and insights.

Specifically, you'll engage in activities such as:

Manage the creation and implementation of market intelligence supporting executive decision-making, the identification of emerging opportunities and threats, and monitoring competitors, potential partners, prospects, and consumers
Provide analytical, project, systems and data support by creating and distributing numerous tactical and strategic market intelligence reports based on primary and secondary sources of learning technology trends and competitive activity to inform short-term and long-term business decisions, goals, plans, and outcomes
Analyze industry trends, patterns, early warnings and forecast. Utilize syndicated and other data sources weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly to assess demand, addressable market size and consensus forecast outlook
Routinely interface with sales, product, and marketing teams and other stakeholders by sourcing and analyzing business and market data in scheduled and ad-hoc meetings to make fact-based recommendations to optimize our go-to-market strategy
Cultivate shared edtech competitive market understanding in every corner of the organization with interactive workshops and courses and support sales enablement.
Embrace the strategic and tactical planning and support our field teams by contributing to and developing sales enablement.
Participate in and lead analysis of client interviews.
Contribute to the development of cost impact models to support the value proposition of the organization by routinely reviewing all components of the marketing mix such as product offering and pricing on a territory by territory basis, including internationally to support purpose-driven learning
Recommend and present changes to go to market strategies by assessing all-source intelligence based on ground rules and working principles reflecting the organization's values and mission to enable the organization to capitalize on novel opportunities, mitigate risks from emerging threats, and drive dominant market share
Present analysis and recommendations to senior and executive leadership.
Challenge assumptions or the status quo and how things have been done to bring new ideas or innovations to bear on existing efforts. 
Verify accuracy and reliability of data and recommend corrections or adjustments in the collection, assessment, and dissemination of intelligence
Implement efficient processes to capture and analyze market intelligence data while acting with a sense of urgency to deliver critical reports and analyses both proactively and on-demand.

WHAT YOU'LL BRING TO THE ROLE:

Deep knowledge of the corporate learning technology market
Ability to spot trends and evaluate emerging technologies
Passion for communicating within all levels of an organization, from senior leadership and across our teams
Curiosity, pattern-recognition, creativity, and drive
Knack for telling the story of the corporate learning market, the competitive landscape, and our position in the market
Skills at creating impactful data visualizations, slides, and slide decks for a multitude of audiences

EDUCATION RECOMMENDATIONS:

Bachelor Degree or equivalent

WHY WE ARE AWESOME:

Flexible work hours
Health and wellness programs
Collaborative work environment
Dog Friendly office
Snacks and food trays!
Foosball and Ping-Pong tables
Showers on site
Centrally located in downtown, close to restaurants and pubs, easily accessible by public transit

As a key member of the Information Technology Team, based in Winnipeg, Manitoba, you will provide technical customer support over the phone and in person to a diverse customer population both in house and in remote locations.
You will be responsible for identifying, evaluating, troubleshooting and resolving a wide range technical computer-related issues and providing ongoing support and training to end-users, covering a wide range of software applications.
This position requires an energetic and motivated individual who enjoys being part of a team in a dynamic, ever changing and fast paced environment.
The successful candidate will be able to understand and apply complex technical information while demonstrating exceptional customer service and support.
CORE RESPONSIBILITIES
Upgrade, install and troubleshoot the network, networking hardware devices, personal computers, printers, software and miscellaneous network components.
Diagnose hardware and software problems, and replace defective components.
Train end users and guide them on how to solve existing system problems.
Gather data pertaining to customer needs and use the information to identify, predict, interpret, and evaluate system and network requirements.
Perform routine network start-up and shutdown procedures, and maintain control records.
Support network systems, systems storage and virtual machine environments.
Design, implement, maintain and manage operations of Microsoft based servers and the switched network that supports multiple locations across Canada.
Maintain inventory of equipment and parts as well as documentation of vendor activities.
Configure and test computer hardware, networking software and operating system software.
Recommend changes to improve systems and network configurations, and determine hardware or software requirements related to such changes.
Analyze equipment performance records in order to determine the need for repair or replacement.
Coordinate with vendors and with company personnel in order to facilitate purchases.
QUALIFICATIONS
Degree or IT related certification from accredited training institution.
A minimum of 1 year work experience in the support and maintenance of a multi-server environment with Windows Server, Exchange Server, and Active Directory.
Experience supporting, implementing and/or administering networks and hardware.
Knowledge of MDM, Blackberry Enterprise Server, active sync and experience with smart phone troubleshooting.
Experience in the use of remote support and remote control tools and technologies.

Are you a go-getter? Do you want to work in a fast-paced modern environment? Are your SQL skills better than all your friends? Are you passionate about data, efficiency and Business Intelligence? Do you love Application Development? Are you a creative out-of-the-box thinker?
If so, IPG Mediabrands has the perfect opportunity to get your career to the next level!
Working in a growing team, the Data Warehouse Engineer is responsible for managing the data load processes for our Data & Technology Solutions team.
You will predominately be working with a variety of data sources, including APIs, relational databases and flat files and will be responsible for extracting & loading them into a Data Warehouse using SSIS & Python scripting for the team of Data Analysts & Report Writers to then visualize in BI Reports & Dashboards for IPG Mediabrands Agency clients (internal and external).
This role will involve maintaining current SSIS packages and API pulls for various sources (including Facebook & Google) and then working to extract new metrics from other new sources as and when they are identified.
You will participate in all aspects of the report creation process, from the initial requirements gathering meetings with internal teams to learning how to gather the data from various external sources, to modelling this data for efficient reporting. Then by using the SDLC, follow through on these steps in designing & creating the necessary database objects before the design & development of the extract, transform and load process to populate them.
Responsibilities:
Managing Data Load processes from multiple data sources using Python API calls and MS SSIS ETL packages. This will include maintaining a scheduled load process & upkeep of existing packages as well as new ones that you will design & develop.
Designing & development of customized load packages from existing and new data sources based on client requirements.
Make recommendations for improvements to management & senior management on improvements for existing API Calls or Extract pulls.
Assist Data Analysts in Ad-Hoc BI report requests including identifying necessary data sources, fields and metrics needed before writing queries to obtain the report output where necessary.
Debug existing application software and create patches and hot fixes when necessary.
Work closely with team during QA to facilitate quick diagnosis & resolutions for the identified defects
Documentation of all processes & code including upkeep and maintenance of software design documentation and traceability matrixes in accordance with organizational standards
Mentor other team members with an aptitude for learning on how to work with API’s.
Participation in DBA tasks on MS SQL Server data warehouse (shared with rest of team).
Immediately integrate & work closely with established team.
Required Skills
Extremely Strong SQL and PL/SQL skills with ability to work independently with stored procedures, functions, views & materialized views to write complex queries against large datasets.
Fluent in Python scripting & C#, jQuery and .Net Web Forms (Nice to have).
3+ years of experience working with MS SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) including demonstrated knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices & procedures with the tool. Experience of cube building with MS SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) (Nice to have).
Demonstrated experience of various RDBMs reporting databases (MS SQL Server & MySQL) including knowledge of data modeling for reporting data warehouses such as star schema, snowflake schema designs.
5+ years of experience working in application development including demonstrated understanding of full Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Demonstrated logical thought process through appropriate & inquisitive questioning.
Good understanding of IT operations including standards, protocols, methods & processes, ticketing systems, configurations.
Basic knowledge of Database Administration tasks & processes.
Proficient user of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).
Extremely keen sense of attention to detail, excellent listening and communication skills (verbal and written).
Eagerness to learn new tools, technologies, concepts as well as knowledge sharing within the team on your own experience.
Post-secondary education in computer sciences, engineering, social sciences or related fields.
Experience working in a related field or media planning related experience would be a great asset & will be beneficial in your application, but is not required.
Experience with Dashboards and Data Visualization Software (Tableau or Domo) would be a great asset & will be beneficial in your application, but is not required.

Scope
Reporting to the Manager, Human Resources Information System (HRIS), the incumbent is responsible for analyzing and meeting user needs through an expert knowledge of systems capabilities and constraints. He/she is also responsible for desktop programming, user training and assists in the design, implementation and monitoring of new applications.
Primary responsibilities
Identify and define system issues and provide analysis of options and constraints; monitor the operation of HRIS on a daily basis to assure the highest level of service and utility.
Develop and maintain effective collaborative relationships with HR staff, IITS network personnel while providing automation support to HR staff regarding hardware and software installations and operations.
Develop and maintain relationships with the Office of the Provost and university Communications Services personnel to ensure collaborative support of HRIS systems.
Assist Human Resources in providing auditors, government, actuaries, and/or external groups by providing HR data upon request.
Gather information and recommend solutions to improve procedures and/or minimize manual efforts, including duplication of efforts; design, implement and test approved and improved solutions, while identifying gaps, risks, constraints and adhering to quality assurance.
Document systems for the new solutions and provide training and user manuals as needed.
Analyze Unit needs and long term requirements and provide technical input for the evaluation of HRIS modifications; maintain technical currency to analyze and test new applications.
Develop and maintain HR Department web pages and forms.
Identify opportunities and recommend solutions to improve systems and procedures as well as HR employee capability; implement approved solutions; develop metrics and reports trends to Manager on system utilization and capability.
Ensure the HRIS security access features for the Concordia community; ensure proper interface procedures are in place with other systems, internal and external.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS or any related field and four to seven years of work related experience developing solutions to complex problems in an HRIS environment.
Experience in handling day to day technical duties in a complex systems environment requiring interfaces and security issues.
Experience in supporting HRIS systems.
Good knowledge (Intermediate level) of Access (to join tables and create cross-tab queries), of Excel (to analyse data) and of Word (to create and maintain documentation). Knowledge of SQL, PL/SQL and Crystal Reports.
Good knowledge (Level 4) of written and spoken English and of spoken French in order to give and understand complex explanations, hypothetical questions, or abstract ideas. Knowledge of written French an asset.
Strong analytical skills and an ability to work under pressure.
Highly organized and able to prioritize multiple tasks and meet stringent deadlines.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, able to work autonomously or as part of a team.
Dedication to providing exceptional customer service; proven skills in client relationship management.
Good problem solving and process management skills.
Strong Analytical and Functional requirement documentation skills.

$66,712.00 - $77,403.00 per annum

N/A

The primary objective of the Research Analyst is to understand the real estate industry and provide support to the capital markets service line. As a member of CBRE’s National Research team, the Research Analyst’s role will encompass certain regular tasks around the collection and analysis of core data, as well as a range of activities that contribute to the team’s production and delivery of research materials.

Key Responsibilities

Provides support to the production and preparation of National Research reports and materials.
In collaboration with senior team members, provides research support to capital markets pitches, presentations, information brochures, and client requests.

High attention to detail, and strong organizational and analytical skills required.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

Works well in a Team environment as well as on an individual basis.

job_description:
Lieu:

C’est toute une décision que de se joindre à une entreprise. Nous offrons des perspectives d’emploi à des personnes qui, comme vous, sont travaillantes, dynamiques et fiables.
Pourquoi ce role est-il important?
Role Mandate:

We are looking for a talented and motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our Store Operations & Labour Analytics team. You will be working with various stakeholders to understand their operations, data structures, and analytical requirements to enable data driven insights. This role will require you to utilize your analytical skill set to identify opportunities to improve store P&L, service model, productivity and colleague engagement. More so, you will be partnering with and provide support to store colleagues, specialist teams, and regional store operations management teams.
Accountabilities:
 
Summarize vast amounts of in-store and operational data to develop reports and models to solve business problems;
 
Analyze reports to identify opportunities to better manage cost, improve store department schedules and best practices within the labour system;
 
Support the Store Operations Team/Labour Engineers in identifying and resolving business risks;
 
Evaluate new data sources and help define more effective ways to communicate data with our business users;
 
Working with our IT and BI teams to create data processes that are accurate, consistent and efficient to process large amount of data quickly to meet reporting needs;
 
Write SQL to efficiently retrieve information from business data sources to support different kinds of reporting needs;
 
Use SAS to manage large datasets, perform ad hoc analytics, and build predictive models;
 
Stakeholder management: Engage with key stakeholders within store operations to ensure their reporting and analytics needs are fulfilled.
Role Requirements:
 
Post-Secondary education in Mathematics, Business, Computer Science or Statistics;
 
Exceptional analytical skills and proven capability to drive insights from data and analytics;
 
Ability to independently deal with relevant analytical and BI tools (SAS, MicroStrategy, BOXI, Excel, etc);
 
Proficient in SQL - query optimization and syntax knowledge;
 
Ability to self-organize multiple tasks well and to complete them on time with a clear focus on quantitative results;
 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
 
Willingness to work well in a fast-paced team environment;
 
Ability to “think outside the box”.

Analyst, Predictive Modeling

25 York Street, Toronto, Ontario, M5J 2V5
President’s Choice Bank is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Loblaw Companies Limited (LCL) and was established to promote President’s Choice Financial services offered by strategic partners in all regions of Canada. PCF has grown to over 3 million customers earning millions in better interest rates, free groceries and other rewards. It operates in the following segments:
Mastercard : The President’s Choice Financial Mastercard is offered and operated by President’s Choice Bank.
Insurance : Home and auto insurance, travel and pet insurance are offered through affiliates and relationships with several insurance companies.
PC Services , which includes PC Financial Insurance, The Mobile Shop, Prepaid Cell Phones Express and gift card businesses, is a new business in growth mode.
PC Optimum : All PCF customers have the opportunity to earn PC Optimum Points that can be earned and redeemed in all LCL stores.
Loblaws Inc. is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Loblaw Companies Limited (LCL). LCL is Canada’s food and pharmacy leader, with a network of corporate and independently- operated stores in communities across the country, employing close to 200,000 Canadians. PCF is an important business unit within LCL that manages and develops products and service programs to improve the customer experience, maximize value, and provide a platform to enhance customer insights and relationships. PCF’s vision is to provide superior value financial products to consumers.
As a Predictive Modeler within the PC Financial Product Management team, the successful candidate will primarily develop predictive models for all lines of business within PC Financial. As a trusted Advisor this role will be accountable for building partnerships with key business stakeholders to provide valuable insights, analysis and key strategic information.
What You'll Do:
Develop and implement statistical models for targeted cross-sell, acquisition and retention using machine learning techniques that include linear/logistic regression, decision trees and k-means clustering analysis
Maintain statistical models that optimize CRM communications through all channels
Track and monitor performance of models in production to determine degradation and the need for recalibration or redevelopment of models
Explore large amounts of structured and unstructured data to extract information, gain insight and derive variables to be used as inputs into models
Ensure models are accurate and supported by reliable data
Document and track all model changes and document in an orderly fashion
What You'll Need:
University Degree in applied statistics field (Operations, Research, Engineering, Mathematics or related).
Experience working with machine learning algorithms including linear/logistic regression, decision trees, k-means clustering analysis
Thorough knowledge of relational databases and data extraction/manipulation tools coupled with strong programming skills (SAS, SQL, R, Python)
Ability to take initiative, multi-task, work in a fast-paced environment, and able to learn independently
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and presentation skills
Experience with Google/Adobe Analytics
Experience in Credit Card industry
Experience working with unstructured data in Hadoop environment

Warehouse Analyst – Canada Cartage System

Reports to: Director, Enterprise Applications and PMO Department: Information Technology
Location: Mississauga, Ontario

Job Summary:
The individual in this position will play a key role in supporting Canada Cartage’s Applications, with a focus on warehousing/logistics. This portfolio currently encompasses the 3PL/Warehouse Management System, Customer Web Portal, Shipping Platforms and smaller Ancillary Systems. The applications are a mix of 3rd party systems with some customizations and internally built applications.

The individual will administer the 3PL/Warehouse systems while ensuring day to day issues on these systems are supported in a timely manner. They will also act as a Subject Matter Expert for all internal initiatives relating to these applications. This is a key role in ensuring the ongoing smooth operation of the business and becomes the natural go-to person for both resources within the technical team and the business community.

Job Responsibilities:

Application Support
Log, prioritize, troubleshoot, route and monitor all support incidents or questions relating to the applications supported. The applications could be COTS vendor applications or internal applications.
Assist internal teams with troubleshooting, technical support and other issues relating to the applications supported.
Perform root cause analysis to determine the cause of recurring issues and either fix or provide recommendations toward solutions.
Mentor L1 staff or Super Users within the Business departments on activities they support in the systems.
Manage the upkeep of the application. Ensure that the application is updated routinely and functioning at an acceptable performance level. This would involve working with the Infrastructure team to ensure sufficient resources are provisioned.
Continually drive improvements within the support processes by identifying opportunities for automation or transforming processes into something simpler. You may have the opportunity to then drive those as small projects.
Subject Matter Expertise
Be a Subject Matter Expert for the Applications being supported. Progressively understand the current functionality, keep up with future enhancements on the product roadmap, and assess capabilities in competing applications within the same domain.
Provide feedback into various projects’ Solution/Design phases that involve the application portfolio. Assist the team members by providing system requirements and/or test cases for initiatives concerning the applications.
Prepare training documentation/SOPs and train both users and other trainers on system use.
Support process mapping and SOP building for business processes undertaken using the application set.
May participate in testing activities within the supported applications by preparing test plans and test cases, managing or executing the tests, capturing results and ensuring defects are raised to the Project Manager or Vendor.

Relationships & Communication
Use effective communication and listening skills with internal customers, external customers, vendors, and team members within the IT department while troubleshooting system issues.
Professional communication with current and new customers.
Be flexible and astute in tailoring communication to different audiences. Example: Technical/vendor vs every day users
Build and maintain strong relationships with key day-to-day users of the system such that you can reinforce proper use of the system and become a change agent during project rollouts.
Manage the relationship with the Application vendors. This will involve routine touchpoints to ensure open issues are being addressed promptly and escalated for further attention as required.

Experience & Skills:

Must haves:
Experience working within the Supply Chain along with a good understanding of the business lifecycle managed within the Applications supporting it.
Strong analytical & prioritization skills
Excellent communication skills (written, verbal, listening and presentation).
Keen to learn and understand new technologies and their applicability
Ability to work with minimal supervision and also the work well with a cross-functional team to achieve organizations goals.
Active person who shows initiative and enjoys a challenge
Able to handle multiple initiatives in parallel but recognizes the importance of prioritization
Completion of Post-secondary degree in an analytical specialization (Engineering, Sciences or Business with IT concentration preferred).
Technically competent with Microsoft Office suite of products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio.
4 or more years working in the capacity of an Application, Systems, Technical or Business Analyst
Proficient within HighJump 3PL System or other Warehouse Management Systems including RF functionality
Understanding of Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) within Warehousing standards
Nice to haves:
Competence using SQL to query tables within 3PL database
IT industry certifications
Experience working with Business Intelligence tools such as PowerBI
Project Management skills
Logistics industry certifications

Working Hours and Location:

Weekend and afterhours support is required based on production issues and project timelines
Flexibility to travel between multiple facilities in the Mississauga area
Some out of province travel may be required if involved in a project. Supply chain WMS Inventory

job_description:

Role Description:

As a Practitioner in Cyber Risk Services, you will be a key part of client engagement teams, with typical responsibilities including:
Work in a collaborative team focused on delivering comprehensive solutions, which include analyzing client issues, performing research, conducting workshops/interviews/walkthroughs, developing and communicating solutions, implementing process and technology solutions, etc.
Develop business cases and strategic considerations for client initiatives
Supporting the team on security/controls and risk management solution development and system integration
Supporting the group in identifying risks and controls within business and IT processes for various initiatives
Performing technical deployment activities on systems implementation projects
Assisting with the development of security strategies, policies and standards
Researching and resolving complex issues and developing innovative solutions for clients

What is expected of you at the firm:
Taking personal responsibility and accountability for your work
Sustaining a high level of drive, enthusiasm, and a positive attitude in the face of obstacles
Leveraging the firm’s resources to seek out feedback and development opportunities
Working in a respectful and professional manner with colleagues, clients and the wider community
Holding yourself to the highest of standards and always thriving to be better both professionally and individually

Your role as junior staff member at Deloitte:
Understand our purpose and values; explore opportunities for impact
Demonstrate a strong commitment to personal learning and development; act as a brand ambassador to help attract top-talent
Understand expectations and demonstrate personal accountability for keeping performance on-track
Actively focus on developing effective communication and relationship-building skills
Understand how your daily work contributes to the priorities of the team, the business, and the firm

Within Cyber Security, there are different personas that exist, and you may be able to identify yourself with one or multiple of these personas. To gain more information about this, please navigate to Deloitte’s report on the ever changing faces of Cyber Security:
https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/Deloitte/ca/Documents/risk/ca-cyber-talent-campaign-report-pov-aoda-en.PDF

In return, you will get an exposure to a variety of different work activities in different industry sectors available in Deloitte’s Cyber Risk portfolio of service offerings, which focus on four aspects of cyber security:
Strategy: Help executives develop a cyber-risk program in line with the strategic objectives and risk appetite of the organization.
Secure: Focus on establishing effective controls around the organization’s most sensitive assets and balancing the need to reduce risk, while enabling productivity, business growth, and cost optimization objectives.
Vigilant: Integrate threat data, IT data, and business data to equip security teams with context-rich intelligence to proactively detect and manage cyber threats and respond more effectively to cyber incidents.
Resilient: Combine proven proactive and reactive incident management processes and technologies to rapidly adapt and respond to cyber disruptions whether from internal or external forces.

Qualifications:
Successful candidates will have the following qualifications and characteristics:
Graduating with an Undergraduate or Graduate degree in an appropriate field from an accredited college/university by September 2019
Comfortable working in a dynamic environment with competing deadlines and rapidly evolving client needs and conditions
The ability to work independently as part of solution teams
Effective verbal and written communication with creative ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions
Leadership and initiative skills with demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in and out of the work environment
Canadian travel required and occasional international travel; Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments.
Must have a minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience to be considered at the Consultant level

Nice to have:
Knowledge or curiosity with security or privacy enhancing technologies
Familiar with some cyber security conferences and talks (e.g DEFCON)
Familiar and knowledgeable about the latest cyber security breaches and incidents in the industry
Knowledge in one or more of cyber security domains would be an asset
Understanding of common technologies such as databases, web servers and firewalls

Submit your cover letter, resume and unofficial transcript in pdf file

Ensure that institution information in your Deloitte profile is accurate and up-to-date
All applications must be submitted no later than 11:59pm EST on the deadline date

Influences strategic functional decisions through advice, counsel or provided services which directly impact the business.
Persuades and influences others through strong and comprehensive communication and diplomacy skills

Qualifications

Job Skills/Qualifications:
Education Bachelor’s degree in Business or Computer Science, or equivalent experience, required.
8-10 years senior level experience in a Business Analysis role.
Subject matter expert in in Banking, Payments or Transaction Services.
Experience with executing global projects is required.
Technical development background in a major development language or Database technology
Strong leadership, interpersonal, influence, negotiation, and written and verbal communication skills required.
Knowledge of TTS (Cash Management) products would be preferred.
Citi Canada is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities (including, without limitation, physical and mental health disabilities) during the recruitment process and otherwise in accordance with law. Individuals who view themselves as Aboriginals, members of visible minority or racialized communities, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

The Opportunity
Quandl is a data platform used by over 400,000 people, including thousands of analysts from the world's top hedge funds, asset managers and investment banks. Professionals use Quandl for our rich suite of databases and unrivaled data consumption experience.
A key part of our offering is "Alternative Data": obscure, rare or esoteric datasets from unusual or untapped sources that are not widely used by Wall Street firms. Examples include intercompany transaction and supply chain data, sentiment measures derived from natural language processing, tracking of vehicles via GPS transponders, satellite monitoring of industrial facilities, footfall and geolocation data, and consumer insights gleaned from anonymized credit card transactions.
These datasets are often considered "alternative" because they do not fall in the traditional categories of data used by the financial industry: stock prices, company fundamentals, options and futures, and so forth. Their importance in the financial markets is increasing rapidly as hedge funds and active asset managers are eager for data that offers predictive insights about the performance of individual companies, sectors, and the economy as a whole.
As the world's leading provider of Alternative Data, we deliver innovative products that power some of the most successful firms on Wall Street. We welcome you to join us in our journey, as we continue to redefine the investment landscape.


The Role
Quandl is currently seeking Quantitative Researchers to join our Alternative Data team. Multiple positions are available at an Intermediate to Senior level. You will evaluate new data sources and use them to create new alternative data products that provide quantitatively measurable market insights. Specifically, you will:
Work alongside data analysts and data engineers to onboard, test, and enrich new data from our partners
Detect, confirm, and amplify predictive signals in the data while filtering out non-relevant information
Communicate predictions and insights to colleagues and customers
Leverage financial market expertise to properly package data for maximum appeal to professional investors
Inject best practices in financial analysis and data science across the team
Mentor and guide junior quantitative researchers and data analysts
The Candidate
You are an excellent quantitative analyst and researcher with experience in the capital markets or financial services industry, looking to work on interesting problems in a collegiate, friendly and fast-moving environment. Your qualifications include many if not all of the following:
2+ years experience (or 5+ years for Senior) in quantitative analysis in the capital markets or financial services industry
Experience in financial analysis and modelling
Intellectual curiosity and passion for financial markets, data, algorithms and statistics
Experience performing exploratory data analysis/mining with large datasets
Deep understanding of quantitative data collection and analysis techniques, statistics and database development
Proficiency in Python or R; working knowledge of Excel, SAS, SQL and similar tools. Experience with Spark, Hadoop, Redshift, AWS and other big data technologies is a plus
Attention to detail coupled with strong analytical skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering or related field


Company Overview
Quandl is a Toronto-based financial technology startup that was backed by two of Silicon Valley's most respected venture capital firms; we are the the first and only Canadian startup in the 'Forbes Fintech 50'.
Everything we've accomplished so far has been the result of hiring intelligent, committed, proactive people, and giving them the freedom to do their best work.
We value character, humility, integrity and teamwork; we try to steer clear of self-promotion, arrogance, passing the buck and other political skills.
Our Company Culture
Quandl was acquired by Nasdaq Inc. in Dec 2018. Post acquisition, we continue to operate independently out of our 50-person office in central Toronto, on our mission to build the world's leading marketplace for financial, economic and alternative data.
Our small-company environment means that we are small enough for you to make a difference; at the same time, Nasdaq's support and scale makes us big enough for your work to have a meaningful impact for our customers and the industry.


Benefits and Perks
We offer:
A competitive salary and incentives
Interesting and meaningful problems to work on
Colleagues who are smart, motivated, talented and a pleasure to work with
Health benefits for yourself and your family
Your choice of hardware, software and work setup
Flexible office hours, tactical telecommuting and unlimited vacation
A beautiful, centrally located office filled with sunlight and perks
If interested in this opportunity, please submit your resume and cover letter for the application. This is a full-time position in Toronto, starting immediately.

Vancouver, BCThe WHY

Why MEC?

MEC is more than a store, and we’re more than a place to buy hats and backpacks. We’re physical and digital hubs for the outdoor community. People connect here, through our stores, online channels, over the phone, or through one of our leading events, clinics or services.

MEC is an equal opportunity employer. We’re proud to work with our people to create a diverse workplace, which accommodates individuals of all abilities, backgrounds and identities. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Tell us what you need during the hiring process, and we’ll do our best to accommodate you.


Why YOU?

If you like working with an inclusive, hands-on, collaborative team, who connect people with quality products to encourage active outdoor lives, then this is the team for you. MEC is an awesome place if you’re always learning and trying new things, like bouldering, yoga or trail running!

We’re a fast-paced and exciting team that’s always on the lookout for the next best thing. Our motto is “Thoughtfully Supplied Adventures” and as such we strive to deliver on the best supply chain for our members. If you’re a problem-solver with a positive attitude, then this is the place for you!


The HOW

You’re a natural problem-solver and consensus builder; you're aware of how your work has impacts both up and downstream. You understand that solutions must be intuitive and easy for partners, staff and members to understand. You know that the members who buy our products are why we come into work every single day. You take initiative and believe in empowering your teams and those around you to do their best every day

The WHAT

Member Obsession

Everything we do, we do for our member.

What does Great look like?

Product is supplied at the right place, right time, through the right channel and in the right quantity to meet our member’s needs.
You collaborate with internal and external partners to elevate member service.
Partners within the supply chain are blown away by your ability to work towards internal customer satisfaction.


Influencing for Impact

You have all the data to know what the right decision is. You know where the ship is sailing and you have the power to get others on-board.

What does Great look like?

You know your business inside-out and bring actionable insights to the rest of the organization. You feel a sense of ownership and responsibility for the work that your team delivers.
Terms like Excel, Scripting, SQL, Python and Machine Learning get you excited. You have the ability to leverage your technical skill-set to generate data-driven actions.
The market holds no surprises for you. You are in-tune with external market factors and can get ahead of trends. You can convert your intuition into testable market insights.
You lead by example, take pride in your work and enjoy helping and developing others while creating fun environments. You energize people through your passion.
Adaptability

Retail is ever-changing. We not only need to keep up, we must know where it’s going and how to get there faster.

What does Great look like?

You thrive in a fast-paced environment, while maintaining a positive attitude and delivering on KPI’s
You handle curve-balls like a pro, navigating unknown territory with a positive and collaborative outlook.
You have developed the skills to ask the right questions and critically assess your new surroundings while maintaining forward momentum.
Drive for Results

You have the knowledge, tools and skillset to make an impact.

What does Great look like?

You always see room for improvement. You’re not satisfied with the status quo and are constantly finding ways to make things more efficient.
You’re curious about the rest of MEC and actively seek out opportunities to partner cross-functionally to drive improvements.
Collaboration

No person is an Island. We work in teams and are better for it.

What does Great look like?

You feel empowered to engage with peers and leaders alike to develop innovative ways to make a positive impact on our members lives.
Stores love hearing from you because you foster a positive, collaborative and energetic relationship with them.
You’re a great partner to our vendors and work with them to develop mutually beneficial strategies and solutions.
You hate to see your teammates struggling and are always willing to lend a hand, or train them on a new skill.
 Processes

Work changes regularly, however, the main processes and tasks that you will be supporting include:

Receipt flow model, per supply chain constraints, liaising with demand planners
Communicate to commercial team assessments of capability to execute commercial plans and any risks
Implementing and execute the allocation plan
Develop a strong understanding of category, regional and store-specific sales trends through data analysis and feedback from member and store insights
Liaising with data analysts to support and improve product allocation system and short term forecasting accuracy
Collaborate with Commercial partners to execute inventory tactics/strategies, seasonal, promotional and changeover processes
Manage external vendors and DCs with regards to day to day supply chain
Review channel/regional/individual store performance and optimize the inventory to maximize the sales potential
Support store/channel partners on inventory requests and capacity/sales optimization processes

Skills
Preferred
Inventory - Inventaire Advanced
Analysing - Capacité d'analyse Intermediate
Behaviors
Preferred
Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well

Preferred
Some college or better.

Who We Are:
HBC is a diversified global retailer, focused on driving the performance of high quality stores and their all-channel offerings, growing through acquisitions, and unlocking the value of real estate holdings.
Founded in 1670, HBC is the oldest company in North America. Our portfolio today includes formats ranging from luxury to premium department stores to off price fashion shopping destinations, with more than 480 stores and over 66,000 employees around the world.
Our leading banners across North America and Europe include Hudson’s Bay, Lord & Taylor, Saks Fifth Avenue, Gilt, Saks OFF 5TH, Galeria Kaufhof, the largest department store group in Germany, and Belgium’s only department store group Galeria INNO.
We have significant investments in real estate joint ventures. HBC has partnered with Simon Property Group Inc. in the HBC Global Properties Joint Venture, which owns properties in the United States and Germany. In Canada, HBC has partnered with RioCan Real Estate Investment Trust in the RioCan-HBC Joint Venture.
A truly global corporate citizen, HBC is committed to responsible business practices to bring about positive change, and we work hard to shape a sustainable future for people and the planet. Our philanthropic initiatives help create healthy families, strong communities, and sport excellence in the cities and countries in which we operate around the world, while striving to create innovative programs and resources that provide flexibility for work-life balance in order to maintain a positive working environment

What This Position Is All About:
The Supply Chain Analyst will analyze, measure, report on, and recommend improvements all aspects of the supply chain process with a focus on promotional activity. This position is critical to the overall success of many of the key promotions at HBC. This role will take a proactive approach to identify and resolve supply chain issues before they occur. The Supply Chain Analyst will develop and implement continuous improvement initiatives related to purchasing, transportation, and distribution chain and overall health of the network.

Who You Are:
Highly motivated with an ability to work independently and as part of a team and willing to go the extra miles if needed to support the business.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ability to communicate with individuals at all levels within the organization and builds strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.


You also have:
1-3 years experience in Supply Chain, preferably in retail distribution
 Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Supply Chain, Computer Science or Engineering preferred
Advanced Excel Skills
 Programming knowledge such as MS Access or SQL is an asset

As the Supply Chain Solutions Analyst, you will
Identifying End to End tracking of all promotional merchandise
Identify supply chain improvement opportunities, work with key internal stakeholders to resolve issues by assessing root causes and providing data-based recommendations
Host and lead regular meetings to conduct process/system improvement initiatives
Support supply chain operations through reporting, analysis and consultation
Forecast future inbound volume based on purchase orders and other criteria

How Often You May Travel:
5% within Canada

Your Life and Career at HBC:
Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
An amazing employee discount

job_title: RES O 24R - Research Analyst **CLOSING DATE AMMENDED
job_description:
Research Analyst
Research Officer R24
An eligibility list may be established.

Bring your strong analytical and technical skills to this dynamic opportunity

The Education Analytics Branch enables the K-12 sector in B.C. to be a world leader in the use of education data to support program and strategic planning, system performance and quality delivery of personalized education. The Branch oversees the management, security and stewardship of education data and client services. The Education System Outcomes Unit is responsible for reporting on education system performance; for supporting Ministry program areas and School Districts and Schools in their use of data to make evidence-based policy decisions; for overseeing the administration and reporting of the Student Learning Survey; for fulfilling data requests and releases (e.g. government partners, legislated representatives such as RCY and FNESC, and researchers); and for enhanced data visualizations and analysis.

The Research Analyst develops and implements technical solutions to identify, and summarize for various audiences, the key information and trends that impact student achievement. As well as the Ministry and other government organizations, external organizations and researchers use the results of this work to improve understanding of the educational system and service delivery. The Research Analyst will spend much of their time providing expert consultation on technical requirements for the ministry’s data needs, manipulating large data sets within a data warehouse environment, reviewing data sets for quality and consistency, and summarizing data for diverse audiences utilizing data visualization tools and visualization dashboards. The position works with ministry program areas, management, professional and administrative staff and external contractors to support data-driven decisions across the entire K-12 system. The Research Analyst plays a lead role in the on-going maintenance of the current Education Data Warehouse (EDW) and in the development of an improved infrastructure and data model.

The BC Public Service is an award winning employer and offers employees competitive benefits, amazing learning opportunities and a chance to engage in rewarding work with exciting career development opportunities. For more information, please see What We Offer.

The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.
The BC Public Service is an inclusive and accessible employer. Please advise the hiring manager if any accommodations are required to assist you to ensure equitable participation.
For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact Nicole.Gardner@gov.bc.ca. DO NOT SEND YOUR APPLICATION TO THIS EMAIL ADDRESS. For more information about how to complete your job application, add/edit your resume and for more useful tips when applying for jobs, please refer to the Your Job Application page on the MyHR website. If you are still experiencing technical difficulty applying for a competition, please send an e-mail to BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca, before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible to assist you.

NOTE: Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.

Job Requirements:
In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience as outlined below:
Bachelor’s Degree in statistics, mathematics, public or business administration or social science field, or related field.
Minimum two years of experience with SQL programming.
Minimum two years of experience with relational and/or object data modelling, data analysis, data warehousing techniques, data management principles, structured analysis and design.
Experience using statistical and data mining packages, including open source tools like R.
Preference may be given to applicants who have any of the following:
Two years of experience with Visual Basic programming.
In-depth Excel spreadsheet experience, including Excel automation.
Experience conducting qualitative and quantitative research.
Experience with data visualization tools, including Tableau, Oracle Business Intelligence
Experience and familiarity with Ministry of Education datasets (demographics, results, transition, and satisfaction).

Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be assessed on the Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies as outlined in the attached Job Profile located in the Additional Information section at the bottom of the posting.

A Criminal Record Check (CRC) will be required.

APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Cover letter required: NO - Please do not submit a cover letter as it will not be reviewed.

Resume required: YES - A resume is required as part of your application, however, it may not be used for initial shortlisting purposes.
Questionnaire: YES (COMPREHENSIVE) - As part of the application process, you will be prompted to complete a comprehensive online questionnaire to demonstrate how you meet the job requirements. Please allot approximately 60 minutes to complete the questionnaire.

IMPORTANT: Comprehensive questionnaire responses will be used to shortlist applicants against the job requirements. Please ensure you include all relevant information about your educational accomplishments and employment history including job titles, start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and your accountabilities and accomplishments.

Business Analyst

The knowledge, skills and abilities required in this position are those of Business Analyst. The domain of application is ocupational health and safety. As such, the job position is Safety Analyst. Reporting to the Director of Health and Safety, the Safety Analyst maintains the occupational health and safety management system (OHSMS); tracks, analyzes, and trends OHS performance data; prepares statistical reports; and, creates process flows and other operational business charts associated with the OHSMS.

Description of Responsibilities
Conduct statistical analysis of occupational health and safety (OHS) performance data us Microsoft Excel.
Prepare monthly statistical OHS reports using Microsoft Word.
Maintain the order and integrity of the SharePoint OHS Management System (OHSMS).
Participate in the development and maintenance of OHSMS documents.
Create process flow charts specific to the OHSMS using Microsoft Visio in compliance with the BPMN standard.
Create RACI charts specific to the OHSMS.
Perform and maintain document control procedures specific to the OHSMS.
Maintain online contractor compliance services such as ISNetworld, ComplyWorks, etc.
Participate in completion and submission of customer pre-qualification reports as required.
Minute monthly safety meetings and maintain library of minutes.
Participate in OHS audit activities and prepare reports as required.
Education
An undergraduate degree or diploma in business with appropriate specialization (e.g., business analysis), or
an undergraduate degree in science or mathematics with significant inclusion of statistics, and formal education (or demonstrable experience in lieu of) in Microsoft products including Visio, Excel, Word, and SharePoint.
Experience
Statistical analysis of business information.
Statistical analysis using Microsoft Excel.
Creation of process flow charts using Microsoft Visio.
Creation of high-quality documents using Microsoft Word.
SharePoint user experience.

JOB CATEGORY: Business Professionals

$65,445 - $78,174 a yearSCHOOL OF GRADUATE STUDIES
ANALYST, GRADUATE ENROLMENT (P5860)

Posted on: March 21, 2019

Deadline: April 3, 2019

Grade: 12

Note
This posting represents a temporary leave replacement effective until July 31, 2020.
Scope
Reporting to the Director, Graduate Admissions and Student Affairs, and working closely with the Associate Dean of Student Affairs, the incumbent performs a range of tasks in support of the Director, Graduate Admissions and Student Affairs and the overall operation of the Graduate Admissions, Student Affairs, and Thesis portfolio. He/she collects and analyzes enrolment data to design and draft reports in support of strategic graduate enrolment management at the University. The incumbent is responsible for compiling data and conducting regular analyses of graduate enrolments, including but not limited to program application and admission rates, registration and graduation rates, and times to completion studies, producing relevant reports, and working on enrolment management with programs. The incumbent is also responsible for functional liaison and follow-up with a number of University areas and certain stakeholder departments in all matters related to graduate registration.
Primary responsibilities
Compile, analyze and prepare briefing notes and reports in support of enrolment analysis; provide data to Faculties and graduate programs in support of the achievement of the University’s strategic enrolment objectives.
Work within a team environment to develop, coordinate and communicate strategic enrolment planning, management and analytic models across the institution.
Design specifications for reports and prepare proposals that move forward the attainment of enrolment objectives. Develop institutional level modeling scenarios and advise the Director and Associate Dean of the School of Graduate Studies on same.
Identify, map, design and recommend enrolment process transformations that maximize the effectiveness of enrolment management at the university.
Coordinate all graduate registration-related web content.
Closely liaise with the Institutional Planning Office, the SIS Sustainment Team, graduate program directors and the student affairs representatives in the Faculties, to establish quality control mechanisms to ensure that information processing is as efficient and accurate as possible and that reporting is accurate.
Provide advice on emerging trends related to enrolment management and highlight changes.
Review and approve student requests related to registration matters.
Perform other duties in support of the unit.
Requirements
Master’s degree in a field related to the primary responsibilities (Statistics and/or Mathematics) and two to four years of related work experience.
Advanced knowledge of statistics and predictive analytical tools and techniques.
A passion for data, advanced analytics, and evidence-based decision making is essential.
Ability to pay close attention to detail is required for data integrity.
Excellent data visualization skills.
Advanced knowledge of Excel (including pivot tables) and basic knowledge of Word, PowerPoint and of Adobe Acrobat.
Knowledge of PeopleSoft SIS highly desirable.
Good knowledge (Level 4) of spoken and written English in order to communicate effectively with faculty, staff, and students and to draft correspondence, documentation, and reports.
Excellent planning, analytical, communication and problem-solving skills.
Understanding of university's mission, goals and culture.
Knowledge of academic and non-academic policies, regulations and decision-making processes.
Proactive work style; will take initiative to make personal connections with key personnel internally and externally.
A keen ability to transform technical information into simpler terms.
Comfortable dealing with varying levels of the university/organization and interact professionally and constructively with a diverse group of data users from various functional levels.
Outstanding interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a team environment, and with other University departments.
Superior organizational skills in order to effectively organize work and set work priorities.

Senior Digital Analyst Job Description
The Senior Digital Analyst is a critical member of the Publicis Analytics Team. The Senior Digital Analyst will provide leadership and execution of analytics across multiple digital channels for various client accounts. He/she will be responsible for helping design analytics frameworks, aggregating and analyzing data, and providing insights and data driven recommendations to our clients.
This individual will be accountable to key stakeholders for delivering a data-driven perspective, actionable insights, and recommendations that help elevate creative and strategic ideation & activation. He/she will support the Director of Analytics Strategy and will assist in the management of the Analytics operational and strategic plan.
Key responsibilities include the following:
Work directly with clients and manage full analytic life-cycle including data requirements, KPI Definition, Measurement Planning, Reporting and Analysis Cadence / Design / Delivery, and Insights and Recommendations
Lead the translation of business requirements into KPIs and specific technical and reporting requirements
Lead analytics projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis
Create dashboards within Tableau Desktop
Effectively present results, findings and recommendations to both internal and external teams via regular (weekly, monthly, quarterly, annual) and ad hoc reports
Lead driving core insights from the data to suggest, create and execute multivariate or a/b/c tests that drive fundamental improvements to the marketing campaigns
Build a strong narrative around the analysis and ensure it is articulated clearly with a strong link back to business objectives
Prioritize objectives and contribute to project planning and status reporting
Function independently in regards to assignments while remaining highly collaborative with the greater team and understand when to keep the Director, Analytics Strategy informed
Mentor and coach junior staff
Assist with the development of internal processes and documentation
QUALIFICATIONS
Completion of post-secondary degree preferably in the area of computer science, mathematics, statistics, engineering or related field
3-5 years' practical experience utilizing data, performing analysis, and developing analytical processes in a marketing context
Must have at least 3 years of hands on experience with Google Analytics and implementing analytics/tag management tools such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Ad Hoc, Dynamic Tag Manager, and Google Tag Manager
Knowledge of user-testing technologies (Google Optimize, Adobe Target, Optimizely, or similar)
Experience in A/B testing strategies and other methodologies for digital optimization
Knowledgeable on all platforms & associated KPIs with a deep understanding of the role all digital tactics play in a digital ecosystem/customer journey.
Digital Media: SEM, SEO, Social, Display, etc.
Offline Media: TV, Print, In-Office, etc.
CRM: Direct Mail, Email, Telemarketing, etc.
Expertise in data visualization tools (Tableau, Qliksense, etc.)
He/she should be curious by nature: critically thinking about the business and marketing implications of data – how analytics can be used to inspire great creative, content and user experience
Someone with an attitude that they can tackle anything thrown their way. They are excited by figuring out things they've never done before. They do not have "that's not my job" in their vocabulary.
Someone that can get along with everyone – strategists, account, creatives, executives, clients
Someone that is self-motivated, hard-working, excited by digital possibilities.
Someone who can both present well, but also build beautiful presentations
You are an ideal candidate for this role if you:
Think strategically in everything you do
Are intrinsically-driven and celebrate every success
Enjoy a variety of work
Are a logical thinker with creative problem-solving skills
Set high quality standards for yourself and aim to get every detail right
Do what it takes to deliver on your commitments
Enjoy working in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment
Welcome and volunteer constructive feedback
Are able to work within both traditional and agile methodologies/processes
Thrive in a collaborative work environment that has an "open door" policy (since we literally have no doors in our office).
Are able to maintain constant and effective communication within multidisciplinary project teams
Believe in continuous learning and improvement

Initiate and deliver R & D efforts to evaluate new releases and fixes to existing technology and alternatives that could provide enhanced capabilities and value.

PermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

As a Replenishment Analyst you will work in partnership with the Category Management and Forecasting teams to introduce exciting new products while maintaining and developing our existing product assortments. At the intersection of Supply Chain and Merchandising, this role is a cross-functional opportunity that is integral to the organization due to the high level of accountability and the critical impact of outcomes to the bottom line.

All analysts hired into the program will participate in a comprehensive two-week education and training program to gain exposure to key components of Canadian Tire’s Supply Chain and Merchandising practices as well as the foundational tasks required to succeed in the role.

What you’ll do

Successful candidates will be responsible for managing the replenishment of specific product lines within the Canadian Tire assortment. Analysts will focus on managing and optimizing replenishment plans in support of regular, promotional and seasonal dealer ordering patterns, and will act as the single point of contact between Category Management teams and Supply Chain.

All analysts in the program manage relationships with suppliers from North America and offshore by planning demand cycles and smoothing channel operations to manage the flow of inventory. You will work closely with several cross-functional groups within Canadian Tire to ensure visibility to forecasted demand and timely flow of goods from suppliers, into our Distribution Centres, and out to our stores. Success will be measured by the ongoing improvement of key metrics in your line such as inventory management, receipt management, and service level to our stores. Other responsibilities may include:

Negotiation with suppliers for additional manufacturing capacity/inventory and shorter lead times

Supporting merchandising initiatives by ensuring that supply chain solutions are in place to effectively service our customers

Collaboration with key stakeholders such as Buying Teams, Suppliers, Marketing, Associate Stores and Distribution

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

University degree in Industrial Engineering, Math, Retail Management, Business or Commerce

3-5 years of experience in an analytical role

Proficiency in modeling processes to determine the financial implications of alternatives

Strong tactical negotiation and process management skills

Exceptional analytical/data mining skills

Solid communication skills and problem solving skills

Excellent time management skills with the ability to manage conflicting priorities

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Top Employers.

To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn.

Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

At integrate.ai, our mission is to build a future in which AI enriches people's lives while creating better, more valuable businesses. Our AI-powered platform helps B2C enterprises become customer-centric, identifying what customers value in businesses and applying AI to guide customers to valuable experiences. We care about privacy and ethics, and are working to make Responsible AI a reality across consumer enterprise. We are proudly based in downtown Toronto, Canada at the center of an exciting AI ecosystem.

We are looking for a Data Scientist who is excited to play an integral part of a client facing team, who excels at uncovering concise business insights, and who can both deliver and communicate these insights effectively to external stakeholders. Responsibilities for this role range from data ingestion to collaborating with both internal and external stakeholders to build the platform in a way that best suits our client's needs. This is a fascinating role that requires both strong interpersonal skills and deep technical knowledge.

What you will be doing:

Using your data science super-powers to advise clients on everything from use case development to solution design to performance measurement
Collaborating with other Data Scientists on the team to problem-solve and develop best practices
Consistently delivering quality work as a member of our client engagement team, while keeping client love and trust at the forefront of all your work
Principally delivering data ingest for our client data, including cataloguing the data and mapping it to our proprietary data schema
Collaborating with our business team to create polished data visualizations and pull high level business insights from client data
Working closely with our machine learning team in the early stages of statistical/machine learning model development to identify valuable patterns and information in the data
Collaborating with our solutions engineers to translate complex business logic into our proprietary data schema
Supporting solutions engineers to do systems integration work with our clients
Sending feedback to our platform engineering and product teams to develop requirements for our product roadmap - specifically our ingest, structuring, and integration capabilities

You have:

5+ years in a lead Data Science role, including experience providing strategic guidance to clients and fellow Data Scientists
An appreciation for the beauty of data. You love a challenge, and you're excited about bringing a narrative to complex business problems using what you learn from a dataset
Worked directly with clients and understand the importance of prioritizing client needs
A bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline
Strong technical abilities, creative problem solving skills and high adaptability
Extraordinary interpersonal, organization and communications skills
Experience working directly with business users to build reports and answer business questions with data
Experience working with big data structures and ETL tools and other big data technologies (Hadoop/Spark, Hive SQL, etc.) to uncover meaningful business insights
A good understanding of statistical modeling and you're passionate about deriving insights from large datasets
Programming experience with Python, R, or SAS
Adaptability and interest in working with a dynamic, early stage company

The diverse experiences, ideas, and identities of integrate.ai's team members helps us make better decisions and drive great results. We foster an inclusive work environment that welcomes team members of all backgrounds and perspectives. We're committed to providing a meaningful environment for every member of our team. We hire exceptional people and reward them with trust, autonomy, mentorship, and growth.

We are naturally curious and have strong attention to detail. We love working in a team environment where trust is key and we all strive to make an impact every day. If this sounds like the right fit, please apply and come work with us.

Job Profile: Senior Data/Financial Analyst – Finance (12 mth contract)


Reports to: Senior Director, Finance


Role Mandate:

This position plays a key role providing financial support to the Food Merchandising Business Unit of the Discount division. The successful candidate will contribute to the Finance team’s ability to provide Data Driven Insights to the business and aid with the achievement of financial targets.


Accountabilities:
Automation of reporting & routine financial information
Data model development leveraging multiple systems and tables
Consolidation of large amounts of complex information into simplified views

Monitor trends in business performance and develop predictive forecasts as required
Ad hoc projects and analyses
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with other departments and build strong working relationships

Advanced Excel/Access/SQL/SAS/Database ability and development experience with business intelligence (BI) tools such as Microstrategy
SAP experience preferred
Ideal candidate would have (or be pursuing) an accounting/finance designation
Financial experience in a corporate retail environment ideal
Self-starter with ability to thrive in ambiguity

Proactive individual with the ability to effectively manage various projects simultaneously to strict deadlines
Superior analytical skills with the ability to provide accurate financial information and business insights
Exceptional interpersonal skills to effectively source information, obtain approvals, build relationships, and provide sufficient influence to achieve success
Highly organized, able to prioritize multiple projects effectively and work independently in a fast-paced environment
Excellent organizational, planning and problem-solving skills

Location: Toronto, ON

The Regulatory Affairs Analyst is responsible for managing regulatory compliance as it relates to new and existing products, new retail initiatives and applicable business practices. This role will be proactive in staying current with the regulatory framework and actively engage with industry partners and regulatory bodies; using this knowledge to drive continuous improvement within the company. This role will interact with all departments including inter-company(IC) facilities, marketing, retail, 3rd party logistic supplier and supply chain; to develop a solid understanding of product requirements and processes to ensure regulatory compliance. This role will also be responsible for supporting the quality process to ensure consistent quality of products.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the process of researching, managing and monitoring of all regulatory information related to ingredients declaration, nutritional rounding, allergen declaration and product claim approvals; while ensuring compliance to Canadian regulations
Provide guidance and collaborate with Marketing, Retail and IC on the approval of packaging artwork, promotional verbiage (as per regulations when necessary) and retail signage
Work with Retail on regulatory requirements (federal, provincial or region-specific) when required for new stores, new product initiatives and sourcing and approval of new raw materials.
Responsible for the process of resolving health inspection non-compliances in coordination with the Retail team
Conduct in-depth research to assure understanding of regulations; current, changes and up-coming changes, which impact existing and new products and communicate business impact
Support or lead (when necessary) communications and interactions with regulatory bodies
Continuous improvement and monitoring of Lindt Canada Product Specification documents
Collaborate with Marketing, Retail, QA, Supply Chain and IC to coordinate and implement changes to affected specifications or labels in response to formula changes or new regulations
Act as liaison with internal and external departments and teams to coordinate documents and data requests from Lindt Canada’s customers
Assist the Consumer Affairs team in the collection, handling and resolution of consumer contacts when needed
Assist in investigation and resolution of food safety and quality concerns (claims, product inspection, and monthly reports) when necessary
Provide back-up support to the Manager, QA/CA as required
Qualifications:

B.S. in Nutrition/Food Science or related degree
Minimum 3-5 years prior regulatory affairs experience within the food industry
Experience with nutritional calculations, allergen and ingredient declaration from recipe data
Knowledge of Canadian, US and European regulatory guidelines and laws on Confectionary and Cocoa products
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Demonstrated commitment to teamwork
Excellent organizational skills
High attention to detail
Proficient working knowledge of MS Office
Proficiency in French a plus
We thank all those who apply, however, only selected candidates will be contacted.
